name: MATT
line: Hello, everyone. →

name: MATT
line: (laughter) →

name: MATT
line: And welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play the first game of our new campaign of Dungeons and Dragons. →

name: MATT
line: (cheering) →

name: MATT
line: Super excited to be back. I've missed this a lot. Missed this-- oh, you guys will be fine. So yes. Glad you guys can join us, apparently in some crazy numbers. So welcome new viewers. Hope you enjoy your stay. So, without further ado, let's get this going so we can get through our announcements. Since it is our first episode of the year, of the campaign, I want to make sure that we get our announcements out of the way. →

name: MATT
line: We've got some cool stuff to talk about. First and foremost, we have two sponsors tonight. Our first sponsor-- and we're going into, for a time, a cool partnership with the folks at DnD Beyond, actually. They've been really awesome, and we've been talking, and anybody who hasn't seen it, it's an online digital tool where you can create your own D&D character, they have options to purchase any of the current D&D books out there, and then carry over any of the character options and racial options over into it, so you can basically use it as a tool. We'll be using it to help us out in the game as we go, 'cause it's actually got some pretty cool stuff. So excited about that. It is D-N-D Beyond, by the way, if you haven't seen, not the ampersand. It's D-N-D. →

name: LAURA
line: As in nnnn. →

name: MATT
line: Nnnn. But yeah, so they're going to be a long-term partner for the show, so working with us through the start of this campaign. We're super excited. But yeah. So we're excited. You can currently activate-- it should be now-- some Critical Role content on there. They should have available the Blood Hunter class that I created a couple of years ago, kind of refining. Should be available for you guys to find on the DnD Beyond, which I'm excited about, and there's a one-time discount of $10 off any digital book in the dndbeyond.com marketplace if you use the codeword 'beginnings' in there right now. So yeah, get a chance to check it out. →

name: TRAVIS
line: (vomiting noises) Would you like some? →

name: MATT
line: So yeah. I'm super excited to have that, guys. So you apply that code at checkout to make that happen, in case you're confused and trying to get it to work. There's a bunch of stuff to explore on there, and a bunch of cool ways to incorporate the existing breadth of D&D lore and options in there, and now you have some of our stuff in there as well, and hopefully more Critical Role content and Tal'Dorei content and Exandria content down the road to also be available on there as we go. Super excited about that. I'd like to thank you guys at DnD Beyond for being awesome. We also have our second sponsor. Sam, if you want to take it away. →

name: SAM
line: I'm our second sponsor. →

name: SAM
line: (laughter) →

name: LAURA
line: Thanks, Sam! →

name: SAM
line: No. Welcome, new viewers. Every week-- or many weeks, I am charged with writing the ad for the sponsor of that week. I did this one way back in mid-December, so it'll feel a little stale. →

name: SAM
line: (laughter) →

name: SAM
line: Sorry. I didn't have time to write a new one. →

name: SAM
line: Apologies to our sponsor. But our second sponsor tonight is Backblaze. They offer unlimited cloud backup for Macs and PCs. You can restore from the web or via hard drive. They'll even overnight FedEx a drive to you, and because it's Christmas season, I wrote this. 'Twas the night before Critmas when I clicked on my mouse, but the drive wasn't whirring; it had said 'Adi-ouse'. When up from the cloud there arose such a sight, I knew in a flash that my shit was all right. As I spat out my plate of cold chicken kiev, down my chimney came a weird little elf named Lev. I said, "Whoa, whoa, whoa, how'd you get in my place?" Lev gave me a wink and punched me in the face. And suddenly he fired up a pipe and started to restore my computer from a backup he carted. My documents, like slash fiction from My Little Pony. My photos, like me naked, covered in bologna. He mumbled that you can get backed up at once for a merry little fee of $5 a month-s. You even get 15 days free if you scroll over to backblaze.com/criticalrole. And just like that, my computer was on. Lev greased up his body, and bam, he was gone. But I heard him exclaim, "Peace out, yo, whassup! Happy Backblaze to all, don't forget to back up!" (cheering) →

name: SAM
line: I'll write another one for Easter, I promise. →

name: SAM
line: (laughter) →

name: MATT
line: Thank you, Sam. So thank you, Backblaze. →

name: MATT
line: Happy to have you for our sponsor tonight as well. →

name: MATT
line: Also, as a heads-up, we've had our friends at Wyrmwood for a while have been awesomely providing Wyrmwood dice boxes and dice trays and dice towers to give away to people in the community. They have new boxes for all the players in the new campaign. →

name: MATT
line: And they have been working on something for a while for us to kick off the new campaign. They made us a new table. If we can go to a camera view of this table they made for the campaign. →

name: MATT
line: (cheering) →

name: MATT
line: It's made out of English brown oak, the center Critical Role inlay is made of ash burl, is the background, and then rosewood for the d20 outline, wenge for the Critical Role words themselves, and silver stringing around the border. It was built by hand in their Massachusetts office and workshop, and it was hand-rubbed oil on a wax finish. Over a hundred hours were put into this table. They did an incredible job, and we're super honored to have that here, and thank you guys for showing such an awesome appreciation for what we do. →

name: SAM
line: It smells really nice. →

name: LAURA
line: We have cubbies! →

name: MARISHA
line: It smells like wood in the studio, like fresh wood. →

name: SAM
line: And, when we get canceled, this is going to be a great dining room table. →

name: MATT
line: This is true! Thank you guys, Wyrmwood. If you aren't familiar with any of their stuff, go to wyrmwoodgaming.com, that's W-Y-R-M-wood Gaming dot com. They do awesome work. It's really super high-quality, it's great. So thank you guys. All right, so. Let's see. Updates we can get through. →

name: MATT
line: Laura, do you have an update for merch stuff in the new year? →

name: LAURA
line: (yells) Okay. Yes, I do. It's a new campaign, new us, new merch. I don't know which camera I'm looking at. →

name: SAM
line: That one. →

name: LAURA
line: So we released our teaser on socials, and everybody was like, "I want that as a poster!" So we listened to you, and we made it a poster! (cheering) →

name: SAM
line: It's a real poster? →

name: LAURA
line: It's a real poster! →

name: SAM
line: Oh, wow! →

name: LAURA
line: Look at this lameness that you could have on your wall! So yeah. It's in the store right now, you guys, and we printed a small amount, so those ones will be shipped faster, and then after that it'll just be pre-order, but I think it's all listed as pre-order, so just so you know. →

name: SAM
line: Can you photoshop out my crotch region? →

name: LAURA
line: No. →

name: TALIESIN
line: That would be a lot of photoshop, man. →

name: MATT
line: None of us have that much talent in post, Sam. →

name: LAURA
line: But let's just talk about this Matthew Mercer. →

name: MATT
line: Let's not talk about what I-- when I put that outfit on, I did not consider quite the permeation in my life it would become. So there's that. →

name: LAURA
line: So we can be with you always. Matt can stare at you while you sleep. →

name: LIAM
line: That's actually how Purvon dressed. →

name: MATT
line: God damn it. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Hey, first throwback! Well done. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh yeah. We've got to be careful, guys, because we have a lot of people that haven't watched the last campaign, or haven't finished the last campaign, so no spoilers for last campaign. →

name: SAM
line: I don't really remember it. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Well, we all died, so. →

name: MATT
line: That's true, yeah. Okay, next announcements: the Critical Role podcast we have currently up to date. All of Vox Machina's story, the whole first campaign, is now on the podcast. You can find it where the finest podcasts are downloaded. And do we have an update as far as the release schedule for this podcast? →

name: MARISHA
line: Yes, we do. They will be releasing one week after we are live. We'll be one week behind. →

name: SAM
line: On a Thursday? →

name: MARISHA
line: They will be releasing on Thursdays the week after. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh, so you can listen to it in the morning and watch it live at night. If you have a lot of free time. Or a really long drive, maybe. →

name: SAM
line: An extra eight hours to spend every Thursday. →

name: MATT
line: To be fair, you guys would have about as much free time on a Thursday as I would. Cool, so look forward to that. Comic book, issue four of Critical Role: Vox Machina Origins, Liam, when does that come out? →

name: LIAM
line: It is coming out on the 24th of this month. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Oh, make it sooner! →

name: LIAM
line: I've read it. It's so good, it's real good, it's so good. You guys, Vox Machina's story ended at this table, but it is going to live on and on and on-- at least for three more issues. →

name: MATT
line: Thank you very much. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Check it out everywhere. →

name: LIAM
line: Yeah, on Zune, on PalmPilot. Darkhorse app, Comixology, Limewire, finally. →

name: MARISHA
line: Napster. →

name: LAURA
line: I'm going to throw up. →

name: MATT
line: That's okay, guys, we've got a couple more things left. Thank you for hanging in there. As far as con appearances go, I actually fly tomorrow to Miami, Florida for Paradise City Comic Con. →

name: MATT
line: I'll be there tomorrow until Sunday. If you guys are in the area, come say hi at the convention. It should be fun. I have panels and signings and stuff. Hopefully see you there. Also, I'll be at Lexington Comic and Toy Con in Lexington, Kentucky, March 9-11, Otafest in Calgary, May 18-20, and A-Kon in Texas, June 7-10. →

name: ASHLEY
line: Jeez Louise, Matt. →

name: LAURA
line: We have Emerald City Comic Con, me and Travis. →

name: TRAVIS
line: First weekend of March. →

name: MATT
line: Badass. Cool. All right, so. Paring it down, finishing it up here. Thank you for your patience. →

name: MATT
line: With the new campaign, I want to renew our appreciation for and make sure that we push to you guys that we, from the very beginning, have been supporting a really amazing charity called 826, 826LA being our local chapter. They have 826 groups all over the United States that they do after-school creative writing, and a lot of great creative classes for children who are either underprivileged or don't have opportunities to go to these types of classes. They do wonderful, wonderful work, and we've been supporting them from the very beginning, and we're just doubling down on that for this new campaign. You guys as a community have been fantastic in supporting them, and all the charities that we've supported from the very beginning. Critmas every year has been a very prime example of that, so I just wanted to continue to push that forward, share the love, and a big thank-you to 826 for being such an amazing source of creative drive for so many young kids who normally wouldn't have that opportunity. So you guys are amazing, and show them your appreciation if you can. →

name: MATT
line: (cheering) →

name: MATT
line: Final shout-outs. One, thank you to Ian Phillips of Iron Tusk Painting, who has painted the miniatures for this campaign. →

name: MATT
line: (cheering) →

name: MATT
line: He actually painted me and Marisha's cake toppers for our wedding, and whenever you manage to see them in the campaign, you can know that it's his handiwork. Soon enough. →

name: ASHLEY
line: Also, fun fact about Ian Phillips: I grew up with him. He was one of my brother's best friends when we first moved out here to LA, and so when that name was floating around, I was like, wait a minute. And then we reconnected back on Instagram. It's such a crazy story. You know, Critical Role brings it all back around. →

name: ASHLEY
line: (laughter) →

name: MATT
line: I love it. So you can follow him, @PaintingTusk on Twitter. →

name: LIAM
line: I've had him paint 20 to 30-- I'm kind of addicted-- 20 to 30 miniatures. They're amazing. →

name: LIAM
line: He's amazing at what he does. →

name: MATT
line: And final thank-yous to Warner Bros and Monolith Entertainment for letting us incorporate the Shadow of War soundtrack into our Critical Role soundtrack here on the air, so those will be coming into the new campaign. And, super excited, CD Projekt Red has been nice enough to allow us use of the Witcher series soundtrack to also incorporate into the campaign, which, honestly, when we started playing at home, the Witcher soundtrack was most of my music, and I couldn't use it when we started streaming, and so it's been a cool full-circle to be able to bring it back in. →

name: MATT
line: Plus it brings a unique flavor that works with the new campaign setting, so. →

name: MATT
line: With that, I believe our announcements are done. →

name: MATT
line: Thank you for bearing with us. →

name: LAURA
line: Wait, we're going to give-- oh, that's-- →

name: MARISHA
line: Afterwards. →

name: SAM
line: There's one more announcement. →

name: MARISHA
line: Our announcement is our brand-new opening title sequence. Which I think we're ready for. →

name: MATT
line: So, as we bring it down, guys, let's go ahead and prepare to dive in to the new year and the new campaign for this episode of Critical Role. →

name: MATT
line: (yelling) [80s music] (laughter) →

name: MATT
line: And welcome back. →

name: TRAVIS
line: That was a new level. →

name: MATT
line: We've definitely returned to the table. →

name: MATT
line: Thank you, Sam. So. →

name: MARISHA
line: Wait, super fast. We've got to go through credits. Right? Okay. So normally we don't do this, and I did this once before when we released our other opening title sequence. Yeah, 50th. So we're going to do this again. These are just people who do so much and who do not get enough love. I'm going to shout them out. Sean Becker, who's the unsung hero of Geek and Sundry, he's the executive producer. T.J. Rotell, he's our production manager around here, he makes sure that we actually have cameras. Maxwell James, our producer that makes this show go every week. Dani Carr, our production coordinator, also huge producer here. Steve Sprinkles, who directed that amazing opening title sequence. →

name: SAM
line: That's not a real name! →

name: MARISHA
line: I know. I love it on the slate. It always says 'Sprinkles'. Jan-Michael Losada, who is our D.P., and is the same D.P. from last time. Tristan Savage-Tate, our first A.C. Sean Delahunt, who is our key grip. Tyler Hart, who is our gaffer, who gaffs everything around here, he's amazing. Jenny Newman, who did the amazing wardrobe. She sourced all the wardrobe. Wren Witting, who's one of our hair and makeup artists. Vanessa Marie, who is our second hair and makeup artist. Jose Sosa, who was our production assistant. Selina Ruthe-- →

name: LAURA
line: That's a lot of pieces of paper! →

name: MARISHA
line: I know. Selina Ruthe, who did additional photography, and she also does stuff every day. →

name: LAURA
line: Why didn't you put them on the same piece of paper? →

name: MARISHA
line: Because I didn't know there was going to be this many. Brandon Clark, who was our location manager. Pamela Joy, who shot all the photos for that, and Loretta Ritchert. →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah, they're with Heirloom Photography, and they did all of our thumbnails, too. They did that poster. →

name: ASHLEY
line: Go check them out on Instagram! →

name: MARISHA
line: Jason Charles Miller, who does our music. →

name: LIAM
line: Party on, Garthok! →

name: MARISHA
line: Sean Hudson, who does our post-production. And Andy Inglat, who edited that thing. Okay. I'm sweating a lot. →

name: MATT
line: That's okay. So. →

name: SAM
line: What a night. Well, guys... →

name: TALIESIN
line: This has been great. →

name: LIAM
line: Holy shit. →

name: MATT
line: Everyone. Everyone. →

name: SAM
line: Can we open our fricking books yet? →

name: MARISHA
line: Not yet. →

name: MATT
line: Welcome to Wildemount. The year is 835 P.D., or post-Divergence. This continent is divided both by jagged terrain and political powers. The Menagerie Coast, a collection of city-states united under the Clovis Concord, monopolizes the southwestern shores and ports of Wildemount, thriving on open trade and cultural freedom. →

name: MATT
line: Beyond the Cyrios Mountains lies the massive region known as Wynandir, bisected by the Ashkeeper Peaks. Eastern Wynandir houses the expansive wastes and turbulent badlands of Xhorhas, overrun with all manner of beasts and terrors, relics from the final battles of the Calamity that ruined that scarred landscape. →

name: MATT
line: Northward, you would find the Greying Wildlands, a lawless realm harboring a curse that has kept it unconquered by human hands. However, this story begins in the territory of Western Wynandir, within the boundaries of the Dwendalian Empire. →

name: MATT
line: Emerging 13 generations before, the Dwendalian Empire has slowly spread to encompass the surrounding societies of the region, absorbing the peoples of the Zemni Fields and the Marrow Valley, before finally conquering the Julous Dominion and taking the whole of Western Wynandir for the Empire. →

name: SAM
line: There will be no test. →

name: MATT
line: No. This is-- let me continue. Under the rule of the current King Bertrand Dwendal, now in his 68th year, most are left to their own devices. →

name: MATT
line: You live as you did before. The crown only takes a tithe of what you produce and earn. You follow its laws, worship its gods, and bow to its installed local leadership. In return, denizens of the Empire are protected from the chaotic horrors and shadowed evils that stalk the edges of the civilized lands. This accord has led to a prosperous century for the Empire, or at least the political elite. Tensions brew beneath the chafing watch of the Crown's Guard. Every temple is government-owned and run, and worship outside the approved idolatry is met with imprisonment. →

name: MATT
line: Rumors of military clashes at the eastern border near Xhorhas have many common folk on edge. Our story, however, begins much smaller. Here in the southern reaches of the Marrow Valley, beyond the entry gates of the Wuyun Gorge, lies the small rural town of Trostenwald. Bordering the blue waters of the Ustaloch, this town came to prominence near the turn of this recent century, when the surrounding fertile farmlands were discovered to produce a unique type of grain and wheat, leading to a boom of breweries. When the glut subsided, three large families stood triumphant in the local business of fermented delights. Now Trostenwald thrives on their exports of fish, crops, and ale. Here in this sleepy trade stop along the Amber Road, a handful of wandering destinies slowly begin to intersect. →

name: MATT
line: We begin in the early hours of the morning on the day of Grissen in a messy room on the second floor of the Nestled Nook Inn. A bleary-eyed, bruised man in a tattered coat slowly wakens from his lengthy sleep, catching his small, snoring ally curled at the foot of the bed. Liam, if you would like to describe your character, please. →

name: MATT
line: (nervous laughter) →

name: LAURA
line: Oh my god, no pressure! →

name: SAM
line: Were we supposed to prepare this? →

name: LIAM
line: I'm pretty filthy. I have a mess of reddish-brown hair, and really filthy road clothes. I wear a long coat that I slept in. I slept about 20 hours last night. Jeez. Unshaven, a bit of a mess. →

name: SAM
line: So far you're just talking about current Liam. →

name: LAURA
line: What color are your eyes? I need visual. →

name: LIAM
line: They're blue. That's it. It was a rough day yesterday, and-- that's it. →

name: MATT
line: And your name is? →

name: LIAM
line: Oh. Caleb. Caleb Widogast. →

name: MATT
line: All right. As your smaller friend curls awake, Sam, would you like to describe your character? →

name: SAM
line: Yeah. Um. I am a little goblin girl. →

name: SAM
line: (laughter) →

name: SAM
line: I am a goblin. So, you know, the green skin, the green hair, the yellow eyes. And she wears not-great clothes, just like her traveling companion there. She hides in the shadows a lot, because she knows goblins aren't welcome in this part, and that's about it. I mean, she's a little skittish, and right now she's probably stirring awake as well, right? →

name: MATT
line: Well. What's your name? →

name: SAM
line: Oh. Nott the Brave. →

name: MATT
line: So Caleb, as you come to consciousness, you glance over and can see, slowly snoring and rousing at about the same time, Nott's eyes blink open, her slowly groaning face looking over towards you. →

name: SAM
line: (high-pitched Cockney accent) Oh! You're finally awake, I see. Oh yeah, motherfuckers. It's on. You were out for quite some time, there. Rough day, eh? →

name: LIAM
line: (light German accent) Not our best day, no. →

name: SAM
line: No, I mean, usually you're so good at everything, but yesterday you were just-- maybe you needed the sleep, is what you needed. →

name: LIAM
line: Thank you. →

name: SAM
line: Well, don't thank me yet. I should probably tell you what happened while you were asleep. I mean, you were asleep for so long. I got bored, frankly. I was going through my pack and reorganizing. →

name: LIAM
line: Has anybody seen you-- seen you seen you? →

name: SAM
line: Well, I mean, many people? I got bored. →

name: SAM
line: You've never slept that long, so I left, I went downstairs, I thought I'd do a bit of window-shopping, and you know how sometimes I get the itch, you know? →

name: LIAM
line: I do. Did you make it back here okay, at night? →

name: SAM
line: I'm here, aren't I? →

name: LIAM
line: Yeah, you are. →

name: SAM
line: Yeah, I did. But I might have been spotted by a few of the Crown's Guard. →

name: LIAM
line: Did you have the mask on? →

name: SAM
line: No? No, I didn't. But they didn't catch me, so. Listen, I'm sorry, sometimes I get the urge, I've got to take something, you know? I was trying to replentish what you lost yesterday, and I failed. →

name: LIAM
line: Well, we-- (sighs)-- discussed coming to a bigger town. It's going to be a little more difficult now. You can't go-- it was easier on outskirts, it was easier in farms, but we can't do that here. →

name: SAM
line: I know, I'm sorry. Yeah. I know. You're right. Yep. I just got a little bit squiggly. →

name: SAM
line: That's all. →

name: LIAM
line: Okay. Well, I think today you should have the mask on at all times. →

name: SAM
line: Yeah, good idea, Caleb. →

name: LIAM
line: It's better when we're working together. If you need to steal something, do it with my help, all right? →

name: SAM
line: Yeah, yeah, of course. Yeah. →

name: LIAM
line: Back up the conversation a minute. Thank you. I would not be alive if you had not-- you saved my life. So thank you. →

name: SAM
line: Ah, no problem. →

name: LIAM
line: Yesterday was really not great. →

name: SAM
line: Yeah, well, we'll do better today, right? →

name: LIAM
line: Sure. Sure we will. Are you hungry? →

name: SAM
line: Yeah, I'm starving. →

name: MATT
line: At this point, you notice the gentle smell of cooked meats and promises of mediocre porridge and eggs just barely begins to creep beneath the subtle floor of your room, meet your nostrils. →

name: LIAM
line: Well, Nott, what are we going to do today? I can go down and get breakfast and bring it up here. At least-- I don't know. I mean, I'm a little wary of just splashing back into the town right away. →

name: SAM
line: Let's go down, get some food. I'll come with you, 'cause as you said, we're better together. →

name: SAM
line: And we'll take it from there. You need some books and stuff, right? →

name: LIAM
line: Always. →

name: SAM
line: All right, well, that's on the to-do list. →

name: LIAM
line: All right, well, let's get something to eat, then. →

name: MATT
line: All right, so you prepare yourself with your mask set over? →

name: SAM
line: Yes, yeah, so I have a half a mask that covers my goblin face, and with the hood over, kind of obscures. Maybe it's not a goblin, maybe it's a little halfling person or something. →

name: MATT
line: Which is helpful. The southern, more rural region of the Empire, especially near Felderwin, which is one of the largest tilling and farming areas of the entire Empire, has a very heavy halfling population. And so while this city is not the core of it, you'd probably see a larger 20-25% of the population here in Trostenwald is halfling. →

name: MATT
line: So you pass off pretty decently as long as you keep away from discerning, intent eyes. So the two of you manage to gather your things for the time being, wander down the stairs from the top floor down to the base of the tavern, which, the air is already bustling with townsfolk and all manner of travelers preparing to take on the day's responsibilities. Yorda, the 40-something woman barkeep with shoulder-length blonde hair and weathered skin that you previously rented your room at the inn from, frantically darts behind the bar while the red-headed barmaid rushes from table to table. It seems that the clientele is a bit more than they were expecting this morning. Yorda yells from behind the bar to the barkeep, "Adelaine, two more brats and a bit of mush at the corner table." She looks up, "I'm working on it!" And she runs over and heads back to the kitchen. →

name: MATT
line: There's a faint bit of music as two slovenly-looking musicians in the corner are trying to work for tips with a small hat on the floor that it looks like nobody's thrown any coin into it. The tables are fairly busy, except for maybe two that appear to be available between the two of you guys, if you'd like to find a seat. →

name: LIAM
line: Okay. Sure. Is that easy to do, find a seat? →

name: MATT
line: Yeah, you walk over to it, you sit down. →

name: MATT
line: (laughter) →

name: LIAM
line: Is this how D&D works? →

name: SAM
line: What do we roll for? (laughter) →

name: MATT
line: You sit down, and due to the chaos that ensues around you, it takes a little while for Adelaine, the red-headed barmaid, to come by, and she scoots by the table. "I'm terribly sorry. What can I get you?" →

name: SAM
line: You know, meat if you have it, but if you don't, that's okay, too. Potatoes, or bacon if it's on the menu, but really anything-- →

name: MATT
line: "I can get you all three, it's fine. What you want?" →

name: LIAM
line: A Trost for each of us, please. →

name: MATT
line: "For breakfast? I like you. All right, two Trosts and a bunch of meats. Be right back." And she rushes off, she pulls her hair back and ties it as she goes into the kitchen, getting ready for the midst of chaos. While you guys have a moment there at the table, you can hear conversation muttering around you, and you have a brief bit of privacy to discuss. →

name: LIAM
line: Yes, I need books, that's true, but did you find drink yesterday? →

name: SAM
line: I have a little left in my flask. →

name: LIAM
line: How much? →

name: SAM
line: Just a couple swigs. →

name: LIAM
line: So that's also on the to-do list, then. →

name: SAM
line: I mean, if you don't want me to get too jittery, yeah. →

name: LIAM
line: All right. Okay. So we'll do that first. →

name: SAM
line: All right. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I love her. →

name: TRAVIS
line: (laughter) →

name: MATT
line: A short time passes before the two platters are rushed over and scattered across the front of your table with a clattering. Pile of meats there set for you, a little bit placed on the side, because you might need, especially with the look on your face-- Adelaine gives you a glance and goes, "Put something in your belly." Comes back and slides two Trosts to you. →

name: SAM
line: I remove my little mask, and then just go (eating noises). →

name: SAM
line: (laughter) →

name: LIAM
line: I take the last piece. →

name: MATT
line: As you guys are partway through your meal-- let's see, this would be Caleb. You notice out of the corner of your eye a gentleman enter the door looking kind of meek. Middle-age, looks work-hardened. He has a heavy chin-beard that is unkempt and a bit wild, but his eyes are warm. →

name: MATT
line: He's holding his hat in his grip, and he scans the room with an eager glance before his face brightens, and he begins to push his way across the room, in your direction, it looks like. He scoots over towards your table, and as you're about to turn and see what he's about-- →

name: LIAM
line: I'm putting my hand on my purse. →

name: MATT
line: --he pivots to the table next to you instead. He turns to you three. →

name: MATT
line: (yelps) →

name: LAURA
line: We've just been sitting here this whole time! →

name: MATT
line: Yeah. You've met this man the day before, Rinaldo, the fisherman, who you had aided. And as he approaches, he goes, "Might I sit, please?" →

name: LAURA
line: Of course, take a seat. →

name: SAM
line: What's that? →

name: MATT
line: As he sits down in his chair, I would ask each of you to please describe yourselves, starting with you, Laura. →

name: LAURA
line: (Slavic accent) Oh, well, okay. I'm just, you know, a little blue tiefling, that's all, with blue hair. →

name: LAURA
line: And I'm wearing a pretty cute dress, that's all. →

name: LAURA
line: And I'm having a good time, you know? We're just having a good time here at breakfast. →

name: MATT
line: All right. And you? →

name: MARISHA
line: Uh, yeah. Yeah. I'm, you know, simple girl, simple needs. Just wearing nice, baggy clothes, some monk vestiges. They're in nice blues and greys. You notice I have a blue sash around my belt. Got a nice shave going on, little undercut. →

name: MARISHA
line: Looks like maybe I put on makeup two days ago, and I'm like, yeah, it's still holding up. It's fine. →

name: MARISHA
line: I can work with that. →

name: SAM
line: What's your name? →

name: MATT
line: We'll get to that. Thank you. And Travis, if you'd like to describe yourself, please? →

name: TRAVIS
line: (Texan drawl) Yeah, I'm here too. →

name: TRAVIS
line: (laughter) →

name: TRAVIS
line: I'm a half-orc, sitting here in beat-up leathers. Have a big scar across my face. →

name: SAM
line: (sings 'Bad to the Bone') (laughter) →

name: TRAVIS
line: Green skin tone, and got some piecemeal armor put together and stuff. My name's Fjord. →

name: LAURA
line: You're very handsome. I just need to tell you. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Thank you. Appreciate that. →

name: MATT
line: As Rinaldo sits down, clutching his hat still in his hands, says, "I thank you for your time. Fjord. And, I apologize, I forget your names." →

name: MARISHA
line: Beauregard. →

name: MATT
line: "Beauregard. And?" →

name: LAURA
line: Jester. →

name: MATT
line: "Jester, thank you. You all came when no one else would yesterday, and because of you my daughter is still alive." →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh yeah. Sorry for being a pessimistic asshole, by the way, when we first came into town. →

name: MATT
line: "Oh, that's okay." →

name: MARISHA
line: I'm not used to things turning out good. →

name: MATT
line: "You'll do well this side of the Empire. →

name: MATT
line: Anyway. I won't keep you, but I-- we spoke yesterday, and I didn't have much to give you. →

name: MATT
line: Sent you away with nothing but my gratitude. But I've been asking around the other fishermen, lochsmen, and we've put together a little bit of coin for your troubles, so." And he turns his cap over on the table, and this catches your attention, you hear this clattering of coin. Your eyes glance over, especially you, Nott, and watch as he leaves this pile of what looks to be mostly copper and silver pieces, with a couple of glimmers of gold, and as soon as it clatters across the hard wood table here in the center of the tavern, other faces begin to turn, gather attention as to what's happening over here in the back edge, and he takes his cap back and pushes it forward towards all of you, his dirty, you can see cracked and very callused fingers shoving it in your direction, before taking his hat and placing it back over his head. →

name: LAURA
line: So cool! →

name: LIAM
line: Those coins went all over the floor? →

name: MATT
line: All over the table. "I hope it's helpful. →

name: MATT
line: But thank you." →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, yeah. Oh wait. →

name: TRAVIS
line: We can't accept this, right? I mean, it's too much. →

name: MARISHA
line: We're supposed to at least say that, right? And then still accept it, right? →

name: TRAVIS
line: I think you're supposed to do it if you say it. →

name: LAURA
line: Well, I mean, he did go around to a bunch of people. That was a lot of work on his part. I would hate to make him go back to all of those people and give it back to each individual person. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Fine, fine. →

name: MARISHA
line: If he didn't keep a ledger, you know. We wouldn't want to do that. It's rude not to accept a gift, right? It's rude not to accept a gift, right? →

name: MATT
line: "I would hope that is the case. Anyway. →

name: MATT
line: Thank you very much. I am sorry for getting in your way." And he stands up and gives you all a nod and rushes out of the tavern, a little embarrassed by all the attention that's now placed on him by the other patrons, and as he leaves, everyone goes back to their business, a couple of wandering eyes starting to count what coins are there as you slowly mitt them in your direction. →

name: LAURA
line: Divide it up. →

name: MARISHA
line: Okay, okay. →

name: MATT
line: There are four gold pieces amongst the pile, 22 silver, and 48 copper pieces. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Can I clock the room, see who else is watching her count? →

name: MATT
line: Perception check. 48 copper. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Is this the first roll? →

name: MATT
line: First roll of the campaign. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Natural 20. →

name: TRAVIS
line: (cheering) →

name: MATT
line: And that's how you start it. All right. →

name: LAURA
line: So I'm leaving it to you to do that counting. Which is really hard for me, personally, but there you go. →

name: MARISHA
line: How do you split up four gold? We have four gold and there's only three of us. →

name: LAURA
line: Don't know. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Well, I actually did pretty good at that card game, so you can have mine. →

name: MARISHA
line: Aw. I will. Okay. →

name: LAURA
line: So two for each of us! That's great. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh, that's good. One for you, two for me, two for-- oh wait, no, wait, math doesn't make sense. →

name: SAM
line: She's your treasurer? →

name: MATT
line: This is going to go great. →

name: LAURA
line: It's hard not being the treasurer. →

name: MARISHA
line: I'll give two to Jester, one for you, one for me. And then 22 silver, that's-- →

name: LAURA
line: Tell you what, you do that math. →

name: MATT
line: While you're counting this out and figuring out the division of your gains, Fjord, you glance about, narrowing your orcish eyes across the room, and you can see two other tables there are some gentlemen who are peering over, and as soon as they meet your gaze, they go right back to their business and completely shrink away. There's a man and a hooded figure at a table immediately adjacent to you. The man looks rather filthy, his hair a bit unkempt, and he's trying to finish his drink. However, the smaller halfling-looking figure is just glaring intently, and is slowly leaning in the direction of the table. →

name: TRAVIS
line: That's creepy. Fucking disgusting. I think we have people watching us. →

name: LAURA
line: Who is watching us? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Well, just take a look right over there. →

name: SAM
line: Don't arouse suspicion, but did you hear all that coin hit that table, Caleb? →

name: LIAM
line: I did. It's on the table, though, so I think on the table it will stay. →

name: SAM
line: Yes, but we could follow them out. We could do the Moneypot. We could run Rat Food. We could do Prince and the Pauper to get it from them. We could try Spider Eyes. Any of those could work-- →

name: LAURA
line: Are you guys staying here? →

name: MATT
line: This blue-skinned tiefling suddenly leans over to you at the table. →

name: SAM
line: Don't move. Don't move. Tieflings can only see movement. →

name: LIAM
line: I don't think that's true-- →

name: LAURA
line: It's very true, we have a hard time seeing things that aren't moving, it's very true. But I can hear you. You should take a bath. You know they have showers here. It's possible. →

name: LIAM
line: A what now? →

name: LAURA
line: You bathe yourself in water. →

name: LIAM
line: No, I've bathed before, yeah, I know what a bath is. →

name: LAURA
line: It's because you smell really bad, and it's wafting over this direction. I'm just letting you know. I would hate if I smelled that bad and someone didn't tell me. →

name: LIAM
line: I've only just met you. →

name: LAURA
line: Hi! I'm Jester. →

name: LIAM
line: Hi, I'm Caleb. →

name: LAURA
line: Nice to meet you, Caleb. How much silver did I just get? →

name: MARISHA
line: Seven! →

name: LAURA
line: Woo! (laughter) →

name: MARISHA
line: And 16 copper. Aren't you all jealous? →

name: SAM
line: Morning. →

name: MARISHA
line: Morning. →

name: MATT
line: Make a perception check, Beauregard and Jester. →

name: LAURA
line: Whoa. →

name: LIAM
line: Are you checking your DnD Beyond specs? →

name: MARISHA
line: I am, I'm adding my-- →

name: LAURA
line: 22. I haven't even flipped over my character sheet yet. This is crazy. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. The somewhat meek female halfling who's now suddenly very reserved, and not as filthy as the human compatriot that she keeps, seems less and less halfling the more you glance in her direction. The ears are folded inward but elongated, the tinges of green to the skin, and with the little words that have poked through her lips, you can see what appear to be teeth more jagged than expected of the half-folk. →

name: MARISHA
line: I just shout over and I say, good morning, in Halfling. →

name: SAM
line: I know Halfling, right? Yes. I'll shout back, top of the morning to you. →

name: SAM
line: (laughter) →

name: MARISHA
line: Would you like a coffee? I'd love to buy you a coffee. →

name: SAM
line: We've got-- free coffee? Yeah, yeah, I'll take it. Sure. Thank you. →

name: TRAVIS
line: You're being mighty fucking friendly. They were looking at our coin. →

name: MARISHA
line: Why can't they have been looking at me? Maybe they were looking at me. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I didn't think of that. →

name: MARISHA
line: Maybe they were looking at you. As Jester said, you're handsome. →

name: LIAM
line: Just-- →

name: LAURA
line: Yes? →

name: LIAM
line: Nott. →

name: SAM
line: He said "Jest". →

name: LAURA
line: I just thought you said my name, is all. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh, I said your name. Oh, they might have said your name, too. →

name: LIAM
line: Never mind, never mind. Could I get another Trost over here, please? →

name: SAM
line: Two, please, right away. →

name: MATT
line: Eventually Adelaine comes by and brings two fresh Trosts to the table, glancing about at the unique tension in the air right here. "Would you like anything as well?" →

name: LAURA
line: Oh, yes. Lots of baked goods if you have them, please. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Pork belly, if you have it. →

name: MARISHA
line: I don't think I've seen you eat anything other than pastries. →

name: LAURA
line: I really like them. →

name: MARISHA
line: I'm kind of concerned for your well-being. It's fine, I'm not that concerned. →

name: MARISHA
line: Eat whatever you want. I'll have bacon, some ham, whatever. →

name: MATT
line: "All right, pork it is. I'll be right back." She rushes off to the kitchen. You guys continue to awkwardly stare at each other. →

name: LIAM
line: I'm going to put my hand up and say, quietly, to Nott, the Moneypot is not for them. →

name: LIAM
line: It's not for them, it's for farmers. Okay? →

name: SAM
line: Yeah, you're right, you're right. →

name: MARISHA
line: Do we notice them whispering? →

name: MATT
line: With your perception rolls earlier? Yes. →

name: LIAM
line: But I said it really quietly. →

name: LIAM
line: (laughter) →

name: MATT
line: She rolled a 22. →

name: LIAM
line: But she can hear my little whisper? →

name: MATT
line: No, you heard the whisper, you're not sure what the words are. You can see that they're whispering. Being mysterious. →

name: LAURA
line: Okay, cool. →

name: SAM
line: In Halfling, I'll say to Beau-- →

name: MARISHA
line: Beau for short works. →

name: SAM
line: Are you in town for business or pleasure? →

name: MARISHA
line: Can I insight check him, see what he's hiding? →

name: MATT
line: Make an insight check. →

name: MARISHA
line: Okay. What's my insight, I can't remember. →

name: LAURA
line: What is he saying? I mean you, you're a girl. What is she saying? Shit. That's really hard to remember now. →

name: SAM
line: You're asking me what I'm saying. →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah, what did you just say? →

name: MATT
line: 13? I mean, seems to be genuine. Hard to read through all the wrappings, shadow, and the hood still obscuring the face. →

name: LAURA
line: Do you have the mask covering you? →

name: SAM
line: I think I do. →

name: MATT
line: Yeah, it's this porcelain covering that has painted lips. It's a little unsettling. →

name: LIAM
line: I mean, I'm sorry, not to be blunt, but, you know. It's pretty obvious goblins are not welcome strolling about. →

name: LAURA
line: She's a goblin?! →

name: SAM
line: Yeah, yeah, but you don't have to make a big thing of it, all right? There could be people here who don't know. →

name: LIAM
line: That's right. She's my companion, she's my friend. There's nothing to make a big deal about. →

name: LIAM
line: That's why she's wrapped up. Just leave it, please. →

name: LAURA
line: I didn't ask why she was wrapped up. →

name: MARISHA
line: I know, we're not making a big deal out it. You're making a big deal out of it. →

name: LIAM
line: Somebody asked why she was wrapped up. →

name: LAURA
line: No, nobody asked. →

name: LIAM
line: Somebody said the words-- this is Liam-- "Why are you all wrapped up?" →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh, I asked if she was cold. →

name: MARISHA
line: (laughter) →

name: SAM
line: That's concern. →

name: MATT
line: As Caleb finishes oversharing. →

name: LIAM
line: Vaxleth is over. It's so over! →

name: MARISHA
line: Those are old times, man. That was a different universe. Different life. →

name: MATT
line: At this point, there is a bit of a commotion towards the entrance of the tavern. Two shadows step into the doorway of the nearish-noonday sun. →

name: MATT
line: The figures, one eclipsing the other from behind, begin to step in. You notice one of them begins to step from table to table, glancing about with a sort of grace to the movement, the other staying a few feet behind. Taliesin, if you'd like to describe your character, please. →

name: LAURA
line: I didn't think we were going to meet you so soon! →

name: TALIESIN
line: Neither did I. →

name: ASHLEY
line: I didn't either. →

name: TALIESIN
line: But here we are. A lavender-- damn it, Travis. A lavender tiefling with red eyes and very pierced, extremely ostentatious horns that are pierced with little gems and little baubles. He's got a tattoo that seems to be running up the side of his face, a peacock tattoo that goes off into his very ostentatious, ridiculous, overblown robes that he wears. His two swords and pouch dangling at the side of his hips. He's very broad in his dress. →

name: LIAM
line: So a literal and figurative peacock. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Oh yes. →

name: TRAVIS
line: One of your characters? No. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I know, mine. Who knew? →

name: MATT
line: As this tiefling darts from table to table, a few feet behind, you see-- →

name: ASHLEY
line: Wait, did you say your name? →

name: TALIESIN
line: I didn't say my name. →

name: ASHLEY
line: Okay. So there is a woman behind him. Taller than your average... lass. →

name: ASHLEY
line: (laughter) →

name: ASHLEY
line: She's very, very, very pale-skinned. Her hair is black that starts to turn white as it gets longer. It's matted, it's dreaded, it's braided. →

name: ASHLEY
line: Her clothes are a bit tattered, but just sort of-- she's a bit of a mess, and she has two different color eyes. One of them is a light greenish-blue, and the other is a violet color. And she's very standoffish, hunch-y, arms folded. →

name: MATT
line: You watch as these figures slowly move from table to table, the tiefling engaging in some distant conversation, leaving a slip of paper, walking to the next table. Gauging the atmosphere, not leaving a slip of paper, and quickly moving on, and then eventually your eyes meet what looks to be two tables with a very motley crew of individuals that are both awkwardly avoiding their own tension and currently trying to figure you out. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Can I tell if-- where are they in the dispensement of the coin? Can I tell they have a little coin on them? Did I catch any of that? →

name: MATT
line: They've completed distributing, so you don't see any coin, unfortunately. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Well. I don't believe I've ever seen a group of people more in need of a good time in my entire life. Mollymauk Tealeaf of the Fletching and Moondrop Traveling Carnival of Curiosities. If there was ever a group of people that needed a good time to go out, have a laugh, see things that you have never seen before, and my god, take my word for it, one month's time, people will be buying your ale to hear the tale of what you saw at the Traveling Carnival of Curiosities this night. →

name: LAURA
line: We saw your tent going up! We did! →

name: MARISHA
line: We were actually going to go without the flyer, but now we also have a flyer. →

name: TALIESIN
line: It's just five copper. A steal. At five silver, it would be a steal, at five gold? Worth every penny. But if you've got the five copper to spend, we would happily have you all. →

name: LAURA
line: Do you perform? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Ah. I'm less of a performer and more of an intermediary for these parts. I do on occasion perform. I can read fortunes-- →

name: LAURA
line: (gasps) I was going to ask if you read fortunes! Can you do one now? →

name: TALIESIN
line: I knew you were going to ask that. →

name: LAURA
line: (gasps) Oh my gosh, you're so smart. Look at this guy, he knows everything! →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm going to sit down at the table. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. He goes and sits down at this table, finishing his presentation. One of the barmaids comes up to you, and looks up. You're standing almost a solid seven inches taller than her. →

name: MATT
line: "Miss, can I get you a drink?" →

name: ASHLEY
line: (deadpan) Yes could I have a drink, please. Just some ale. →

name: MATT
line: "Coming right up. Any preferences for the family? Baumbauch?" →

name: LAURA
line: Stay clear of Baumbauch. They're dicks. →

name: MARISHA
line: That's kind of true. →

name: ASHLEY
line: Just a big. →

name: MATT
line: "Husseldorf, then. All right. Be right back." And she wanders off. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Well. Who has coin for a fortune? →

name: LAURA
line: Do you know my name? →

name: TALIESIN
line: What is your name? →

name: LAURA
line: Jester. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I know your name now! →

name: LAURA
line: (laugh) →

name: LAURA
line: What is your name? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Oh, my name is Molly to my friends, and we're friends, now, aren't we? Pleasure. →

name: LAURA
line: Molly. Look at this guy. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Mollymauk. Molly for short. This is Yasha, she's a charm. →

name: ASHLEY
line: Hello. →

name: MARISHA
line: Yasha. Yasha. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Now. Would anyone like a fortune read? →

name: LAURA
line: I would love one. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Do you have coin? →

name: LAURA
line: Yes. How much do you want? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Two copper. →

name: LAURA
line: Two copper, okay, I just got some copper. →

name: LAURA
line: Here you go. →

name: MATT
line: Mark down your two copper. (laughs) →

name: TALIESIN
line: I am taking this in. All right. (sighs) I'm going to try and do this. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh my gosh, really? →

name: MATT
line: So, as he pulls out a small set of cards and begins to shuffle them, go ahead and roll an insight check. →

name: ASHLEY
line: (deadpan) He's really quite good, you all should line up and get your fortunes told. →

name: ASHLEY
line: (laughter) →

name: TALIESIN
line: Let's do a 16 there. →

name: MATT
line: Okay, so you get a brief conversation here, you get a pretty solid read: the excitability, the eagerness, and the exuberant interest in just getting in your face that this person wants-- any fortune you tell will probably suffice. Go ahead and roll a sleight-of-hand check as well. →

name: SAM
line: Look at this fucking game! (laughter) →

name: TALIESIN
line: Also 16. →

name: MATT
line: Yeah. And you feel pretty confident that her eyes are locked onto your eyes at the moment and not the deck, as you set up a proper reading. And the cards are shuffled, set, you place them before you, and you may give your fortune. →

name: SAM
line: I'm going to just keep my eyes open for any tricks of the hand, sleight-of-hand-y-type tricks. →

name: MATT
line: Make a perception check. →

name: SAM
line: Okay. Perception. 14. →

name: MATT
line: 14. All right. Everything seems pretty above-board. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Your first card, the Silver Dragon. This is good. You're pure, you're virtue, you are a worthwhile and wonderful human being, obviously, or creature of some repute. →

name: LAURA
line: That's what everyone always tells me. →

name: TALIESIN
line: It's true. And heading towards the Anvil. →

name: LAURA
line: What is that? →

name: TALIESIN
line: That is a destiny forged. →

name: ASHLEY
line: (deadpan) Ohh. →

name: TALIESIN
line: There is something bright and adventurous in your future. →

name: LAURA
line: Wow! You know, we did just defeat a really big snake? So maybe there's even bigger things coming up, you know? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Can I make another roll? →

name: MATT
line: Sure. →

name: SAM
line: Ashley confirmed worst hype-man ever. →

name: SAM
line: (laughter) →

name: MATT
line: Yeah, easy enough. Even with discerning eyes at the table, you are at the top of your game. →

name: TALIESIN
line: The Serpent card appears. Of course you did. →

name: LAURA
line: (gasps) Oh my gosh! Look at that! How did you even do that? →

name: TALIESIN
line: That's all the cards. I'm simply a vessel for higher powers. →

name: LIAM
line: While everybody's watching this shit happen, may I cast Detect Magic? →

name: MATT
line: You may. You lean back and subtly begin a brief muttering of an incantation, your fingers wash through the air, a faint silver gleam across your fingertips. Nothing magical shows up in the immediate vicinity. →

name: LAURA
line: Will you ask the cards if I'm going to find him? →

name: TALIESIN
line: If you're going to find her? →

name: LAURA
line: Him. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Give me a little bit more. Who's this 'him' that you're looking for? →

name: LAURA
line: I'm looking for my dad. →

name: MATT
line: You fumble for a second, but the card still finds its way through without issue. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Pushing through, pushing through. The Eye card pulls up. You've already found the clue you're looking for. You just don't know what it is yet. →

name: LAURA
line: Really? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Apparently. Well, it's what the cards are saying. It's right in front of you. →

name: LAURA
line: Wow. Does it say how long ago I found it? Because that's-- →

name: TALIESIN
line: Sadly, I don't have that sort of specifics. That's much more expensive. →

name: LAURA
line: That's going to take a lot of thinking. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Well, you find us at the show, you'll find my tent and I'd be happy to give you a more complicated reading. →

name: LAURA
line: I can't wait! It's going to be so much fun. →

name: TALIESIN
line: So much fun. →

name: MATT
line: Yasha, at this point, the barmaid, Adelaine, comes up and hands you the ordered ale. →

name: ASHLEY
line: Thank you, my lady. →

name: MATT
line: "On the house." →

name: TALIESIN
line: On the house! →

name: ASHLEY
line: That's very kind of you. →

name: MARISHA
line: Do you perform in the circus, too? →

name: ASHLEY
line: No. I do not. I just-- I put it up. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh, cool. →

name: TRAVIS
line: The tent. →

name: LAURA
line: It's a big tent. It would take a lot of work. →

name: ASHLEY
line: I put up the stage, I move things around. →

name: ASHLEY
line: I'm very strong. But I don't do anything in the show. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Some of our acts are a little complicated, with performers who are not of the traditional variety. Can make some of the locals get a little shifty, if you know what I mean, and it's good to have a few people around who are capable of keeping issues contained. →

name: MARISHA
line: Is that why it says 'No admittance to the elderly'? You don't want to deal with those riley elderly. Or the ill, yeah. Why no elderly, though? Ill kind of makes sense, but elderly? →

name: TALIESIN
line: We cannot be held responsible for anything that may happen to someone who is ill or infirm. It is such an exciting, impressive show. →

name: ASHLEY
line: We've had people die watching it. →

name: ASHLEY
line: Yeah. It's just that exciting. Just from excitement. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Did they die in the show, or from watching it? →

name: ASHLEY
line: Yeah, just like heart attack. Just from getting so excited, I guess. →

name: MARISHA
line: We gotta get so wasted. →

name: LAURA
line: When is it? How long is it? When is it? →

name: MATT
line: It is actually the day of Grissen, and your first show is today. →

name: TALIESIN
line: First show is tonight. →

name: LAURA
line: Well, we have plans tonight! →

name: MARISHA
line: Yay! →

name: LAURA
line: Do you stinky people want to come with us? →

name: SAM
line: I-- Caleb, we don't have any plans tonight. I guess we could go along. I wouldn't mind seeing it. →

name: MARISHA
line: It'll be fun! →

name: TALIESIN
line: Or you could stay here and buy beer for the people who do see the shows, and you can hear all about it and pay more. →

name: LIAM
line: Yeah, we can go. →

name: LAURA
line: It's going to be so much fun. →

name: SAM
line: Yeah, yeah, it sounds like a good night. →

name: SAM
line: Yeah. →

name: LAURA
line: Look at all these friends we're making here. This is a good city. →

name: SAM
line: Yeah, it is. →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, yeah. →

name: TALIESIN
line: You are all the most charming people I've met in-- yes. I finish my beer. (sighs) Well, we'd better be getting on. →

name: ASHLEY
line: Yep, nice to meet you all. You're so, uh, wonderful. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Charm. Pure charm. See you tonight! →

name: MATT
line: And as they leave you, Yasha just downs her entire ale, slams it on the table, and they both walk out, passing a couple more flyers at off tables, and then exit out to the rest of the day's sun beyond your sight. →

name: MARISHA
line: She was awesome. →

name: TRAVIS
line: She didn't say much. →

name: MARISHA
line: That's why I liked her. →

name: LAURA
line: She was really, really cool. Did you see that cool thing she had going on with her chin? That's interesting. I wish I would have thought of something like that. →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, I mean, you could maybe do something like that in time. Just wait until maybe-- →

name: LAURA
line: So she doesn't know I copied. I can't do it tonight. →

name: MARISHA
line: No, no. →

name: LAURA
line: Wow. Cool. What do you guys want to do now? (laughter) →

name: TRAVIS
line: Was he using magic? →

name: LAURA
line: I don't know. →

name: MARISHA
line: Are you-- you're superstitious. Yeah? →

name: LAURA
line: No. →

name: MARISHA
line: Okay. →

name: LAURA
line: No, I'm not superstitious at all. →

name: MARISHA
line: You-- sure. →

name: LAURA
line: Why? →

name: MARISHA
line: I mean, what he was working in was-- he was doing a little like-- he-- he's a smart guy. →

name: MARISHA
line: He's a smart guy. →

name: LAURA
line: By the way, did you open your Christmas present from me? →

name: TALIESIN
line: No, not yet, no. →

name: LAURA
line: You should go open it! Yes! Go grab the bag! →

name: TALIESIN
line: On the break. On the break, I'll grab it. →

name: SAM
line: Hey, Matt. Dungeon master. They're wearing what they described. They're not wearing any cloaks or anything right now, are they? →

name: MATT
line: Both of them have small cloaks over the shoulders, Beau has a-- →

name: SAM
line: Do I recognize those cloaks? →

name: MATT
line: No, you do not. →

name: LAURA
line: What? Why would you recognize the cloaks? →

name: SAM
line: Maybe I saw something. I don't know. →

name: MATT
line: No, you do not. →

name: SAM
line: I didn't see them last night? →

name: MATT
line: No. →

name: SAM
line: Okay. Interesting. →

name: MARISHA
line: Mysteries. →

name: LIAM
line: Also, for the record, there was nothing magic about that. Maybe he's good at reading people, but that was not magic. →

name: SAM
line: Caleb knows everything about magic. He's been even teaching me some. He's real good. You should see him-- →

name: LIAM
line: Nott-- →

name: LAURA
line: Caleb, are you going to go the Academy? →

name: LIAM
line: (strained laugh) That's silly. →

name: SAM
line: He could if he wanted to. He's really good at magic. He can make a cat appear and disappear whenever he wants. →

name: LAURA
line: Really? A cat? →

name: LIAM
line: (snaps) →

name: MATT
line: You watch as just beneath the table, this orange patchy tabby leaps up. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh, shit! What's his name? →

name: LAURA
line: Or her name! →

name: LIAM
line: Well, it is a he. This is my cat Frumpkin. →

name: LIAM
line: Frumpkin, yes. →

name: LAURA
line: Aw! Can I call him Lumpy? →

name: LIAM
line: You can call him Frumpkin. →

name: LAURA
line: Look at this Lumpy! Made in England. →

name: LAURA
line: (laughter) →

name: LIAM
line: That was a little show gift from Marisha, so this is Frumpkin. →

name: LAURA
line: That's so great. →

name: SAM
line: That's not all he can do. Caleb, tell them all the stuff you can do. It's really impressive! →

name: LIAM
line: You know, sometimes less is more. →

name: LAURA
line: I can do things, too. →

name: SAM
line: With magic? →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah. →

name: SAM
line: Like what? →

name: LAURA
line: Like-- →

name: SAM
line: Not to me, not to me! →

name: LAURA
line: Like-- oh, gosh. Okay. I'm going to use Thaumaturgy and I'm going to make all the windows in the place open up really fast, like crash open. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. You watch as four of the nearby windows slam open with a sudden burst of wind, and all the various bits of torchlight that light the deeper and more shadowed corners of the room suddenly darken and flicker. The music suddenly comes to a stop. Everyone holds their position and glances over at the table where you're all sitting. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Jester, don't you remember us talking about keeping a low profile? →

name: LAURA
line: You're right. I'm sorry. I use Thaumaturgy and I close all the windows. →

name: LAURA
line: (laughter) →

name: MATT
line: They all slam shut a second time. The light flickers and then brightens back to its normal place. →

name: LAURA
line: Ta-da! →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah! Yeah! →

name: LAURA
line: Come see me tonight at the carnival! I'm really good! →

name: MATT
line: One really crotchety-looking guy in his early 50s with a super underbite, probably missing most of his teeth, just goes-- (laughter) →

name: LIAM
line: I telepathically tell Frumpkin to jump up and sit in the lap of the woman in the monk's robes who just made a big scene and hopefully keep her occupied with being cute. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. As soon as you sit down, Frumpkin leaps into your lap and starts purring and rubbing up against your hand. →

name: MARISHA
line: Hey, buddy. Look at this kitty! I think he likes me. →

name: LIAM
line: Sure, right now he likes you. →

name: MARISHA
line: Is this a real cat? Or is this a fake cat? →

name: LIAM
line: What do you mean, a fake cat? →

name: MARISHA
line: Like a magic cat. →

name: LIAM
line: He's both a real cat and a magic cat. →

name: MARISHA
line: Is he an illusion cat? →

name: LIAM
line: Do you feel him? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Could you put him over there? →

name: MARISHA
line: Are you allergic to Frumpkins? Oh no! →

name: LAURA
line: But he's a magic cat. How can you be allergic to magic cats? →

name: TRAVIS
line: I'm pretty sure he's a real fucking cat. →

name: MARISHA
line: He's one of those hypoallergenic magic cats. →

name: LIAM
line: I don't know what the Fifth Edition rules are-- →

name: LAURA
line: --for cat dander? →

name: MATT
line: As far as you know right now? Yeah, he's having an actual allergic attack. A minor one. →

name: MARISHA
line: I walk away a little bit from Fjord. →

name: LIAM
line: Shit. →

name: LIAM
line: (laughter) →

name: SAM
line: Well, you're both magic-users, then. And so is the larger fellow? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Well, I mean, a little. →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah, I mean, he's learning. He's getting really good at it. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Trying to learn more. →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah, you should have seen him. He disguised himself the other day, and it was like, (clicks tongue). →

name: TRAVIS
line: Thanks, Jester. She's better at it than I am. We're trying to make our way up to the Academy to get a little bit more learning done. →

name: LAURA
line: Well, he's going to learn. I'm not going to go to the Academy. →

name: MARISHA
line: Man, this Academy place keeps getting brought up. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Well yeah, it's the place to be. →

name: MARISHA
line: Okay. →

name: SAM
line: I'm sorry, what Academy are we talking about? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Solstryce Academy. You know. →

name: MATT
line: Soltryce. →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah, that one. →

name: SAM
line: The Soul Train Academy. →

name: LIAM
line: It's a very fancy place. →

name: TRAVIS
line: You know it. →

name: LIAM
line: I have heard of it. →

name: TRAVIS
line: And you have arcane talents as well. →

name: LIAM
line: Yeah. →

name: LAURA
line: How long have you had yours? →

name: LIAM
line: That's a tricky question. I studied when I was younger, and then I gave it up for a while. I picked it up again recently. It's all book-learned. →

name: LAURA
line: Wow, that's cool. →

name: MARISHA
line: This was a good way to go for your first. →

name: LAURA
line: A frickin' cat! →

name: MARISHA
line: This is kind of therapeutic. Making me feel better, just about life in general. →

name: TRAVIS
line: (sneezes) →

name: MARISHA
line: All right. →

name: SAM
line: He reads lots of books, Caleb does. He's very smart. In fact, should we go looking for more right now? →

name: LIAM
line: Maybe in a little while. →

name: LAURA
line: Can I see one of your books? →

name: LIAM
line: Well-- and I pull apart the lapels of my coat. I have books in what modern-day people like to think of as holster-straps, but there's a book hanging here. →

name: SAM
line: I think ancient people would call it a holster as well. →

name: LIAM
line: Bap-bap-bap. The books are right here. I have these, but these are heirlooms, family heirlooms, so I don't share those, but-- no, I like to read. That's all. And I'm a bit of a self-starter, so I have to find-- I mean, good luck at the Academy. That's rough, I hear. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Do you know anything about it? We're just going up. Beginner's luck. →

name: LAURA
line: We know it's rich people that go there. We have to find a way to get you in. →

name: LIAM
line: All I know is how hard it is to get into. →

name: SAM
line: You don't have a lot of money, then? →

name: LAURA
line: Well. →

name: TRAVIS
line: No. →

name: LAURA
line: We had more. →

name: MARISHA
line: But then we lost it, but then we got it back. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Somebody has a gambling problem. →

name: SAM
line: Oh. Which one? →

name: LAURA
line: What's the name of it again? →

name: MATT
line: It is the Crick-Queen's Call. →

name: LAURA
line: Have you played it? →

name: SAM
line: No, I haven't. →

name: LAURA
line: I'll teach you someday. It's so much fun. →

name: SAM
line: It's a game? →

name: LAURA
line: Yes. →

name: SAM
line: Cards? All right. I might like to know that. →

name: LAURA
line: I mean, I can teach you, if you want. →

name: SAM
line: Yes, I would like to know that. →

name: LAURA
line: Okay, I'll deal! →

name: SAM
line: Oh, right now? →

name: LAURA
line: Yes, sure, this will be fun. →

name: SAM
line: Is this okay? →

name: LIAM
line: Listen, I would not be sitting here if it were not for you. Do whatever you like. →

name: LAURA
line: Okay. You draw three cards. Well, I give you three cards. So you use 3d6. →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah. →

name: SAM
line: Got one. I'm not you. I have one of each dice. →

name: SAM
line: (laughter) →

name: LAURA
line: Okay. So hide your roll from me, because we can't know. So first you have to ante up. How much coin do you want to put in? →

name: SAM
line: I'm out. →

name: SAM
line: (laughter) →

name: LIAM
line: It's all right. I will front some coin for you to play this game. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh, great! How much do you want to front him? →

name: LIAM
line: I will give you a silver piece. →

name: LAURA
line: A silver. Okay, this is great. →

name: SAM
line: Thank you, Caleb. Thank you. →

name: LIAM
line: Wish I had more. →

name: LAURA
line: Okay. Am I doing this right? →

name: MATT
line: So far. →

name: LAURA
line: Now I'm going to give us three cards, so we both roll, but we can't see. That's good. Okay. →

name: MARISHA
line: Don't say 'that's good'. →

name: LAURA
line: Bluffing. How do you know I wasn't? →

name: SAM
line: I'm going to try to change one of my cards. →

name: LAURA
line: No, wait, there's rules! →

name: SAM
line: Without you seeing. →

name: MATT
line: Make a sleight-of-hand check. →

name: SAM
line: 12 plus eight, so that's 20. →

name: MATT
line: Make a perception check. →

name: LAURA
line: No, he totally did it. She totally did it. →

name: LAURA
line: This is really hard, Sam. →

name: LIAM
line: You're only an hour and a half in. →

name: SAM
line: This is my only skill, guys. →

name: LAURA
line: But, you know, that's my skill, too. →

name: SAM
line: Oh, shit. →

name: LAURA
line: So I'm going to try to do it as well, 'cause that's my skill as well. →

name: MATT
line: Well, first, what'd you roll for-- →

name: LAURA
line: I did not notice him doing it. →

name: MATT
line: Okay, yeah, so you only get to reroll one of the dice. →

name: LAURA
line: Okay, so I'm going to try to reroll one of my three, too. →

name: MATT
line: Go ahead. So make a sleight-of-hand check. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh, right. Oh, shit. →

name: SAM
line: Do I notice her? →

name: MATT
line: Well, roll a perception check. →

name: SAM
line: Nope. →

name: SAM
line: No, I rolled three. →

name: LAURA
line: Okay. So the best hand you can get is three of a kind. Then, after that, it's a straight. A high straight. Then a low straight. Then it's if you get all evens, or if you get all odds, then it's two of a kind, then it's nothing, it's just high card. Okay, but now we put in a second amount, because you can up the ante, and you get one more card. →

name: SAM
line: I'm out. →

name: LAURA
line: No, but wait, wait, wait. You can put in more money, and then I deal you a different card. →

name: LAURA
line: You get to give a card back, and then I deal you another card. →

name: SAM
line: Should I? Caleb, do you have any more? →

name: LIAM
line: Because you saved my life yesterday, you may have one more silver piece. →

name: LAURA
line: One more silver. Okay, I'll keep it low, too, because you're only doing the one. So I only put in one silver, too. →

name: MATT
line: That's a four-silver pot. →

name: LAURA
line: Yes. And now give one of your dice back, whichever one you don't want, and roll it again. →

name: MATT
line: So you get to reroll. →

name: SAM
line: Okay, got it. →

name: MATT
line: And you get to reroll one as well. →

name: LAURA
line: I don't want to reroll any. Okay. Now you show what you got and we'll see who wins. →

name: SAM
line: I got a pair of fours. →

name: LAURA
line: I got three fives. →

name: SAM
line: I draw my shortsword. →

name: SAM
line: (laughter) →

name: MARISHA
line: I immediately grapple him. →

name: MATT
line: Make an athletics check. You make an acrobatics check. →

name: SAM
line: Acrobatics? 24. →

name: MATT
line: So the female goblin draws a shortsword. You reach out to grab, and she slips out of your grasp and is now holding the blade at the edge of the table. →

name: SAM
line: You're cheating. Somehow you're cheating. →

name: LIAM
line: Nott, Nott, that's fine. That's fine. She won my two silver pieces. We'll just leave it at that. →

name: SAM
line: I'm sorry. →

name: LIAM
line: That's okay. She's very jumpy sometimes. You can understand; we've been living in the woods for a long time. Every time we come near any place like this, we're attacked, jumped, followed. So I apologize on behalf of-- →

name: SAM
line: That was stupid. I'm sorry. I shouldn't have done that. I'm sorry. →

name: LAURA
line: No, it's okay. Just don't do it again. But I'm sorry I took all this money from your friend. →

name: LIAM
line: That's making it worse. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Maybe you could give some of it back. →

name: LAURA
line: Why, though? But I won it. →

name: SAM
line: Your Laura is showing. →

name: SAM
line: (laughter) →

name: LAURA
line: Tell you what. I'll give you-- none of it back, I can't! Okay, here's one silver back-- →

name: LIAM
line: No, I insist. →

name: LAURA
line: Okay, but I insist, all the money back. All right, fine, it's mine, thank you. Yay. →

name: SAM
line: I need another drink. →

name: LIAM
line: A round of Trosts for both our tables, please. →

name: LAURA
line: See? Isn't that the most fun? →

name: SAM
line: It's fun. →

name: MATT
line: Yorda looks over and goes, "Any preference of family?" →

name: LIAM
line: Not Baumbauch. →

name: MATT
line: "Von Brandt it is." →

name: MARISHA
line: I'm impressed that you stuck to taking a guy's money in a training game. →

name: LAURA
line: Right? Oh, wait, is that bad? →

name: MARISHA
line: Meh. →

name: LAURA
line: Well, I only learned last night, you guys. →

name: LIAM
line: What is a training game? →

name: MARISHA
line: Just meaning when she was teaching. →

name: LAURA
line: People took my money when I was learning. →

name: LIAM
line: It's fine. It's water under the bridge. It's fine. It's all right. →

name: MATT
line: Another round is brought to your table. You guys can share a solemn post-game drink amongst yourselves. →

name: LIAM
line: If you feel slightly worse, there's a drink on me. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh jeez, now I'm definitely giving you your two silver back. Don't worry about it, man. →

name: LAURA
line: (laughter) →

name: SAM
line: She's just a couple of wild and crazy guys over here. →

name: SAM
line: (laughter) →

name: LAURA
line: Have my baked goods come out yet? →

name: MATT
line: They have. Your meal's been presented for a while now. You've had the opportunity to eat most of your meal. →

name: SAM
line: That's real. →

name: MATT
line: That is actually real. That's the power of imagination, Sam. That wasn't there a second ago. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Bangarang! (laughter) →

name: TALIESIN
line: Right there for you. →

name: MATT
line: So you all finish your independent meals and decide to continue your conversations or go about your business for the day. →

name: LAURA
line: I just want to go to the carnival. →

name: LIAM
line: That's later tonight, though, isn't it? →

name: MATT
line: If you have no other business, we can wait until dusk. →

name: SAM
line: Well, there's that board on the wall. Has anything new been posted on the board? →

name: MATT
line: You go ahead and take a look at it. There is one sheet that pertains to somebody in the Hills Ward looking for folks to go ahead and do an extermination run near the southern portion of the Ustaloch. It looks like there's what looks to be a vole infestation. →

name: TRAVIS
line: What the fuck is a vole? →

name: MATT
line: It's a small rat. →

name: LAURA
line: Should we do it? →

name: MARISHA
line: I mean, we have to kill Rodents of Unusual Size. →

name: SAM
line: That doesn't sound interesting to me at all. →

name: TRAVIS
line: What else is there? →

name: MATT
line: Currently, it looks like there was another sheet that looks like most has been torn off. The rest of the board is pretty empty at the moment. →

name: LIAM
line: DM, did I tear that? I can't remember. →

name: MATT
line: You did, yes. →

name: SAM
line: Wasn't it a delivery thing? →

name: LIAM
line: That was what it was, yeah. →

name: MATT
line: It was to help move and load crates at one of the local breweries. →

name: SAM
line: Fuck that. →

name: LAURA
line: We've done that. It sucked so much. →

name: SAM
line: You did that? →

name: LAURA
line: Well, by mistake. →

name: MARISHA
line: We played D&D and we moved crates for eight hours. →

name: MARISHA
line: (laughter) →

name: TRAVIS
line: We did, yeah. →

name: MATT
line: Welcome to level two. →

name: SAM
line: We said no to that job, thank you. →

name: TRAVIS
line: We get bored pretty easily. →

name: MARISHA
line: We did, however, then gamble with the other workers and then Jester-- yeah. Jester-- →

name: LAURA
line: Well, I lost it, but he made so much. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Maybe not out loud say that. Just a thought. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh, that's right. We probably shouldn't. →

name: MARISHA
line: We didn't make any money. →

name: LAURA
line: Do you guys want company? Do you want us to come and hang out with you today? →

name: SAM
line: I don't know about that. That sounds risky, I don't know. →

name: LIAM
line: Do you know something? I, shockingly, think that's not a bad idea. →

name: SAM
line: To have these weirdos with us? →

name: LAURA
line: I can hear you. →

name: LIAM
line: Yesterday was a very bad day. →

name: SAM
line: Yes. Well, I suppose if we surrounded ourselves with weirdos, then maybe it would take some of heat off of me. →

name: LIAM
line: Well, yes. Bottom line: can you hang with the goblin? →

name: LAURA
line: Bottom line-- and I touch Nott's shoulder, and I cast Blessing of the Trickster. →

name: SAM
line: Oh, Jesus, she's going to kill me right now. →

name: SAM
line: (laughter) →

name: SAM
line: Any magic kills a goblin instantly. Yeah, instantly. →

name: SAM
line: (laughter) →

name: LAURA
line: That would be the worst character choice ever. →

name: LAURA

A renewed energy takes the streets as the sound of a fiddle seems to creep through the night air. →

name: MATT
line: Folks begin to prod their heads out into the open air, curious about the source of this unusual din, and you find your vision capturing a small procession of flamboyantly dressed people parading through the central road. A lanky man of some obvious elven descent leads the pack, his long, ashy-brown hair curling ever-so-slightly past his mid-back, his long coat and tails knocking around by his skipping step. Two halfling women in purple and green bodysuits dance from side to side, handing flowers to children and flyers to adults, as a bald man in a neck-frilled frock coat of bright red, his face adorned in vibrant orange makeup to look like the setting sun behind him, plays the violin that you heard earlier in an upbeat, jovial manner. A tall half-orc masculine man with a well-groomed handlebar mustache that curves out to the side, billowing white silk shirt and black trousers, follows behind with a big drum slung over his shoulder, going (drumming) along with the fiddle. The tiefling man of lavender skin that you saw earlier walks along with a grin, juggling two curved scimitars as he walks in place, almost loses one and catches it, continues to go. →

name: MATT
line: Families are beginning to gather out to see this display. The two dancers part, and then a woman of short, fiery red hair and dark skin walking between them, lifting a small candle before-- fwoosh! A giant burst, a gout of flame emerges from the front of her mouth, brightens the vicinity, and everyone collectively gasps and begins cheering and clapping as they continue the walk. There, to the back of it, you see the rather burly-looking pale woman, arms crossed, just following behind and keeping an eye like a security guard to ensure that no business gets out of hand. The gasps and the cheers begin to follow, and as the procession continues down its way, the families and civilians begin to gather and follow behind. As the last bit of the sun sets behind the mountain range, the torches glowing, the procession curves through the center of the Loch Ward to the edge of the Ustaloch itself. Through the fishing village, more folks begin to gather. →

name: MATT

The procession continues towards the eastern side, out along the southern edge of this Loch Ward, to the Ustaloch's southern place, towards the new, completely constructed, large, dark blue tent. Lengthy streamers of white and silver flap with the cold winds from the top of the structure. As you guys walk, you watch as the horned tiefling you had approached earlier slowly saunters up to your side, you recognizing these individuals you had spoken with earlier. →

line: I just drag Nott five feet over. That is two strikes against you. I think we should really just sort of enjoy the show tonight. →

name: MATT
line: 11, that's enough. As she spins the falchion around, you notice that, affixed to her back, in uncharacteristically clean leather towards the rest of her outfit, what appears to be a slung-over sheath and a very large bladed weapon, larger than your falchion, affixed to her back. →

line: Hey, Jester. Before you go. Tiefling to tiefling, and thank you for keeping this rabble in check. →

line: Both her and the half-orc turn to you. →

line: Little one. I just go over and I fireman-style over my shoulder. Since you can't walk. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh. →

name: MARISHA

name: MATT

name: TALIESIN

line: The birds are out already. →

name: MATT
line: At which point, the other Bo, Bo the Breaker, goes ahead and collects five copper from each of you as you pass through, so mark off five copper, except for the two of you, you guys are part of it. →

name: LAURA
line: If I skip around, will I be part of the show and then I don't have to pay? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Weirdly, being part of the show means you strangely pay more. I'm not entirely sure how that works. →
