line: Nott, do you have five copper? →

name: SAM
line: For you, Caleb, I do. →

name: LIAM
line: No, I'm not asking. I was going to help you, but if you have it, you're good. →

line: Mollymauk. That Jester's adorable. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I know. Highly entertained. →

name: ASHLEY
line: I like her. →

name: TALIESIN

name: MATT
line: So, stepping into the interior of the tent, the rocky floor filled with grass and dirt and various flattened groundscape on the outskirts of the Ustaloch, you can see a thick, heavy tarp-like material hitting the very edge where the heavy dark blue cloth hangs from the sides of the tent you're within. You can see where the seating is guided across the floor, and there, already in a very packed room, you see a few dozen townsfolk that have begun to gather in a semicircle. There is the entrance flap of the tent where you guys are walking in. As soon as you walk in, you can see a central pillar, a heavy column of wood, a tree that has been completely rounded off on all sides, held aloft to carry the top of the canopy of the tent itself. And across the way, you can see a larger flap tent that is currently closed that appears to be probably the performers' entrance. You can see above you four hanging lanterns that glow with what seems like a flicker of light, but the pattern to them is consistent, meaning it's not probably natural flame. Children and people are beginning to mash around the sides, and the space along the edges of the interior of this tent is starting to get a little cramped. →

name: MATT
line: Where do you guide them, Yasha? →

name: ASHLEY
line: Did you guys want to sit in the front row? →

name: SAM
line: That's what we were told is the best seat in the house. →

name: ASHLEY
line: We want to sit in the front row. →

name: MATT
line: So there's-- if you consider a semicircle pattern here, there's-- if you're entering, you can go front to the right, front to the left, front to the center, anywhere in between. Where would you like to be currently sitting? →

name: ASHLEY
line: Front and center? Or do you want to be on the sides? →

name: LAURA
line: Front and center! →

name: ASHLEY
line: I take them to the front and center. →

name: MATT
line: Front and center, okay. →

name: LIAM
line: I'm going to keep my hand on my meager purse for the evening. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. →

name: LAURA
line: As soon as I sit down, I'm going to pull out my sketchbook and draw the moon and the shadow card that Molly showed me. →

name: MARISHA
line: As we're walking over, I say, hey, Yasha, 'cause I was totally on your shoulder, heard you talking about my friend, Jester. →

name: ASHLEY
line: Ah, shit. →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah. →

name: ASHLEY
line: I didn't mean anything by it. I just-- →

name: MARISHA
line: No, dude. No, she's never mentioned a significant other, so, I mean. →

name: ASHLEY
line: Oh, I'm not looking for anything, I just-- →

name: MARISHA
line: Will you hold me through the show? (laughter) →

name: MARISHA
line: Like, cradle me? →

name: ASHLEY
line: That's an extra charge. We do do that, though. →

name: MARISHA
line: How much? →

name: ASHLEY
line: Well, it's an extra five gold pieces. →

name: MARISHA
line: Five gold? →

name: ASHLEY
line: These arms are worth a lot. →

name: TALIESIN
line: It's a very swaddling hug. You've never experienced anything like it. →

name: ASHLEY
line: It's the best way to see the show, if that's how you want it. →

name: MARISHA
line: I'll give you five silver just to have your shrug to sit on so my butt's not on the floor. →

name: ASHLEY
line: I don't take off my shrug. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh, sorry. →

name: ASHLEY
line: How about you just keep your money and I'll put you in a chair and I'll just watch over your weapons. →

name: MARISHA
line: Okay. →

name: MATT
line: So she places you on the ground, as there are no chairs. →

name: ASHLEY
line: On the ground, I mean, because there's no chairs. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh, there's no chairs? Aw. I was picturing benches. That's okay. →

name: TRAVIS
line: There's no benches? Oh, fuck. →

name: MATT
line: Where are they going to transport benches from place to place? →

name: ASHLEY
line: That's a good point. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Carnival? I don't know. →

name: TRAVIS
line: (laughter) →

name: MATT
line: Well, sorry, you have Fletching and Moondrop to deal with. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Bring a cushion from home like a regular person. →

name: MATT
line: So, as the music has died down and everyone begins to crowd in and whisper to themselves, eventually it begins to quiet a bit, everyone having their seats. The familiar sound of the fiddle begins to play, and everyone quickly gets quiet, down to a hush. The music seems sourceless in the interior of the tent. Everyone begins to look around to see where it may come from. You hear points of hushed "look"s, pointing off in different areas, and at the top of the tent, you see, seeming to stretch and fall, like a slow drop of water, the man in red you saw earlier descends from the top of the tent, but now dressed head-to-toe in a matching deep blue outfit and full makeup, to where he appears out of the canopy of the tent. He hangs from a rope by one foot, it's wrapped around and clutched as his foot catches the edge. Playing his violin ever-so-slowly as he carefully descends, and then at the last moment releases the rope and lands on his feet, continuing the music he's playing. He slowly spins as the longer-haired elf leader of the earlier parade that you saw, the one that had marked back briefly to your two new friends over here, enters the tent from the distant flaps, the performers' entrance, his head now sporting that same tall hat, flopping backwards at the apex. He extends his arms, removing the hat, and takes a deep bow as the crowd begins to clap. →

name: MATT
line: (applause) →

name: MATT
line: "Ladies and gentlemen of Trostenwald, I am Carnival Master Gustav Fletching, and allow me to welcome you to the Fletching and Moondrop's Traveling Carnival of Curiosities." (applause) →

name: MATT
line: "I ask you, each and every one of you--" You hear some children giggle as he makes eye contact. →

name: MATT
line: "--grant us your imaginations this eve but a trifle bit of time, and allow us to reveal a realm of laughter, mystery, danger, and beauty. I see you've already met Desmond." And he gestures towards the man in all blue who's playing the fiddle. "He'll be part of our story tonight, so keep a wily eye for the shifting fool. But first, I tell you a tale of two sisters of the Fey." And as Desmond slowly leaves the tent, you see two armored guards by where he is now have entered, two of the Crown's Guard are stepping by the entrance where he walked in, watch him pass. "Lost without form into the mazes of the underworld. →

name: MATT
line: There, where the body would break, they found a teacher in a mystical serpent, and the gift they received was the ability to bend with this maze that captured them and slither their way back to the surface to reclaim their place in the world. →

name: MATT
line: May I present to you Mona and Yuli, the Knot Sisters." As he slowly backs through the performers' entrance, the two halfling dancers you saw earlier, in the full bodysuits, emerge from behind the Carnival Master as he discreetly exits. →

name: MATT
line: They sport serpentine makeup, scales affixed to the sides of their face and arms. Approaching the central spire, the pole that holds the tent up, one immediately leaps onto the shoulders of the other, bending her back a near-impossible amount, creating this humanoid sculpture that you see the front row cringe at the idea of the pain that would cause an average individual. But these halflings are very nimble and able to create almost a single form out of two bodies. Their rigid form becomes fluid to the eye as they move and shift to the music, the violin now sourceless once again, not seeing where this Desmond is placed, but they seem to move as it picks up speed. →

name: LAURA
line: (whispers) It's like the serpent we fought, you guys! →

name: SAM
line: I was expecting more Ringling Brothers, actually. →

name: SAM
line: (laughter) →

name: MATT
line: Suddenly, the top one folds over and slams into the ground, tumbling across the center in a wild display of physical control. The two of them begin to tangle and wrap like two battling snakes, their bodies seemingly disconnecting from the rigid halfling forms you had seen, and you swear, for a moment, becoming serpentine-like as they intertwine around the base of this pole. It's beautiful and violent at the same time. It's off-putting. And watch as they curl around the base of this pole, the lights above begin to become a dull greenish-blue, and get darker and darker, presenting this imagery of the underworld. →

name: MATT
line: One by one, they silently tell a tale of struggle, crawling across one, then the other, one at a time, using their serpentine-like forms as an extending ladder, folding over each other as they use every muscle in their body to cling around this pole and ladder-step up like a snake. It's a very strange but alluring sight, and you can't help but notice that you forget that these are two halfling girls, and you find yourself pulled into this wordless story they tell of climbing back to their place, to the surface, towards the dark sky of lightless blue cloth. As the baubles that contain the interior light of the tent begin to glow brighter and brighter, their climbing becomes more fevered. The two of them, arm into arm, leg into leg, rolling up and swirling, until eventually at the apex they grab each other's arms around the pole before spinning downward, back-to-back, legs outward, with a rapid pace, the music coming to a full crescendo. Like a Maypole, they both curl and twirl and then tumble to the ground before the audience with a flourish, arms in the air, and the audience erupts in applause. →

name: MATT
line: (applause) →

name: MATT
line: As they both begin to back away, smiles on their faces, nodding to each other, Gustav emerges once more from the performers' flap. The fool appears at the back entrance again, taking an ominous tune with his violin this time, his outfit no longer blue but deepset black. The hanging lights darken once again as Gustav takes the center stage. "In a flash, beyond the ash, the gods all went and gone. The darkness came to grasp, reclaim, and suffocate the dawn." Suddenly, out of the darkness behind him, a burst of flame lights the room. "But from that night, a burning light doth keep back shadows' bane. The strength to fight will set alight the morning sun again. →

name: MATT
line: Ladies and gentlemen, I present to you Ornna the fire fairy." And Gustav leaves the tent once more. →

name: MATT
line: As you watch, a pair of metallic fans, alight with flame, now frame the beautiful woman of short red hair you had seen before in the procession. Gustav slinks into the darkness and vanishes as Ornna spins in hypnotic twirl, her simple dress of golds and reds almost glowing in the firelight around her, the flickering of the flames giving her the visage of a warrior-goddess battling the dark that surrounds. The frenzied fiddle of the fool picks up as she twirls the fans in her grasp, her face stoic and graceful simultaneously. The hushed awe of the audience fills the air, watching this magnificent warrior strike at the shadows, the lights above flickering brighter with each spin and dive, banishing the shadows from the room. She matches the pace of the music, drawing to a crescendo, and leaps, and barrel-turns and climaxes with her striking a powerful pose as the lights rocket to a victorious luminescence. Once again, the crowd goes crazy. →

name: MATT
line: (applause) →

name: LAURA
line: This is really different than most carnivals that I've gone to. →

name: SAM
line: It's very artistic, yeah. →

name: MATT
line: Gustav enters as she exits with a bow, the fans flickering out. He enters clapping at Ornna. A low drumbeat begins to beat in the distance as the fiddle grows tense once more. "Even as the sun would rise anew, bellowing roars will quake the lands of Xhorhas and beyond. Terrible beasts, now freed from their dark masters, scattered into our world." (roars) A terrible, guttural roar shakes the room, followed by the sounds of grinding and dragged chains. From behind the performers' flap, the half-orc, Bo, who you'd met earlier, the Breaker, and the fool, who is now still playing the fiddle, yet the bow of it continues to go on its own as he drags the other chain with his arm, wrapped around his forearm. The two of them pull something through the flap. It swells, and from beneath it is revealed an enormous creature of green scales, slimy-looking skin, and a corpulent form, large toad-like legs frame a rotund torso, and muscular arms that are manacled and pulling him in. It fights and wrestles against the taut chains as it's pulled further and further towards the center of the tent, but is held in place by the two men. It roars a second time. (roars) The front row immediately pulling back and screaming. →

name: MATT
line: You hear kids begin to cry. A handful of townsfolk shoot to their feet, grasping the children in fear, preparing to run. →

name: LAURA
line: Have we ever seen anything like this before? →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, what's it look like? →

name: LAURA
line: Well, he just described what it looked like. →

name: MARISHA
line: By name. →

name: MATT
line: You have not seen this creature. Gustav continues, seemingly unflinched by its approach. →

name: MATT
line: "The devil-toad crawls hungrily--" →

name: SAM
line: But what does it look like? (laughter) →

name: MATT
line: "--into the land of the free folk, lording over nightmares as they say, and what truth lies behind the eyes of this beast? What would be learned when the guiding heart of innocence pierces the hateful soul and brings it to see beauty for the first time? I present to you the vivid voice of Toya." And as Gustav backs away, the devil-toad struggling against the chains, a soft, faint voice begins to slowly emanate from the air-- (a voice appears in the background music) (exclamations) →

name: MATT
line: Eyes previously locked on the frightening creature now seek a source and find, atop a platform within the chamber, high up on a small platform set against the apex of the pole, a young dwarven girl, maybe 12 years of age, her braided golden hair clasped and her hands at her side, a white dress obscuring her feet. She sings with a mystifying, mature voice that pierces your hearts with joy, unexpectedly and uncontrollably. The crowd audibly gasps as one, the entrancing song of this girl bringing every person into this music. →

name: MATT
line: The devil-toad stops struggling against the chains, seemingly caught by the sound of her voice. Its face drops into a soft smile as it slowly walks towards the base of the pole and sits. The half-orc and the fool drop the chains and back away, leaving the beast free in its rapture. →

name: MATT
line: Her voice almost begins to summon a chorus from the ether, magical in nature, as there are no others but her joining into this piece. Her smile is infectious, and you can't tear your eyes away. →

name: MATT
line: You only now realize the tears down your cheeks, but you cannot break your gaze. From the front row of the audience, on the left, a man stands up, his arms outstretched towards her. His dirtied cloak falls away, his face and skin wracked with age. →

name: MATT
line: You see his legs shaking as he stands, his cheeks wet with tears. He shouts (exclaims). His arms drop and clutch his chest. Gurgles a burst of vocal pain once more, and folks nearest to him begin to lean away as he begins to shake. You glance over as the old man yells out once more, as the skin on his arms suddenly begins to tear, the bones splitting from the flesh, writhing, cracking. Dust and blood shake from his wounds as his form swells. Screams begin to ring out from the audience around him, people rising up and running for the exit. Chaos breaks into the room around you. Toya's song abruptly ends, the little girl looking down with fright in her eyes, the devil-toad glancing about worriedly, the half-orc and the fool rushing up beside him to look at the transforming man. The half-orc yells, escorting patrons to the exit, "Everyone! Leave the tent now! Kylre--" As he points to the devil-toad. "--get her to safety." The devil-toad glances up and leaps with a sudden gust of strength to the top and grabs the center pole of the room as it begins to almost quiver to his weight. He grabs the little girl safely under his arm and leaps back down. What are you all doing? →

name: LAURA
line: I invoke Duplicity. →

name: MATT
line: You watch as her form suddenly dissipates into multiple seemingly copies of her form as Jester. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yasha? We're going to need those weapons back. →

name: MARISHA
line: I turn to Mollymauk and go, man, I thought it was kind of lame at first, but this is awesome! →

name: TALIESIN
line: Everyone get out right now. →

name: MARISHA
line: This isn't part of the show? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Not part of the show. →

name: SAM
line: It's too artsy. →

name: MATT
line: The old man's body stops quaking, his flesh now grey and mangled like an ancient tree trunk. →

name: MATT
line: He turns, his eyes blood-red and bulging, his lips curled into a horrifying grimace. The two Crown's Guard begin to try and make their way through the panicked crowd, but the people, like a wave of chaos, are keeping them at bay. I need everyone to roll initiative. →

name: MATT
line: (yelling) →

name: LIAM
line: The miniatures come out, guys! →

name: TRAVIS
line: First map! (yelling) →

name: MARISHA
line: I rolled a natural one. →

name: SAM
line: That bodes well. →

name: MATT
line: So you guys, this guy is actually over here. →

name: MATT
line: You guys are all up here in the front. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh yeah, we were right in the fucking front row. Look at us! We're so cute! →

name: TALIESIN
line: Oh my god, it's so pretty. →

name: SAM
line: We're all going to die. →

name: LIAM
line: Probably. But then the third campaign begins. →

name: LAURA
line: Yay. →

name: SAM
line: I like the tents and donkeys outside. →

name: SAM
line: Amazing. →

name: MARISHA
line: Look, Taliesin, it's a bardo. Oh my god! →

name: TALIESIN
line: No, go for it. Oh boy. →

name: MATT
line: All right, so. 20 to 15? →

name: MATT
line: All right. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh, wait, 22. →

name: MATT
line: Nice. 15 to ten? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Ten. →

name: SAM
line: Ten. →

name: MATT
line: So 13 and then ten and ten? Sorry, 12. So Yasha got 13, then we have Fjord. And then 11. And then we have Nott at ten. And what'd you get? →

name: MARISHA
line: Five. Rolled terribly. →

name: MATT
line: There we go. Okay, so. Top of the round, as this creature turns and glares about in the area, this swollen form over here to the side, that's what remains of the old man who had stood up in the center of the chamber. Jester, you're up first. →

name: LAURA
line: Okay. Well, I'm just going to go for it, all right? I'm going to cast Guiding Bolt on the monster that just appeared. →

name: MATT
line: Okay, as it turns towards you. It's a saving throw, correct? →

name: LAURA
line: Let's find out. You make a ranged spell attack. →

name: MATT
line: Go ahead and roll on that. →

name: LAURA
line: Okay, okay. →

name: SAM
line: Magic, you're using magic. →

name: LAURA
line: Well, it's cocked. It was 20 and then it rolled. →

name: SAM
line: You said cocked. →

name: LIAM
line: You're a cock. →

name: LAURA
line: That's 11 plus-- what do I add to my-- Guiding Bolt, plus five. So 16. →

name: MATT
line: 16 hits. Go ahead and roll damage. →

name: LAURA
line: Yay. 4d6. →

name: MATT
line: Yasha, you're almost on deck. →

name: LAURA
line: Ten, 16, 18, and then any attacks in the future-- the next attack has advantage. →

name: MATT
line: How much damage was that? 2d6, 18? →

name: SAM
line: 4d6, you said. →

name: LAURA

So with eight points of bludgeoning damage, it reaches down and slams its fist into her chest, and as it does, she gives out this horrible yelp as it rips into her and begins gnawing into her flesh and pulls away with a mouthful of it and stands up, its eyes scanning the room for the next possible victim. It's going to begin to stalk forward, coming up to that guy. All right, Yasha, your turn. →

name: ASHLEY

name: MATT

This crowd begins to push, the guards are trying to push forward, and they can only get a little ways forward to there and there. Everyone just shifts out this direction. →

They're crying, and the chaos is just swelling into this absolute cacophony. As soon as that finishes, the devil-toad carrying the dwarven girl, who was given a decree, exits out back with her to get her to safety. These two begin to slowly back away, seeing that things seem to be handled? And the guards making their way in are looking scared at each other, not really knowing what to make of the current chaos. At that point, you watch as the woman whose chest was torn into by this creature suddenly-- (groaning) →

That brings us to Caleb. →

So as you pull it out a second time, you're pushing through the crowd and you pull up your diamond, and right as you're about to release the spell, one of the people in the crowd slams into you with her shoulder and you get jarred off to the side. The acid bolt of the Chromatic Orb flies off and actually burns a hole through the distant tent and then vanishes into the night sky. →

name: MATT
line: Six points of damage. Natural 20. You watch as you sock it in the face and the jaw breaks and then snaps back into place. As you land, pulling it back, you can see some of the teeth are actually stuck in your fist as you pull back, they've broken off into your knuckles. →

name: MARISHA
line: I go, oh, come on. I'm going to use my other ki point to do flurry of blows again, and I'm going to try and punch him in the bridge with the remainder of his teeth. →

name: MATT
line: Her teeth, technically, this is the woman that was killed originally. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh. I'll be like, you were so pretty, too. →

name: MATT
line: Go for it. Two more strikes. →

name: MARISHA
line: 19 and 18. Natural. And then, okay. →

name: LAURA
line: That's a really pretty dice. →

name: MARISHA
line: Eight, 12, 13 damage. →

name: MATT
line: Natural one, no. So the second punch, you swing wide and hit the side of the head, and the neck snaps, and it's now stuck in a sideways position. →

name: MATT
line: As it turns, the jaw, it pulls back one of its weirdly swollen clawed hands, ready to go for that open wound in your gut, and as it does, how do you want to do this? (cheering) →

name: TRAVIS
line: First one! →

name: SAM
line: First blood. →

name: MARISHA
line: I'll do the uppercut with the other one, and the one that has its teeth in it, I want to go right between the bridge of the nose and get the teeth right in the eyes and break the nose bridge into the brain. You know that thing? Yeah. →

name: MATT
line: And as you do that, you slam into its face. →

name: MATT
line: You watch as the skull caves in, the teeth piercing both of the red, bulging eyes. And with this horrible sucking, sighing sound, it falls onto its back, no longer moving, the shadows released. →

name: MARISHA
line: I grab my gash and fucked-up ribs and immediately turn over me. Can I do a perception check or an insight check on any of the ringleaders? On any of what was going on? The ringleader or the jester? →

name: MATT
line: That was your turn, unfortunately. That's your turn. At this point, the current threats are down, and the crowd is screaming and rushing. The two members of the Crown's Guard are rushed to the front, weapons ready, and they see both of these creatures bloodied and ruined across the base of this. In the midst of the chaos, one of them points and goes, "You, you! Stay where you are!" And you watch as the rest of the crowd slowly pushes through, you see as Gustav manages to make his way in. "Dear god, what's happened here?" Looks over toward Bo the Breaker, the half-orc who's now joined the rest of you. →

name: MATT
line: "Sir, I don't know how he got in here." And everyone looks around back at you. Bo looks at you, Gustav looks to you, Molly. "What happened?" →

name: TALIESIN
line: One of them turned. I don't know what happened. →

name: LAURA
line: There was a sick guy! There was an old sick guy and he turned into a zombie! And I run over and I cast Cure Wounds on Beau. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh, thank you, man. I'm really down. →

name: LAURA
line: Are you sick too? Did you get hurt? Hold on two seconds. I'm going to cure her and then I'll cure you too. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yasha, have you ever seen anything like this happen before? →

name: ASHLEY
line: No. Never. →

name: LAURA
line: Seven points, that's all I could cure. →

name: MARISHA
line: That's amazing. That's great. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm going to drop my sword. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh, that's better for you, ten for you. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. At this point, the two Crown's Guard that are there are trying desperately to maintain control. You can see they're visibly shaken, and they glance at each other like they're a little out of their depths at the moment. "Stay where you are. Don't go anywhere." →

name: TALIESIN
line: Oh, wherever will I go. →

name: MATT
line: And he turns to the one who's in the front, looks to the other one who just made his way through, and goes, "Sivelmen, find someone. Bring the rest of the guard. Please!" "Right now, sir." And he pushes his way towards the back as the rest of the crowd runs out. Now everyone in the crowd has mostly pushed out of the tent, the last few dregs pushing through. Children crying, people of Trostenwald just exiting out the flaps as they close, and you're all standing there, weapons in your hands, wondering what to do. →

name: TRAVIS
line: What are the corpses doing now that they've fallen? →

name: MATT
line: They're both unmoving, ruined, torn apart. →

name: LAURA
line: Can I search the corpse of the woman? →

name: MATT
line: You can. As you go to move to it, both of your forms merge. The Crown's Guard goes like, "Don't move." →

name: LAURA
line: Which one? →

name: MATT
line: "Both? Uh." He looks genuinely confused. →

name: LAURA
line: When I'm going "which one?" I make my second form just dart forward and start searching the body. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. It mimics searching a body. It's not actually you. Begins rifling imaginary things out of the pockets. →

name: LAURA
line: Look at all the stuff that that one's finding over there! (laughter) →

name: LAURA
line: Can he turn and look and I try to search the other guy? →

name: MATT
line: Make a deception check to try and deceive him to glance over. →

name: LAURA
line: Not bad. 19? →

name: MATT
line: (laughs) He goes, "What, over there?" Looks over as you jump over quickly and begin searching through it, and you guys watch her do this, and there's a clear line of sight. As soon as he turns back, he's going to notice her rifling through the other corpse. →

name: ASHLEY
line: Is Gustav still in here? →

name: MATT
line: Gustav is now walking up, and he's hands up in the air. "I'm terribly sorry. I-- this has never happened. I don't know what happened. What happened?!" →

name: TALIESIN
line: We've never seen anything like it before. He just-- he gripped his heart and fell over and turned into that thing. →

name: ASHLEY
line: It was when Toya started singing. →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, what's with the dwarven girl? Why-- →

name: TALIESIN
line: Nothing like this. →

name: MATT
line: "She's been singing with us for over two years, now." →

name: MARISHA
line: How'd she come to you? She's a pretty young girl. →

name: MATT
line: "She had no family and she was singing in the street for change. There was an opportunity. →

name: MATT
line: We seized it. We gave her a family she didn't have." →

name: TRAVIS
line: Put your hands down. →

name: MATT
line: The Crown's Guard goes like (grunts). "It's fine, just don't move." →

name: LAURA
line: Did I find anything? →

name: MATT
line: Make an investigation check. →

name: SAM
line: She uses a different dice for everything, Travis? →

name: LAURA
line: Shut up. →

name: SAM
line: Is that what I'm dealing with now? →

name: TRAVIS
line: You're not even ready. →

name: MATT
line: You manage to rifle through the old man's body, through the stringy bits of gore, and you do find three pieces of silver that are just coated in blood. A few moments pass. The rest of the people are gone, and it's just this awkward quiet, and at this point you watch as Ornna, the fire fairy who had previously performed, walks in and is like, "I'm sorry. What has happened here?" →

name: LAURA
line: Your little dwarf girl was singing, and she turns people into zombies. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I feel that that was entirely coincidental. I'm really not sure that the two things were related. Something was wrong with this man. →

name: MARISHA
line: See, it's interesting, because I would say the opposite. I would say it wasn't that coincidental, because-- →

name: LIAM
line: I would agree, it seemed to happen with this-- →

name: TALIESIN
line: We've seen her sing dozens, hundreds of times. Nothing like this has ever happened. I've seen people sit in the front row hundreds of times. Nothing like this has ever happened. →

name: LIAM
line: Have you had the elderly or the sick in these tents before? →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, you also happen to be very explicit on your page that you don't want the sick, so. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Gustav. →

name: MATT
line: At this motion, Gustav goes, "It's generally just because we want to promote a space of welcoming cleanliness. When we're working amongst the outskirts of the Empire, we don't want to bring an element that reminds you of death and--" →

name: SAM
line: You hate old people so much. →

name: MATT
line: "Well, we're in entertainment. We have to be cautious." The single Crown's Guard guy who's sitting there with his weapon out, you can see him shaking almost, he's never had to deal with anyting like this before. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Hold up. I've never seen that one before. He looks really suspicious. →

name: MATT
line: Towards him? →

name: TALIESIN
line: No, the guy behind him. →

name: LAURA
line: (gasps) He does look suspicious. →

name: MATT
line: Make a deception check. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Sure. Eight. →

name: MATT
line: He goes, "Don't try that on me. I've been doing this for over ten years." →

name: ASHLEY
line: Oh wait, look at him! →

name: LAURA
line: I cast Thaumaturgy and make it sound like there's a sound coming from behind him, too. →

name: MATT
line: Make a sleight-of-hand check to see if you can cast this spell subtly enough or not. →

name: SAM
line: This poor guard. Ooh! (groaning) →

name: LAURA
line: Natural one. →

name: MATT
line: As you attempt to cast this spell, a little bit of spittle gets caught in your windpipe, and you begin to cough uncontrollably. Yeah, it just falls away. →

name: LAURA
line: (coughing) There was some popcorn that I ate earlier. →

name: TRAVIS
line: You should know that whatever happened to that first man when he attacked the woman, she caught whatever he had. →

name: MATT
line: "And that is extremely worrying. Nobody touch that body." And he looks back and sees you coughing over the corpse, and the guy's like, "Don't you touch that body! Are you sick?" →

name: LAURA
line: (coughing) I have bloody fingers. →

name: MATT
line: "Someone hold her down. If she's sick and turns into one of these, I will not--" →

name: ASHLEY
line: She's fine. Just calm down. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Well, we've already killed two of them. →

name: SAM
line: She's definitely sick. →

name: MATT
line: Make a deception check. →

name: LAURA
line: That was cocked, unfortunately. That was a good one. Oh, well. 16? →

name: MATT
line: 16? His face goes white and he goes, "Kill the thing!" And rushes forward, blade held above. →

name: ASHLEY
line: I take out my greatsword. →

name: SAM
line: What, you're going to kill a guard? →

name: ASHLEY
line: Stop, stop. →

name: MATT
line: He holds back. He turns to you and sees you standing a full four inches taller than him with a much larger blade, with one hand, and he goes, "Look, if she's going to become one of these things, we have to stop her now." →

name: LAURA
line: Yasha will totally kill me. Don't worry, you can leave. →

name: MARISHA
line: Jester. Jokes are great until they get you killed, man. She's joking. →

name: LAURA
line: (weak laughter) →

name: SAM
line: Poor guard. →

name: MATT
line: Immediately rubs his eyes. You can see him, now that he's closer to you, you can see he's sweating, he's scared, he's generally trying the best he can to use whatever training he's received to deal with a scenario he was not trained for. →

name: MARISHA
line: This is the King's Guard guy? →

name: MATT
line: One of the Crown's Guard. The Crown's Guard are all generally hired and trained militia that are sent amongst all the cities to keep the peace. →

name: MARISHA
line: What's your name, man? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Wow, he's really shook up. →

name: SAM
line: Jamieson. →

name: MATT
line: "Flynn." →

name: MARISHA
line: Flynn. How long you been doing this, you said ten years? →

name: MATT
line: "Ten years two months ago." →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh. Happy ten year-i-versary. Yeah, congrats. Did you get a nice watch or like a commemorative tankard? →

name: TRAVIS
line: They don't have watches yet. →

name: MARISHA
line: Shit. Did you get a commemorative tankard? Forget the watch part. →

name: MATT
line: "No. Don't move." →

name: MARISHA
line: I'm not moving, man. Hey. Hey, Flynn. →

name: MARISHA
line: Hey, man. How about first we put the swords down, because we helped? Yeah. →

name: SAM
line: Are any of us high charisma? 'Cause it don't seem like it. →

name: MATT
line: At this point, the flaps at the front of the tent, the entranceway, fold in and you watch as one, two, three, four, six, ten Crown's Guard begin filtering into the chamber. You watch as one man, the one who has his helmet off and under his shoulder, he's maybe in his early 40s or so, short brown hair with patches of grey. Somewhat jaundiced skin. Molly, you've encountered this man once before when you entered the city. He approaches Gustav right now with a commanding voice. "I had a gut feeling that you were nothing but trouble when you came into our town." Gustav turns around. "I guarantee to you, my friend, I have no idea--" "What happened here?" The Crown's Guard who's been shaken turns around and goes, "Sir, Flynn. There was a creature. This carnival seemed to create some sort of terrible entity that killed and then created a secondary beast. I watched it with my own eyes from the back row." And the man turns back towards Gustav and the rest of you. "And who else saw that?" →

name: TRAVIS
line: We did. →

name: LAURA
line: Well, we saw an old guy turn into a zombie. →

name: LAURA
line: But it's possible that he just died because he was old, and then he had the zombie curse on him and just turned, you know? Because that happens a lot. →

name: TALIESIN
line: (deadpan) Gustav, it's no use, we've been found out. Our terrible plot to make a zombie rampage through our carnival has been discovered. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Whatever will we do now that we've been discovered for our brilliant plot to make a zombie ruin our circus. My god. →

name: MATT
line: Flynn turns to you and goes, "Put your weapons down or we'll arrest you immediately!" →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm literally holding nothing but my hands. →

name: LIAM
line: I mean, I'm sorry, but we're basically a group of strangers. Most of us don't know each other. We all have the same story. There was a show, an old man became a thing, and we helped destroy it. This one destroyed it. What more do you want from us? →

name: TALIESIN
line: It ruined our show. →

name: MATT
line: Flynn turns back and says, "Watchmaster, what should we do?" And the man with the helmet under his arm walks forward, walks to Gustav, gives him one look over, still a few inches shorter than him. Looks at him with a sense of purpose and social status that has a sense of disinterest and disrespect. "You, sir, and your orc, and your circus, are considered currently under arrest. Who else belongs to your merry band?" He looks about the rest and Gustav goes, "The orc." Glances back at the two of you and goes, "The rest of them are just purveyors of our performances. He was just joking earlier, right?" Make a deception check. →

name: SAM
line: Oh boy. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Nope. →

name: MATT
line: "And you are also under arrest. The rest of you, what are your names?" →

name: LAURA
line: Shirley. →

name: SAM
line: Temple. →

name: SAM
line: (muffled laughter) →

name: LIAM
line: Caleb Widogast. →

name: MARISHA
line: Beau, same as him. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Bo. →

name: TRAVIS
line: (laughter) →

name: SAM
line: I am Bo! →

name: TRAVIS
line: You pointed at me. →

name: MARISHA
line: I meant the NPC Bo! But it works! →

name: ASHLEY
line: Here's the thing. Oh, it's Mary by the way, but I think I know who might know what has happened here. →

name: MATT
line: "Do you? Tell me." →

name: ASHLEY
line: I'll have to go get her. →

name: MATT
line: "Who is this?" →

name: ASHLEY
line: She is the singer that made this all happen. →

name: MATT
line: "Flynn, escort this woman to retrieve this individual she speaks of." Flynn nods and walks over towards you. →

name: LAURA
line: She's really shy, though, and I hear she only talks to tieflings, so you should probably send-- →

name: MATT
line: "Stay where you are." →

name: LAURA
line: --my brother along, because he's really good with that stuff. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Try not to stab any random people on your way there, Flynn. You're doing good. →

name: MATT
line: "My men tell me that the rest of you helped destroy these fiends. Is that correct?" →

name: ALL
line: Yeah. →

name: MATT
line: "Then on behalf of the Starosta, I appreciate your aid. But until this investigation is complete, you are all under investigation from us. Where are you staying?" →

name: TRAVIS
line: The Nestled Nook Inn. →

name: SAM
line: Nested Nook. →

name: MATT
line: Nestled. He got it right. →

name: SAM
line: Oh, shit. One letter. God damn it. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I have an intelligence of 14. I know what I'm doing. →

name: MATT
line: "Do not leave this city unless you are told otherwise. Should you do so, I have your names, and I can have the full might of the Cerberus Assembly track you down. You. Flynn. Free this girl." While you all stand in the tent, Flynn approaches you and walks a little bit behind you, weapon drawn but at the side. Do you lead him out of the tent? Okay. So you walk through the performer's flap, and as you walk out, you can see backed up into the number of tents that are set up, and some of the carts, other members of the circus are hiding, and as soon as you exit out the front and they see you before the Crown's Guard, they all immediately scatter and vanish to the nearby shadows, out of sight. The two of you walk out into the center, the fire crackling in a small pit off to the side. "All right, where is this girl you speak of?" →

name: ASHLEY
line: She's in the back in the tents. →

name: MATT
line: "Show me." →

name: ASHLEY
line: Follow me. →

name: MATT
line: He follows you. Which tent do you lead him to? Over here? Okay, there's a larger tent, as he walks by your side, there's the flap that's slightly open. →

name: SAM
line: God, you could seduce him. →

name: ASHLEY
line: Go get her. She won't talk to me. She's too scared of me. →

name: MATT
line: "All right." Gets his weapon ready and walks into the tent. →

name: ASHLEY
line: I close the tent and I take off. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. There's a few moments before, in the distance, you hear a voice say, "The tent is empty. What are you talking about? Hello? Helloooo?" (laughter) →

name: MATT
line: And you don't look back, and you just run into the darkness of night, into the Marrow Fields and disappear. →

name: SAM
line: But that's so mysterious. →

name: LIAM
line: While that was happening, I'm close to the edge of the tent, and at some point I just (snap) and summoned Frumpkin. I have a 30-feet outside the tent, so Frumpkin's out there. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. Frumpkin keeps watch. The Watchmaster, as you heard him notified earlier, turns to the rest of you. "So. The investigation will begin. If any information comes to light that could alleviate you of the charges brought to this carnival, come to me and let me know. If you have no answers before we complete this investigation, then I believe you all will fall into the judgment." →

name: LAURA
line: Next time we don't help. That's what it comes down to. →

name: MARISHA
line: I know, we got paid the first time we helped, and then we got arrested the second time. →

name: MARISHA
line: I don't know what lesson to learn here. →

name: SAM
line: Just say okay and let's leave. →

name: LIAM
line: Yeah, yeah. →

name: MATT
line: So the guards escort you out of the tent. →

name: MATT
line: Molly, you're stuck behind with Gustav and Bo the Breaker, with a guard of five Crown's Guards set to keep watch. As the rest of you are sent to the city, the Watchmaster turns once more and says, "Remember, you flee, I'll find you." And that's where we'll end tonight's session. →

name: SAM
line: No way! What? No! I want to keep playing. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm so excited, this is great. →

name: LIAM
line: It's a good spot. →

name: ASHLEY
line: We did it, we did it. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Holy shit. →

name: LAURA
line: We have to get Molly out! →

name: SAM
line: (sighs) Everything's better with Molly. →

name: SAM
line: (laughter) →

name: TALIESIN
line: Truer words were never spoken. →

name: MATT
line: Well, guys, welcome to the new campaign. →

name: MATT
line: Season two, I guess. →

name: LIAM
line: Oh my goodness. →

name: MARISHA
line: It feels so weird. →

name: SAM
line: Look at these cool Wyrmwood cases that we have! →

name: MATT
line: Fucking Sam. I swear to god. →

name: MARISHA
line: I used 100% new dice. No repeats from Keyleth. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah, totally new dice. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I kept the Gil die. →

name: LAURA
line: I used some new dice. →

name: TRAVIS
line: What are you talking about? →

name: LAURA
line: Some new dice. →

name: MATT
line: I used this beautiful little-- →

name: TALIESIN
line: Fuck you. →

name: MATT
line: The Snitch is mine now. →

name: LIAM
line: Look at all the 20s Taliesin rolled tonight. →

name: MATT
line: I know. Oh man. I'm excited. →

name: SAM
line: Such cool characters, guys! →

name: MATT
line: I'm excited to see where this goes. →

name: SAM
line: I still don't know what half of you guys are. →

name: SAM
line: What's Travis? →

name: MATT
line: Everyone did something that revealed them tonight. →

name: SAM
line: I don't know nothing, I don't know how to play D&D. →

name: MARISHA
line: Should we all say in case you're Sam and you don't know? →

name: TRAVIS
line: I'm a ballerina. →

name: MARISHA
line: He's a prima. →

name: MATT
line: Well, guys. Happy New Year. Welcome back, Happy New Year to you guys. Thank you for coming along with us on this first episode of a new journey. Thank you, Backblaze and DnD Beyond, for being awesome sponsors partnered with us going forward. Thank you, Wyrmwood, for this amazing table. Thank you guys for coming along with us this evening for our first dive into this new venture. Hope you enjoyed it. We did. →

name: MARISHA
line: Thank you to our amazing crew. →

name: SAM
line: Thank you, Matt Mercer, for this amazing new campaign! Welcome to Wildemount. →

name: MATT
line: I'm excited. →

name: SAM
line: Thanks, Yev. →

name: MATT
line: Guys, have a wonderful evening. We'll see you next week. See where this next stage in the story takes us. Ashley, I'm glad you could make it for this first episode. →

name: ASHLEY
line: Yeah, me too. →

name: MATT
line: Until then, have a wonderful night, sleep well, and is it Thursday yet? Good night! (cheering) [music] →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: And welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons & Dragons. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: TRAVIS
line: Dungeons & Dragons! →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: Or that. We also do that, I guess. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: TALIESIN
line: That's the same embarrassment that you feel about us; the way we're feeling about you now. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: What the fuck was that?! →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: Where we play Dungeons & Dragons! →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: Oh my god. Welcome. We're already loopy, what could possibly go wrong? So yes, welcome! Before we jump into tonight's game, we have some announcements to get through real fast so hold tight for just a moment. First and foremost, continuing tonight's sponsorship with our friends at D&D Beyond. Our now long-term partner. We're super excited to be working with them for the foreseeable future for the time being with the show. Sam, you have some words, I believe. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: To plug our good friends at D&D Beyond, I need my fellow castmates to help me. Can we practice? Can you all say, "Boo"? →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: ALL
line: Boo! →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: Can you all say, "Yay"? →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: ALL
line: Yay! →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: Okay, the official digital toolset for Critical Role is D&D Beyond. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: ALL
line: Yay! →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: A great service to organize everything D&D. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: Rules, spells, character sheets, and more, all with a pesky pen and paper? →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: ALL
line: Boo! →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: No! You can access it digitally on your computer, mobile, or tablet. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: ALL
line: Yay! →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: The cast is using D&D Beyond every week, except for Taliesin. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: ALL
line: Boo! →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: Just kidding, he is! →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: ALL
line: Yay! →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: I have to use both the boo and the yay or else it doesn't make sense. He can do cool stuff like activate Critical Role content in his character builder and create a blood hunter. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: ALL
line: Yay! →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: And do you think they charge an arm and a leg? →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: ALL

line: Once again, we are firmly in support of our longtime charity partners, 826LA. They do awesome work teaching creative writing classes for children who normally wouldn't have the opportunity to get involved. They do phenomenal work. I recommend that you research them and if you can, either help with a donation or actually, you can donate your time as well to help teach and be part of the program if one is near you. Go check it out. →

So if there's an 826 in your area, and you're like, "I know, I'll start a D&D club," I'm sure they'll be open to it, just go talk to them and go teach kids D&D! →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: And welcome back. Last we left off, our slowly gathering band of adventurers had begun to have their stories intertwine in the city of Trostenwald, on the southern reaches of western Wynandir on the continent of Wildemount. Here we had Nott and Caleb who had been traveling southward coming and meeting, in the center of the tavern, the Nestled Nook Inn, with Jester, Beauregard, and Fjord. They were invited to a nearby carnival that had begun preparing for their performance later that evening, in which they met Yasha and Molly. After swapping some stories, earning and losing some gold, they began to gather at the outskirts of the Ustaloch, the lake right on the eastern edge of Trostenwald, for the first opening performance of the Fletching and Moondrop Carnival of Curiosities. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: TALIESIN
line: Traveling Carnival of Curiosities. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: Upon entering the tent, they saw a number of performances. However, during a musical performance by this young dwarven girl whose voice was this mysterious, magically enchanting experience, a member of the audience rose up and began to transform into a terrible undead creature that began to lash out, killing another member of the audience, who then began to become one of these same creatures. You all, grabbing your weapons from Yasha, who had been keeping them stashed away, leapt into the fray, slaughtered both of these terrible beasts, just in time for the crownsguard to rush in and ask you what the hell happened. After information had been gathered of who was immediately available and responsible for this carnival, Gustav, Bo the Breaker, and Molly were marked to be arrested. One of the guards was escorted outside of the tent by Yasha, who was going to show him where this young dwarven girl was currently resting, and upon being led astray to the wrong tent, she just ran into the distant hills and vanished. And that is where we left off. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: So we're still at the carnival? →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: You're still in the tent. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LIAM
line: With crownsguard? →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: With the crownsguard and with Watchmaster Jossyd. The crownsguard that had left naught but a moment before comes rushing in, his breath huffing, sweat dripping from his brow, his eyes wild. He goes, "Watchmaster! The big woman is gone! She's gone!" The Watchmaster turns to him and says, "You three, go with him. Search for her." They all immediately run out back out the performer's flap and he turns to the rest of you in the group, "Shackle and drag those three down to the stockade." About five guards approach and begin to press Gustav, Bo, and Molly to the ground and begin to put chains and shackles on them. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: TALIESIN
line: I'd like to make a counteroffer? →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: He's in mid-speech, "The rest of you keep an eye on the performers here. Ask around, see what you can find. As for the others, don't go far." →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LAURA
line: The innocent patrons, you mean? →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: "You may be innocent, in which case you have nothing to worry about. However, we have an investigation to complete, so I would ask that you stay in the city and wait until you are called in. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: You will be questioned, and when this investigation is completed, regardless of how long it may take, you are not to leave Trostenwald." →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LIAM
line: If I could just contribute one word, the 40 or so people who are outside and the rest of us will vouch for this one, the colorful one. He saved many people's lives. Don't take my word for it. There's everyone outside. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: All the rest of the crownsguard glance to each other, he goes, "Well, unfortunately, that is not for me to decide. The Lawmaster would have to be appealed to. If you wish to come with us, we can bring you along with us to the stockade and you can speak with her. Then, perhaps, she may grant you leniency, but I can give you no guarantee." →

name: MATT
line: As you back out of the performer's exit of the tent into the center of their encampment, the immediate exit, there are already four crownsguard currently searching around and setting up a watch perimeter around the different tents. They're gathering and making sure none of the other performers have fled and a lot of them are being brought out into an area where there's a number of tents all facing towards a large campfire in the center. There's a couple of chairs set up there, it's kind of the common area for the performers of the carnival and it looks like they're all being put out there so they can get a bead on it and make sure they know where everyone else is. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: One of the guards tugs on both of your chains and says, "Quiet now! Save it for the lawmaster." They bring you in-- you go in through the Lochward into the Hillsward, which is the southern portion of Trostenwald. You are brought to the outside of the stockade, which is a large single-story, tall, rectangular building of large stones and masonry. It's built for function. It's not a very beautiful building, but it's defensible and it seems fairly well-made. However, there are the banners of the crownsguard marking the double-door entrance. As you're brought within, you can already see there are two central chairs where two current watch sit, just watching the front door. Beyond the right, you see, is an office that you guys are dragged to-- and the rest of you eventually catch up to the group. You are all brought inside this darkened office. Inside, relatively simple. This isn't a library-type study office. This is very much for function. There's a couple of small crates that contain materials that are too far in shadow to see the details of it. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: There is a stone desk on the far end, and there, within this office, already accompanied by a messenger dressed for immediate travel, is a tough-looking dwarven woman in her middle years rapidly scrawling on parchment. Her black hair is streaked with silver, tumbling past her red and gray leather armor. She finishes writing on this parchment, rolls it up, and hands it to the messenger who immediately darts out of the room without a word past you guys, giving you a brief look as he continues on whatever his business is. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: As soon as your eyes pass off the messenger, you hear a loud slam, and you glance back. She's put her hands on the table. She glances up, "All right, what riff-raff have you brought in to me this day?" The watchmaster takes the chains of the three of you and pulls you to the front of the group and says, "Sorry to be a bother, but we have three individuals arrested in connection with, as you have heard so far, the deaths at the carnival performance this evening." She rolls her eyes. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: "All right, bring them forward." They go ahead and pull the chains up. The watchmaster bows his head and then leaves the room. She steps forward and goes, "I am Norda. It is my job to keep this city safe and keep shite like what happened tonight from happening. I approved your second time on the outskirts of our town and you have killed two of my people. What have you to say about yourselves?" →

At which point Bo the half-orc steps forward, against his chains and goes, "Gustav, what are you doing?" He's like, "Shut. Up. Please, whatever judgement there is, put it upon me," and he bows his head low. "Is that the case? Is he the only one?" She takes a good, hard look at you and Bo the Breaker. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: And there is probably a total of ten cells to each side. As you walk through, you can see in the off shadows in the corners a few huddled bodies hunched or asleep. Keeping to the shadows and out of the light. The smell of mildewed wet compost and piss hits your nose like a wall. →

He walks up and puts his hand on the bars and goes, "Oh well, if you want to be patient, I'm sure the Lawmaster will be here sometime in the morning and you can discuss whatever this business is. But if you want to say goodbye, now's the time." →

name: LIAM
line: That's eight Frumpkins. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: TRAVIS
line: An audience is all we're asking for. No favors. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, this is just a wrong time, wrong place thing. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: Make a persuasion check. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: Use it. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: TRAVIS
line: God bless. 16. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: He gives you a look and says, "All right, but if she gets angry, it's not on me." →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: TRAVIS
line: I understand. Thank you for your understanding. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LAURA
line: She's a very calm person. I've never seen her angry, ever. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: He gives a whistle. Another crownsguard comes up and approaches him and he goes, "I'm sorry. Could you go and fetch the Lawmaster? They are requesting an audience. If she gets angry, just add it to this one's sentence." The guard exits and a brief time by, you can hear the slight muddled cursing of a dwarven female descending the stairs. You can see she has an overcoat on, was halfway out of the stockades finishing up her evening in her office. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: TRAVIS
line: Beau, remember your little sister. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: Oh, what? Little sister? What? →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LIAM
line: We're not there. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: So, as the Lawmaster approaches, now pulling the coat over herself, she goes, "Okay, so you've returned, apparently, needing to poke into what business now before I go off and get some food?" →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: TRAVIS
line: I do hate to trouble you again, twice in the same evening. It's incredibly inconvenient. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: "I hate being troubled twice in the same evening." →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: TRAVIS
line: If we may, this sweet girl here was also part of our party and she is quite the protective one. I'm afraid that she was also providing aid to our fellows in that tent. I'm afraid her younger sister was attacked in a similar way. I feel it's only prudent to acknowledge that she was trying to protect this young dwarven girl that performed in the circus. She means no harm. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LAURA
line: It was an adopted sister. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MARISHA
line: I practically raised her. It's a sensitive subject. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: Okay. I would like a deception check. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: TRAVIS
line: Oh, yeah baby. 24. Natural 18. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: Modified by their answers. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LAURA
line: I was helping! →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: TRAVIS
line: I'm new at this stat! Don't fuck it up! →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: She gives a narrow look through her eyes, looks to one of the other guards that you can see standing in the back, a familiar one to you, Beau, and goes, "Is this true?" He goes, "It appeared to us that she was attempting to escape upon us trying to bring calm to a very tense situation, but I'll leave it in your realm, Lawmaster." She looks back. "So your sister, apparently, is part of this scenario as well?" →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MARISHA
line: Adopted sister. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: "Okay. Well, your sister's under investigation." →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MARISHA
line: Sure. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LAURA
line: She's staying at the same place that we are. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: TRAVIS
line: Indeed. And we can be found at any hour. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: TRAVIS
line: The Nestled Nook Inn is where we are. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MARISHA
line: And I'm more than willing to be compliant with the investigation. In fact, you can see the injury the beast left on my ribs, so if you want to test it for any type of specimen samples, feel free. It's very painful, but I'm willing to do it for the cause. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LAURA
line: Do you need me to heal that? MARISHA (through gritted teeth): No! For the cause! Do it for the cause! →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: At which she looks to you now and goes, "Are you saying you might have been infected by this beast?" →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MARISHA
line: No. It's a separate issue. There was two things going on. There was, like, the big angry toad beast and he got a swipe at me. And then there were people who were getting attacked. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: "Theeds!" And she looks over to the jailer, who goes, "Aye?" And she goes, "Could you have a look at this wound for me real fast? I want to make sure this isn't something that's going to spread." →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MARISHA
line: Yeah! Yeah. Uh-huh. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: TRAVIS
line: A great idea indeed. And thankfully there was no flesh-to-flesh contact. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MARISHA
line: Nope. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LAURA
line: Yeah. The big zombie beast especially was using a lot of, like, sticks and stuff to attack people more than any kind of mouth. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LAURA
line: (laughter) →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: The jailer, Theeds, takes a quick look at the wound and he goes, "No, it appears to mainly be just bludgeoning. I mean, we'll keep a close eye on her." You can see now the Lawmaster is rubbing her eyes in frustration and goes, "I just want to sleep." →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: TRAVIS
line: Indeed. It would give us no greater pleasure than to get out of your hair. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: "Fine. We'll have guards posted at the outside of the inn. You're not to leave until this investigation is complete. It may take days. Until we find out who's responsible for these deaths and bring them to justice, you are not to leave the tavern." →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: TRAVIS
line: Understood. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LAURA
line: Like, at all during the day, even? Just a question. If we wanted to shop or something. Not okay? →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: "Not until this is done." →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LAURA
line: Cool. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: "Because otherwise, you're welcome to stay here, instead." →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LAURA
line: It is really beautiful here, but I think I'd rather stay at the inn? →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: TRAVIS
line: Indeed we would. This is most gracious of you, Lawmaster Norda. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: "Get them the fuck out." She turns around and sighs heavily as she stomps out of the chamber. The jailer opens the cell door and allows Beauregard back out, and he looks a bit confused but amused at the same time. The guards that had originally arrested you escort you out, not leaving any element of their sight off of you. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: They escort you guys to the actual inn itself, to the bottom floor of the Nestled Nook Inn, watch you enter, and then post up right outside the main entrance to the tavern. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LAURA
line: You should have spasmed a couple times on the way here. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MARISHA
line: Aw, shit. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LAURA
line: Yeah. Opportunity missed. →

name: MARISHA
line: My little sister? What the what? →

name: LAURA
line: She's a dwarf! She's human! →

name: TRAVIS
line: What? No, I was trying to say she had a little sister that had a similar incident and that made you try to protect Toya. I was trying to throw you a bone. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh. You didn't make that clear at all. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MARISHA
line: All right. I mean, it kind of worked. But you're not entirely wrong! I was trying to go get the stupid little girl, who seemed to be stupid. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Did you see anything? →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MARISHA
line: I tried to save her. I was like, get the hint, what's going on? →

name: MARISHA
line: (stammers) →

name: TRAVIS
line: We don't know that. →

name: LAURA
line: I mean, she could have. →

name: TALIESIN
line: She didn't. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh, hi! You're here. →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, if anything, we should be looking at this guy. Why are we putting our neck out for you? →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: TALIESIN
line: You're putting your neck out for Toya for some strange reason and I don't know why, she's perfectly capable of handling herself. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Have you been to this town before? →

line: Busy, yeah. →

line: And you've never seen conditions like this affect any other carnival goer before? →

line: Nothing like this. Hundreds, possibly thousands of shows. Yeah, thousands of shows. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Nothing. Never. It's not us. →

name: MATT

line: They don't appear to be nearby. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I wonder if they came back. →

name: MATT

line: Yeah, Yorda. →

name: MATT
line: "Oh, hi! Everything all right? You had a few bruiser types leading you in here, some of the crownsguard, huh?" →

line: Oh my gosh, there was this big trouble at the carnival, did you go? →

name: MATT
line: "I heard that! That's incredible!" →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah! And then we're all under investigation because we saved them! These guards are weird. Hey, did you see the wizard guy, the stinky guy and the little halfling? →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: "Yeah, they came in not but a few minutes before you did. They went upstairs." →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LAURA
line: Oh, great! They're here! →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: TRAVIS
line: They are? →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LAURA
line: Yeah. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: TRAVIS
line: Good. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LIAM
line: During all of that, I would have dragged you back here, brought you upstairs. And I whip off my ratty coat, throw it on the bed and sit down on the ground so that I'm eye level with you, Nott. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: Hi. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LIAM
line: Nott, you and I have to make some decisions right now, okay? →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: Now? →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LIAM
line: Yes. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: Why? →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LIAM
line: Well, I know why we said we were coming here. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: Get some booze, got some books, find a little taste of civilization, maybe some better food. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LIAM
line: Yeah. I didn't say, I also had the idea-- you know, you and I meeting and teaming up has been a good thing. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: Oh, yes, very good. I know everyone else makes fun of your smell, but I don't smell nothing. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LIAM
line: That's what I like about you. I have been thinking, and yesterday just furthers that thinking, that I don't think you and I are enough. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LIAM
line: I had the idea that we would come here maybe and find others that we could tag along with, or meet up the way you and I did. But now I think that is a terrible idea! The people we spent the day with are lunatics. I don't think that we can do this. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LIAM
line: I've changed my mind entirely, and I think we should go, but we can't now because we are stuck here for the moment. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: Under sort of holding arrest or something? We can't leave the city. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LIAM
line: No. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: But I was thinking about this. The people we met down there and spent the day with: they are lunatics, but they draw a lot of attention to themselves, leaving us free to sort of slink back into the shadows a little bit. It might be sort of the perfect camouflage. No one's going to be looking for a little goblin girl anymore, because they'll be looking at the crazy people, the tieflings running around smashing shit. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LIAM
line: You know, I had not thought of it quite in that way and that is a good point, but I am not convinced. I'm not convinced. And perhaps we're better off-- maybe I was too ambitious. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: Well, let's give it a day and if things seem a little bit, you know, skinky-doodie tomorrow, we can fritter away in the middle of the day or something. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LIAM
line: All right. Well, we'll wait and see. While we're here, one thing, okay? No Money Pot. No Rat Food. None of those plays. I have silver, we don't need it right now. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: But we need to replenish the healing potion you used. If we don't have that, then what happens the next you get in trouble? →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LIAM
line: We're sealed here, and they are watching. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LIAM
line: We're with a couple of tieflings, a little person in a doll mask, and a dirty ginger. We've got people staring at us every second of the day. We need to dial it back a little bit. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: All right, but how on earth are we-- all right. We can cool it with the cons for a couple of days. But I can't promise that I won't get the itch again. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LIAM
line: You just talk to me. You hold Frumpkin. Just keep your hands full with Frumpkin, okay? Hold my cat, okay? →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: All right. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LIAM
line: And then this is going to blow over because we didn't do anything! We did something good. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: No! I didn't do nothing, we just went to a show. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LIAM
line: That's right. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: It was a pretty good show. Up until, you know, the dead people part. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LIAM
line: But it was a good show, wasn't it? →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: Yeah! Well, we'll lay low. Should we pretend that we're still friends with these people? →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LIAM
line: I was going to suggest the same thing. In fact, I think we should go downstairs. They're going to be coming back. We don't want to cause a stir with them, either. We just want to leave if that's what we're going to do. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: Don't worry! I'll turn on the charm. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: TALIESIN
line: Thank God. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LIAM
line: Okay. Let's get a drink. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: Thank gods. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LIAM
line: We head downstairs. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: You guys head down. You get to the bottom of the stairs just in time to see Jester, Beauregard, Molly, and Fjord looking across the tavern, making their way in your direction, and you guys notice them meeting you in the tavern room, as well. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: Oh, thank God you're here and safe! We missed you! Somehow we got separated! Friends. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LAURA
line: That happens, yes. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MARISHA
line: Can I insight check him? →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: Sure. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: Her. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MARISHA
line: Her. Sam. Natural 20. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: SAM
line: I'm lying! (laughter) →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MARISHA
line: Front butt?! You just saw that, too?! (laughter) →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MARISHA
line: You guys peaced out pretty quickly. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LIAM
line: We did, I did not come to Trostenwald to go to jail. →

name: TRAVIS
line: What did you come to Trostenwald for? →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: LIAM

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: TRAVIS
line: Sure, I'm not trying to pry. I was just curious where you were going. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MARISHA
line: Just curious why you have a mask. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: TALIESIN
line: If I'm going to listening to somebody's life story I'm going to need a drink. You, gorgeous, what's your name? →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: MATT
line: You look over and see a woman with darker hair, the general barmaid. "Adelaine." →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
name: TALIESIN
line: Adelaine, I would like a round for all these terrible people and one for myself. What's the difference between these three beers? I've honestly got to admit, they all taste the same to me. →

name: MATT
line: "Go with the von Brandt." →

line: Two, please. →

episode: Campaign 2 Episode 2 A Show of Scrutiny
