line: Is that one five or ten feet away from me? The horses immediately freak out and start running this direction in a gallop. →

name: LIAM
line: Oh, damn it. →

name: TRAVIS
line: There goes that idea. →

name: TALIESIN
line: It was such a good idea. →

name: SAM
line: The horses have better initiative than all of us. →

name: MATT
line: That's going to go ahead and end their go. →

name: MATT
line: Beau, you're up. →

name: MARISHA
line: I turn to Jester and Molly. Fucking-- we probably shouldn't kill crownsguard, even if it's a zombie. Should we go after the toad? →

name: LAURA
line: We should probably kill the zombies because anybody that gets bitten by a zombie turns into another zombie! →

name: MARISHA
line: I don't want to be a guard killer. All right, fine. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I don't want to be a fucking zombie. →

name: TRAVIS
line: We just can't be here. →

name: MARISHA
line: Can I peek out and see the guard-zombies? →

name: TALIESIN
line: They did run by. →

name: MATT
line: You watch them as you peek under the tent and they both just ran to the right. →

name: MARISHA
line: Can I crawl out from under the tent and clear the gap with them and get up to them? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Oh, fancy. →

name: SAM
line: Cool map. →

name: MATT
line: That's as close as you can get right there. →

name: MATT
line: You can go into a dash if you wanted to engage directly. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh, man, I don't know what to do. →

name: TRAVIS
line: It's all right. Work it out. →

name: MATT
line: Actually, this is my fault. I rolled for the zombies to see who they saw first, but technically their turn hadn't come up yet. That's my fault, because their initiative is lower in the order, so we're going to retcon a little bit of that. That's still there. →

name: TRAVIS
line: (singing) Rewind! →

name: MATT
line: Because your initiative was super high. →

name: MATT
line: That's totally my bad. It's early enough in the combat where it's not going to make a huge difference. But you do watch as they turn and they look past the direction like they're ready to dart towards the actual large carnival tent. →

name: LAURA
line: Now I just want to do Hamilton with all our character voices. →

name: MARISHA
line: After Jester trying to help me, can I close the gap to this guy? →

name: MATT
line: You can at this point, yeah. It's two squares to get there. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Look at that mini! →

name: LAURA
line: Oh, you're out there all by yourself! Beau! →

name: MARISHA
line: It's cool, man. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Cut them down with those guns. →

name: MARISHA
line: Is that fire still going? →

name: MATT
line: It's not a huge blaze, but there's some flames in it. It's starting to burn out a little bit. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Both barrels. Six shooter. Give it to them. →

name: MARISHA
line: Okay. With my initial attack as I run up, can I take my staff and try and take them out at the knees? Just a sweep? →

name: MATT
line: Sure. I'd say go ahead and make an athletics check. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Knock them prone? →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, that's what I'm going for. →

name: MATT
line: Make an athletics check. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I like that a lot. →

name: MARISHA
line: That's not great. Nine. →

name: MATT
line: Rolled a natural 20 on his end. →

name: MARISHA
line: Shit! →

name: MATT
line: As you swing with the staff, it slams into the side of the guard's leg and you hear the slight crack of wood as the armored exterior of the zombified form seems to stand resolute against the strength of your blow. Its head, which was turned off angrily towards the shadowed direction of Caleb and Fjord, turns back, the red burning coals for eyes now glaring in your direction. What are you doing? →

name: MARISHA
line: I look at him and I say, you fucking broke my stick! I'm going to do an elbow to the face and then another punch with the staff still in my hand and do Flurry of Blows. →

name: MATT
line: Well, you did your one attack to sweep him. →

name: MATT
line: It's an unarmed attack for your next two. →

name: MARISHA
line: Right, I know. I'm doing an elbow and a punch, I'm just holding my staff. →

name: MATT
line: Right. Misunderstood. Okay, go for it. Roll for the attack. →

name: MARISHA
line: Two attacks, right? →

name: MATT
line: You got it. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh god, this makes me so nervous. That's good! 19 for the first one. →

name: MATT
line: 19 hits. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh, and a natural one for the second. →

name: MATT
line: You guys with the ones at the start of this fight! →

name: LAURA
line: I don't know what's happening! →

name: MATT
line: Roll damage for the first one. →

name: TRAVIS
line: You can't be too cocky. →

name: MATT
line: I know, apparently. →

name: MARISHA
line: Eight? →

name: LAURA
line: What's new at the table? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Everything. →

name: MATT
line: Eight points of damage. As you elbow across, wham! You watch as the jaw hangs and dislodges a bit, and as its head turns towards you, you reach with your other first and it catches it in the middle of the air and it tries to bite at your arm, but the jaw hangs open, not able to actually find any purchase in your arm. I believe that ends your turn. Caleb, you're up. →

name: LIAM
line: I am going to move over a bit towards that carriage and I pull the diamond out of my component pouch and a small prismatic ball forms over it. I take my other hand and spin it really fast and little ice shards start shooting out of the side. I take it with the free hand and I'm going to throw it like a fucking baseball pitcher at the one closest to Beauregard. →

name: MATT
line: Right there? Okay. So go ahead and roll your attack on that. →

name: LIAM
line: D&D Beyond, where did you go? Oh, that's good! 23. →

name: MATT
line: 23 definitely hits. →

name: LIAM
line: Okay. So that is cold damage. 3d8. Come on! Nine total. →

name: MATT
line: Nine points of cold damage to it. You watch as it's trying to bite with no effect towards Beau's arm as she's pulling away. The sphere slams into the side of its shoulder, it would be this side, and it pulls back. You watch as the arm breaks a bit and the ice shards coalesce around the outside of the armor and linger with this frost and mist that sprays off the impact. It looks fairly damaged. →

name: LIAM
line: Question, am I supposed to roll initiative for Frumpkin as well? →

name: MATT
line: Technically by the rules, yes. But it might be easier to have you guys go at the same time. →

name: LIAM
line: Okay, if that's what you want to do. →

name: MATT
line: Sure, for now. →

name: LIAM
line: I'm sending Frumpkin to zip under that tent. →

name: LIAM
line: He has 40 feet of movement. →

name: MATT
line: This one here? →

name: LIAM
line: Yeah. →

name: MATT
line: Easy enough. Frumpkin is underneath there. →

name: TRAVIS
line: What's inside? →

name: MARISHA
line: What's in the tent? →

name: TRAVIS
line: (sneezing) Fucking cat. →

name: MATT
line: That your turn? →

name: LIAM
line: That's it, ja. →

name: LAURA
line: This is so cute. Look at all the little barrels. →

name: MATT
line: Molly, you're up. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm going to burst out of the tent. Can I make it to the one that Beau is fighting? →

name: MATT
line: (counting) You can indeed. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm going to make it to the one that Beau is fighting and I'm going to take two straight attacks with my scimitar. →

name: MATT
line: Go for it. You see half of its body encased in ice now, and it's still lashing out in Beau's direction as you rush up. →

name: TALIESIN
line: That's a 15 and a natural 20. →

name: MATT
line: Okay then! →

name: TALIESIN
line: Without even figuring out, yeah. →

name: LAURA
line: Fifteen plus whatever. →

name: MATT
line: Those both hit. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Natural 20 is just double the die, right? →

name: MATT
line: Yeah. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Come on, iron snitch. →

name: LAURA
line: Make up for our shortcomings, Taliesin! →

name: MATT
line: Which one's which? →

name: TALIESIN
line: First one is (counting) 15? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah, dude. →

name: TALIESIN
line: No, double, I have to roll two dice, right? →

name: MATT
line: The first attack is that die, so that's not the critical. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Okay, that's fine. That's nine points of damage. Then two dice or double the dice? →

name: MATT
line: We'll just double the die, it's fine. It's fun to do it that way. Less dice to have to roll. →

name: TALIESIN
line: That's 13 points of damage. →

name: MATT
line: 13 points of damage. →

name: MATT
line: Ha, nope. So you watch as it's slashing at Beau. The ice explodes in its side and Mollymauk comes walking out of the tent, both of the scimitars spinning in his hand like this dervish entity. As he slams both blades simultaneously into the sides of this creature, he cuts a v shape into the upper torso and it slips out of it. The central portion of its body slips onto the ground with a splat and the arms fall to the side and the body collapses onto the ground. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I turn and smile at Beau. →

name: MARISHA
line: Thanks. →

name: LAURA
line: You cut like a little v cake with head. →

name: TALIESIN
line: It's a pizza pie with a pizza slice. I turn 180 and get ready for the other one. →

name: MARISHA
line: Doesn't make me trust you any more. Less, actually. →

name: MATT
line: Which is now its turn. Having you rush out of the tent, its attention once in the distance, it traces you over as you attack its ally. It lunges over towards you and makes two strikes in your direction. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I make eye contact with it and, fuck it, just for fun I'm going to burn my blood maledict. →

name: TALIESIN
line: There's going to be a blood vessel that pops on my neck and I'm going to make him cry. →

name: TRAVIS
line: "I'm just going to make him cry"! →

name: MATT
line: The bulging red eyes suddenly go black and thick droplets of blood-like ichor begin to spill out the corners of the zombie's eyes. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I take three damage. →

name: MATT
line: Oh are you-- →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm amplifying. →

name: MATT
line: You take three damage. This attack and the next attack he has disadvantage on. →

name: MARISHA
line: Ooh shit, that's awesome! →

name: MATT
line: 16 and an eight for the first attack so that bring it down to a 12 to hit. →

name: TALIESIN
line: No. →

name: MATT
line: As it rushes towards you, you can see the opening as it swings too wide and you duck right out of the way. Second attack with disadvantage as well. That's a 19 and a 16, so the 16 plus four that's 20, so it still hits. →

name: TALIESIN
line: It still hits. That's fine. →

name: MATT
line: The first one you duck out of the way. →

name: MATT
line: However, the secondary slam hits you for five points of bludgeoning damage across your shoulder. →

name: MATT
line: You get pushed back into Beau and Beau catches your fall. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Not the jacket! →

name: TALIESIN
line: Ow. →

name: MATT
line: That ends its go. Nott, you're up. →

name: SAM
line: It's still alive? →

name: MATT
line: Yeah. →

name: SAM
line: Nott is going to hard charge out of the tent. →

name: SAM
line: Not at the beast, but across the courtyard. Yes. →

name: SAM
line: As fast as she can go, saying: Shit shit shit! Can she make it to that box? →

name: MATT
line: She can't, unfortunately. →

name: SAM
line: She can't? →

name: MATT
line: No, it's (counting). You can get to right there. →

name: SAM
line: As she's running, she's going to fire her crossbow at the dude. 11 plus six, 17. →

name: MATT
line: That hits. →

name: ALL
line: Ooh! (laughter) →

name: TRAVIS
line: Wow! Your dice just ollied off of the side of your dice tray! If this was Tony Hawk, you would be accumulating points still, it's racking it up. →

name: LIAM
line: I've seen this Twilight episode. He knows what is behind your screen the rest of the game! →

name: MARISHA
line: Give him the multiplier! →

name: MATT
line: There you go. →

name: SAM
line: Okay, so that is seven points of damage and sneak attack damage? →

name: MATT
line: Correct, as it is adjacent to Molly. →

name: SAM
line: Another two points. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. →

name: SAM
line: Oh! And why not? I'll use Fury of the Small! Add another two points. →

name: MATT
line: That's a full ten points of damage to him. →

name: SAM
line: Yes and then bonus action can I just hide behind that thing? →

name: MATT
line: You can't hide behind it because you'd have to get behind it, but you can use your bonus action to dash and get behind it. You're not technically hiding, but you'll move in this direction. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh, that's what rouges can do, they can use their bonus action to dash? →

name: SAM
line: Apparently? →

name: MATT
line: Yep. You get behind. "Oh god!" That finishes your turn, Nott. That brings us to Jester! You're up! →

name: LAURA
line: Oh okay! I'm going to sit down on the ground and open the tent. →

name: MATT
line: And look out? →

name: LAURA
line: And look out. →

name: MATT
line: You see this sudden interaction of everyone, or at least Beau and Molly leaping towards the standing zombie. →

name: LAURA
line: Then I say: Oh shit, I shouldn't have used all those spells earlier. All I have is Sacred Flame, and I'm going to do that. I'm going to shoot Sacred Flame and at the same time I'm going to go: Frumpkin, come here, let me pet you! →

name: MATT
line: All right so Sacred Flame is a saving throw for the-- →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah, it's a 13 dexterity. →

name: MATT
line: It actually rolled exactly a 13 with no modifiers, so it does succeed. →

name: LAURA
line: That doesn't do any damage then? →

name: MATT
line: Well, what does it say on the spell, is it half damage or no damage? →

name: LAURA
line: It just says that's it. →

name: MATT
line: Okay then yeah, sorry. →

name: LAURA
line: Balls! (Coughs) Shit. Frumpkin! Lumpy, come here. →

name: MATT
line: Let me double check that. →

name: LAURA
line: Sorry, guys. →

name: MATT
line: That finishes Jester's turn. Fjord, you're up. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Oh yeah, can I fucking run up past the cart? Charge into the fray with my 30 speed. →

name: MATT
line: That's about as close as you can get right there. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Can I pull out my falchion? I'll flip it over so it's pommel up and I will use Eldritch Blast towards the remaining zombie. →

name: MATT
line: As you hold your arm out in force, the edge of the pommel glows with this dark, black, purple, crackling energy, and this single bolt of Eldritch energy fires out in the direction. Roll for the attack. →

name: TRAVIS
line: That is a 14. →

name: MATT
line: That hits, roll damage. →

name: SAM
line: Travis is using magic. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I'm telling you, it's all happening you guys! That is nine points of damage. →

name: MATT
line: Nine points of damage, nice. It hits and the armor dents inward, to the point where if it was still a living human, it probably would've caused some serious internal bleeding or bludgeoning, but the creature seems relatively unphased by the impact, other than being pushed onto one foot then back on its, two-foot weight. That ends your turn. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I look around and say we need to drop this fucker and get the hell out of Dodge. →

name: TRAVIS
line: (laughing) →

name: TALIESIN
line: There's no way we're going to be able to take this shit seriously. →

name: MATT
line: Beau, you're up. →

name: MARISHA
line: Okay, back to the top. I'm going to do with my two-handed, I'm going to use my quarterstaff two-handed and come down and try and crack it over his head. →

name: MATT
line: All right, you have to move over to him, though. →

name: MARISHA
line: Okay, can I step over the dead guy. →

name: MARISHA
line: Sorry, excuse me. →

name: MATT
line: You vault off of the corpse of the other zombie guard and then leap down with your staff towards him, go for it. →

name: MARISHA
line: Goddamn it, fuck, balls and shit. 13. →

name: MATT
line: 13 still hits. →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah! Fuck yeah! →

name: TRAVIS
line: If you weren't drinking a sea anemone. →

name: MARISHA
line: You're so weirded out about it. 11 points of damage. →

name: MATT
line: 11 points of damage. Wham! You slam into it and watch as it (impact). It's starting to look pretty beat up, but it's still standing. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Damn, that armor's helping it, huh? →

name: MATT
line: You have a bonus action if you still want it. →

name: MARISHA
line: I can hit again with my bonus, right? I'm still trying to figure this out. →

name: MATT
line: Every turn, as long as you're attacking with your action, you can bonus attack with you unarmed strike. Then use a ki point to double attack if you want. →

name: MARISHA
line: Right. Learning these combat abilities, it's weird. Okay. I'm going to be like: Ugh, die! I'm going to do a big roundhouse kick to his head. →

name: MATT
line: Go for it, roll for the attack. →

name: TRAVIS
line: That's awesome. →

name: MARISHA
line: That's good, that's a 16! →

name: MATT
line: 16 hits! Go ahead and roll damage. →

name: MARISHA
line: That's an unarmed strike? Okay, eight points! →

name: MATT
line: Eight points?! →

name: MARISHA
line: It's a two, plus-- No, wait! I'm sorry, six points. I was looking at the wrong thing. →

name: MATT
line: That's okay. Six points of damage. Whack! You slam it in the side of the head with a roundhouse kick and watch as the neck snaps and the head is stick there like (snarling). It's trying to snarl, but you can hear the windpipe is closed off at the angle that it got snapped and it's making this horrible choking sound. →

name: MARISHA
line: I go, "Ugh, Molly!" "Do it!" →

name: MATT
line: Caleb, your turn. →

name: LIAM
line: Okay I'm also tapped as well. I'm going to back up against the tent that we came out of and with a sinking pit in my stomach, my hand starts to blacken and flake and fire springs from the palm and it shoots, and I cast Fire Bolt. →

name: MATT
line: Roll for the attack. →

name: LAURA
line: Is that a cantrip? →

name: LIAM
line: That is a cantrip, yeah. That's good though, that's 17. →

name: MATT
line: That hits, go ahead and roll damage. →

name: LIAM
line: That's 1d10, that's this guy here that I never used in the last campaign. Oh, that's four. →

name: MATT
line: Four points of damage. All right. The bolt slams into the side of its head where it was hit by Beau, and actually snaps it back into place. →

name: MATT
line: You watch its eyes lull for a second and it comes back with renewed undead strength. →

name: LAURA
line: Renewed undead strength? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Undead strength. →

name: MATT
line: Renewed in the sense that for a second you watched the light flicker out but it seems to push through by the force of the enchantment that holds it aloft. →

name: MARISHA
line: Beau goes: Who undid my work? →

name: LIAM
line: I probably have a little bit of movement left. →

name: MATT
line: You've got ten feet. →

name: LIAM
line: I would like to sidle into the tent that I exited before and disappear. Frumpkin will dart across behind Molly to the little tent. →

name: LAURA
line: No, don't leave me! →

name: MATT
line: (Counting) What's the movement on Frumpkin? →

name: MATT
line: All right. That's your turn? →

name: LIAM
line: Ja, that's it. →

name: MATT
line: All right. Molly, you're up. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm going to take two more shots, I'm going to see if I can decapitate-- →

name: MATT
line: Two more shots? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Oh man! I've got to get out of that habit. →

name: LAURA
line: Two more swings? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Two more swings, see if I can decapitate it. →

name: LAURA
line: Two more flourishes. →

name: TALIESIN
line: That's an eight. →

name: MATT
line: Eight? Misses. →

name: TALIESIN
line: But a 16 does not. →

name: MATT
line: 16 does hit. Go ahead and roll damage. →

name: TALIESIN
line: That's nine points of damage. →

name: MATT
line: Nine points of damage. →

name: MATT
line: As the blade sinks into its shoulder and you see it carves in and jams halfway through the torso, the armor stopping it part way before it lodges in, and it leans forward. (growling) It's still standing, and your blade's stuck in the abdomen. →

name: LAURA
line: Renewed, undead strength. →

name: MATT
line: All right, that ends your turn, Molly. It's going to take its first slam, swipe at you. Since you're immediately in front of it. That's a natural 20. I'm rolling some good 20s tonight. →

name: TRAVIS
line: What dice did you use? →

name: MATT
line: What other dice? Of course it's the snitch. →

name: TRAVIS
line: (screaming) No, look what you did! Come back to bite you in the anus. →

name: TALIESIN
line: This is not looking good. →

name: TALIESIN
line: This is looking very bad. →

name: MATT
line: 11 points of bludgeoning damage. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Oh my god. →

name: MATT
line: It clocks you across the side of the temple. You're vision goes blurring for a second. You spit across the ground. You're used to the sight of your own blood, but now it's across the grass and dirt at your foot. You start to feel yourself get a bit woozy. It's going to go ahead and spin around and strike you with its open claw with the other arm. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I swear I thought I could kill it. →

name: MATT
line: That's going to be a 16 to hit? →

name: TALIESIN
line: That hits. →

name: SAM
line: Man down. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Come on, baby. →

name: MATT
line: That is nine points of bludgeoning damage. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Oh yeah, I'm out. →

name: TRAVIS
line: (laughing) Yeah, first one! →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh shit! Christ! →

name: TRAVIS
line: Write the history books. →

name: MATT
line: You guys watch as the first hit clocks Molly hard. The second one is this clawing uppercut. He goes backwards dropping one scimitar; the other one being left, stuck in the body of the undead guard. As it now glances back towards Beau to its right. That's the end of Molly's turn, and the zombie's turn. Nott, you're up. →

name: LAURA
line: Kill it, Nott! →

name: TRAVIS
line: You didn't fall into the fire, right? →

name: MATT
line: No, he fell straight back. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Are you sure? →

name: MATT
line: If he rolled a one, we'd talk. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I think I'm immune to fire, anyways or some such thing. →

name: MATT
line: Fire resistance? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Yeah, fire resistance. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Because of your magical, technicolor dreamcoat? →

name: MATT
line: Nott, what do you got? You just watched Molly go down. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Out, but not dead. →

name: SAM
line: Seeing one of us die scares the shit out of me. →

name: MATT
line: Unconscious. →

name: SAM
line: No, dead forever. →

name: SAM
line: (laughter) →

name: TALIESIN
line: I've just started working on a new character tonight. Thank god. →

name: SAM
line: I start charging out at the beast. →

name: MATT
line: All right. →

name: SAM
line: I get about halfway. I fire my crossbow (wailing scream). →

name: SAM
line: Fire the crossbow. →

name: TRAVIS
line: So brave. →

name: SAM
line: That's a natural 20. →

name: SAM
line: (cheering) →

name: LAURA
line: With sneak attack you double your dice. →

name: MATT
line: How do you want to do this? (cheering) →

name: MATT
line: It doesn't even matter the damage you deal. →

name: MATT
line: If the damage from a critical hit, it doesn't get its undead fortitude. →

name: MATT
line: (cheering) →

name: SAM
line: I'm low to the ground so probably in the back of the calf or something. Before it falls, I'm going to turn and run into the tent. I don't even know if I hit. (screaming) →

name: LIAM
line: That's my girl. →

name: MATT
line: Molly, as you watch it turn around towards you, suddenly it lurches as a crossbow bolt shatters its kneecap from behind. Its other leg, which had been partially damaged from the process of getting up and combat that's happened isn't enough to keep it aloft. It tumbles back into the fire and immediately begins to burn as it begins to scream and squeal. See the flames begin to burn and engulf its body before eventually it comes to rest, no longer held by this undead magic that keeps it standing. Quiet falls over the encampment. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Nice. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Molly. Well, next up, as this is now important, Jester it's your turn. →

name: LAURA
line: I come running out of the tent. Say: Molly! Oh shit, oh no! Okay. I kneel down next to him and I'll do Spare the Dying cantrip. →

name: SAM
line: It's a cantrip? →

name: LAURA
line: Yes. It took someone going unconscious, guys. →

name: SAM
line: It's designed for this moment. →

name: MATT
line: That being the case, you become stable. →

name: TALIESIN
line: (gasps) →

name: MATT
line: You're not conscious yet, but you're stable. →

name: MATT
line: You don't have to make-- →

name: LAURA
line: Can I try and do some medicine on him? Does that heal him at all? →

name: MATT
line: Do you have a healer's kit? →

name: LAURA
line: I don't think so. →

name: TRAVIS
line: She has desserts. →

name: LAURA
line: I have doughnuts, some paint supplies. →

name: MATT
line: Beau as you're standing here, Molly is no longer bleeding out. He's breathing and coughing in the unconsciousness from the pain. You watch as Jester is fiddling through her bag, pulling things out. →

name: MARISHA
line: You have a six pack of donuts, but you don't have a healer's kit in there? And you're the cleric? I'm confused. →

name: LAURA
line: I'm the cleric? What is this? I've never traveled with a bunch of people that I thought would die in front of me, okay? I never needed a healer's kit before. →

name: MARISHA
line: Well, congratulations, you're the cleric now. →

name: LAURA
line: (gasps) You have a healer's kit? Oh my gosh. I've always wanted one of these for so long. →

name: MARISHA
line: I'll give it to her. Here, it's a gift. →

name: MARISHA
line: Congratulations-on-you-being-in-a-new group gift. →

name: LAURA
line: Yes! How do I use this, though? →

name: SAM
line: Oh no, she's not proficient. →

name: LAURA
line: I open it and rummage through a bunch of shit here. →

name: TRAVIS
line: No vanilla extract or sprinkles? →

name: MATT
line: I'll say for the instance of this, since it's not necessarily immediate danger of him dying off. Go ahead and make a medicine check. →

name: SAM
line: Use my dice that I gave you. →

name: LAURA
line: Should I? →

name: SAM
line: Yes. →

name: LAURA
line: What if I roll a one on it? →

name: SAM
line: That's what I'm hoping for. →

name: SAM
line: That's a strong four. →

name: LAURA
line: A nine? →

name: MATT
line: Okay, I'll say-- (sighs). He's still unconscious. Given a little bit of time, he'll come back to consciousness. Ten minutes or so. You can probably, eventually through the use of strong vapors or something you can bring him back from the brink. At this point the rest of the carnival currently within the vicinity begin to emerge from the tents seeing that the danger has passed. →

name: SAM
line: Is there any young girl in the tent with me? →

name: MATT
line: Make a perception check. →

name: SAM
line: Natural 20. →

name: MATT
line: You glance around the interior of the chamber which has a unique smell to the inside. →

name: MATT
line: You smelled it before, but it catches you very strongly now that there's quiet and you're not focused on anything else. A very faint smell of brimstone lingers within the tent, mingling with the wet grass. You look around and see no girl. →

name: LIAM
line: What does happen is Frumpkin scrabbles up your back and comes to your shoulder, and I'm watching everything from my hidey hole. →

name: MARISHA
line: I immediately drop down and start searching the guard. →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah, is any of their armor still usable? Because we can pretend we're guards for some reason. →

name: MATT
line: The one that he cleaved, the armor is not functional at all. The other one, the last one to die, the armor is still functional. It is dented and beat up, but it's still functional. There's the slightly tarnished brass armor. Then there's the red maroon color. It's like a scale mail chestplate and armplates for it. It could be used but it's still a big piece of armor. You'd have to lug it around or wear it. →

name: TRAVIS
line: We still look like Crownsguard. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh. →

name: MATT
line: You both do, currently. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Caleb and I. →

name: LIAM
line: We probably have a half hour at this point? →

name: MATT
line: About, yeah. →

name: LAURA
line: We should get out of here soon though because guards could be coming. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Did anybody see what happened or where that hellish toad went? →

name: LAURA
line: It jumped off that way. →

name: TRAVIS
line: You saw it? →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah. →

name: MATT
line: The Knot twins emerge like, "Where are the guards, the rest of them? Are more coming or is this all of them?" →

name: LAURA
line: There's probably more coming, I would think. →

name: TRAVIS
line: We can't be here. →

name: MATT
line: "Do you think we should run?" →

name: MARISHA
line: We should hide the evidence. →

name: TRAVIS
line: What? Where? →

name: MARISHA
line: I don't know. →

name: LAURA
line: I don't know who should run where. →

name: TALIESIN
line: (groans) →

name: LAURA
line: I have his head in my lap and I'm slapping his cheek consistently. →

name: MARISHA
line: Was there nothing useful on the guard? →

name: MATT
line: As you continue to search through, aside from the armor that seems functional, each of them have a basic longsword. →

name: TALIESIN
line: One of them has my sword embedded in their chest. →

name: MATT
line: Yes. Which can be pulled out. Between the two of them you can gather about six gold pieces and four silver pieces. →

name: LAURA
line: Ooh! →

name: TRAVIS
line: I don't want to get these folk in any more trouble. How far is it from here to the lake? →

name: MATT
line: Glancing off to the side you can see the lake is maybe 400 to 500 feet north. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I say we could drag them and throw them into the lake to avoid suspicion on the carnival. →

name: TRAVIS
line: We've got to get out of here. →

name: MARISHA
line: How well did the fire burn the other body? Did it do pretty well or-- →

name: MATT
line: It's pretty burned. The maroon robes on the one armor is damaged and can possibly be salvaged. →

name: MATT
line: The armor on the one that is burned can be used. →

name: MATT
line: The robes or the maroon cloth is burned away entirely. The armor looks like its been burned. It has blackened, charcoal edges to it. →

name: LIAM
line: Nott, you feel Frumpkin's claws slowly and deliberately squeeze into your shoulder. →

name: SAM
line: That means I have to go. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Where's Caleb? →

name: MARISHA
line: I thought he was with you. →

name: TRAVIS
line: He was. I look around for Caleb. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. If you're right there, you're not far from the tent. You head back and see he's not on the outside of the tent. →

name: SAM
line: The smell of sulfur, I mean brimstone, do I figure that it's probably the residual from the big toad guy or is there a substance in the room that is causing it? →

name: MATT
line: Make a religion check. →

name: SAM
line: A religion check? One. →

name: SAM
line: (laughter) →

name: MATT
line: You believe the little girl may have tooted before where she went to where she is. →

name: TRAVIS
line: That's a devastating toot. →

name: SAM
line: I'm going to try and get out of the tent through the side. Like underneath the side and towards the horse. Yeah, back there. Looking for Caleb. →

name: MATT
line: You glance over and you don't see Caleb. You do see Fjord is in the process of looking in the area. You walk up and Caleb is nowhere near the tent on the outside. You don't know where he is. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Nott, have you seen Caleb? →

name: SAM
line: No, not yet. Is he okay? Did he live? Did everyone live? →

name: TRAVIS
line: You got his little cat right there on your shoulder. →

name: SAM
line: Oh yes I do, hi. Yeah, so he can't be far. →

name: TRAVIS
line: We need to get out of here. We need to follow after that toad. →

name: SAM
line: Okay. There's horses around here, let's steal them. →

name: TRAVIS
line: That's actually not a terrible idea. →

name: LAURA
line: Ooh good, we can put Molly on the back of the wagon. That way we can get him out of here. →

name: LAURA
line: And the guards' bodies, too! That way we can drop them off away from the carnival and people won't think it's related. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh my god, you are so speaking my language. →

name: LAURA
line: I'm a very wise person. →

name: TRAVIS
line: That's a great idea. Let's do that. →

name: LAURA
line: Okay. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Who wants to help me with the one totally charred body? →

name: LAURA
line: I'll do it. I go pick him up and carry him. →

name: MATT
line: An impressive display of physical strength. →

name: MATT
line: The little, adorable tiefling, without an issue lifts the body out of the charred bits of burnt wood and charcoal. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Shit. Never would have known. →

name: MARISHA
line: I grab the other body and start dragging it or at least its torso. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I'll help you. →

name: MATT
line: Ornna gives a hand and helps you. The Knot sisters look like they want to be absolved of this whole scenario and look like they're about to flee at any moment. →

name: SAM
line: Might I point out real quick, up to this point we are fugitives who haven't committed a crime. But starting now we will be fugitives who have committed crimes. Are we sure we want to do this? →

name: TRAVIS
line: I mean it's either that or leave the carnival and take the fall for what is two dead crownsguard. →

name: SAM
line: All right, let's go. But I have to find Caleb first. →

name: LIAM
line: Caleb gets over it and he comes out and starts helping push the bodies onto the-- doesn't say anything, but starts pushing bodies onto the back of the cart. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Where'd you go? →

name: LIAM
line: This is not my thing. I am not brave like Nott. Let's get out of here, please. →

name: TRAVIS
line: You shot shit out of your hands. I don't think you were not brave. That was really impressive. →

name: MARISHA
line: Wait, you were shooting shit out of your hands? →

name: TRAVIS
line: It was fire. It's a figure of fucking speech. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh. →

name: LIAM
line: I haven't learned that one yet. Some day. →

name: LAURA
line: Somebody needs to grab Molly. He's still over there. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah, okay. We go back over there and we fucking grab Molly. I grab him by his horns. →

name: MATT
line: As you're dragging Molly, Molly, your eyes lull open and you're at one hit point. Come to consciousness. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm at one hit point? →

name: MATT
line: You're being dragged. →

name: MARISHA
line: I start hooking up the horses. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. You're hooking them all up to? →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, one is going to hook up to the wagon and I'll-- which wagon do we want to take? →

name: LAURA
line: The one with the two horses attached, yo. →

name: LAURA
line: Can you see it? →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah. →

name: LAURA
line: We'll take that one. →

name: MARISHA
line: Okay. →

name: LAURA
line: Unhook the other horse so we can steal that one, too. →

name: MATT
line: As you guys are doing this, the two Knot sisters talking to each other, look around, and they go running to the southeast. →

name: LAURA
line: They're outies. →

name: MATT
line: They're out. →

name: SAM
line: Should I shoot them? →

name: TALIESIN
line: They're okay. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Is that single horse a mustang? →

name: LAURA
line: Oh my god. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Really? →

name: TRAVIS
line: What? Can I ask a simple question? →

name: MARISHA
line: We better get $100,000 from Ford for that one. We better fucking get that. →

name: MATT
line: Sure. →

name: TRAVIS
line: It's not a mare? I'm just checking. →

name: MATT
line: No, no it is. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I'm just very curious as to the sex of the horse, that's all. →

name: MATT
line: Roll a perception check. →

name: MATT
line: That is a mustang. →

name: LIAM
line: Is its name Roy? →

name: SAM
line: The white one? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Are you going to name it Sally? →

name: TRAVIS
line: You'll find out. →

name: TRAVIS
line: (laughter) →

name: TALIESIN
line: I had that coming. →

name: LIAM
line: During all the busywork, I'm not saying anything, but I keep giving worried and stressed glances at my little friend. →

name: LAURA
line: Don't worry, Caleb, I'm okay. →

name: MATT
line: You guys have the bodies loaded up, both the charred and the slashed one, onto the cart. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm going to pull my sword back out and start trying to get the horses going. →

name: LAURA
line: He's alive! You're awake! →

name: TALIESIN
line: That really hurt. →

name: LAURA
line: How do you feel? →

name: TALIESIN
line: I feel terrible. →

name: LAURA
line: I saved your life. You should be really grateful. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I can do that. I can do that. →

name: MARISHA
line: Molly, I appreciate you trying to rally the horses right now, but I really think you should rest. →

name: TALIESIN
line: No, I'm fine. I'm going to actually fall back into the cart. →

name: MARISHA
line: I take the reins. →

name: MATT
line: All right. Easy enough to find any sort of material if you wanted to cover the contents of the cart. You guys are ready to go. Ornna is standing there alone. "I think I should stay here." →

name: LAURA
line: Are you sure? →

name: MATT
line: "What, and be a fugitive? I can explain what happened. Hopefully." →

name: LAURA
line: What are you going to say to them? →

name: MATT
line: "Exactly what happened. The same thing that turned these guards ran off and you're hoping to stop it." →

name: LAURA
line: Don't say that we were here. Don't mention we were here. That's pretty important, I think. →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah? →

name: TRAVIS
line: You couldn't see us in the low light, but they chased after whatever caused this. →

name: MATT
line: "Okay. I can do that. I can't leave Gustav and Bosun in prison to take the fall for this." →

name: LAURA
line: We'll get them out of it. →

name: LIAM
line: Would you have the abilities to burn these things up the way we did? Are you capable? Could you have killed these things? Is that believable for people who know you? →

name: MATT
line: "I'm quite good with fire. That's not entirely impossible." →

name: MARISHA
line: Ornna, is there anything else that you can think of that could possibly help us? Like why this toad decided to freak out right now? Anything that comes to mind before we go chase after your mess. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Any previous episodes of this kind? →

name: MATT
line: "No. Never trusted anything that looked the way Kylre did. Everyone seemed to put a lot of trust in him. Gustav did. Toya did. I don't know if this is still a misunderstanding, but--" She points over to where there's splatters of blood in the middle of the grass. The leftover carnage from the battle. "Just get this figured out, please. →

name: MATT
line: This is all I have left." She looks around the empty encampment. She stands amongst the four empty tents by herself. →

name: SAM
line: Toya's gone, right? →

name: MATT
line: Toya's gone. →

name: LAURA
line: What happened to her? Did it take Toya with it? →

name: LIAM
line: Yeah, she frogged out. →

name: TRAVIS
line: We'll try and find some evidence that will exonerate you and we'll return. →

name: LAURA
line: We need to find evidence to exonerate us. →

name: SAM
line: Sorry that we thought that you did it. →

name: SAM
line: Briefly. →

name: MATT
line: "It's okay. It's hard for some folks to trust carnival folk. Just as hard as it is for some folks to trust little green folk." (laughter) →

name: TRAVIS
line: We should really get to stepping. →

name: LAURA
line: Let's go. →

name: SAM
line: Saddle up. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Sure. →

name: MATT
line: You hop on your mustang. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I do. Shelby. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh, god! →

name: TRAVIS
line: Just deliver it to the PO Box, that's fine. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Everything that you've been holding back for years now is going to come pouring out of you. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Okay. →

name: MATT
line: You have the cart and the horses at your disposal. What are you guys doing? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Trying to take as much of a short rest as I can back there. I'm going to try and sleep this off like a bad hangover. →

name: LIAM
line: I will attempt to do the same to do arcane recovery. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. The two of you saddle up on the back of the cart as it makes its way northward. →

name: SAM
line: Where are we going? →

name: TRAVIS
line: In the direction the toad leapt. →

name: LAURA
line: Are we really chasing the toad right now? Molly obviously did the most damage out of anyone and he's almost dead right now. →

name: MARISHA
line: Maybe we can at least find him, stake him out, and then we'll rest. →

name: LAURA
line: We are going to rest, right? We can't just chase after a toad. We'll die. →

name: TRAVIS
line: We might need to play it by ear. →

name: LAURA
line: Fjord, I'm trusting you. →

name: TRAVIS
line: If it's too dangerous, we'll stand down. →

name: TRAVIS
line: How about that? →

name: LAURA
line: Okay. →

name: LIAM
line: Also I have a cat. →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah, it's cute. →

name: LIAM
line: That's not what I mean. If we catch up to them, my cat can follow and I can watch. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah, you blanked out there for a second. →

name: LIAM
line: If we find them, then we assign Frumpkin to the case and I will lean against a tree. Nott will keep watch over me and we will know where it goes. →

name: SAM
line: We're going with them, then? →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah, let's follow the direction that the toad went. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah. →

name: MARISHA
line: Cats love toads. →

name: LAURA
line: I like it. It's a good plan. This is definitely not going to backfire. Let's go. →

name: LAURA
line: (laughter) →

name: MATT
line: All right. The horses pick up and begin heading northward towards the Ustaloch. →

name: LAURA
line: When we get far away from the carnival, we should drop the guard bodies off. Push them out so it looks like they were on patrol when they turned into zombies. Far away from the carnival. →

name: MARISHA
line: We ran into those guards that were patrolling the lake-- →

name: LAURA
line: Exactly! Like a lake patrol. →

name: MATT
line: It doesn't take you too long to get to the southern edge of the Ustaloch. You can see the muddy lake bed that gives way to the water itself. →

name: MATT
line: Number of scattered stones in the muck and occasionally you hear the lapping of waves. The very subtle wind flowing through in the night. →

name: MATT
line: It's about two in the morning. There's some moonlight in the sky. It looks like a waxing moon. →

name: MATT
line: At least the one you can see because there are multiple moons. →

name: SAM
line: Wait, what? →

name: MATT
line: There's two moons in Exandria. →

name: SAM
line: How did we never know that? →

name: MATT
line: That was established in the last campaign. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Like dogs, we never looked up. →

name: MATT
line: One of the moons is so faint-- →

name: SAM
line: How many suns are there? →

name: MATT
line: There's one. Anyway, there's a faint bit of moonlight which gives you folks without darkvision a little bit of detail that you can make out in the vicinity. You come to the lake edge and there's the water. →

name: TRAVIS
line: This is the best we can do for them. →

name: LAURA
line: Take them out of this wagon! →

name: MARISHA
line: Hang on, hang on. I want to look around. →

name: MARISHA
line: Do I see any guards? →

name: MATT
line: Perception check. →

name: MARISHA
line: Big dice, don't fail! Natural 20! →

name: MATT
line: Okay. Couple things. One: you don't see any guards, but you do see a few hundred feet to the west of you along the edge, you see a boat that is about a hundred feet out on the water. You see two figures that are in the boat. Possibly two fishermen or two guards, but you can't really tell from this distance. There are two figures in a boat a little ways out on the water. →

name: MATT
line: From your current visual perspective, you don't see the other end of the lake. It's a pretty decent sized lake, but you can see the very faint bump of a landmass that breaks the horizon of the water. →

name: MARISHA
line: Like an island? →

name: MATT
line: Like an island, possibly. →

name: LAURA
line: Or a giant toad sitting in the water? →

name: TALIESIN
line: That would be a very big toad. →

name: MARISHA
line: It's far away on the horizon, the little bump? →

name: MATT
line: Yeah, it breaks the water's horizon from here. →

name: MARISHA
line: There's two figures on a boat about a hundred yards out. →

name: LAURA
line: Can they see us? →

name: MARISHA
line: I don't know. It's hard to say. Do they seem distracted? Can I make anything else out? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Lamplight on the boat? →

name: MATT
line: There's a faint bit of lantern light that's the only reason you're able to make them out at this distance, but that's as much detail as you can make out. They're a few hundred feet away from you. →

name: LAURA
line: If we can't see them very clearly, they can't see us very clearly. We don't have a light on us. →

name: TRAVIS
line: We're going to have to ditch this wagon anyway because we've got tracks. →

name: SAM
line: Just change the license plate. No? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Vanity plate? What does it say? →

name: SAM
line: "Back in time"? (laughter) →

name: MATT
line: Oh, man. →

name: MATT
line: So, what do you do? →

name: LAURA
line: Go up a little further away from the boat and then dump the bodies. →

name: SAM
line: It's really shallow. Shouldn't we weigh them down with something? →

name: LAURA
line: It's not like we're trying to hide the bodies. We're saying they turned into zombies around here. Is that stupid? →

name: TRAVIS
line: No, they don't have to go in the water, right? They're burned. It's not like they burned in the water. →

name: MATT
line: That would be very confusing. →

name: TRAVIS
line: It would. →

name: TALIESIN
line: The wagon tracks directly to the point at which they are found. →

name: TRAVIS
line: That's what I just said. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh, coming from the carnival. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I wish I had something that could help Molly out. →

name: SAM
line: We could write a little note and put it in one of their pockets that says something like "I've discovered that Caleb and Nott are innocent and should be cleared of all charges", or something like that. →

name: LAURA
line: That would definitely work. Will you add my name to that list? →

name: SAM
line: Sure. How do you spell Jester? →

name: LAURA
line: Like normal. →

name: SAM
line: Okay. →

name: MARISHA
line: Maybe we can dump them, backtrack with the cart, and drop the cart back off. →

name: TRAVIS
line: As we've been riding, have we seen any tracks that we think might have belonged to the toad? Since it was leaping in these huge arcs. →

name: MATT
line: Make a survival check. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Ugh, three. →

name: MATT
line: Even with your darkvision, it's hard to make out too many details. There's a lot of foot traffic along the banks of the river at different points in the day. There's not a lot of light. →

name: MATT
line: You're unable to pick up any tracks. →

name: LAURA
line: Maybe we dump the bodies and I'll get out and try to make the tracks go away for a little bit. I'll walk up the path and do like this. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Why? We could get rid of the wagon later. →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah, but the wagon will come from the carnival straight to the bodies. Isn't that weird? →

name: LIAM
line: You'd have to erase the tracks all the way back to the-- how far back are you willing to go? →

name: LAURA
line: Not that far. →

name: LIAM
line: What's the plan here? Are we going to flee? →

name: LAURA
line: I think we have to go back to the inn, right? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Once the sun comes up-- →

name: LIAM
line: I know. Everybody's in deep shit. I understand the problem, but my question is are we cutting and running? →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah. →

name: LIAM
line: No, I mean cutting and running. →

name: TRAVIS
line: No, no, we can't just leave. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh, okay. →

name: LIAM
line: We do it all the time. →

name: LAURA
line: Well... →

name: TRAVIS
line: Let's see if we can find the toad. If the sun starts to break, then we'll make up our mind. →

name: LAURA
line: All right. Are we dumping these bodies or what? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yes, kick them out. →

name: MATT
line: Okay, so you remove the bodies from the cart. Are you dumping them on the shoreline? →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. (thud, thud) The two transformed guard corpses now lie there. One an ashy mess, the other in three pieces. Left along the bank of the water. →

name: LAURA
line: I get out and I start positioning them like maybe they were having a romantic tryst. →

name: LIAM
line: Those two burnt men? Yes. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. (laughs) →

name: MARISHA
line: I'm going to help Jester try and clear the tracks while she positions bodies. →

name: MATT
line: Make a survival check. →

name: MARISHA
line: (disgusted noise) Eight. →

name: MATT
line: All right. You guys-- (laughter) →

name: TRAVIS
line: Anybody else want to look for some toad prints? →

name: LAURA
line: Do you want us to? →

name: SAM
line: We were going to go along the north way, right? →

name: TRAVIS
line: We've been doing that already. →

name: MARISHA
line: If we try and cover the wagon tracks as much as we can, then follow the embankment and try and ride the horses and the cart along the water, it'll hide our tracks as we move northward. →

name: LAURA
line: Sure, let's do that. →

name: MARISHA
line: Okay. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Who are you? →

name: TRAVIS
line: That's actually a great idea. →

name: TALIESIN
line: That's really clever. Why would you even think that? →

name: LAURA
line: Oh, she's all about shady shit. She does a lot of it. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Huh. →

name: MARISHA
line: You understand. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Maybe. I don't know. I'll think about it. →

name: LAURA
line: (singsong) Go to sleep, little tiefling. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Ow, that hurts. Ow. →

name: LIAM
line: Beauregard, are the people on the boat doing anything different? →

name: MATT
line: You glance back over and you can see the boat seems to have moved a little bit further away and has come up to the bank and looks like it's hitting land. →

name: MARISHA
line: Towards us? →

name: MATT
line: No, a little bit further away and then has hit the land. The figures are currently taking things out of the boat. →

name: LAURA
line: They're late night fishermen. →

name: MARISHA
line: I think they're fishermen. Let's keep moving. →

name: MATT
line: Okay, which direction are you moving? →

name: MARISHA
line: North. →

name: MATT
line: Well, north is into the water. Like you hit the water of the bottom of the lake. →

name: SAM
line: The toad went due north? Like straight into the water? →

name: MATT
line: That's the direction it was traveling. →

name: LAURA
line: Can I look for toad tracks? →

name: MATT
line: Make a survival check, sure. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Come on, don't roll Sam's fucking dice. →

name: LAURA
line: I didn't. →

name: MATT
line: Oh, Sam. →

name: TALIESIN
line: That was a lot. →

name: LAURA
line: That was a whole lot of rolls. Survival. →

name: MATT
line: 11. It's hard to really make out what tracks are what. You do see a few heavy impacts in the mud. Some of them looks like it could have been the bodies being rolled, but not too far from where you are, there's one big smack in the mud. →

name: MATT
line: Like something heavy impacted. →

name: LAURA
line: Fjord! Come look at this! This is definitely toad tracks. →

name: TRAVIS
line: In the shape that it's in, this print. Are their toes pointing in a specific direction? →

name: MATT
line: Make an investigation check. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Well, this will break my short rest. →

name: MATT
line: This will break your short rest. →

name: MATT
line: You can see the heavy impact has a few subtler imprints. There do appear to be two hands and two feet though the water has washed in and gotten rid of a lot of the details at this point. →

name: MATT
line: You can vaguely tell they appear to be facing towards the water. →

name: LAURA
line: That lump is the toad. →

name: SAM
line: Could be. →

name: TALIESIN
line: How many people in the boat? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Two. →

name: TALIESIN
line: How many people are we looking for? →

name: TRAVIS
line: One and a giant toad. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Didn't he leave with a-- →

name: TRAVIS
line: Girl. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Two people? →

name: MATT
line: Two people in the boat. →

name: MARISHA
line: Do these silhouettes look proportionate to each other? →

name: MATT
line: They look proportionate to each other. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Does one look like Gorilla Grodd and--- →

name: MATT
line: They both look vaguely humanoid and regular. →

name: MARISHA
line: Which way did the fisherman go? →

name: MATT
line: They are a little bit to the west along the bank in the direction of the city. The city is northwest of you currently. If you were to continue around the lake-- →

name: LIAM
line: Because the city is on the lake so we're just around the edge of the lake. →

name: MATT
line: Exactly. →

name: MARISHA
line: I think we should keep heading away from the city, right? →

name: LIAM
line: It depends on what we're going to do. →

name: SAM
line: If we're chasing the toad it seems like we need to find a boat and go out into the water. →

name: LAURA
line: So we head towards that boat that hit land. →

name: SAM
line: Steal that boat? →

name: LAURA
line: If we go towards the toad we are going to fight the toad. →

name: SAM
line: Well no, we are just going to find the toad. →

name: SAM
line: You said this. We're camping and waiting and resting. →

name: LIAM
line: The other thing we can do, but it will take some time, need about an hour. Frumpkin is a cat but Frumpkin does not need to be a cat. I could fly him over as well but I need time, I need about an hour. →

name: SAM
line: Or swim. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm actively tracking this creature, aren't I on a certain level? →

name: MATT
line: I mean, if you want to. You haven't yet decided to. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I hadn't really thought about it. It's something I can in theory do. →

name: LAURA
line: Because you used your blood on it? →

name: TALIESIN
line: No. This would also break my short rest, wouldn't it? →

name: MATT
line: Actually, I'd say for the points of expediency, with the time it has taken you and have these discussion at the edge, it's pushing 2:30 like 3:00 in the morning and both of you have finished the short rest. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm going to use Hunter's Bane really quickly and look at the track for a second. →

name: MATT
line: You get your blood maledict and you can use your hit dice if you want. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Yeah, I'm going to do both of those. →

name: LIAM
line: I changed my mind, I believe I used arcane recovery during the day. So forget it. →

name: MATT
line: Yeah, it's gone. →

name: SAM
line: You can hit dice it. →

name: LAURA
line: I bet you have a thing where you can click it on. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Now I'm at 12 hit points. →

name: MATT
line: That's better, there you go. →

name: MATT
line: Better than one. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Yay 12 hit points. I'm going to see if I can help with the tracking because I'm going to start actively tracking this particular creature. →

name: MATT
line: Make a survival check. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Survival check? Which I have advantage on. →

name: MATT
line: You have advantage on it because it's a feat. →

name: LIAM
line: If I have an hour to do some ritual casting, yeah. →

name: MATT
line: Looking at the imprint you follow back the direction of the carnival and you can see the path because it was a beeline toward the Ustaloch. The best you can tell because the water picks up there's no trail to pick up in the water. Looking at the trajectory, it was very intently making its way towards the water either avoiding making any more tracks and making it difficult to follow. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Guy went into the water. →

name: LAURA
line: That's what we figured. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Do you think he's trying to swim all the way to the other side or you think he's just going around the lake? →

name: TRAVIS
line: We're not lucky enough to have any small boats along the shores that have been beached? →

name: MATT
line: Not near you. There's the one that you saw the two fishermen are at right now. Then further into the city the docks, there's plenty of boats that are tied up and locked. →

name: LIAM
line: At the level two-- Oh sorry, go ahead. →

name: MARISHA
line: Go ahead. →

name: LIAM
line: It's a rules question, you go for it. →

name: MARISHA
line: Even if we find this thing, if we rest camping out then we're not at the tavern. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah, we got like four hours until sunrise. →

name: SAM
line: Do any of us know what's beyond? Like what's on the other side of this lake? Is it a mountain? →

name: LAURA
line: Straight across. →

name: MATT
line: The other side of the lake, from what you know, because you were traveling southward towards it, there's no major landmass on the other side of the lake. It's just open field. You notice what looks to be some sort of a bulge in the landmass in the center. Too large to be the toad, but it does seem to break up the water horizon from that vantage point. →

name: LAURA
line: It could have gone to the island. →

name: MARISHA
line: I bet that's exactly where it is. →

name: TRAVIS
line: How do we feel about the knowledge that it's somewhere here in the lake, perhaps, or the other side? Circling back tomorrow? At least we'll avoid suspicion if we're at the inn. →

name: LAURA
line: Will you be able to keep tracking it? After you sleep? →

name: TALIESIN
line: I don't know. I'm not sure. Maybe. Could be. →

name: MATT
line: It's not like a mental tracking ability. →

name: MATT
line: It's to be able to see details of the specific type of tracks. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I legitimately do not know how it works. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Sorry. →

name: MATT
line: Just like any other tracking, you still need to have things to follow. You can read damage in the forest to see if something barreled through. →

name: MATT
line: You can follow tracks. You can see blood splatters. Any sort of thing that can give you an idea of where something went that is of those types of creatures. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Do I know what he was, by the way? →

name: LAURA
line: He was a fiend. →

name: MATT
line: With the knowledge of it being a fiend, go ahead and make a religion check. →

name: TALIESIN
line: And I get advantage on that. →

name: MATT
line: You do, actually. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Religion check? 15. →

name: MATT
line: 15? Now that they've mentioned a fiend, it seems familiar, but the most you can get is a memory that you don't know where it came from, this memory of horrible toad-like demonic creatures that exist to the far east in Xhorhas. →

name: MATT
line: That's as much as you can recall. But you're definitely sitting here now with this memory that comes to mind, going, "This whole time! This whole time--" →

name: TALIESIN
line: This whole time I've been sitting with this. →

name: LIAM
line: Rules question. Caleb is too fucking poor to change Frumpkin's shape willy-nilly because it's ten gold pieces worth of charcoal, incense, and herbs, which I don't have. So he's a cat for the foreseeable future. →

name: SAM
line: Do you just need ten gold pieces? →

name: LIAM
line: I need incense, herbs, and charcoal. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Are you saying this out loud? →

name: LIAM
line: No, I'm just talking in my accent to you. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Listening to this, I reach in. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I've got some incense. →

name: LIAM
line: Do you have charcoal? →

name: TRAVIS
line: I'm sure we can find some charcoal. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Isn't this impressive enough that I happen to have some incense? →

name: LIAM
line: If we can get back into town somehow. →

name: SAM
line: We're going to go shopping at three in the morning? →

name: MATT
line: Technically, elements of that guard's body are charcoal now. →

name: MARISHA
line: That's what I was going to say. →

name: MARISHA
line: Let's go back and raid the fire. →

name: TALIESIN
line: There'd also be a fire inside the inn, to be fair. Charcoal is-- it's not like it's hard to get. →

name: TRAVIS
line: And you two seem to be able to move freely, without suspicion. →

name: TALIESIN
line: That's true, you can go shopping more. →

name: LIAM
line: I will. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Let's go maintain the illusion of innocence for the evening. →

name: MARISHA
line: Should we walk the cart off? →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah, yeah, yeah! →

name: TRAVIS
line: And leave it outside town as we're making our way back. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Maybe give the horse a little spank on the ass and send it on its way. →

name: MARISHA
line: See where it goes. I like that. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Shall we? →

name: LAURA
line: It's open 24 hours. →

name: LIAM
line: That random book about fiends has all the answers about the fiend we're chasing. Let's go get it. →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah. You should do that. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Xhorhas. It's a creature from Xhorhas. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm pretty sure, I don't know. We'll see. →

name: TALIESIN
line: God, I'm remembering something. →

name: LAURA
line: Let's go. →

name: TRAVIS
line: We head back. →

name: MARISHA
line: We go along the lake, then off to the edge, and then we're going to give the horse a slap and send him off past-- →

name: MATT
line: Okay, so the cart makes its way. →

name: MATT
line: The two fishermen you see are in the process of tying up nets and bags of things, and they just stop and watch you guys ride by, then go about the rest of their work. You continue with the cart, pulling it up toward the southern edge of where the Ustaloch meets Trostenwald, and you can abandon it there, or you said you wanted to send it somewhere? →

name: LAURA
line: I don't think we would have taken the cart past the fishermen. Are we going to do that? →

name: TRAVIS
line: I thought we were going to head back to the village, to a good distance. →

name: LIAM
line: How much ground did we cover, I don't know? →

name: MATT
line: So what are you doing? →

name: TRAVIS
line: We're taking the cart back to a distance from the city. →

name: LIAM
line: Half a mile. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah, and then letting the horses run, so the-- sending the track off. →

name: MATT
line: I see. Okay. →

name: LAURA
line: I don't think we would have gone right past the fishermen that would be able to identify us. →

name: MARISHA
line: Using the lake to hide tracks. →

name: MATT
line: Okay, so you guys head the opposite direction for a little ways after the field. All right. Who's spooking the horses? →

name: LIAM
line: That's your specialty. →

name: MARISHA
line: Whack with the stick. →

name: MATT
line: Make an animal handling check. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Please roll bad. If there is any justice in the world... →

name: MARISHA
line: It's not great. Thanks, Travis. Thanks. Six. →

name: SAM
line: Six? To hit a horse? →

name: MARISHA
line: Correctly hit a horse! →

name: LAURA
line: The horse whimpers; you hurt a horse. →

name: MATT
line: What's your armor class? →

name: MATT
line: 17? As soon as you hit it, there's a (whinny) and there's a split-second where you watch its back leg muscle twitch, and you duck out of the way just as its back hooves (whoosh) past your face. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm going to walk over to the horses and-- they're trained horses. →

name: MATT
line: Yeah. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm going to go whisper in their ear and give them a little pat. →

name: MATT
line: Make an animal handling check. →

name: LAURA
line: You rolled shit, too! →

name: TALIESIN
line: Nine. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Horses are our new door! →

name: LIAM
line: Drops a couple of horse apples. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I didn't get advantage on that because I knew the animals, did I? →

name: MATT
line: No. You knew the animals, but you weren't the animal handler. →

name: LAURA
line: I use Thaumaturgy and I make the sound of like a predator behind them. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. I'll give you an animal handling check with advantage, because it's fun. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm into this. →

name: LAURA
line: Okay, 13! →

name: MATT
line: 13! It's above a ten, guys! Awesome! →

name: ALL
line: (chanting) Level two! →

name: TALIESIN
line: This is Romper Room! →

name: MATT
line: Yeah, I know! With a crack, and a heavy echoing snarling sound in the vicinity, both horses kick up and go into a full gallop sprint away from the direction of you, the cart being dragged behind it. They continue to go into the shadow. You don't know how long they're going to go. →

name: LIAM
line: I cast Thaumaturgy! (quacks) →

name: MATT
line: By the time you guys make it back to the inn-- →

name: LAURA
line: Those ducks are scary! →

name: MATT
line: Are you guys being careful, or are you just walking back? →

name: LAURA
line: We're being careful. →

name: MATT
line: I'd like you all to roll a stealth check, please. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I'm going to use Mask of Many Faces to make myself look old. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Natural 20. →

name: SAM
line: What was that? I don't even know what that was. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Look at all that stuff! →

name: LAURA
line: I'm going to-- Does anybody have shitty stealth? →

name: TALIESIN
line: I can't even see myself with this roll. →

name: LIAM
line: I do, but I rolled 12. →

name: LAURA
line: Well okay, I was going to give anybody advantage, but here you go. →

name: SAM
line: Thank you. →

name: LAURA
line: Wow, that was bad. →

name: LIAM
line: You have advantage, right? Roll again! →

name: SAM
line: I already rolled once. →

name: TRAVIS
line: 18, but I'm also-- →

name: TALIESIN
line: Technically, my stealth would be 23. →

name: MATT
line: All right, that's fine. You manage to make it to the Nestled Nook Inn without any prying eyes seeing too deeply into your movement. You get back to your rooms as the very faint distant change of black night begins to turn to the faintest of blue of morning curling over. You guys go to your respective rooms, and you take a rest? →

name: LAURA
line: We should go to sleep. →

name: LIAM
line: I'm going to dig some charcoal out of the remains of the fire in the common room and then go to bed. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. The owner watches you do that and she's just, "Whatever." →

name: LIAM
line: Don't thank me. Lovely inn. Good night. →

name: MATT
line: "Don't get anything else dirty!" →

name: LIAM
line: Just going to draw some dicks! →

name: MATT
line: You guys complete a long rest. →

name: TRAVIS
line: We made it! →

name: SAM
line: One day down. Two days down! →

name: LAURA
line: Do we reset our max hit points when we take a long rest? →

name: MATT
line: Your max hit points? I mean, your max hit points are your max hit points. →

name: TALIESIN
line: When you hit 'long rest', it should auto-reset. →

name: SAM
line: With D&D Beyond, it does the work for you. →

name: LIAM
line: Wait, is there a rest button? →

name: SAM
line: There is, there are two rest buttons, Liam. →

name: LIAM
line: Where are they? →

name: SAM
line: They're down towards the bottom, short rest or long rest. →

name: LIAM
line: Whoa! →

name: LAURA
line: I fell asleep in my sketchbook, halfway through my drawing of the two zombie guards making out. →

name: SAM
line: Gross. Were they dead? →

name: LAURA
line: They're zombies, so yeah! →

name: TALIESIN
line: Slightly hotter, okay. →

name: LAURA
line: One arm is like off to the side. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Way hotter. →

name: MATT
line: With full rests completed, consciousness comes to on the outside of Jester's room with the heavy sound of (knocking). →

name: MARISHA
line: Jester! →

name: LAURA
line: Is that our door? →

name: MARISHA
line: I think so. →

name: LAURA
line: Hold on, I'm naked! →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, hold on, she's naked! Do you want to get it? Or should I get it? →

name: LAURA
line: I'll get it! →

name: MARISHA
line: Maybe I should get it. →

name: LAURA
line: No, I get up, I get it. Hello! →

name: MATT
line: You open the door. The same two crownsguard that had come the day before. →

name: LAURA
line: Did you come back to play some games? →

name: MATT
line: "No. We came to tell you that you'll be needed for the investigation and questioning within the next three hours to arrive at the behest of the Lawmaster at the stockade." →

name: MARISHA
line: Why didn't you just come and get us when you were ready for us? →

name: LAURA
line: Well, you know, we might want to brush our teeth. →

name: MARISHA
line: Does that take you three hours? →

name: LAURA
line: No. Now we have time to-- →

name: MATT
line: "We'll be back in three hours." →

name: LAURA
line: Okay. I'll see you soon! I miss you already! →

name: MATT
line: (door creaking) Habit of creeping out guards, I like this. The rest of you come to consciousness. →

name: MATT
line: You're rested. At this point in time, it's past noon. It's about two in the afternoon. →

name: TRAVIS
line: No knock on our door, only you two. →

name: MATT
line: Well, no. It's these two currently, for the moment. Then-- (knocking). →

name: TRAVIS
line: Your jury summons is (groans). →

name: MATT
line: Just finishing up with them. →

name: LAURA
line: It's two o'clock in the afternoon, you said? When we woke up?! →

name: MATT
line: Yes. →

name: LIAM
line: We got back in the middle of the night. No real job here. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I'll open the door. →

name: MATT
line: Two guards are there. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yes? →

name: MATT
line: "Sorry to disturb, the investigation will require you in about three hours." →

name: TRAVIS
line: I just shut the door. →

name: MARISHA
line: Love it! It's my favorite. I was waiting for it. →

name: MATT
line: All right, so. What are you guys doing? →

name: SAM
line: Go down for breakfast? →

name: LIAM
line: I go down. It's Yorda who runs the place? →

name: MATT
line: Correct. →

name: LIAM
line: I find Yorda. Excuse me, a question about the town. →

name: MATT
line: She's right in the middle of pouring a drink, she's like, "Right! What do you need?" →

name: LIAM
line: Is there a pawn shop anywhere in this city? →

name: MATT
line: "If you're looking for strange wares in general, then your best look would be Burnished Bibelots." →

name: LIAM
line: Thank you. →

name: MATT
line: "You might be able to talk to, let's see here-- Lochward General might be interested in buying a few things." →

name: LIAM
line: Wockwurt? →

name: MATT
line: Lochward General. →

name: LIAM
line: Lochward's General, of course. Excuse me. →

name: LIAM
line: That's in the Lochward, then? →

name: MATT
line: Aye, it's about three blocks up north. →

name: LIAM
line: Only been here two days. Okay, you are down here? →

name: SAM
line: I'm always with you. →

name: LIAM
line: Yeah, okay. That flask. →

name: SAM
line: Yes? You saw that? →

name: LIAM
line: Yes, I did see it. →

name: SAM
line: Sorry! →

name: LIAM
line: No, I'm not sorry at all, but I have a big favor to ask you. That's very valuable what you have there. Do you know that is made of platinum? →

name: SAM
line: Would I know that it's made of platinum, just from glancing at it and feeling it? →

name: MATT
line: It looks very pretty. Make an intelligence check. →

name: SAM
line: Not great. Just an intelligence check? →

name: MATT
line: Yes, just your modifier. →

name: SAM
line: Eight. →

name: MATT
line: It's very shiny. →

name: LIAM
line: Let me explain it to you. That little bottle is worth a great deal. It can buy you many full bottles. →

name: SAM
line: I don't want to get rid of it. →

name: LIAM
line: Would you like to trade that for many bottles of booze? Many. →

name: SAM
line: That is a tough decision. But this is the only one I have! I only have one flask. →

name: LIAM
line: We could buy you another flask that can hold whiskey just as well as that one. Here's the thing, you know that I was very interested in those books. We came here for books and booze. →

name: LIAM
line: You've gotten a little booze, but we can get a lot and those books are expensive and I know that we can get enough money for it and I really don't feel like pushing our luck with the law here in town and pulling a fast one again. →

name: SAM
line: Oh, but it's so pretty. How about this for a counteroffer: how much are the books? →

name: LIAM
line: They were worth a total of 13 gold. →

name: SAM
line: Here! →

name: LIAM
line: Did she just hand me 13 gold? →

name: MATT
line: Yes. →

name: SAM
line: I like this better. →

name: SAM
line: (laughter) →

name: LIAM
line: I take her by the head and I rustle our heads together. →

name: SAM
line: Stop! →

name: LIAM
line: That's a good deal. I leave to find that place. →

name: SAM
line: I come with him. →

name: LIAM
line: Oh, you're coming too? What a good day this is! All right, let's go shopping! →

name: MATT
line: All right, you guys make your way to Burnished Bibelots. It is open, though there is nobody currently inside the interior. As you go to the door, it opens up and you see the same cluttered mess of the inside. There across the way you see the tiny gnome gentleman who's up on top of his desk, his legs folded over each other. He's looking through a book right now, as he's thumbing through, "Hello!" →

A lot of it is fables, a lot of it is warnings and things that parents would tell to keep their children from wandering in the darkness. But it does have little tidbits of information about different types, and they talk about horned devils, and they talk about the great and terrible balor and pit fiend, and it seems to be a jumble between both demons and devils. →
