name: LAURA
line: Can he tell who did it? →

name: SAM
line: No, he can't see you. →

name: LAURA
line: That's wonderful. →

name: SAM
line: But I will tell him later when he asks. →

name: LAURA
line: Well, okay, but he won't know now. →

name: MATT
line: As you concentrate, the bird's-eye view of Trostenwald-- Frumpkin carries up high into the air. For the large lake that it is, you can see two smaller land masses in the center of the lake. →

name: MATT
line: Technically not north from where you are now, since you're back in the city, it's more of a northeastern direction. They're both relatively small, one's maybe a few hundred feet across, another one is maybe 50 feet across. It's a smaller mass. Watching as it coasts downward and does a pass over the larger one, make a perception check for Frumpkin. →

name: LIAM
line: That is a six plus very little or nothing, so you can guesstimate. →

name: MATT
line: There is a faint treeline on this island. →

name: MATT
line: The island has a few small trees, which is mainly what you had seen during the night when you looked out over the water, Beauregard. The land mass was actually the very top of this tree line. It's a small grove that has clustered there on the center of this island. Unable to make out any other details other than the tops of these trees and there's a few spots in between where you can see overgrown grass and general ground, rock. →

name: LIAM
line: This is the bigger one? →

name: MATT
line: The bigger one, yeah. Make a perception check for the smaller one. →

name: LIAM
line: Worse. Five. →

name: MATT
line: The other one has maybe five or six trees on it, but most of them appear to have either died or be standing alone on this small mass. That one looks pretty barren. Even with as bad of a look as that was, it doesn't look like there's anything visible on that land mass. →

name: LIAM
line: Does it look balder than the other? →

name: MATT
line: It does. →

name: LIAM
line: Okay. →

name: MATT
line: The larger one has much more of a cluster, a grove. →

name: LIAM
line: Last question, I can probably tell how far apart these two islands are, yeah? →

name: MATT
line: Yeah, they're roughly 600 feet apart from each other. →

name: LIAM
line: 600, okay. →

name: SAM
line: We're all sitting around in this room, watching him watch TV, essentially. →

name: MATT
line: Yes, basically. →

name: SAM
line: While this is going on, can I whip out my little chemistry kit and start putting together some chemical stuff? →

name: MATT
line: Sure, what would you like to make? →

name: SAM
line: Acid. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. It requires half a day to make that. →

name: SAM
line: I'll start it, then. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. →

name: SAM
line: Get in an hour of work. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. →

name: MARISHA
line: While she's doing that, I'm going to take my staff and repair where it cracked. →

name: MATT
line: That's easy enough. →

name: LAURA
line: I'm going to braid Caleb's hair. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. →

name: LIAM
line: I feel that. →

name: LAURA
line: I know. →

name: LIAM
line: And it feels good. →

name: SAM
line: We talking just one braid? French braid? →

name: LAURA
line: Like a few little braids, because his hair is not super long. Maybe one here, one here, and one down here. →

name: LIAM
line: You can't make me Vax again, it won't work. →

name: MATT
line: Make an intelligence check, adding your proficiency modifier. →

name: SAM
line: One. →

name: SAM
line: (laughter) →

name: TRAVIS
line: You kill us all. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Play-Doh, we've got Play-Doh. →

name: MATT
line: For the supplies that you've spent-- You've used your one set of acid supplies you had on you, so you'll have to buy more to make it again. As you begin to make it, it becomes caustic and begins to melt through part of your glove. You immediately freak out, you drop it, and it hits the wood. Splatters a bit and begins to melt through the wood. →

name: SAM
line: Sorry. I didn't mean to, I was-- →

name: LAURA
line: (gasps) Now we can spy on the people below us. →

name: SAM
line: It didn't go through the entire floor, I don't think. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Well, we're not going to get our deposit back. →

name: SAM
line: We'll move the nightstand over a little to cover it up. No one will see. →

name: MARISHA
line: Is it slowly eating through the wood? →

name: MATT
line: It is still slowly eating through the wood. →

name: SAM
line: I pour some water on it. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh no. →

name: TALIESIN
line: That makes it worse. →

name: SAM
line: Oh no. →

name: MATT
line: Eventually Frumpkin begins to return, having done Frumpkin's full watch. →

name: LIAM
line: When I see that he's halfway back, I come out of it. →

name: MATT
line: You come out of it and the first thing you see is all of them gathered around this hole in the wood. →

name: LIAM
line: What are you doing? →

name: SAM
line: I'm sorry. I'm sorry, Caleb. →

name: LIAM
line: I plant my hands on the sides of the wood and start transmuting it to iron. →

name: LAURA
line: Iron? That's not noticeable. →

name: MATT
line: As you concentrate, the area and the wood around where that hole is all of a sudden begins to turn darker and more solid. While the texture remains of wood, suddenly it has the appearance of a dull reddish-brown metal. →

name: SAM
line: Thank you. We'll mop it up with some towels and whatnot while it's still iron. →

name: LIAM
line: Hopefully it will dry. →

name: TRAVIS
line: That is a hell of a talent you have. →

name: TALIESIN
line: It's pretty fancy. →

name: MARISHA
line: Is that what you did with the coin? Is this the coin trick? →

name: SAM
line: No, the coin was magic. It was a magic pot that we sold you. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh man, I've been concentrating on skinky-doodles all day. →

name: SAM
line: That is your power word. →

name: LAURA
line: Man. All right. →

name: SAM
line: Sorry. →

name: LAURA
line: It's fine. →

name: MARISHA
line: Sorry. →

name: LIAM
line: But it brought us closer together. →

name: SAM
line: Would you like back the two copper pieces you gave me for the pot? →

name: LAURA
line: No, you keep it. I'm a very generous person. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Can we ask what you saw? →

name: LIAM
line: Of course, sorry. Acid. Wood. There are two islands out there, a bigger one-- they're not close-- and a smaller one. One is bald-ish, a couple of trees, but I couldn't see too well on either of them. The bigger one is dense with trees. I didn't see them. →

name: LAURA
line: Did you have it fly down closer so you could see better? →

name: LIAM
line: I thought that he would be able to see from the air, and I thought that would be safer, so no, I'm sorry. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Was it busy water, was there lots of ships out? →

name: LIAM
line: I would have seen that. →

name: MATT
line: There are some fishing vessels out there, and there are a number of them that are still at the docks. →

name: TRAVIS
line: It's not a lull for any reason? →

name: MATT
line: No. →

name: LIAM
line: It's not fleet week. →

name: LAURA
line: I guess we should go to the big island? →

name: LIAM
line: I think that the chances of finding it on the big island are greater, yes. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Fair enough. Out the window, shall we? →

name: MARISHA
line: What time of day is it? →

name: MATT
line: By now it's 3:30 in the afternoon, four o'clock. →

name: LAURA
line: Should we wait until dusky-time? →

name: MARISHA
line: That's what I'm thinking. Wait until the sun starts to go down? Because it's got to be soon at this point. →

name: MATT
line: Actually, it's probably closer to five at the time that you've spent with Frumpkin, so it's starting to get closer to dusk. →

name: LAURA
line: Okay. Does anybody else want braids in the amount of time we have to wait? →

name: MARISHA
line: Ooh, yeah! Can you give me one going back this way? →

name: LAURA
line: Of course, I can totally do that. →

name: MARISHA
line: Thanks. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Is anyone else going to be heading out the front door besides Caleb, Nott, and myself? →

name: LAURA
line: I don't want to waste a spell this time. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I think that's smart. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'll keep with you. →

name: LIAM
line: How far away, roughly, was the edge of the lake and islands from where we are right now? →

name: MATT
line: From where you are right now? I'd say a mile and a half. →

name: LIAM
line: Okay, so while everyone is preparing, I take out my spool of silver thread and I go first to Jester's room, and I stretch the thread across, and a little (magic flitter sound) flashes across and the thread disappears. It takes about ten minutes each time, and I do the same on Fjord's doorway, stretch across (magic flitter sound). If anyone goes in to these doors besides you, I will know, but not when we're on that island. Only on the way there. Lasts about a mile. →

name: LAURA
line: That's awesome! →

name: TRAVIS
line: That's great, yeah. →

name: MARISHA
line: While we're getting ready, Molly, I don't know if you unintentionally dodged the question last time, or if you didn't hear me, but you never exactly told us how the circus creates and writes their performance acts. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'd forgotten about that. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh, so you did hear me though? →

name: TALIESIN
line: We were in the middle of things. →

name: MARISHA
line: Just clarifying. →

name: TALIESIN
line: It's usually Gustav. If somebody's got an act, they show it off, Gustav figures out how it's going to work into the narrative. Puts it all together. →

name: MARISHA
line: You bring your own narrative? →

name: TALIESIN
line: You bring a bit, and then the bit is shaped and formed by the director of the show. If you can do a thing with fire or you can do some juggling, and then they figure out how that's going to work into everything. Where it sits and what costuming, and the whole thing is all an act. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Mostly. Mostly an act. →

name: MARISHA
line: Did Toya and Kylre come together with their act? →

name: LAURA
line: They came separate. →

name: MARISHA
line: They came separate. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Oh, you're thinking of Toya and Kylre? They were an act before-- They were an act for as long as I can remember, right? →

name: MATT
line: As long as you can remember, yeah. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Yeah, I've never not known them as an act. →

name: LAURA
line: I thought when we talked to them they said that Toya came after Kylre. They joined the circus at separate times. →

name: MARISHA
line: That's what they told you? →

name: SAM
line: When we were investigating, we were-- →

name: LAURA
line: We gave them a hard-- what was it? →

name: SAM
line: Bad Cop. →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah, Good Cop. I was the good cop. →

name: SAM
line: I was the bad cop! →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah, and we got hard information from them! →

name: SAM
line: You're not leaving here without telling us the truth! →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah, and I was like, "Don't worry, she won't hurt you!" →

name: SAM
line: I'm crazy! I'll bite her too! →

name: LAURA
line: Then they fessed up to everything! They were like, "We're a fiend!" and she was like, "I'm a little girl!" →

name: SAM
line: Yeah, it was crazy. →

name: LAURA
line: That was how it went. →

name: SAM
line: She confessed to being a little girl. →

name: LIAM
line: Do you have any empty positions at the circus for these two? →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm feeling like maybe that might be a thing. →

name: LIAM
line: Tealeaf, you said, "It's mostly an act." What's the not-mostly part? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Well, I mean, everyone's got some weird. →

name: TALIESIN
line: We're weird people. People come in and you're a bit strange, you got something you can do. →

name: LIAM
line: Are they all swashbuckling swordsmen like you? →

name: TALIESIN
line: No. →

name: LAURA
line: Can they all tell fortunes like you? →

name: TALIESIN
line: No. →

name: SAM
line: Do they cut themselves like you? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Well, that's a complicated conversation, but no. →

name: MARISHA
line: You guys are super easy to lie to, no offense or anything. They lied to them, which means-- →

name: LAURA
line: No, they didn't lie to us! →

name: SAM
line: We meted out the truth! →

name: LAURA
line: They told us the truth! →

name: SAM
line: We cracked the case wide open! →

name: TALIESIN
line: She is a little girl, to be fair. →

name: LIAM
line: Nott? →

name: SAM
line: Toya. Unless, and here's my new theory: the big frog man can leech the life force from people? →

name: LIAM
line: If that's what it is, yeah. →

name: SAM
line: What if Toya is a fully-grown adult woman, but he's been slowly leeching so much life from her that she's a small husk. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Toya's not a fully-grown adult woman. →

name: SAM
line: She's a tiny full-grown person! →

name: TALIESIN
line: She's a dwarf. →

name: SAM
line: Oh, she's just a dwarf? Oh, okay, that makes more sense, actually, when you say it that way. It seemed like she was shrunken down from magic! →

name: TALIESIN
line: That is so offensive. →

name: LIAM
line: Perhaps this girl Toya is his baby's bottle, and then once in a while he wants an extra snack. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I think you're right, but I don't know how he's managed to go this long. Why now, and why in front of all those people? →

name: LAURA
line: What if he's like one of those creatures that lives on the bottom of the sea, and she's not actually even a person, she's like this light thing that dangles in front of-- →

name: SAM
line: One of his tentacles! →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah! →

name: TRAVIS
line: He has tentacles now. →

name: SAM
line: Not just tentacles, dwarf tentacles! →

name: LIAM
line: Fucking anime actors. →

name: LIAM
line: (laughter) →

name: SAM
line: Let's go. I think we know all we need to know. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I think he is a fiend. I think he is feeding off her. The rest of it I'm not sure. →

name: MARISHA
line: You never noticed Toya acting weird? You were never like, "Oh, this is a strange--" →

name: TALIESIN
line: Have you met us? We're all a bit weird, and you don't ask a ton of questions. →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, but there's a difference between "quirky" weird and "Oh, I think this person's life force is being siphoned away from them" weird. →

name: TALIESIN
line: There is. It's the difference between being in a carnival and not being in a carnival. →

name: MARISHA
line: Then why were you with the carnival? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Because I'm weird! →

name: MARISHA
line: (groaning) →

name: SAM
line: That tracks. That fully tracks. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I mean, it's putting together. He was never that talkative. I don't know. I don't like it. →

name: LIAM
line: Well, what are we doing? →

name: MARISHA
line: Let's go find the damn toad! →

name: TRAVIS
line: Can I use Mask of Many Faces to change into that older gray-haired farmer? →

name: MATT
line: Sure. Easy enough. The sun is close to setting. you've got about another 30 minutes or so before it sets. →

name: SAM
line: Let's go. →

name: LAURA
line: I bless you. →

name: SAM
line: Gesundheit. On the way out, can I grab some booze from the bar to fill up my platinum flask? Or to fill it up a little? →

name: MATT
line: Okay, we'll say for that, that'll run you about-- Fine liquor? About two silver pieces. →

name: SAM
line: Great. I'll mark it down. →

name: MATT
line: It's a hefty flask, too. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Using D&D Beyond. →

name: TRAVIS
line: (laughter) →

name: MATT
line: Mark that bar tally. All right. Liquor refilled, you go towards the window, you all gather and glance out, and in the alley below the inn is a stationed crownsguard that wasn't there before. You immediately get the sense that with the sudden murder of two crownsguard being discovered in the vicinity, they may have beefed up security a little bit. →

name: MARISHA
line: Ah shit. →

name: MATT
line: Only one of them is guarding the alley's exit onto the main street, and they're looking away at the moment out into the road, but occasionally glance over their shoulder into the alley. But there appears to be a little more of a security set-up. →

name: LAURA
line: Maybe you should go out the front and talk to him and distract him so we can sneak out the window. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I can do that. Do you want to come along on this little escapade? →

name: LIAM
line: Yes, I'm a good talker when I have to be. →

name: SAM
line: As am I. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Well! →

name: LIAM
line: Not for this. →

name: SAM
line: I'll keep lookout. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I am not the right kind of talker for this. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Fair enough. So I'll head out the front. →

name: MATT
line: Okay, you exit without issue. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Can I locate the crownsguard? →

name: MATT
line: Easy enough, and as you exit the tavern, you can see where once there were two guards sitting at the front, there's now three, and there are two guards stationed across the street that are keeping a watch. It looks like everyone's on high alert since they've had some of their own crownsguard killed. You make your way around the corner, through the T-intersection to the other road that meets with the main street that crosses in front of the Nestled Nook, and you see the guard stationed outside who's currently leaning up against the wall, arms crossed, looking back and forth. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Can I run up to him and say: (old raspy voice) You, please, over here! I've seen one of those creatures! It's tearing into him and it's horrible. Please, come quickly! →

name: MATT
line: Make a deception check. →

name: SAM
line: Oh yes, here it is. Come on, charis. →

name: MATT
line: 15? He goes, "Which way? Please, point and show me." →

name: TRAVIS
line: This way, quickly, please! →

name: MATT
line: He grabs his blade and draws it out, and gives a jog after you. The rest of you guys make your way down quickly outside into the alleyway. →

name: MATT
line: Make a stealth check. →

name: LAURA
line: I'm so scared of rolling right now. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Why does every roll have to be-- Oh thank god. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh my god, why. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh, no. →

name: SAM
line: We're fine, we went out the front door. →

name: MARISHA
line: Nope, it's a one. →

name: TRAVIS
line: It's a nordic "7." →

name: LAURA
line: No! →

name: SAM
line: We're going out the front door. →

name: MATT
line: All right. →

name: MARISHA
line: I don't know! You know, if it's binary, one means-- →

name: MATT
line: All right. Between the three of you making the check that's still a majority success. But you do pop your ankle when you land. →

name: MARISHA
line: Did you see the stink-eye he gave me? →

name: LAURA
line: Don't make comments after he just was kind to us. →

name: MATT
line: I was being kind! You sprained your ankle a little bit as you land and you kind of hop behind but the three of you make your way past the alley without issue. →

name: SAM
line: Does she have disadvantage on all checks for the next two days? →

name: MATT
line: No. →

name: MATT
line: (laughter) →

name: SAM
line: That's how I would rule it. →

name: TALIESIN
line: This is why we don't have you as DM. →

name: MARISHA
line: This ankle is affecting my wisdom! It's reaching into my family's history! →

name: LIAM
line: Dungeons & Dragons is about punishment. →

name: MATT
line: The three of you dart on the outside and make your way down the alley behind what looks to be a cluster of empty rain barrels that are set up to catch during storms, and you appear to have managed to just avoid the sight of the guarding crownsguard on the outside of the inn. Caleb and Nott, what are you guys doing? →

name: LIAM
line: We're scouting the way nonchalantly, I would imagine. →

name: SAM
line: I'm real! I'm with you! →

name: MATT
line: So they darted off into the alley, what are you guys doing? →

name: LIAM
line: We could make our way to the outskirts of town. →

name: SAM
line: I said that I would be on lookout duty, so I'm just peering-- Wait they went to the alley to go? →

name: MATT
line: While he was distracting them, you saw the guard leave with Fjord. →

name: SAM
line: We'll go with, right? →

name: LIAM
line: No, we can stay in the open. I send Frumpkin up into the air over the party, 100 feet in the air. →

name: SAM
line: We're just going out in the open to the water. →

name: TALIESIN
line: We can also follow the bird. →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, I was going to say, why don't you guys lead the way, and you guys give us a signal if you guys see a guard. →

name: MATT
line: You aren't there. You haven't caught up with them yet, they're still out in the open. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I miss the earrings. →

name: LIAM
line: So I take your hand, and I'm watching them from above. →

name: SAM
line: I'm guiding him along. →

name: MATT
line: So the two of you make your way towards the docks slowly. →

name: LIAM
line: I'm totally acting like I see everything. →

name: MATT
line: Right. I see everything. →

name: LAURA
line: I have my hood up. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Yeah, no, I'm over cloak. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Weekend at Bernie's walking. Looking around at nothing. →

name: MATT
line: You guide for two and a half blocks and the guard's still like, "Where is it?" →

name: TRAVIS
line: I look over my shoulder and keep running, and then go: Oh, what do you want? Who are you? Why are you following me? →

name: MATT
line: "You called me-- You said there was one of them--" →

name: TRAVIS
line: Have I done something again? Have you seen my son? What's your name? You're a strong looking-- →

name: MATT
line: He sheathes the blade. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Oh dear. Do you have any coin? →

name: LIAM
line: It's badass. →

name: MATT
line: He walks up and slaps you across the top of the head, and just goes, "Don't go wasting our time." →

name: TRAVIS
line: I'm sorry. No respect for the elderly, apparently. I walk away. →

name: MATT
line: He spits on the ground towards you and turns around and heads back to his post. →

name: TRAVIS
line: (grunting) I make my way towards the docks. →

name: MATT
line: You all manage to slowly make your way to the outskirts of the Ustaloch, down to where the majority of the docks are set up on the lake itself. Since the lights have gone out, most of the boats have now come back in, and they are bringing in their hauls out, and have small nets and baskets filled with fish they've caught while they're out there, small crustaceans, most of them are in the process of just offloading and locking up and tying their boats. What are you guys doing? →

name: LIAM
line: I think perhaps the best thing to do is to rent a boat, not steal a boat. →

name: LAURA
line: You should talk to people. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I think we may be able to avoid any kind of trading of currency. →

name: LIAM
line: What's your idea? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Let me see if I can find a boat that would accommodate all of us and see if we can find some amicable people. →

name: LIAM
line: All right. →

name: TRAVIS
line: As a sailor, apparently I'm able to acquire free passage on ships. →

name: MATT
line: You are, actually. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I have to talk the talk and maybe trade something, but-- →

name: MATT
line: One of the larger fishing vessels that can carry a group of your size, as well as a couple of others, has already been pulled in and most everyone has been loaded off. →

name: MATT
line: You can see there's one gentleman in his mid-forties, a little bit of a five o'clock shadow on his chin, a small scar across the bottom of it. →

name: MATT
line: He has a heavy knitted cap that's folded back onto the top of his shoulders and a long coat, and as he's standing there, he looks over at you and watches you approach, taking the rope and tying it around the edge. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Hello there. I was hoping that perhaps I could trouble you. We're trying to make our way out into the lake, some of my companions and I, for a small day trip. We've never quite been out on the lake, not this one. Is there a chance we could trade some work on your day's journey for some travel? →

name: MATT
line: "If you're looking for someone to take you around the lake, I could do that for a bit of coin, sure." →

name: TRAVIS
line: I'm sorry, we're a bit light on coin. Is there perhaps anything we could help you with around here in trade? →

name: MATT
line: He glances at your hands as you're talking, "You look like a hard-worker." →

name: TRAVIS
line: Indeed. Many years of my life. →

name: MATT
line: "Where are you from?" →

name: TRAVIS
line: Port Damali. →

name: MATT
line: "I see you've been a shiphand before. I can see the cracks in the fingers." →

name: TRAVIS
line: They never go away. →

name: MATT
line: He looks at his own hand. "So you're just looking for a joyride?" →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yes, it would help me look a bit more impressive in the eyes of my younger comrades. →

name: MATT
line: "I'll tell you what. I'll take you around. →

name: LAURA

name: MATT
line: As you return with the bottle, you all get onto the boat. The older gentleman, as you all get on, introduces himself: "I'm Noah, this is my vessel. I'll take you where you need to go. Now, if I can ask where you're headed. Want to do a pass on the lake and back, or..." →

name: SAM
line: Caleb, where are we headed? →

name: LAURA

name: LIAM

name: MATT

name: TRAVIS

name: LIAM

name: MATT
line: He goes and gets his paddle out and begins making his way-- "Well there's only two islands out there. One's a piece of shite and the other's Crookedstone." →

name: MATT
line: Okay. For future note, if everyone's going to make a perception check I may have a few folks, you know, to helm it, and other people aiding their roll with advantage. Just so we don't end up having a barrage of perception like, "They failed? I do it. They failed? I do it." Because that gets a little lame. All right, as you guys keep watch over the edge of the water, heading in as the sky darkens, heading towards Crookedstone, the island in the center of the Ustaloch. Prepare yourselves for whatever you'll find there and we're going to go to break! →

name: MATT
line: It's time. We're going to go ahead and take a quick ten minute break, roughly. We have ten minutes so we get a little bathroom break. We'll be back here shortly. Make sure to stick around for a video at the break in which we have our Wyrmwood contest to win some awesome Wyrmwood stuff, so keep an eye. We'll be back here in a little bit. See you soon. →

name: MATT
line: The sun has set as you guys approach the outer banks of the Crookedstone Island in the center of the Ustaloch. You can see the grove, a clustered central conglomerate of trees that all create this mound of brush. Now that you're up close against it, you can see the bit of moonlight that's starting to come over the horizon dancing across the upper part of the canopy. The trees, at most, are about 15 to ten feet tall. They're not incredibly huge, some even hovering around the five to ten foot range on the outskirts. →

name: MATT
line: As you approach the bank, you can see already there's a lot of heavy rocks. This is not a soft, muddy embankment like the outskirts of the lake. This has a lot of jagged rock, and your ship-finding friend is carefully making his way through as close as he can before he comes to a stop, pushes off with an oar, and says, "All right, I think this is as close as I can get. What are you doing here, if I might ask?" →

If there's some illegal business here and I see something shifty, I'm back on the shore and you have to swim your way home." →

The faint bit of moonlight gives you the general structure of the island, but beyond that, even looking close, you have a hard time making out details. →

name: MATT
line: As you guys slowly become a cohesive unit, a true adventuring party, you begin to carefully make your way through. Thankfully, most of the small tree cluster, this small glade, the floor of it is soft, and as you step, there's no heavy snapping of twigs or crumbling of leaves. →

name: MATT
line: Something does catch the edge of your foot on the outskirts, Fjord, as you glance down. You see what looks to be two crustacean shells: small crabs that have been fished out of the nearby lake, and have been completely eaten. The inside has been cleared out. →

line: You don't see any more crab shells, but you do glance a bit ahead, and amongst the trees, you can see stonework. Stones stacked in a wall that is toppled over and fallen. A small ruin. Some sort of a structure, once a single-story structure that seems to have fallen inward and been destroyed. Partially overgrown, and what little moonlight comes through, you can make out the shape of it. There's corners still standing, but other than that, it looks like it's been toppled over and left to ruin. →

She, scared, sees you, and begins to walk back this way and hide behind the wall, but continues to sing, giving this aura in the vicinity. That ends Toya's turn. Beau, you're up, as well as Jester. →

Like it was freshly pulled out of the ocean. The shadows that had been drawn from the nearby bits of stonework begin to tear into the body of the devil toad who looks around at the ground as there's now this squirrely swirling bit of black energy that's wrapping around and causing it to look about confused at its torso. That's your bonus action. →

line: Damn, there's not a lot I can do. I guess I'll run up. Just there. Can I pick up a rock and throw a rock and be like: Get! Get on! →

name: MATT
line: Sure, we'll call it an improvised weapon. →

name: MARISHA
line: Get! →

name: MATT
line: You're not proficient. So go ahead and roll a straight attack roll. →

name: LIAM
line: In the dark. →

name: MATT
line: Yes, with disadvantage. →

name: MARISHA
line: Four. 14. I guess that's a four. So ten. →

name: MATT
line: You hear it clatter against a tree in the distance. →

name: MARISHA
line: Yah! Yah! →

name: TRAVIS
line: Damn trash pandas, get out of here! →

name: MATT
line: Caleb, make another death saving throw, please. →

name: TALIESIN
line: How are you doing, man? →

name: LIAM
line: That's a success. →

name: MATT
line: Two successes. All righty. Nott. →

name: SAM
line: Okay, with one hand I will try to cover the bleeding wounds of Caleb, and with the other hand, not even looking, I'll just fire my crossbow at the other-- (laughter) →

name: SAM
line: At the other imp-y thing. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. Go for it. →

name: SAM
line: One. →

name: MATT
line: That's what happens when you don't look! →

name: SAM
line: I should've looked! →

name: MATT
line: All right. Roll one more attack roll for me, please. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh no. →

name: SAM
line: That's a six. →

name: MATT
line: Six? You hear a (metallic sound) across your shield as a bolt from a hand crossbow almost hits you, Jester. →

name: SAM
line: I'm blinded by tears! (laughter) →

name: TALIESIN
line: This is-- oh man, one imp is going to kill us all. One fucking imp. →

name: MATT
line: All right. Nott, does that end your turn? →

name: SAM
line: I mean, I can't do anything. I can run over to the other thing, but I can't do anything, so-- →

name: TALIESIN
line: We have to stabilise Fjord, is what we've got to do. →

name: SAM
line: And my boy-- →

name: TALIESIN
line: Caleb? Caleb's doing okay. →

name: LIAM
line: I have two successes. Not that you know that. →

name: SAM
line: I don't know that, but... I'm just staying. →

name: MATT
line: Fjord, I need you to make a death saving throw. It's been a long time since you've had to make one of these in the game. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Three. →

name: MATT
line: That's a fail. All righty. →

name: MARISHA
line: Is that your first fail? →

name: MATT
line: Top of the round. The imp-- I'm going to make a perception check for that imp. That's not good enough. The imp is going to go ahead and fly over and attempt to take a swing at your duplicity illusion. →

name: MARISHA
line: That's good. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. Does anything happen when the illusion is hit? →

name: LAURA
line: It doesn't say! It just says for the duration you can cast spells as though you were in the illusion's space. →

name: MATT
line: Let me check just in case. →

name: LAURA
line: I have advantage on attack rolls against the creature if we're both within five feet of each other. →

name: MATT
line: Okay, yes. So just an illusion. So it strikes and its stinger passes through with no effect and it seems confused and figures it out. →

name: MATT
line: So now it knows that it's an illusion, but it wasted its attack that round. Illusions come in handy for that. All right, that ends their turn. →

name: MATT
line: Molly, you're up. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm running right at it. →

name: MATT
line: All righty. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Let's try some different dice here. →

name: TALIESIN
line: For fuck's sake! I've got to stop rolling that die. This is-- yeah, no. →

name: LAURA
line: Both of them fucked you again. →

name: MATT
line: 11 does not hit. It's too quick. You swing twice more and it's doing figure-eights around your blades. It's frustrating the shit out of you. →

name: LAURA
line: Poor Molly. His arms are getting so tired swinging both those blades. →

name: TALIESIN
line: This is so embarrassing. →

name: LIAM
line: The dice don't give a shit-- →

name: MATT
line: All right. Toya-- →

name: TALIESIN
line: This is so embarrassing. →

name: MATT
line: --succeeds on her third death saving throw and stabilizes. No, she's stabilised. A natural 20 is what we'd need to see for the one. All right, so that brings us to Beau and Jester. →

name: LAURA
line: Do you want to attack the imp? →

name: MARISHA
line: I'll-- yeah. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Do you get advantage because I'm engaged with it? →

name: MATT
line: No. It doesn't work that way. →

name: MARISHA
line: I'm not a rogue. →

name: MATT
line: That's right. →

name: MARISHA
line: So seeing everyone dodge this thing, I'm just like-- →

name: MATT
line: I mean, if you're flanking it, I'll allow advantage on the attack. Which is like, as long as you're on the complete opposite side of the foe-- →

name: TRAVIS
line: There is a convention around the imp right now. →

name: MATT
line: So you can-- I'll say you can get advantage. →

name: LIAM
line: Everyone's like, "Hey, hey, hey!" →

name: MATT
line: Essentially, yeah. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Ugh, look at it scoot! God! →

name: MATT
line: So yeah, you can if you want to. →

name: MARISHA
line: So I'm just going to run up and be like, stupid! I'm going to try and stomp it. →

name: MATT
line: So you're going to try and knock it to the ground and stomp on it, is that what you're doing? Because it's flying in the air. All right, first strike. So attack with advantage. →

name: LIAM
line: It's like that video from Ireland. Catch it, daddy! →

name: MARISHA
line: With advantage, right? That hits. 15, natural. With my two-handed staff? →

name: MATT
line: Yep. →

name: MARISHA
line: Wait. I've already hit. Forget that. →

name: MARISHA
line: Forget that! Eight, so 12 damage. →

name: MATT
line: All right, so the first attack crushes the imp and it hits the ground, the wings go limp and it's dead, but you still (yells) and stomp down, just crushing it more and more. And then its body eventually just burns away into ash. So all the threats have been neutralised and you now have two friends that are bleeding out. →

name: LAURA
line: Okay, then I'm going to run over to Fjord and cast Cure Wounds on him so he wakes up. →

name: MATT
line: You come back to consciousness. →

name: LAURA
line: With five hit points. →

name: SAM
line: I will try to stabilise Caleb using no-- →

name: MATT
line: Caleb, I need you to make a death save. →

name: LIAM
line: Death save? Fail. →

name: MATT
line: All righty. Make a medicine check. →

name: SAM
line: Natural 20. And I will do mouth-to-mouth. →

name: MATT
line: I will say for the purposes of this, you watch as Nott pulls the porcelain mask back and just gives Caleb the most terrifying mouth-to-mouth you've ever seen. Caleb, the darkness fades and you come to consciousness. The first things you notice are the cold temperature, the taste of iron in your mouth, and the vision of Nott pulling away from you like a terrifying Nosferatu. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Oh Jesus! Like Willem Dafoe as-- →

name: LIAM
line: Caleb goes (yelps), and I cast Dancing Lights into the goblin and light her up! Ah! →

name: TRAVIS
line: Even worse. →

name: MATT
line: (laughs) Temporarily blinded. →

name: LIAM
line: What the hell happened? →

name: MARISHA
line: It's like 2am and the lights come on at the club. →

name: SAM
line: Ugh, that's what she looked like? (laughter) →

name: LAURA
line: Oh man, I start dancing around in a circle with my illusion. We did it, guys! →

name: MATT
line: You watch as two Jesters start doing a little skip. →

name: MARISHA
line: I immediately run to Toya. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I was about to say, I'm going to run to Toya and pick her up. I've got her. I've got her. →

name: MARISHA
line: Do you-- I've got her. I could hold her, though. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I've got her. →

name: MARISHA
line: Why-- →

name: TALIESIN
line: Because you were the last face she saw? I should probably be the first. Thank you. You did the right thing. You don't need to be the first thing she sees. She'll just start screaming all over again. Thank you. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Anything of the toad? →

name: TALIESIN
line: We're going to need him. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh yeah. I want to go over and start searching his body. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I thought it burned away, no? →

name: MATT
line: A large part of the torso just burned away. →

name: MATT
line: The inside is partially burned out to embers in the blast, but there's still probably 60 percent of the body remaining. →

name: LIAM
line: DM, am I at one hit point at this moment? It was zero. →

name: MATT
line: You would be at one hit point when you come to consciousness. I'm giving you that because of the natural 20. Any other roll, you would just be stabilised. →

name: LIAM
line: True love's kiss. →

name: MATT
line: Exactly. (laughs) →

name: LAURA
line: Investigation or perception? →

name: MATT
line: This is investigation, because you're poring through the-- →

name: MATT
line: 14. You find a small pouch of flesh, like a little hiding pouch that you kind of reach in a little bit and it has kind of a mucus-y liquid on the inside. As you reach in, your fingers find what appear to be a few small stones you can feel at the tip of your fingers. Do you pull them out? →

name: LAURA
line: Okay. →

name: MATT
line: You pull it out. It's a handful of jewels. →

name: MATT
line: Looks like rings, necklaces. There's actually a few stolen pieces of jewelry that are in the pouch as well as a few coin. →

name: LAURA
line: What? This is awesome. Here, Fjord, I found a cloister of seamen for you. →

name: TRAVIS
line: What is it? What did you give me? What is this? →

name: LAURA
line: It's a bag of stuff that I think you will like. I already removed all the fancy stuff from it though. →

name: SAM
line: So it's just gooey flesh? →

name: TALIESIN
line: That's definitely a cloister. It's a nu-gget. →

name: TRAVIS
line: That's foul. →

name: MATT
line: But other than that, it is devoid of any other items or objects and it looks like that was its running fund. →

name: LAURA
line: Whoa! I put all of the jewels on my fingers. →

name: MATT
line: They're still slick but easy to put on because they're lubricated. →

name: LAURA
line: Nott, look at me. →

name: SAM
line: Those are very nice. →

name: LAURA
line: Aren't these pretty rocks? →

name: SAM
line: They are very pretty, yes. Where did you find them? →

name: LAURA
line: On the bag. →

name: SAM
line: On the bag? Can I have one? →

name: LAURA
line: Yes, but first, can I use a ritual spell? Does that work against-- Yeah. I can do ritual spells? →

name: MATT
line: You can do ritual spells and it won't take a spell slot, just takes ten minutes more of casting time to do it. →

name: LAURA
line: Can I Detect Magic on it? →

name: MATT
line: You may. So you take a little bit of time concentrating on it. At the end of the spell, you send out your extended consciousness, but they do not resonate anything magical. →

name: LAURA
line: Hmm, they're just plain rings, but they're very pretty. →

name: MATT
line: They are pretty. →

name: MARISHA
line: What are you going to do with the girl? →

name: TALIESIN
line: (sighs) Get her back home. →

name: MARISHA
line: Where's home for a traveling circus? →

name: SAM
line: What if she's evil? →

name: TALIESIN
line: I know. We're going to have a talk. →

name: LAURA
line: We should bring her to the-- →

name: SAM
line: Authorities. →

name: LAURA
line: So that she can defend us. So that she can tell everyone that the fiend was bad. →

name: MARISHA
line: I don't know if she feels that way. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I don't know if she feels that way either, but although-- it's going to take some time, I think. And also, we're going to need the body, and honestly, only one of us was here. For those at home, I'm pointing at Caleb. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Well, why was he the only one? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Because the rest of us are under arrest. →

name: TRAVIS
line: That's very true. →

name: TALIESIN
line: So congratulations on single-handedly defeating the creature that killed several guards. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm sure you will be well-rewarded and compensated. →

name: LAURA
line: You are a very powerful wizard. →

name: LIAM
line: Yeah, you know, ain't nothing. (coughs) (high-pitched) Oh! →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah, that's how I feel. →

name: LAURA
line: Can I use my healing kit and help heal him? Does that work, or does it just bring somebody back to consciousness? →

name: MATT
line: It just helps stabilise. There's a feat you can take that makes it do more. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh really? Okay, cool. →

name: LIAM
line: Do you have any anything left in you? →

name: LAURA
line: I got nothing. →

name: LIAM
line: Well, okay. →

name: LAURA
line: I can heal you in the morning. →

name: LIAM
line: Or we could just sit here for a bit and I could catch my breath, I think. →

name: LAURA
line: We can rest for 30 minutes or an hour or so. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Let's take a rest. →

name: MATT
line: All right. As you guys sit here in the quiet, you can hear the crickets now; the rest of the sound of the forest has fallen away and the din of the battle has vanished. The moonlight gets a bit brighter as the moon climbs higher in the sky. And you all kind of look around at each other. Through this haphazard series of events you've come to assemble a skillset that seems to overlap pretty well. And hopefully it's enough to clear your name. But we'll find that out next week. So we're going to end the episode. We'll be back to continue that thread next Thursday. →

name: MARISHA
line: But I want to, like, keep going. →

name: MATT
line: I know, but it's 10:45! →

name: LAURA
line: I would just like to say that as we're resting there, I'm closing my eyes and keeping a hand down close to Nott with my rings on my fingers. →

name: SAM
line: I'm going to try to take one off. →

name: MATT
line: Sleight of hand. →

name: SAM
line: Eight-- 26. →

name: MATT
line: I don't even think you have high enough perception at all. You have a very nice-- →

name: LAURA
line: It was all the mucus on the ring. →

name: MATT
line: Yep. →

name: SAM
line: I'm just going to say, I did it. →

name: SAM
line: (laughter) →

name: LAURA
line: I'm so proud of you. →

name: MATT
line: Aw. And we'll leave it at that. All right, thank you guys so much for watching. I'm excited to continue this next week. →

name: LIAM
line: Man, I got the full wizard experience tonight. →

name: MATT
line: Yeah, you did! (laughter) →

name: MATT
line: Oh man. Well done, that's your first boss fight of the campaign! →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh my god! →

name: TALIESIN
line: That was so unpleasant. →

name: LAURA
line: Good job, Fjord! →

name: MATT
line: Two of you went down. →

name: MARISHA
line: Does this mean we level up? →

name: MATT
line: Well, because we are doing milestone leveling with this campaign-- →

name: SAM
line: What does that mean? →

name: MATT
line: That means there's no experience points, but at the end of each major story beat, like a big moment that I see fit, then everyone will level up together. →

name: MARISHA
line: So do you see fit? →

name: MATT
line: I will see fit when this arc concludes, so end of next episode, probably, everyone's going to hit level three. So start thinking about-- for those of you who have to choose a path, think about what you want to do if you haven't already. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I think I'm going to multiclass. →

name: LIAM
line: Seven times. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Master of none. →

name: MATT
line: Not even passable. (laughs) All right, thank you guys so much for watching. Thank you again, D&D Beyond, for being our awesome partner and sponsor for the leg of this campaign. Hope you all have a wonderful weekend, and is it Thursday yet? Have a good night. →

name: TRAVIS
line: We lived! →

name: MARISHA
line: We lived! Episode three! [music] →

name: MATT
line: Hello, everyone, and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons & Dragons. →

name: MATT
line: (cheering) →

name: MATT
line: Welcome. Thank you for joining us. Before we jump in to tonight's episode, we're going to go ahead and do some quick announcements. First and foremost, our returning sponsor and long-time partner for this campaign's beginning, on into the foreseeable future, hopefully: D&D Beyond. They've been awesome. Sam, do you have a few words you want to say? →

name: SAM
line: Guys, hi! Sam Riegel, here. It's award season, so tonight I'm going to announce the D&D Beyond Awards. The envelope, please! →

name: TRAVIS
line: Paper cut. →

name: SAM
line: Okay, nervous, really nervous. There's nothing in here. Best discount codes for books in the D&D Beyond store? The winner is: beginnings. →

name: SAM
line: "Beginnings" is the discount code! Best URL on the entire internet? The winner is: DNDBeyond.com! Best picture-- →

name: LAURA
line: This is so stupid. →

name: SAM
line: La La Land. It's Moonlight. →

name: SAM
line: (cheering) →

name: MARISHA
line: Old jokes. →

name: SAM
line: Best way to build a Blood Hunter? Activate Critical Role content on DNDBeyond.com! Best supporting actor? Sam Riegel. Best job opening at a D&D-related internet company? Front-End Developer. I guess they're looking for a front-end developer. Someone will put a URL somewhere on here. →

name: MATT
line: At careers.com is where you can go to the Careers tab. →

name: SAM
line: Thank you, D&D Beyond, for being our official-- What are they calling it? →

name: LAURA
line: Sponsor? →

name: SAM
line: No, not sponsor. They're the official tool set of Critical Role. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh, that's cool. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Well done! Is that the first annual-- →

name: SAM
line: The first annual awards show. What should we call them? Not the Oscars. The Critters. No. The Sponsees. →

name: LAURA
line: Ooh, The Sponsees. That's fancy. →

name: LIAM
line: That was strangely manic and desperate. →

name: MARISHA
line: Isn't every awards show, though? →

name: LIAM
line: Did you literally write that in the bathroom six minutes ago? →

name: SAM
line: For sure. →

name: MATT
line: I feel like Kendrick Lamar should've won at least two of those, but... →

name: MATT
line: Thank you, Sam. Thank you, D&D Beyond. You can find them on DNDbeyond.com. That's DNDbeyond.com. Next up, based on tonight's episode, we'll have next Tuesday, at 7:00PM Pacific Time, here on Twitch and Alpha, Talks Machina, where members of the cast will come, with our fantastic Brian W. Foster, to discuss what transpires tonight. You get to ask questions and submit them, so do so. Asinine Wisdom, next week on Geek & Sundry Twitch, has a special guest. I believe our very own Sam Riegel will be there. →

name: SAM
line: Oh, god. →

name: LAURA
line: You're actually doing something else on the internet? →

name: SAM
line: I always do shows on Geek & Sundry, and this is no change. What's the show called again? →

name: MATT
line: Asinine Wisdom. It's at 9:00PM on Tuesday, Pacific Time, after Talks Machina. A double-dose of Sam Riegel, which is a lot. We have a new show coming up here, featuring the Weave RPG, from The Monocle Society, called Weave. That'll be showing next Wednesday night at 9:30 Pacific Standard Time, here on the Twitch Channel. Check it out then. It has a great cast of Amy Dallen, Gina DeVivo, Whitney Moore, Becca Scott, and Stef Woodward, so check it out! I hope you like it. →

name: MATT
line: Weave is really awesome. I'm really excited to see that. The podcast of episode three last week released today, so if you missed the last episode, or have friends who have been trying to keep up with the podcast, last week's episode is available for download. Once again, we have issue number four of Critical Role: Vox Machina Origins. It's available for download digitally, on Comixology, the Dark Horse app, and all other places where fine digital comic books are sold. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Go get it, rate it, love it. Show us that you're reading it. →

name: LIAM
line: Burn it. Not the book, Laura's die. →

name: SAM
line: I've got to help her choose her dice. →

name: MATT
line: No! Why would you do that? You know better! →

name: SAM
line: I've already cursed two of them. →

name: LAURA
line: They're out. All the ones that got selected tonight are shades of pinks, purples and blues and I think it's lovely. →

name: MATT
line: It's like watching a video of guys putting their hands in alligator mouths. Like, why would you do that? It's entertaining for us, but why would you do that? Once again, our fantastic charity, 826LA. If you get the opportunity to either give and help out or donate your time to help teach any of their fantastic classes to help children learn creative writing in environments where it's hard to find that type of tutelage. →

name: MATT
line: It's a great program. Check it out at your local 826 chapter and see if you can help out. →

name: MARISHA
line: Tell them you want to run a D&D game for them. →

name: MATT
line: I think that's it. →

name: LAURA
line: That was so fast, though! →

name: MATT
line: I know. →

name: SAM
line: The comic book is out. →

name: LAURA
line: What about our appearances coming up? →

name: LIAM
line: I'm going to be at BAK-Anime this weekend. →

name: LIAM
line: Two days only in Bakersfield, California. I will talk and I will go out in public. →

name: LAURA
line: Me and Travis-- →

name: TRAVIS
line: Travis and I-- →

name: LAURA
line: Travis and I are going to be at Emerald City Comic Con the first weekend in March. →

name: MATT
line: I'll be at Lexington Comic and Toy Con in Lexington, Kentucky. That's March 9th to the 11th. →

name: MATT
line: I'll be at Otafest in Calgary, up north, May 18th to the 20th. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Keep it within a few months, for the love of-- →

name: MATT
line: And A-Kon in Texas, June 7th to the 10th. If you are anywhere near those regions. I've said before, I'm going to take this off the sheet for the future. We've said that a lot now. Hey, it's not my job to update that sheet. Anyway guys, I'll remember this. →

name: MARISHA
line: You should go check out Good Fortnight Kevin on Alpha because it's a morning show and it's funny. It's dumb and it's super meta. →

name: MATT
line: Super meta funny dumb show. All right. It appears that the dice have been culled. →

name: LAURA
line: We're on the last one, so we're solid. →

name: MATT
line: Then let's go ahead and dive into tonight's episode of Critical Role. →

name: MATT
line: [click, TV static] [groovy Critical Role theme] →

name: MATT
line: Welcome back. Last we left off, our group of adventurers had found their various individual fates come together here in the city of Trostenwald, where they had attended a carnival that had blown into town, had watched a horrible occurrence happen where one of the older attendees transformed into this terrifying zombie creature. →

name: MATT
line: Upon defeating it, you were all put under investigation as possible culprits for the reason that it occurred. In trying to wander the city to investigate and try and clear your name, you eventually found that there was a fiend hiding amongst these carnival workers. This large devil-like toad creature, which through some research you had found to actually be called a nergaliid, had killed two more of the guards, leaving you to fend with their transformed forms, and then fled deep into the center of the Ustaloch Lake. →

name: MATT
line: (clattering off-camera) →

name: MATT
line: Thank you for the punctuation. Upon gathering your supplies after a night's rest, you managed to, through the trade of a bottle of wine, get passage across the lake onto the central island, which at one time housed the abode of a witch that had long collapsed. Waiting for nightfall, you approached the center of the grove that existed there on the island and found near this ruin this same fiendish nergaliid, as well as Toya, the 12-year-old dwarf girl who had been affixed to him for the performances in the carnival. You did battle with this large fiendish entity who summoned a cluster of imps and managed to knock a few of you pretty heavily to the ground before you finished it off. →

name: MATT
line: We left off as you all were finishing licking your wounds, catching your breath, and now as the moonlit night gets its darkest in the sky, you figure out what the next step is in gathering means of absolving yourselves of suspicion. As you've all now taken a moment to yourselves, you can hear the sound of the nearby crickets getting more and more deafening as the silence crawls over the center of the lake. Toya, the young girl, still lies unconscious. The remains of the devil toad, still partially burnt from the final blow delivered by Fjord, are mostly intact above its shoulders, head, and its legs. What would you like to do? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Ow. We're all fucked up. →

name: LAURA
line: Does anybody need any healing? →

name: SAM
line: Oh, are you alive right now? →

name: TRAVIS
line: We're up. Just barely. →

name: LAURA
line: You need some? →

name: LIAM
line: I'm really shabby at the moment. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh, that's too bad because I don't have any spells left. →

name: LIAM
line: That's good. Let's go back and talk to the cops. →

name: LAURA
line: Should we do something with this body? →

name: TALIESIN
line: I think we need to bring it. I think we're going to need a trophy. →

name: LIAM
line: What about just its head? →

name: TALIESIN
line: That'll do. →

name: TRAVIS
line: It's a big head. It might be all we can take. →

name: LAURA
line: I don't know if it'll fit on the boat. →

name: LAURA
line: Would it fit on the boat that we came out on? →

name: MATT
line: How much of the body? →

name: LAURA
line: The whole body. →

name: MATT
line: The whole body with all of you could probably fit. It doesn't have the usual-- you could probably fit it. →

name: SAM
line: How about just the head? →

name: MATT
line: The head it would probably do, but the full body, I'd have to make a few rolls. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm going to give the body a quick search to see if there's anything. →

name: MATT
line: You already did. →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah, I got a bunch of rings. See? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Do I recognize any of these rings? →

name: MATT
line: No, you do not. →

name: TALIESIN
line: All right. That's disturbing. →

name: SAM
line: I got one, too. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Has the head been damaged at all, or is it mostly intact? →

name: MATT
line: It's mostly intact. There are a few gashes on it from the general fray, but for the most part it's still a solid head. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Molly, you've got them impressive swords. →

name: TRAVIS
line: You want to do some hacking? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Suppose I should. →

name: MARISHA
line: I'd say you have a pretty impressive sword, too. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm going to try and carve off the head. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. It's a tough form. Not only is the exterior of its flesh blubbery and a heavy rubber-like substance that is glistening with whatever mucus-like liquid it naturally produces, but then beneath it, the muscle sinew is extremely tough. It takes you the better part of 20 minutes to finally get the head entirely off the rest of the torso. It weighs enough to the point where you're going to need one or two other hands to get it anywhere. →

name: TRAVIS
line: That's an artiste at work right there. →

name: TALIESIN
line: This is as far as I go one this one. →

name: TALIESIN
line: That's way too heavy for me. →

name: LIAM
line: It's all you, blue. →

name: MARISHA
line: I'll help you out. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm going to grab Toya. →

name: LAURA
line: (groaning) →

name: LAURA
line: Is Toya waking up at all? →

name: MATT
line: Toya is passed out. You'd have to try and rouse her. →

name: LAURA
line: It's probably best not to wake her up while we're carrying this head around. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I think that's a very good idea. →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, this is frightening. →

name: LIAM
line: The imps burned away? →

name: MATT
line: Yes, they turned to ash. →

name: LAURA
line: Does he have hair? What are we carrying him by? →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, what are we carrying him by? →

name: MATT
line: Along the brow line there are these small holes that could be breathing holes. You'd have to carry it from there, under the socket, or under the jaw. →

name: LIAM
line: Because that's what you want to stick your finger in. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah, totally. The mucus hole. →

name: MARISHA
line: I grab the jaw and I say: "Hey, Jester." →

name: TALIESIN
line: I did share meals with this person for two straight years. Never mind. I'm walking away. →

name: TRAVIS
line: We are fucking with his old co-worker. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm already walking away. I took the kid and am walking to the boat. →

name: LAURA
line: Sorry! →

name: LIAM
line: Caleb just retched into the grass from watching that. →

name: LAURA
line: All right, let's carry him. →

name: TALIESIN
line: You're the worst. You're all the worst. →

name: LAURA
line: Fjord, I gave you the bag of skin. Don't forget you have that. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I have it? →

name: LAURA
line: You have the bag of slimy skin. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I'm going to salt it and hang it out to dry. →

name: LIAM
line: If it will help tomorrow or today-- what time is it? It's the middle of the night, isn't it? →

name: MATT
line: You approached just after dusk, so between the slow moving in there, the combat, and the rest afterward it's probably close to 10:00PM. →

name: LIAM
line: I know exactly what time it is, don't I? Yeah. →

name: TRAVIS
line: You know exactly what time it is? →

name: LIAM
line: It's something I've always been able to-- why is everybody looking at me like-- (vomiting sound) →

name: LAURA
line: Where's Frumpkin? →

name: LIAM
line: (fwoosh) →

name: LAURA
line: Oh, good. →

name: MATT
line: At this point, Molly, as you're ahead of the group and you're making your way through the trees, Toya begins to stir in your grasp. Her eyes open a bit as you're holding her and she looks up at you, confused, eyes lolling around in the sockets for a moment before they see you and clarify. "Molly?" →

name: TALIESIN
line: I know, dear. You've been through a bit. →

name: TALIESIN
line: There's been some bad business. →

name: MATT
line: "What happened?" →

name: TALIESIN
line: (sighs) A friend turned on us, but it's going to be all right. I'm going to get you home, all right? →

name: MATT
line: "Wait, where's Kylre?" She starts trying to fight your grasp. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'll explain it later. →

name: MATT
line: She's going to try and break free of your grasp. Are you going to attempt to hold onto her? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Oh, yeah. →

name: LIAM
line: How far away are they from the rest of us? →

name: MATT
line: While you guys have been doing all this, he's gone on ahead. He's probably a good 40 to 50 feet ahead. Go ahead and roll an athletics check. →

name: TALIESIN
line: You're a monster. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh, no! →

name: TRAVIS
line: Tell me you did it. →

name: TALIESIN
line: No, it's not that bad. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh, it looked like a one from this angle. →

name: LAURA
line: Still pretty terrible. →

name: TRAVIS
line: (chanting) Level two. →

name: LAURA
line: You were rolling bad on this the last game. →

name: LAURA
line: You need to stop rolling that one. →

name: MATT
line: Yeah, that dice needs to go away. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I've got some new stuff coming in. →

name: LAURA
line: All right. →

name: MARISHA
line: It's coming across the border. It's real good. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Coming in from the Feywild. →

name: MATT
line: You can choose athletics or acrobatics. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Oh. Can I reroll? →

name: MATT
line: No. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Then that's nine. →

name: MATT
line: That still beats her. She rolled a five. All right, wanted to double-check. She's scrambling and as you pull her back she tries to fight for a second and then goes limp in your grasp and goes, "I'm scared." →

name: TALIESIN
line: I know. It's going to be a bit rough, but it was for the best. I'm so sorry. Some people just turn, I'm so sorry. →

name: MATT
line: "What happened?" →

name: TALIESIN
line: He got sick. There was something inside him. There was something that made him do some bad things, but it had to be taken care of. You're going to be all right. →

name: MATT
line: She gets really quiet for a second. You get to the boat and the gentleman earlier that you had passed the wine off to is sitting there waiting. →

name: MATT
line: He has a small pouch that's opened with some dried meat that he's chewing on as he's waiting. As you guys walk up, he says: "Oh, I see you've finished." →

name: LAURA
line: (groaning) →

name: MATT
line: (shouting) "What in the hell is that?!" →

name: MARISHA
line: Move! →

name: LAURA
line: We told you we were having a party, man! →

name: LIAM
line: I was just about to suggest covering that up, but you know, all cards on the table. →

name: MATT
line: He grabs his bag of dried meat, pulls it up, and backs up. "I didn't know-- What is that? What did you do? What is that?" →

name: MARISHA
line: I said we were going to be doing some frog digging. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Biggest frog you've ever seen. →

name: MATT
line: There's a pause before this tiny screeching sound begins to emit from Toya. This high pitched and barely audible squeak as Toya begins to scream. →

name: LAURA
line: I take off my cloak and I cover the head with it. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I was trying to keep her away from that. →

name: MATT
line: It's hard to keep her away from that. →

name: TRAVIS
line: We literally cut the head off Barney and shoved it in her face. (singsong) I love you. →

name: TALIESIN
line: The Barney that been raising her, yes. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Really take that in. Off to a great start. →

name: MATT
line: After Jester throws her cloak over Toya-- →

name: LAURA
line: No, not Toya. Over the head. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm trying to keep her quiet. →

name: MATT
line: She's sobbing into your arms at this point. →

name: MATT
line: You feel her body shaking against your grasp. →

name: LAURA
line: I feel so bad. →

name: TALIESIN
line: You should. →

name: SAM
line: Poor girl. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm going to take her to the front of the boat and keep her far away from all that. →

name: LIAM
line: I pull Fjord away for a moment, about ten or 15 feet away. This man in the boat has seen all of you who are supposed to be under house arrest. We cannot have him talking to the authorities. →

name: SAM
line: Should we kill him? →

name: LIAM
line: Jeez! Come here. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I have a good feeling that this guy is a man of upstanding nature. I'm sure he'll keep it to himself. →

name: LIAM
line: Oh, that's very trusting. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah, of course. →

name: SAM
line: We gave him one bottle of wine. That's not very much. →

name: TRAVIS
line: We have another bottle. Don't we? →

name: MARISHA
line: Yes? →

name: LIAM
line: Oh, you're here too, now. Great, it's a party. →

name: MARISHA
line: We could also toss him a bit of gold if we think it would make him forget the night. →

name: TRAVIS
line: After all, we came to him, right? I would prefer not to use any violence. →

name: LIAM
line: I'm not suggesting that, but it's either violence or giving him a little something. →

name: MARISHA
line: What makes you think he's going to go talk to the authorities? →

name: LIAM
line: You want to leave it to chance? →

name: MARISHA
line: Who cares? →

name: SAM
line: This is a small town, Beau. Everyone talks to everyone. You taught us that. →

name: MARISHA
line: I did, but everyone also hated the circus. →

name: LIAM
line: Molly, do you want to join this conversation? →

name: TALIESIN
line: I've been listening. I pull out a gold coin. Give him this. →

name: LAURA
line: Maybe one more. Or two more. →

name: MARISHA
line: I pull two out as well. →

name: LAURA
line: I'll pull three out. →

name: MATT
line: He's recessed to the very back of his boat, wide-eyed as you approach. →

name: TRAVIS
line: You're right. Coin is a good idea. →

name: LAURA
line: Go charm him, Fjord. You're very charming. →

name: MARISHA
line: You've got fisherman vibes. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Oh, shit. Wait a minute. How long did that fight take? →

name: MATT
line: You've returned to your normal half-orc form. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Oh, cool. Okay. There was an old man who was with us before. →

name: TALIESIN
line: And now there's a little girl. It's all coming full circle. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Maybe we give him the extra bottle of wine and you go talk to him. →

name: LIAM
line: Walking up to the boat-- →

name: MARISHA
line: Here. (clink) →

name: LIAM
line: Collecting it as I go. The thing of it is, we've just done Trostenwald-- what was that? Never mind. --a great service. There was an unsavory element-- did you know the circus was in town? Doesn't matter. There was a bad fellow-- that's his head-- with them. It's no fault of theirs. You pick weird folk up on the road in the circus. Isn't that right, Mollymauk? →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'll let that go. →

name: MATT
line: He reaches over, grabs the oar from the side, and lifts the cloak off the face. →

name: LIAM
line: That's going to rile you up. That's a bad idea. →

name: MATT
line: "It doesn't look like a savory creature." →

name: LAURA
line: It wasn't. Trust us. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Took a lot out of us. →

name: LIAM
line: But the situation in town is a little political. We're going to take this thing out of here and I'm going to report it to the authorities. We don't really want to create a stir and frighten people here. I hope you will take-- →

name: LAURA
line: We like to be unsung heroes. You know, like superheroes with secret identities. →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, we're an underground anonymous activist group. →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah, that helps people. But if everyone knows who we are, it'll be much harder to fight all the crime. →

name: LIAM
line: Try to focus on the gold. →

name: MATT
line: He slowly reaches out and takes it from your hand. "All right. I trust it was a bad thing. So I'm going to take you back, and then you promise I'll never see you again?" →

name: LAURA
line: We'll try really hard to not let you see us. →

name: TALIESIN
line: If you see us, we won't make eye contact. →

name: LAURA
line: We'll pretend we don't know you. →

name: MATT
line: "That includes the goblin." →

name: SAM
line: I was never here. We never had this conversation. →

name: LAURA
line: She's a halfling. →

name: MATT
line: He glances over and takes a closer look. →

name: SAM
line: I'm very ugly for a halfling. →

name: MATT
line: "Let's just get back to shore." He grabs the oar, takes the bottle of wine that he had mostly drunk by himself before, and polishes it off in one series of gulps. →

name: LAURA
line: Don't boat drunk. →

name: MATT
line: As you all gather up onto the ship, he begins to paddle you back towards the western shore of the Ustaloch to the outskirts of Trostenwald. →

name: MARISHA
line: When we get to the shore, we should probably split up. →

name: LAURA
line: How are we going to get this giant head to the authorities? →

name: MARISHA
line: That's a good question. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh, I got an idea! Why don't you go get a wagon as soon as we get to shore, and we'll help you load it onto the wagon, and then you just take it on in yourself. →

name: TALIESIN
line: It's a shame we didn't just get rid of a wagon not more than one night ago. →

name: SAM
line: Why do we need to take it with us? Us traipsing through town with a giant head seems like it would draw focus. Why don't we just put it somewhere and send the authorities out here to find it later? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Someone else may get to it, or something might happen. →

name: SAM
line: What are they going to do with it? It's a big head! →

name: MARISHA
line: We could leave someone with it, and we can just-- →

name: TRAVIS
line: I could stand guard as a crownsguard next to it. →

name: TALIESIN
line: What could people do with the head of a creature like this? →

name: MATT
line: What could people do with the head of a creature like this? Who knows. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Would I know? →

name: LAURA
line: They could make a lot of soup. →

name: MATT
line: They could turn it in for-- there's a lot of poor folk here. If they had a large looking odd creature, that's worth some gold. →

name: SAM
line: We can hide it. Maybe some of us have skills to hide things. →

name: LIAM
line: I think Fjord had a good idea, which is if you can disguise yourself as a crownsguard again, you wait with it. You guys get back to the tavern, yeah? →

name: MARISHA
line: You can go and alert the authorities. →

name: LIAM
line: Now, here's the thing. I may be speaking out of turn-- I know I don't know you very well, but it feels like the thing that we all share in common here is that we don't wish to make-- maybe not you-- make a big splash here. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Agreed. The less attention, the better. →

name: LAURA
line: Well, you know, whatever. →

name: TRAVIS
line: The less attention, the better. →

name: TALIESIN
line: For the moment. →

name: LIAM
line: Okay, so maybe I'm 70 to 80 percent correct, but we're all in this together. →

name: MARISHA
line: And gold. I like getting paid. →

name: TALIESIN
line: We need to get this one back to the circus, too. You might be helpful for that. →

name: LIAM
line: I don't want to make a big thing. I'm going to go the authorities, to-- my keen mind tells me that woman's name was--? →

name: MATT
line: Oh, the-- sorry. →

name: LIAM
line: Yeah, the one who wanted to go eat. →

name: MATT
line: Yes, you're talking about-- →

name: TRAVIS
line: Norda? →

name: MATT
line: Yes, Lawmaster Norda. →

name: LIAM
line: Norda? I want to go to her and citizen's arrest kind of thing. Keep it quiet, don't need big accolades, will take gold, and then I'll bring that back and we can divvy that up. That's no problem. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I like it. As soon as other crownsguard arrive with Norda and the rest of whoever you bring to the scene, maybe I can go with you and help return Toya. →

name: LAURA
line: You disappear quickly, because if you get drawn into that investigation, it would be bad. →

name: LIAM
line: Right, and if nobody recognizes you-- Do you remember any of the guards that were in town that you could make yourself look like specifically? →

name: LAURA
line: Oh! →

name: MARISHA
line: What was that guy's name? →

name: LAURA
line: What were the two guards that keep coming to the tavern? →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh, wait! →

name: LAURA
line: We wrote their names down. →

name: MARISHA
line: Jonas and Lucas. →

name: LAURA
line: That's right! →

name: SAM
line: The Jonas Brothers. →

name: MATT
line: They're not related at all. →

name: LIAM
line: DM, question. The two zombified back at the circus tents, were they burnt to a crisp beyond recognition? →

name: MATT
line: One of them was, and they have been discovered. →

name: LIAM
line: Yeah, but was he recognizable? Did we leave him looking like that dude at the end of The Last Crusade after he drank from the wrong cup? →

name: MATT
line: With some time, he could be identified. →

name: LIAM
line: Okay. Well, the Jonas Brothers it is, friends. →

name: SAM
line: Just to game this out. You, Caleb, someone who is not suspected of a crime, is going to bring the severed head of a member of the circus to the police-- →

name: LAURA
line: No, he's going to go to the police and bring them to the head. →

name: SAM
line: Either way. You, Caleb, someone who is not suspected of a crime, is going to point the police to the severed head of a member of the circus with no evidence showing what that thing was or that it was evil, and that will somehow not implicate other people who were not with us at the time. How is this going to prove their innocence, just showing a head? →

name: LIAM
line: They already believe that the circus is terrible. I think they were just going to confirm their own suspicions. →

name: MARISHA
line: Also, Toya. If she would speak honestly, she would absolve all of us. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I think Beau makes a very good point. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Without Toya's testimony we're in trouble. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm hoping Toya will-- →

name: LIAM
line: Well, that's a sticky situation. Because what if she talks about my friends who were there with me? →

name: TALIESIN
line: She knows what to say when guards are asking questions. →

name: LIAM
line: It looks like she knows how to go off like a siren. →

name: TALIESIN
line: She's had a bad night. →

name: LIAM
line: I'm at one hit point, I understand. →

name: TALIESIN
line: We'll have a talk. We'll get her to some people who can calm her down and make sure she remembers how we take care of each other. →

name: MATT
line: "If there's something you want to ask me, I'm right here." You're all in this boat as it makes its way across the Ustaloch. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Sorry, dear. I was hoping that we didn't have to have this conversation in front of strangers. →

name: MATT
line: "Can someone please explain to me what's going on?" →

name: LIAM
line: Can you explain to us, maybe, your relationship with Kylre? If that was his name. →

name: MATT
line: "I mean, that's the name I've ever known." →

name: LIAM
line: Let's talk about the killing part, though. →

name: MATT
line: "I don't know anything about that. When we did the show the other night, the horrible man--" →

name: TALIESIN
line: It turns out that that was-- Kylre did that. →

name: MATT
line: "Why?" →

name: TALIESIN
line: I don't know why. Something snapped. →

name: TALIESIN
line: He's hurt and killed a lot of people. We think that maybe he's been making you sick too. →

name: LAURA
line: Have you ever heard him say nergaliid? →

name: MATT
line: "No. Where's Gustav?" →

name: TALIESIN
line: Gustav is having trouble with the authorities. We're going to need to all work together to save him. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Unfortunately, the authorities think that Gustav and the circus are responsible for what happened. Actually, it's just Kylre. He wasn't what you thought he was, I'm afraid. →

name: TALIESIN
line: The twins are being the twins, Ornna's being Ornna. But I think we can save everybody. We just need to take care of each other. →

name: MATT
line: "He was my friend, though." →

name: LIAM
line: Child, how did you grow so close to him? →

name: MATT
line: "Gustav put us together for our act and he protected me. I felt safe around him. He didn't let anybody get too close I didn't want to." →

name: LIAM
line: Did he communicate with you in some way? →

name: MATT
line: "He talked." →

name: LIAM
line: What did you talk about? →

name: MATT
line: "Well, we talked about everybody else in the family. We talked about how I missed not having a family. He didn't talk about himself much, but it was mainly just little games." →

name: LAURA
line: Did he teach you how to sing to affect people's minds? →

name: MATT
line: "No. That was how I got by before I met these guys." →

name: LIAM
line: I am sure this is painful for you. You are young. Sometimes people we feel we know can be someone else. Regrettably, this is one of those instances. He was a dangerous thing. It is very important that this is buried here. You want to travel on with the circus and with Mollymauk and your friends. That thing tried to kill us. It did kill things in Trostenwald. Who knows what it would have done to you, child? →

name: MATT
line: Make a persuasion check. →

name: LIAM
line: Oof. →

name: SAM
line: It's good. →

name: LIAM
line: No, it's not good. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I felt it. →

name: TRAVIS
line: It's Sam good. →

name: LIAM
line: It is only a six. Rolled very low. →

name: MATT
line: As you're talking to her, her eyes keep flickering off of your face and over towards Beau. →

name: MATT
line: You watch her curl back into herself and get quiet. →

name: TRAVIS
line: It might do for you to apologize. →

name: MARISHA
line: Sorry. →

name: LAURA
line: Sorry for what, Beau? →

name: MARISHA
line: Really, Jester? →

name: LAURA
line: Really. →

name: TALIESIN
line: No, I want to hear this too. →

name: MARISHA
line: Sorry for choking you with my stick. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Somehow that was better than what I was hoping for. →

name: LIAM
line: Rated T for Teen. →

name: SAM
line: And I'll never do it again? (laughter) →

name: MARISHA
line: And I'll never do it again. As long as you don't try that again, of course, I guess. →

name: LAURA
line: It was only because Kylre was trying to kill us and she was afraid that you were helping him. →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, I wasn't trying to hurt you. I was just trying to get you to stop singing. But it was so abrasive. →

name: TALIESIN
line: You know how people outside can be. The mean girl was just afraid of you and we're going to let her go on this one. →

name: MATT
line: "I'm tired." →

name: TALIESIN
line: Yeah, I know. Let's get you home, okay? →

name: MATT
line: She leans into you, Molly. After a few minutes, she falls asleep against you. →

name: LAURA
line: That went well, I think. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Choked you with my stick?! →

name: MARISHA
line: I did. →

name: LAURA
line: She apologized for exactly what she did. →

name: TALIESIN
line: That was certainly memorable. →

name: MATT
line: "All right, we're here." The boat hits the edge of the dock. He hops off and pulls the rope up. Slowly manages the boat over to the side of the dock, ties it up. →

name: LAURA
line: How many people are around the dock right now? →

name: MATT
line: There's no boats at the dock that are being manned currently. There are a few boats out on the water that you saw in the distance. There are some night fishermen. There's nobody immediately in the vicinity. →

name: TRAVIS
