line: Check them out at wyrmwoodgaming.com but if you want to enter that, the codeword is toad. Only enter once please in the Twitch chat because if you do more than once, you'll be disqualified. →

name: MATT
line: Wait for them to notify you over the break and we'll come back with the winner when we return. →

name: MARISHA
line: They gave us an amazing matching set with the Elvis-- Elvish for our wedding. It was super sweet. Thanks Wyrmwood. Elvis from Memphis. →

name: MATT
line: (Elvis impression) "Oh that was a natural 20." We'll see you guys in a little bit. →

name: MATT
line: (cheering) [break] →

name: MATT
line: Hello, everyone, and welcome back. Before we jump back in, we have our winner from the chat. →

name: MATT
line: The winner is Piamo_Feddie! If I am reading this correctly, Piamo_Feddie. Congratulations! Danoba will get your contact information, we'll get that sent out to you. Well done, and happy Valentine's Day. Now jumping back into the game, I would like to ask everyone but Marisha to leave the table, please. →

name: MARISHA
line: See you, guys. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Don't die! →

name: MARISHA
line: This is so scary! So nerve wracking. →

name: MATT
line: Beauregard. →

name: MARISHA
line: Mm-hmm. →

name: MATT
line: Quietly, they walk you through the night air, through the Northward, to a familiar place: the outskirts of the Baumbauch Family Brewery. →

name: MATT
line: There's a slight opening on the side warehouse doors where you had previously worked when you first arrived at Trostenwald, and Archivist Zeenoth gestures for you to enter. "Please. If you don't mind, my dear." →

name: MARISHA
line: Really? Is this what got me caught, working for these fucking assholes? Ugh. I walk in. →

name: MATT
line: There is a single glowing lantern that is currently hanging from a rope that is strewn across the ceiling of the warehouse that gives a central source of light to the room. It causes the shadows to stretch out very long across the sides. →

name: MARISHA
line: What is this? →

name: MATT
line: As you walk in and turn around, the door is closed. The two figures approach. The female elf goes and takes a chair and sets it in the center beneath the lantern. "Please, have a seat." →

name: MARISHA
line: I'd prefer to stand. →

name: MATT
line: She just sits back, about 20 or so feet, and leans against one of the large stacks of crates as Zeenoth approaches you. "Now, Beauregard. You have been what the Archive would call a problematic student." →

name: MARISHA
line: (laughter) →

name: MATT
line: "I've had to pull in quite a bit of a favor--" →

name: MARISHA
line: Sorry. (laughter) Keep going. I'm listening. →

name: MATT
line: "Since I have been assigned to your tutelage, overseeing your progress and training, you've shown great promise, in many ways. You're a seeker of truth, and you have a keen sense for manipulations and falsehoods. Correct?" →

name: MARISHA
line: Thanks? →

name: MATT
line: "When the Archive took you in at the behest of your family, you agreed to undergo our discipline. Our lifestyle." →

name: MARISHA
line: No, I didn't agree to shit. You took me in because I'm assuming my father paid you a pretty nice sum of coin to make sure that you took me in. I'm assuming that coin is no longer coming to the Reserve, so, why do you care? →

name: MATT
line: "Believe it or not, not everyone does what they do in this world for coin. We see possibility in you. We, wish to prevent you from blowing out your own flame. Your tendencies clash with our teachings, your dislike for authority." →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, I thought you guys hated me. →

name: MARISHA
line: Thought I was doing you a favor by leaving. →

name: MATT
line: At which point, the woman from behind says, "Your dislike for authority is not a bad thing. It can keep you alive. Authority should always be questioned. Those with more power than you should be held to a higher standard." →

name: MARISHA
line: Thank you, authoritative figure who I am unaware of your name? →

name: MATT
line: At which point, Zeenoth picks up, again, says, "But the way of the Knowing Mistress has an order of learning. Your patience is essential to adhering to this path. I know it may not be stimulating at times, but we must prepare your mind if we are ever to prepare your soul." →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, I'd say that sorting books and punching brick walls repeatedly can definitely not be stimulating at all times. →

name: MATT
line: "Look, I just wish to--" At which point, the elven woman goes, "Enough. I've heard enough, Zeenoth. You are removed of your responsibility to oversee Beauregard." Zeenoth's eyes go wide. "This is not a student you can help. Return to Zadash." Zeenoth goes, "Expositor, I do not think that I have been given a fair shot. Please--" "I know this girl, because I see much of myself in her. →

name: MATT
line: You cannot reach her. Go." Zeenoth looks hurt. "I apologize that I failed you." He turns around and heads back towards the warehouse doors, which shift open, and close. →

name: MARISHA
line: The fuck was that? →

name: MATT
line: The woman now steps forward. →

name: MARISHA
line: I feel like he made me look like an asshole, feel like an asshole. Fuck, maybe I'm an asshole. →

name: MATT
line: "Maybe you're an asshole. You probably are an asshole. That's all right, because so am I. →

name: MATT
line: Because sometimes you need someone to be an asshole to get shit done." →

name: MARISHA
line: Being nice never did. What are we talking, stranger? →

name: MATT
line: "I am Expositor Dairon, of the Cobalt Soul." →

name: MARISHA
line: Dairon? →

name: MATT
line: D-A-I-R-O-N. "I take it you have heard of our station through whispers." →

name: MARISHA
line: Some people like to call you boogie men. →

name: MARISHA
line: I figured it was always real. In my opinion, the best way to hide in a secret organization is by having a boogie man. →

name: MATT
line: "We are the hidden strength of the library, you are not wrong. We wade in the filth of society. We weed out the corrupt. We pursue the secret evils of the world, and expose them to the light." →

name: MARISHA
line: Wow. →

name: MATT
line: "We twist the arm of the unjust, until they spill their mysteries. We are the spies. We are the hunters. We are the watchmen to those who rule. We are not kind. We are forthright. We are truth. Do you, Beauregard, want to see the truths of the world?" →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh god, I'm sorry. I have this burn in my butt from all the smoke you just blew up my ass. →

name: MARISHA
line: It's just, oh god. Is that a magical talent? →

name: MATT
line: What's your armor class? →

name: MATT
line: You suffer ten points of bludgeoning damage as, out of nowhere, her fist hits you right across the side of your face. →

name: MARISHA
line: It takes me to the ground. That takes me to the ground. →

name: MATT
line: You're unconscious? →

name: MARISHA
line: No, just takes me to the ground. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. "Are you listening now?" →

name: MARISHA
line: Do I have a choice? →

name: MATT
line: "Let me be your teacher." →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh, boy. Is that what I have to look forward to? →

name: MATT
line: "No. What do you want to do now, that that's happened?" →

name: MARISHA
line: I kind of want to fucking punch you back. →

name: MATT
line: "Then do it." "What's stopping you?" →

name: MARISHA
line: Now you have my attention. And I fucking punch her in the face! →

name: MATT
line: Go for it. Roll for an attack. →

name: MARISHA
line: Just a straight unarmed, right? →

name: MATT
line: Yep. →

name: MARISHA
line: 12 total, not good. →

name: MATT
line: She dodges out of the way, and as you move past, plucks you in the back of the head with a knuckle. That hits. You take one point of bludgeoning damage. It's a very light tap. →

name: MARISHA
line: Ow! What the fuck, my dad used to do that type of shit. →

name: MATT
line: With that, she rushes around with a rapid pace to the front of you, feints with an upper cut, and then goes to elbow you in the side of the head. That is a 16. What's your armor class? →

name: MARISHA
line: That misses. 17. →

name: MATT
line: Misses. You manage to duck out of the way of it. She goes, "Good. Good." →

name: MARISHA
line: I got to add some points here. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. She's going to go ahead and use her bonus action to go into a defensive stance. →

name: MATT
line: "Come on." →

name: MARISHA
line: (yells) I'm going to spend a ki point, and go into Flurry of Blows, and do a blind haymaker, a second blind haymaker, and then try and backhand with the third. Wildly, recklessly. →

name: MARISHA
line: Okay, first one. Natural 20! →

name: MATT
line: Oh, shit! →

name: MARISHA
line: Second one. Natural 20! →

name: MATT
line: Two natural 20s in a row! →

name: MARISHA
line: I don't have anyone sitting next to me to confirm this, but I swear it's a natural 20! →

name: MATT
line: No, I can see it! →

name: MARISHA
line: I'll take a picture if I have to! A natural 17. →

name: MATT
line: Roll damage on those first two! →

name: MARISHA
line: Okay. You double the dice, right? →

name: MATT
line: Yeah. Roll the dice, double it. →

name: MARISHA
line: Okay. That was a three, a two, so five, ten plus eight. 18. →

name: MATT
line: 18 points of damage. Then the third strike that hit? →

name: MARISHA
line: One, so another five points. God fucking-- Thinking of my dad, after she just went "boop," something just popping the back of my head. →

name: MATT
line: You watch as her defensive stance, she's prepared for it, and as you go to swing, she lets it down at the last second, and lets you get some hits in. Wham, wham! But much stronger than she expected. The first one clocks her across the chin. The other one hits her across the temple. →

name: MATT
line: The last one-- →

name: MARISHA
line: Just a wild backhand. →

name: MATT
line: Just hits her in the back of the head. She stumbles for a second, then spins around. You can see a bit of blood trickling out of the corner of her mouth, and there's a little bit of a scrape of dirt on the side her head where you hit. She turns around. "Very good. You have learned some things in your time." She quickly advances on you. Hits. →

name: MATT
line: 18, hits. Okay. You take three points of bludgeoning damage, one per hit. Pop! Pop pop! She is basically going full in with the strike, and is just prodding you with these gentle little hits, showing control, showing that she's entirely able to overwhelm you, and she's hitting different places on your body, strategically. Because with each hit, you feel this burst of numbness in those vicinities. I need you to make a constitution saving throw. →

name: MARISHA
line: Not great. That's a natural seven, so ten total. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. After each hit, you gather yourself for a second, she stops and goes, "You are quick, and there is intelligence lying in there. You are also quite nimble at dodging blows. Do you see, with but a few simple strikes, I'm able to extract from you everything I need to know about you." →

name: MARISHA
line: What the fuck, why can't I feel my hand? What did you do? →

name: MATT
line: "You see, brute force has its place. But precision, and intent. That can take down the greatest of mountains, by poking the weakest point. Now, I know where your weak points are." →

name: MARISHA
line: You don't know shit about me, bitch. I'm going to take another attack. →

name: MATT
line: Go for it. →

name: MARISHA
line: That's a three. That's a nine. →

name: MATT
line: Nope. With each miss, or, the first miss, she's going to use a reaction to attack you. →

name: MATT
line: That's going to be-- She can do that. Ducks out of the way, and immediately uses a reaction to smack you in the head for one point of damage, another bludgeoning point. She's going to spend another ki point to do another reaction. She can also do that. →

name: MARISHA
line: Roll. I rolled a 15 to attack. Second attack. These are two attacks, right? →

name: MATT
line: For your second one, yeah. →

name: MATT
line: Yeah, the second one does hit. She does not get the second attack. Roll damage on that second strike. →

name: MARISHA
line: Okay. Attacking her with the first one, and then I'm just going to duck down a little and jab her right in the ribs. →

name: MATT
line: All right. What was the damage on that? →

name: MARISHA
line: Eight. →

name: MATT
line: Eight damage, nice. You crack her in the ribs, and the impact actually does catch her off guard. She ends up tumbling five feet backward across the ground, catching herself in a three-point landing. →

name: MARISHA
line: I back up. I'm going to spend another ki point to do my defensive stance. Patient defense. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. Patient defense. You go into that stance that she was in earlier, but holding it for the entirety of this. Her eyes narrow for a second. You see her looking at all the different points that she struck on you earlier, like she's reading some sort of a docket on what your physicality is. With that, she doesn't run at you, she runs around you in a circle and begins to jump off the sides of the boxes, some of the crates that are stacked up nearby. You watch them wiggle as she puts her weight up against them, leaps off-- →

name: MARISHA
line: Instead of getting distracted by her, I just listen to her and look at her out of my periphery. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. Eventually, she uses her momentum to climb to the top with her feet and leap off, then come downward with the knee towards you. →

name: MARISHA
line: Right as she comes down and I'm going to use-- Oh, wait, dodge? Go first? →

name: MATT
line: You're already in your defensive stance, so her attack's at disadvantage against you. The first strike. 19, 20 to hit? →

name: MARISHA
line: Miss. It says patient defense, spend one ki point to take the dodge action as a bonus action on my turn. →

name: MATT
line: Correct, what the dodge action does is it means any attacks against you have disadvantage. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh. Cool. →

name: MATT
line: The first one did hit. Second one does not. →

name: MATT
line: The third one does. Two hits still get you. Both one point of bludgeoning damage. The knee comes down, and right as it cracks into your head, she shifts to the side and glides off, and as soon as her body glides off, her back is to yours, and her spinning elbow goes and cracks you in the side of the head, but it stops short, just barely hitting you. She's toying with you at this point. →

name: MARISHA
line: You said two more points? →

name: MATT
line: Yes, two more points of bludgeoning damage. →

name: MATT
line: Make another constitution saving throw, please. →

name: MARISHA
line: 11. No, sorry, 12. →

name: MATT
line: This time, opposed to the pressure points being hit, there is the one smack on the side of your head. →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah? →

name: MATT
line: This pain surges through the side of your temple, and travels through your spine, to all the points she had hit earlier, and your whole body tenses and seizes for a second. Your vision blurs, and your mouth stammers, and you're stunned for the next round. As she lands behind you, and walks around to the front of you, you're unable to, you can't move, you can't speak. "I can start you on this path. You can return to your wanderlust, your allies. Our kind learns more in the world than in a library. Agree to my instruction, to use the skills I teach you, as you return throughout your journeys. One day, you too, can become an expositor." You begin to regain control of your senses, and your speech begins to slowly return to you. →

name: MARISHA
line: Okay. I got to hand it to you, that was awesome, and I want to know how to do that. You beat me. →

name: MATT
line: "Very well. Your first lesson begins now." →

name: MARISHA
line: Okay. (groan) →

name: MATT
line: She snaps her fingers, and you watch as Zeenoth steps back in, sheepishly. "Is it over, my dear? Is it done?" "I need you to stand here for a second, Zeenoth. I need a body. Let me show you the proper pressure points." Zeenoth's eyes go wide for a second. "I don't believe--" "You owe me a favor. I found her for you, did I not?" Zeenoth sighs, sags his head, and takes his cloak off. →

name: MARISHA
line: I grab that stool, and I drag it over. →

name: MATT
line: "Now, depending on what you wish to learn, there are different places where you can pull the information from the body." Over the next few hours, working with you, and over time-- →

name: MARISHA
line: Does she beat the shit out of Zeenoth? →

name: MATT
line: You both do. →

name: MARISHA
line: Sorry, Zeenoth. Sorry. God, we're such assholes. →

name: MATT
line: "Assholes that the world needs, from time to time." →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah. The world does need an asshole. →

name: MARISHA
line: We'll work on that one together. We'll work on that. That's good, that's good. →

name: MATT
line: "I'll return to Zadash in the morning. Take what I have taught you. "When you feel it's time for more tutelage, return to me. Do not worry. I have an eye on you." →

name: MARISHA
line: What do I do until then, do I just continue-- →

name: MATT
line: "Do what you must. Travel the world. Use what I've taught you. Learn about injustice. Those you don't trust, follow them. Bend them. Make them tell the truth and admit their guilt. Find where ever corruption is. Root it out and let the system do its job. If the system isn't doing its job, destroy the system." →

name: MARISHA
line: Why are you doing this? Why me? →

name: MATT
line: "Because a long time ago, I was a wayward girl with no direction, was angry, and fighting at the world. And someone did this for me." →

name: MARISHA
line: I don't really believe in systems or being a part of them, let alone a system that takes down other systems. Seems almost hypocritical. →

name: MATT
line: "Perhaps. Who knows. Maybe one day you'll find the corruption inside our own." →

name: MARISHA
line: Touche. →

name: MATT
line: "Go. Get some rest. Clean up a bit, I think you could use it." →

name: MARISHA
line: You might have broke my wrist. →

name: MATT
line: "It'll heal. Zeenoth." She slaps him awake. →

name: MATT
line: His unconscious body on the ground. →

name: MARISHA
line: Bye, Zeenoth! Zeenoth! →

name: MATT
line: (coughing) →

name: MARISHA
line: Zeenoth! →

name: MATT
line: "Oh dear." →

name: MARISHA
line: Bye. →

name: MATT
line: "Goodbye. I have such great pleasure in saying goodbye, and good riddance." →

name: MARISHA
line: I leave. →

name: MATT
line: You make your way back to the tavern, go back into the room, and, exhaustedly, pass out. →

name: MATT
line: Let's bring everyone else back in. →

name: MARISHA
line: Hi, friends. How's it going? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Are you alive? →

name: LIAM
line: I'm sure everything went according to plan. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Quiet dignity and grace. →

name: MATT
line: As you all come to consciousness in the morning, little sore, but recovered--mostly--from the battle that wrecked you the evening before. →

name: MATT
line: The fresh smells of cooked meats, and the sounds of various patrons below in the inn tavern floor, rouse you to the morning. What do you wish to do? →

name: LIAM
line: Ah-- →

name: MARISHA
line: Hi, guys. Sorry I snuck in last night. →

name: TRAVIS
line: How does she look? →

name: MATT
line: She's beat to shit. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Oh, fuck! Did you get horse kicked? →

name: MARISHA
line: Several times. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Damn. How's the horse look? →

name: MARISHA
line: Horse is fucking dead. I ate it. →

name: TRAVIS
line: That's a bit excessive. →

name: MARISHA
line: Horse is fucking fine. Hey, Jester, do you have a bandage? Do you have a thing? →

name: LAURA
line: Oh, yes! Of course I do. I have a lot of bandages because I am the cleric. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I don't know if that bone's supposed to be sticking out of that part. →

name: LAURA
line: Yes, I'm going to open the medical kit and rummage around. Pull out some stuff. Give me your wrist! I can definitely heal this. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I bet Yasha can pop it back into place. →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, crack. →

name: MATT
line: Make a medicine check. →

name: TRAVIS
line: You just made a bow. →

name: TALIESIN
line: It was string and mime. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh, you made it worse! →

name: LIAM
line: (blood gushing) →

name: MATT
line: Okay. It's actually fairly well made; it gives some nice support to it. I mean, it's more of a sprain than a break. But it helps offer some support to it. It'll heal. →

name: MARISHA
line: I've had some sprains that feel like breaks. →

name: MATT
line: Yeah, no, it hurts like a bitch, or it did last night. Or it feels a little better today, but that's definitely going to help give it some support. Good job. →

name: MARISHA
line: Thank you. →

name: ASHLEY
line: What happened to you? →

name: LAURA
line: I've been practicing. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Not you, her. What happened to her? →

name: LAURA
line: Oh. Sorry. →

name: MARISHA
line: Man, it was a great night. I had a great night! I haven't had a great night in a long time, you guys. That was a great night. →

name: TRAVIS
line: With the guy you-- →

name: LAURA
line: You came in really late. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'd like to see the other guy. →

name: MARISHA
line: I might have been accepted into, like, a secret society. It's kind of secret society business. It's hard to talk about. →

name: LAURA
line: Are you allowed to talk about it? Tell us about it! →

name: MARISHA
line: Okay! No, I can't. It's fine. There are these monks. I thought they hated me. It turns out they like me. Turns out they want me to become a part of their gang. But it's not really real, and they're like, "Just keep doing your thing! But you're against injustice and seek out truth and break systems!" →

name: LAURA
line: You are a hero! →

name: LIAM
line: Is this one of those dreams where nobody has their clothes on? →

name: TALIESIN
line: You know, if the monks beat you up to make them join your gang, they're not really your friends. →

name: MARISHA
line: You know, I said something like that to her. It wasn't as black and white as that. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Is that why they did that to your face there? Oh, no, they didn't. Apparently they were pretty-- →

name: MARISHA
line: I wouldn't say this woman was my friend. →

name: MARISHA
line: I would say she's definitely a badass. I wouldn't say she's my friend. →

name: TRAVIS
line: This woman, was she with the fellow that you left with last night? →

name: MARISHA
line: She was. His name was Zeenoth. He's an archivist of the Cobalt Reserve. Lot of books there. Lot of books. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Cobalt Reserve. He was in the court. →

name: ASHLEY
line: Was this a test of some sort? →

name: MARISHA
line: I think so. →

name: LAURA
line: Did you pass? I mean, they made you a hero, so obviously you did. →

name: MARISHA
line: I'm not a hero. That's not what they did. →

name: MARISHA
line: It's more like a vigilante! Like what we said! Yeah! →

name: LAURA
line: This is so great. Can they let us into the secret society too? →

name: MARISHA
line: No. →

name: LIAM
line: Well, you know, this is very fascinating, but I have some errands to run. Nott, would you like to run errands with me? We are totally coming back and not leaving on our own undercover. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Insight check. →

name: LIAM
line: Bring it on. →

name: MARISHA
line: Do you need an insight check to know that that was shady as fuck? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Fuck all. →

name: LIAM
line: Persuasion? →

name: MATT
line: You don't have to tell me what you're rolling! →

name: LIAM
line: I rolled a natural 20! Whatever. I'm being very honest! We're not going anywhere. But I do have errands to run. So, we're going to leave soon. Have some breakfast. I grab some bacon from Ford/Fjord's plate, and grab Nott and head out the door. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Meet us at the circus. →

name: LAURA
line: I'm going to draw in my sketchbook a drawing of the devil toad head rolling along the ground like a bowling ball. →

name: SAM
line: She really did. →

name: LAURA
line: Well, kind of. I put the little bowling ball things on there. And he's going to run into all of us, in chains, being knocked down like pins. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. Roll a dexterity check. Why not? →

name: LAURA
line: Eight-- No, 15. →

name: MATT
line: It's very well done. There's, like, hatch mark shading. →

name: LAURA
line: Well, I did get really good training, so it's good that I know how to do shading. →

name: MATT
line: All right, what are you guys doing? The rest of you, while they rush off to go about their errands. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Apparently eating less of my bacon, motherfucker. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm going to pack up and head back to the circus. Start getting things together. →

name: ASHLEY
line: Yeah. I think I'll join you. →

name: MATT
line: Molly and Yasha are heading back to the carnival grounds. →

name: LAURA
line: I want to go try to buy a map. →

name: MARISHA
line: That's a good idea. →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah! →

name: ASHLEY
line: Oh, I did actually want to see that map. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'll meet you there. Actually, you know what? I want to see you see that map. →

name: ASHLEY
line: I think that's a great idea. Seeing me see a map is something pretty special. →

name: TALIESIN
line: It's gorgeous. It's fabulous. →

name: MATT
line: You guys, where are you heading off to? →

name: LIAM
line: I have two places to go. The first, we're going to the Burnished Bibelots. The second is a surprise. But I know that I whisked you away in a hurry the other day and you weren't done browsing. →

name: SAM
line: That sounds lovely and I would like to browse there again, but, honestly, Caleb, I am very worried about you. You have passed out twice in the last few days, and unless we get you a healing potion, there is no promise that you will still be alive tomorrow. I think we should go to Natural Remedies. You distract the owner while I go in the back and I steal a healing potion. It's the only way to guarantee your safety. →

name: LIAM
line: Maybe that's the third place that we go. I will point out your point, which was that these crazy bastards are very distracting and strange, yeah? →

name: SAM
line: Yes! →

name: LIAM
line: So they could be my healing potion, you know? We'll talk about it. Third place. So, drag her off to the Burnished Bibelots. Boom, in the door. →

name: MATT
line: You head inside. It looks as chaotic as you left it. You see what looks to be a small bowl of heated porridge that's gathered on the counter, and cross-legged on top is the fantastic gnomish purveyor of the interior, Oglen. "Hello?" →

name: LIAM
line: Good day to you, sir! →

name: MATT
line: "Good day to you as well." →

name: LIAM
line: I give Nott a little shove over towards the shelves and walk up to him, right up to the counter. What are you eating there? That looks good. →

name: MATT
line: "Breakfast." →

name: LIAM
line: All right, yeah. That's what that is. You know, I wanted to thank you for the book. I don't know if you read it yourself, but I read it cover to cover quickly. It was fascinating and very useful. →

name: LIAM
line: [aside, quietly] I hope you're doing stuff over there. →

name: MATT
line: "All sales are final!" →

name: LIAM
line: Well, here's the thing. I have read this book and loved it, and if you would like to purchase it for the low, low price of one gold, you can sell it again. You sold it to me for three. You have it back for one. You can turn a profit. →

name: MATT
line: Make a persuasion check. →

name: LIAM
line: Natural 20. →

name: MATT
line: You watch as some of the porridge is spilling out the side of his mouth, and he rubs it off. "All right." And he pulls a gold coin out of his pouch. →

name: LIAM
line: That is a good decision, and it was a good book. I am grateful for the knowledge you have imparted upon me. →

name: MATT
line: "Might I have the book?" →

name: LIAM
line: Oh, of course! It's right here on the table. →

name: LIAM
line: Sorry, grandfather. →

name: MATT
line: "All sales are final." →

name: LIAM
line: Right. You will not sell that back to me, for sure. →

name: MATT
line: "Do you want it? I can sell it to you for three gold." →

name: LIAM
line: That's a good price. Nott, how are you doing? →

name: SAM
line: (chewing) Bacon's really good! →

name: LIAM
line: All done for the day? →

name: SAM
line: I'm looking around for something to swipe. →

name: MATT
line: Make an investigation check. You guys keep just shaking down this poor gnome guy. →

name: SAM
line: Ten. →

name: MATT
line: Looking around, I mean, a lot of this is knick-knacks and inane garbage, and things that just aren't quite worth what you'd be looking for. →

name: MATT
line: You do find one art piece that looks like it's a pretty good art piece with a decent frame, might be worth a little bit, but that's the best you can find. Everything else here looks like it's the dingy side of the Salvation Army. →

name: SAM
line: Anything small? Ooh! Can I find my old flask that I left here? →

name: MATT
line: Yes, I'll let you do that. It has not moved from where you placed it. →

name: SAM
line: I'm going to steal back my old flask. →

name: MATT
line: Make a sleight of hand check, please. →

name: LIAM
line: What is that little dancer toy? Between the three red mushrooms on the shelf behind you, is that a music box there? →

name: MATT
line: "It is a music box." He takes it and cranks it. →

name: MATT
line: "It was a music box." →

name: LIAM
line: It's lost the magic. →

name: MATT
line: "I can fix it." →

name: LIAM
line: How long would that take? →

name: MATT
line: He breaks it open, looks inside. "Three days." →

name: LIAM
line: Okay. Well, I'll come back and see your work in three days. Work on that and your breakfast. →

name: LIAM
line: Hey Nott, are you ready? →

name: SAM
line: Mm-hmm! →

name: LIAM
line: All right. Good day to you. Happy sales. →

name: MATT
line: "Happy sales, as well." →

name: LIAM
line: Sure. Out the door. →

name: SAM
line: I rolled a 24. →

name: MATT
line: Yeah, he did not notice at all. →

name: LIAM
line: I'm going to head in the direction, dragging my goblin friend with me, to that fancy bathhouse that was described to me last night at the Nestled Nook. →

name: MATT
line: You guys make your way southward. Go ahead and make a general charisma check. →

name: LIAM
line: Charisma check? Well, something I wanted to do before we got there, was going to do it maybe in an alley, but you tell me, is I would like to cast Disguise Self on myself. Presumably gone into an alleyway so no one sees me doing this in the middle of the road. I take the form of a man in very fancy green robes, beautiful blond hair, very handsome man, with a vomit stain down the front of my clothes. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. Specific and easily done. →

name: LIAM
line: I drag my little friend along with me. You are going to like this, this is something very special. →

name: SAM
line: I'm excited. →

name: LIAM
line: Oh, charisma check. Straight charisma? →

name: MATT
line: Straight charisma. Add your modifier. →

name: LIAM
line: Yeah, it's 11. →

name: MATT
line: 11, okay. With your Disguise Self form, it's easy enough for you to ask a few questions, and eventually you are given directions to what is called the Warm Dew Bathhouse. Warm Dew. →

name: LAURA
line: Warm Doo, D-O-O. →

name: MATT
line: D-E-W. →

name: LIAM
line: Dew, dew. There's a liquid u in that. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Warm doo. Thank you. →

name: MATT
line: It'll be one before you bathe there and the other when you leave. →

name: MATT
line: (laughter) →

name: LIAM
line: All right, let's enter this establishment. →

name: MATT
line: For as far south as this is, it's pretty decent compared to the other areas. Most of the Hillsward-- you get the sense that a lot of the rural farming community that fills out most of Trostenwald, a lot of the money that gets made goes directly to the central portion of this ward, where this bathhouse is. It's small, but it's really well put together. As you walk inside, you can see there are marble busts set on the sides of the entrance way, each side. You can see nice tapestries that are pulled back over the windows, and as both of you walk in, you see this young man, maybe his mid-twenties or so. Human, but he looks very thin and sickly, like he had a rough upbringing, and his general constitution has suffered for it. He has a warm smile, and he's wearing these long white robes with what looks to be a yellowish scarf that's wrapped around as he approaches. "Hello and good morning. Can I help you?" →

name: LIAM
line: Yes, one moment. (quietly) Stay close to me and let me do the talking. (louder) Hello, please, don't focus-- my daughter is shy. →

name: MATT
line: "I'm very sorry." →

name: LIAM
line: I've had a terrible day. Some disgusting derelict has vomited all over me, I smell like filth, and I would like to spend a couple of hours in your finest bath. Maybe not your finest. A good bath, for a couple of hours. My daughter and I. I will need adjoining baths, if you have that. For modesty's sake, my daughter and I. →

name: MATT
line: "That can be done. Of course." Make a persuasion check. →

name: LIAM
line: (humming) There's a 12. →

name: MATT
line: "For two hours, that will run-- for two baths adjoining, we'll put it at eight silver pieces." →

name: LIAM
line: That's fine. I definitely have that. I take out the eight silver, I slap it down. →

name: MATT
line: "Wonderful. We'll show you to your bathroom." →

name: LIAM
line: Okay. Come along, dear. →

name: SAM
line: Yes, Vater. →

name: MATT
line: You guys are escorted to what-- It's really off-putting for the two of you. Not only is the smell clean inside here, but there's the scent of lavender in the hallway, and you hear soft music in the distance. As you walk past, you do see that there is a resident violinist that plays, and you guys are led to these two-- →

name: SAM
line: This is really nice! →

name: LIAM
line: Yes, it is. →

name: SAM
line: They got a violinist over there! I'm sorry, zey got a violinist over zere, Vater. →

name: LIAM
line: That's meine Liebchen. I'm hoping for a hot bath for the both of us. It has been a long bit of travel. →

name: MATT
line: "Right this way." Leads you into the chambers. There is a glass, fogged window, so the sunlight comes through, but no one can see through. There are some linens set out, a towel, and two basins that are freshly filled with steaming water. You are left into the chamber. →

name: LIAM
line: Are they separate, though? →

name: MATT
line: They're separated by a small wall that's eye length, but you can still talk to each other over it. →

name: LIAM
line: Excellent. This is called a bath. →

name: SAM
line: I've heard of them. →

name: LIAM
line: A hot bath. We have been pretty dinged up for the past several months, and we might not get back into something like this for a while, so I want you to enjoy it. Go over to your side, and I will be here. Nott, I'm going to do a bit of reading. →

name: SAM
line: While you bathe? →

name: LIAM
line: Yes. →

name: SAM
line: You'll still be the same Caleb when you're done, right? →

name: LIAM
line: Yes, I will be the same Caleb. →

name: SAM
line: I've just gotten used to you, and now you're going to change a bit. →

name: LIAM
line: Trust me, I will not. →

name: SAM
line: All right. →

name: LIAM
line: Once she is clear of the wall, I'm going to start actually disrobing, although I guess the illusion stays. →

name: MATT
line: The illusion stays. Strangely, clothes start apparating out of you. (slurping) →

name: MARISHA
line: It's like a bad video game glitch. Bad texture glitch. →

name: LIAM
line: Nott, I'm probably going to go quiet for a little while. →

name: SAM
line: No problem. I'll just be over here, you know, bathing. →

name: LIAM
line: Enjoy it. I find the second book and examine it. Am I able to read this? →

name: MATT
line: You are, actually. There is one incomplete arcane inscription in there. Unfortunately, it's been too burned, beyond recognition. You can see this was a spellbook. Mostly destroyed, but there are two complete spells in there that, if you wish to, you could transcribe over into your book. →

name: MATT
line: Those would be Arcane Lock and Unseen Servant. →

name: ALL
line: Ooh! →

name: LIAM
line: So. All my actual clothes are off. I'm going to take the book and set it on the edge of the basin. →

name: MATT
line: Because you paid for it, there is a hinged, small desk piece where food can be eaten, or drinks could be served while people are taking a bath. →

name: LIAM
line: I set it down. I sit with just my legs in the bath for a moment, and I look at the book. →

name: LIAM
line: [exhales] →

name: SAM
line: I'm going to find the pitcher of cucumber water, dump it on the floor, and eat all the cucumbers. →

name: SAM
line: (laughter) →

name: MATT
line: As you hear over the wall (gobbling). →

name: SAM
line: Look around for anything in the room that can be stolen? →

name: MATT
line: Plenty of things, actually. No one's watching. There's a vase that's really nice. The doorknob itself is a brass, gold-like material. →

name: SAM
line: I'll start working on that. →

name: MATT
line: Using your thieves' tools, you can get that free, if you want. →

name: SAM
line: After a while, I put a toe into the water, feel it, and I'm like: Nah. I'll use my empty flask and fill it up with water. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. You get a water flask. →

name: SAM
line: Then work on the doorknob. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. Go ahead and make a thieves' tools check, adding your dexterity. →

name: MATT
line: Add the dexterity and your proficiency. →

name: MATT
line: There you go. With very little sound, the doorknob comes off, and you have now a solid brass doorknob. There is the vase. →

name: SAM
line: Is it a big vase? →

name: MATT
line: It's like that big. It's more of a decorative flower holder over by the window. →

name: SAM
line: Sure. I'll try to get that too. →

name: MATT
line: Easy. You get it. There's nobody watching you! →

name: SAM
line: I'll also save the flowers in a separate pouch. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. There you go. →

name: SAM
line: Any towels. Ooh, you know what? →

name: MATT
line: Yeah, the linens can be taken. →

name: SAM
line: I'm going to take one towel and tear it into shreds, and use it to replace any of my bandages that have worn or fallen off. →

name: MATT
line: Easy enough. There's some nice clean bandages. Good. →

name: SAM
line: I'm good. →

name: LIAM
line: On my side, while all of that is happening, two things. One is that when I finally get into the tub I dip my whole body almost entirely in, but not my head or hair. Letting the bruises soak in the hot water, which feels wonderful. The second thing is, while flipping the pages of this book, very still, I can hear all of this, and it is extremely endearing, but I go completely still. →

name: LIAM
line: Completely quiet. And read in peace. →

name: MATT
line: While you guys are taking a bath, the rest of you are going off on a shopping trip. Except for you, you're going to-- →

name: TALIESIN
line: No, I'm going map hunting. →

name: MATT
line: That's right. You're going. Who's all going together? →

name: LAURA
line: All of us. →

name: MATT
line: Where are you going? →

name: LAURA
line: Okay, I'm going to ask Yorda if there's a map maker in town. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Or if she can draw us a map of how to get there. →

name: MATT
line: "There's not much of a specific cartographer in place. Most of the cartography guilds are up north in either Zadash or Rexxentrum. There might be one in Alfield? We're a bit small over here. →

name: MATT
line: You could ask the general store, or you could maybe go to the stockade. They have maps there but they use those. You might be able to pay enough for them." →

name: LAURA
line: I don't want to go back to the stockade. →

name: MATT
line: "Then maybe check the general store or any of the strange book places might have something old and lying in the back." →

name: LAURA
line: Ooh, what strange book places? →

name: MATT
line: "Well, let's see. There's the Hillsbrook Parchment and Binding. There's the Burnished Bibelots, that I think one of your friends has already been to. Those are the two strange book places. I'm not much of a reader myself, so I couldn't tell you." →

name: LAURA
line: Can you draw me a map of how to get to those places? →

name: MARISHA
line: We've already been to the general store. →

name: LAURA
line: Yes, you're right. I guess we can try that place. →

name: MARISHA
line: You can still make her draw a map. I don't want to rain on your parade. I'm sorry. →

name: TRAVIS
line: You just shit all over her. →

name: MARISHA
line: I totally did. →

name: MATT
line: She gives you directions. →

name: LAURA
line: Let's go on a trip! →

name: MATT
line: Where are you guys going first? →

name: MARISHA
line: (singing) General store! →

name: LAURA
line: We've been there before. →

name: MARISHA
line: (singing) I want to buy another health pack! →

name: SAM
line: Health pack? →

name: MARISHA
line: I meant a healer's kit. →

name: LAURA
line: The general store doesn't like us very much. Oh wait. That healer's kit, is that the one you bought when we were together? →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah. →

name: LAURA
line: You spent way too much money on it because I changed the tag? →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah. That one. →

name: LAURA
line: That was great. Now I have it. Cool. →

name: MARISHA
line: You won twice. →

name: MATT
line: Everything's coming up Jester. →

name: LAURA
line: All right, let's go back there. They don't like me, but let's go back there. →

name: MARISHA
line: I can just pop in if you want to wait outside. →

name: LAURA
line: They don't like you either. →

name: LAURA
line: MARISHA, Yeah, but they like money. Let's go. →

name: MATT
line: All right, so you guys make your way to Lochward General in the Lochward District. As you enter, the older woman, Harper Mince, is there in the general store. It's the large, almost wooden barn exterior. The front door opens two ways, and the inside is wall-to-wall lined with tools for farming and farming equipment for building. →

name: MATT
line: There's lumber. There's all sorts of iron nails. →

name: MATT
line: It's by all accounts a rural general store. →

name: MATT
line: You see on far end is Harper, the older woman there, standing and looking out at the rest of you. "Hi, can I help you? What are you looking for?" →

name: LAURA
line: We are looking for pickles, did you get any yet? →

name: MATT
line: "No, we don't sell pickles here, sorry." →

name: LAURA
line: Most general stores have pickles, this is the only thing. →

name: MARISHA
line: You're not wrong, generally, yeah. →

name: MATT
line: "We can order some pickles, if you like." →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah, you probably should. I think you would do well if you sold pickles. Do you have maps for sale of the area? →

name: MATT
line: "The area? Let me check. I'll be right back." →

name: LAURA
line: Does she leave the room? →

name: MATT
line: Yeah, she does. She leaves the room. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Don't-- put your hands in your pockets. →

name: LAURA
line: Don't put my hands in my pockets, got it! I start running around and just moving everything on the shelves again the same way as before. →

name: MATT
line: Make a sleight of hand check. →

name: SAM
line: You're just moving things? →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah, just like moving-- →

name: TRAVIS
line: Please be Laura when she was five and break shit. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh yes! 18 plus five. →

name: TALIESIN
line: This is beautiful. →

name: MATT
line: With nary a squeak you completely rearrange in a period of about two and a half minutes most of the price cards that are dangling from a number of the tools, their placement. You guys all sit back and watch as this glorious display-- you can almost hear the William Tell Overture begin to play in the back of your head as she rummages back and forth throughout the interior of the chamber, turning things around and sticking them in the ground. It has been completely rearranged. →

name: LIAM
line: [old man voice] Why is this crowbar seven gold? →

name: MATT
line: Eventually you hear some rummaging from the back room and some footsteps coming nearby and you quickly stop and return to your original point there and Harper Mince returns from the back room. →

name: MATT
line: She has a few papers in her arms. She goes, "I'm sorry, we don't have any maps of the local area for detail. I have a map of the Dwendalian Empire as a whole, I hope that's enough." →

name: LAURA
line: I mean, that could work, I suppose. It's not what we need, but if that's what you have that's what we can buy from you. →

name: MATT
line: "All right, let me look at the date here. →

name: MATT
line: This will run about seven silver." →

name: LAURA
line: Okay, that sounds like a good price, yeah. →

name: MARISHA
line: Can I also get another healer's kit? If you have one. →

name: MATT
line: "Right, yes, let me go ahead and get that for you here." The healer's kit. Looking up the pricing in the equipment section.That is five gold pieces for the healer's kit. →

name: MATT
line: (groaning) →

name: MARISHA
line: Five gold. →

name: MATT
line: All right, mark it off. You get yourself a secondary healer's kit. →

name: MARISHA
line: Well, one healer's kit. She's got the other one. →

name: MATT
line: You hand over the seven silver? →

name: LAURA
line: Yes, I do. →

name: MATT
line: She takes it and put the ribbon back on it. →

name: MATT
line: Finally get to give that to you guys. →

name: LIAM
line: Shut the front door! →

name: LAURA
line: And I have a pretty ribbon out of it. →

name: TALIESIN
line: We're going to Goonies this really quickly here. Ready? →

name: LAURA
line: What the fuck?! →

line: That's beautiful! Who made this? Did you make this? →

line: I designed the layout, but the map is made by a wonderful woman named Deven Rue, who does incredible handcrafted maps. →

name: TRAVIS

name: MARISHA

name: TRAVIS

name: MARISHA

name: MATT

name: MATT
line: This is north, this is south. →

name: SAM
line: Angle it to that camera. →

name: LAURA
line: What camera? →

name: ALL
line: Wow. →

name: MATT
line: This is the Dwendalian Empire. This is not all of Wildemount, this is just a portion. Deven did an incredible job with this. You should follow her on Patreon or Twitter, she does amazing work. →

name: MATT
line: She does incredible work. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh my god, you guys, let's go all of these places. →

name: ASHLEY
line: Maybe not all of them. →

name: LAURA
line: Okay, we are definitely going to visit this place called Hupperdook. →

name: SAM
line: I think I had one of those this morning. →

name: SAM
line: [laughter] →

name: LAURA
line: Then we'll make our way up to Nogvuror. Oh man, this is awesome. Hey look, look over here! This is where I live! →

name: SAM
line: There be dragons there. →

name: TALIESIN

name: LAURA
line: Mm-hmm. →

name: MATT
line: By the way, Deven, who did the map, it is her birthday today. →

name: MARISHA
line: Happy birthday, Deven! →

name: LAURA
line: Damn, this is amazing! Okay, I'll leave it up here. →

name: TALIESIN
line: If you pull out a real medi-kit now I'm going to be really excited. 50 bandages come flying in... →

name: ASHLEY
line: That is so beautiful. →

name: MATT
line: She did an incredible job. The exchange is done, you have your map. Anything else you guys want to handle? →

name: TALIESIN

name: MARISHA

name: LAURA

name: MATT

name: TRAVIS
line: Can I actually approach the storekeep and say: do you know of any stores that have arcane items, things with magical properties, healing potions? →

name: MATT
line: "I'm sorry, we're a bit out of the center of the country for arcane items. You'd want to go further north for that." →

name: MATT

name: MARISHA

name: TRAVIS

name: MARISHA
line: I don't care. →

name: MARISHA
line: [laughter] →

name: TRAVIS

line: Sure. Thank you so much for this beautiful map. You did a really good job drawing it. →

name: MATT

name: MARISHA
line: [bell dangling noises] →

name: MATT

name: TALIESIN
line: I like the idea of you just standing there going, [bell dangling noises] →

name: LAURA
line: Wherever we go, I'm going to bury my head in the map and walk behind everybody like a total tourist. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Well, that's the question: are we going to be able to grab a cart or two from the circus? →

name: MATT
line: You can probably get a cart. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Like one of the little vardos? Can we snag a vardo? →

name: MATT
line: Technically it's a vardo and the three of them took it. There's a vardo and then there's some carts. You weren't rolling with a pretty heavy-- honestly, most of the room in the carts was either for carrying you guys, whatever small bags you had with you, and the poles you would assemble to make the tent. Are you guys done with your business? Anything else you want to do while you're out and about? →

name: TRAVIS
line: That's it for me. →

name: LAURA

name: MATT
line: There's Natural Remedies, which you've passed before, but not entered. It's an herbal healers establishment. →

name: LAURA
line: Let's try that. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm very wary of this, but fine. →

name: TRAVIS
line: It's going to smell like "Sephoria," I know it. →

name: LAURA
line: Sephora. →

name: TRAVIS
line: That's the fancy version. →

name: MATT
line: Now, you guys had left earlier, so as you guys head toward Natural Remedies, you guys finish your bath. →

name: LIAM
line: I pack up. I said we're staying for an hour, so I cast Disguise Self again to keep the illusion going. I'm done, you look-- →

name: SAM
line: I splashed some water on my face. →

name: LIAM
line: --refreshed. →

name: SAM
line: Oh, it was such a good bath. I'm ready to go now, I feel refreshed. →

name: LIAM
line: Did you like it, though? →

name: SAM
line: It was a once-in-a-lifetime experience. →

name: LIAM
line: I wanted to repay you for all you've done for me for the past couple of days. →

name: SAM
line: Consider it paid! You look the same. Does he look the same? →

name: MATT
line: Yeah. →

name: LIAM
line: The brief moment that I was in my own guise nothing changed up here, so I look exactly the way I did this morning. →

name: LAURA
line: What's the purpose of that? →

name: LIAM
line: Who said that? You wanted to do something, right? →

name: SAM
line: I wanted to go to Herbal Remedies and see if we could get you a healing potion. →

name: LIAM
line: Let's do that, then. You lead the way. Well wait, you lead the way outside. Let's keep our little schtick going here and then off we go. →

name: MATT
line: All right. As you guys exit-- →

name: SAM
line: Auf Wiedersehen! →

name: MATT
line: "I trust you enjoyed your time at the bath, thank you." →

name: LIAM
line: Yes, but we have to go. Sorry, I'm late for a very important appointment. I drag Nott right out of here because I saw no doorknob on the door. →

name: MATT
line: Yeah, amongst other things. You guys make your way out and beeline it towards the Lochward to where you would find Natural Remedies. The rest of you guys, as you approach the exterior, amongst the rest of the buildings in the central city, Natural Remedies is, for lack of a better term, humble. →

name: MATT
line: It's a small shack, but as soon as you approach it has very strong, pungent smells of funguses. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Instant headache. →

name: MATT
line: Yep. On the outside you can see, right where the doorway is open, there are strings of herbs that are tied up and left to dry out. On the inside, you can already see that there are shelves of various flora and fauna that are being cultivated for various remedies and means of selling to anybody who wants to come by and procure herbal medicines. Let's see who's handling this one, because you guys have not been here yet. As you enter the main chamber-- →

name: LIAM
line: Sorry, I will say that on the way there that I dropped the disguise, somewhere. →

name: MATT
line: Okay, easily enough, so you guys haven't arrived yet. You guys have arrived. As you enter the interior, it's a very musty smell on the inside, too. →

name: MATT
line: There's a lot of fungus being grown on the inside here, and you can see that elements of it may have expanded into the corners of the actual room and it's not necessarily the nicest space to be wandering in. It seems natural. Across the way, you see a gentleman of relatively tanned skin, with darker hair that's ratty and clustered. He's in his late twenties or so, looks to be upon closer inspection partial elven blood, partial human blood, and he's in the process of carefully carving a large stalk of what looks like a fungus off of a small pot that he pulled off one of the shelves. As you enter, he doesn't even make eye contact. He goes, "Hello, please, just wait a moment. There we are. Hi, can I help you?" →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah, my friends keep dying. Do you have any health potions? →

name: MATT
line: "We have a handful, that is correct. How many are you looking to purchase?" →

name: LAURA
line: How many do you have? →

name: MATT
line: "Four." →

name: LAURA
line: Ooh. That will last us probably, like, a day. →

name: MATT
line: "What do you do for a living?" →

name: LAURA
line: We're superheroes. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Sword jugglers. →

name: MATT
line: "Why would-- Fine, who am I to ask?" →

name: MARISHA
line: Look at this bruise. →

name: MATT
line: "I cut fungus for a living." →

name: MARISHA
line: Look, it's in the shape of a dick. →

name: MATT
line: "I'm not going to ask. Four? Did you want them?" →

name: LAURA
line: Sure, yes. How much for four healing potions? →

name: MATT
line: "For four healing potions," and he pulls them out and plops them on the table, "240 gold pieces." →

name: TALIESIN
line: Level two. →

name: LAURA
line: Okay, hold on. I open up my pack and I pour out all my money. I start counting it. →

name: ASHLEY
line: Do you have a deal, you know, if we got all of them? That seems pretty high. Right? That seems pretty high for a healing potion. →

name: MATT
line: Make a persuasion check with disadvantage. →

name: MATT
line: Yasha: the wheeler and dealer. →

name: ASHLEY
line: Three. →

name: MATT
line: "No, actually, I think it's rather standard in these parts. But I can put them back." →

name: TALIESIN
line: Healing potions aside, you are doing something really interesting and exciting here. →

name: TALIESIN
line: You're not a healing potion dealer. What are you doing here? Like this is fascinating. →

name: MATT
line: "Oh, I create all sorts of means of tending to wounds and loss of stamina. To be honest, a lot of people come around here for performance-enhancing fungus." →

name: TALIESIN
line: I don't know, I feel like you can excite me. I feel like there's something that you have to show that's really exciting. I'm not entirely sure it's all about stamina, I think you've got something-- you did that on purpose. Talk to me like I'm a child, show me something I've never seen before. →

name: MATT
line: Make a persuasion check. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Not with advantage, because I don't have it, but I was so excited. →

name: MATT
line: Nope. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Persuasion check. 19. I'm fishing for drugs, I'm not going to lie. I've been on the road a long time, I don't remember how to do this. →

name: MATT
line: He leans in close to you. "Mind closing the door?" →

name: TALIESIN
line: I skip over to the door and gingerly close it. →

name: MATT
line: "Keep curious company, that's true." →

name: TALIESIN
line: Yes, I do. And we're leaving town today. →

name: MATT
line: "Those are magical words for a man of my business. Are you a fan of skein?" →

name: TALIESIN
line: I don't actually know what that is. →

name: MATT
line: "Well," and he goes back into the back chamber, comes back with a small satchel. There's a finely dried, dusted material on the inside, it has a grayish-blue color to it. He goes, "This is a dried and ground fungus called skein. It's called skein because when you eat it you can see the weave of time." →

name: MARISHA
line: Is that what skein means? →

name: MATT
line: "It's a woven skein, it's a joke on fate-- never mind." →

name: TALIESIN
line: I thought it was very clever. →

name: MATT
line: "Thank you very much. It's effective, it's popular on the outskirts where it's not so heavily controlled and carries a huge jail-time if caught. →

name: MATT
line: How much are you looking to purchase?" →

name: TALIESIN
line: I've got to be honest, I'm not made of money, but I'm always curious for a new experience. →

name: MARISHA
line: Can I do an insight check on this guy? →

name: MATT
line: Sure, go for it. →

name: MARISHA
line: See if he's trying to scam us. →

name: MATT
line: Go for it. →

name: MARISHA
line: Can I use my criminal background? →

name: MATT
line: Sure. →

name: LIAM
line: All right, Marisha said that, not Beauregard. →

name: MARISHA
line: To know if he's actually giving what he's giving? →

name: MATT
line: You know what? Make your insight check. →

name: MARISHA
line: Just straight insight. →

name: MATT
line: Straight insight. →

name: MARISHA
line: It's not as good as I would've hoped. →

name: MATT
line: Not as good as I hoped: 18. →

name: LIAM
line: That's a slam dunk at level two. →

name: MATT
line: Seems on the level, seems excited that somebody's asking about it. You get the sense that maybe he makes a lot of this either for himself or in hopes that somebody asks about it and is seemingly excited that somebody in this bumfuck town, in his opinion, would even have interest. You have once encountered this substance before, and it does seem legit. →

name: MARISHA
line: Okay. →

name: ASHLEY
line: How do we know if it's good quality, though? Can I give it a sample? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Well, this might be complicated, I think that just-- What would-- →

name: TRAVIS
line: How about a few experiences? →

name: TALIESIN
line: A few experiences' worth. What would that run me? →

name: MATT
line: Hey guys, we're dealing D&D drugs. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm so sorry. I'm so sorry for dragging the entire audience into this. Hopefully your children are already asleep, I do apologize. →

name: SAM
line: D&D Beyond, everybody. Our sponsor for the evening. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Thank you for really bringing that to earth for me. You started this. →

name: MATT
line: "I'll put you in at a gold an experience, how about that?" →

name: TALIESIN
line: All right. Yeah, put me in for one. I'll try anything once. →

name: MATT
line: He takes a small little batch of this dried, powdered fungus, and puts it into a small glass vial, corks it, and hands it over. →

name: ASHLEY
line: Well, you might as well make another one. →

name: ASHLEY
line: I'm not going to let my friend experience it alone. →

name: TALIESIN
line: What's it called? Skein? →

name: MATT
line: Skein. S-K-E-I-N. I believe that's how it's spelled. →

name: LAURA
line: Yasha, you should take it with them. Right now. It'll be fun. →

name: TALIESIN
line: No, this is not how this works. This is not how this works. We bank our moments for those moments when life is disappointing. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I know a unique substance when I see it, I'll take one as well. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Oh my god. →

name: MARISHA
line: One for me too. →

name: TALIESIN
line: This can come in handy in all sorts of ways. →

name: MATT
line: God damn it, guys. →

name: TALIESIN
line: The fact that you had this ready means that there is no shame here. You were ready for this. →

name: MATT
line: You're right, I am not making any of this up on the spot at all. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I know, I can tell! →

name: LIAM
line: This guy went from the Simpson's Safeway clerk to the shadiest motherfucker in a snap of time, because of your question. →

name: TALIESIN
line: A big, purple, pierced demon walked into the room and was like, hello. →

name: LIAM
line: Yes, can I help you, good sir? Yes, I can help you. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I'll tell you what, because you are such a purveyor of such interesting items, I will take one of those health potions, but for 50 gold. →

name: TRAVIS
line: That's the running price I've seen in neighboring towns, and I don't mean to be swindled. →

name: MARISHA
line: I assume you'd want to go ahead and give it to us for that so that we keep this a secret. →

name: MATT
line: Make a persuasion check, with advantage. →

name: MATT
line: "50 gold," and he pulls his hair back a bit, "Seems fair." Takes a potion and hands it over. He scoops a little vial and says, "And for fun." He throws it over. →

name: LIAM
line: You fucking badass. →

name: SAM
line: Cut to an hour later, and someone's jamming an adrenaline needle. →

name: MATT
line: TPK by misuse? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Somewhere around level eight, this is going to be hilarious. Somewhere around level eight somebody's going to go shopping and the rest of us are going to be like: this is now, this is happening now. →

name: MATT
line: This has become the longest afterschool special I think we've ever experienced. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Years in the making. →

name: MATT
line: He immediately gets nervous at her mention of-- →

name: TALIESIN
line: She's fine, she's just awful, you're a gentleman, I hope to see you again. I'm looking forward to this. →

name: MATT
line: "I'll be here." →

name: TALIESIN
line: Of course, we never met you, you never met us. →

name: MATT
line: "Of course not. I don't know who you are." →

name: TALIESIN
line: I am already out the door, with a flourish. →

name: MATT
line: At which point, you run outside just as Caleb and Nott are approaching. →

name: MARISHA
line: Before I go out I say, nice to meet you, mister--? →

name: MATT
line: "Davies." →

name: TRAVIS
line: The decision was still happening by the time you got to the last letter. →

name: MARISHA
line: I go: Okay, Davies. →

name: LAURA
line: I guess I'll scoop my money back into my pouch and leave. →

name: MARISHA
line: Do you want anything? →

name: LAURA
line: No. →

name: MATT
line: You bump into Caleb and Nott on the way out. →

name: LIAM
line: What's the matter, do you have a cold? →

name: LAURA
line: You don't smell bad, what did you do? →

name: MATT
line: Actually, ironically, his clothes do still smell pretty bad, and he still looks awful. →

name: LAURA
line: You don't smell as bad. →

name: MATT
line: That's true, on a gradient scale, he does smell a little better. →

name: LIAM
line: I will take that as a compliment, thank you. →

name: LIAM
line: What are you guys doing here, are you shopping? What do they have in there? →

name: LAURA
line: They bought drugs. →

name: TRAVIS
line: That is an over-exaggeration. →

name: TALIESIN
line: That is an extreme over-exaggeration. We got a health potion. →

name: SAM
line: All of you? →

name: MARISHA
line: Well, it was kind of a ploy to get a cheaper health potion. →

name: TALIESIN
line: It worked. →

name: MARISHA
line: And we got drugs on top of it. It was a win-win, am I right? →

name: LAURA
line: If you guys go in there and you buy a health potion, don't spend as much as he says, because apparently he was lying. →

name: LIAM
line: How much do they run for? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Health potions were quoted at 70, but he was kind enough to understand that 50 was enough. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Gold pieces. →

name: SAM
line: North we go. →

name: TALIESIN
line: North, to the horses. →

name: LIAM
line: We have a plan for the day? →

name: LAURA
line: Yes, and I show them the map that we just got. We're heading that way. Can I take the ribbon that was wrapped around the map and tie it around one of my horns? →

name: MATT
line: Easily enough. →

name: MARISHA
line: That's cute. →

name: LAURA
line: Thank you. →

name: SAM
line: We could rob the store. →

name: LIAM
line: Do you have a strategy for that? →

name: SAM
line: I mean, we could use one of our pre-planned strategies. →

name: LIAM
line: Which one would that be? Because I was thinking about it on the walk here and I can't think which one applies. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I was going to say, robbing shady people is usually a bad idea. →

name: MARISHA
line: Do we hear them doing these plans? Do we hear you guys making this plan? →

name: LIAM
line: No, I wouldn't be saying this out loud if you're close. →

name: SAM
line: We could just do the simplest: the Prince and the Pauper. →

name: LIAM
line: Here's the thing, I have died almost twice in two days. We have our friends and I think that's a good way to start. →

name: SAM
line: All right. →

name: LIAM
line: I mean, you know, we almost all got pinched yesterday. →

name: SAM
line: You're right, we should leave town with our wits about us and full of health. Let's just go while we're ahead. Besides, I got plenty of stuff today. →

name: LIAM
line: You and me? →

name: SAM
line: Yeah, let's go. →

name: LIAM
line: All right. Okay, where are we going first? →

name: LAURA
line: We're heading north to-- →

name: LIAM
line: Is it this big? →

name: MATT
line: That's the size of the map. →

name: LAURA
line: I mean, we can stop through Alfield first and see if there's anything cool there, or-- what city was it that the academy was in? →

name: MARISHA
line: "Solstryce?" →

name: MATT
line: Soltryce. →

name: MARISHA
line: Is that the name of the town? →

name: TALIESIN
line: No, I don't think it's the name of the town. →

name: LAURA
line: I mean, the ultimate goal, you guys, is to get to Hupperdook, but-- →

name: TALIESIN
line: What about Yogurt? →

name: LAURA
line: That's an afterthought. →

name: TALIESIN
line: It usually is. →

name: LIAM
line: How far off does Hupperdook look? →

name: LAURA
line: Well, we have to pass through Felderwin and the Felderwin Village first. →

name: SAM
line: Let's skip that one, please. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh, is that the one you don't like? Okay, then we'll go up through Alfield, and then Zadash, and then we'll cut across and go to Hupperdook. →

name: MARISHA
line: Is that where your clan is from? →

name: SAM
line: They roam about. →

name: ASHLEY
line: You don't want to go to Zadash, is that right? →

name: MARISHA
line: Nah, it's cool. We can go back. →

name: TRAVIS
line: It's cool now? →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, I mean, there's a few places that I didn't get to see in my sight-seeing roundabout, didn't get to hit everything. Now that I've slept on it, I've had a change of heart. It's a nice town. →

name: LAURA
line: How long of a travel would it be to get to Zadash from where we are now? →

name: MATT
line: Following the road is longer, but it's safest. That'll probably be close to 200 miles to Zadash. →

name: SAM
line: Jesus. We're on foot. →

name: TALIESIN
line: No, we've got a cart. →

name: SAM
line: A cart. →

name: MATT
line: You do have a cart. A single cart. →

name: LAURA
line: A horse? Let's go back to the inn and ask Yorda if she knows if Alfield is a big city. →

name: LIAM
line: Do I have any knowledge of Alfield? →

name: TALIESIN
line: I came though Alfield, didn't I? →

name: MATT
line: No, you guys traveled around. You went from Felderwin, and curved around to the Ustaloch. →

name: TALIESIN
line: That's right. →

name: MATT
line: Alfield is actually slightly smaller than Trostenwald, it's a stop on the way to Zadash. →

name: MATT
line: Zadash is the second-largest city in the kingdom. →

name: MARISHA
line: What do I know about Zadash that I could tell them? Can I tell them anything? →

name: MATT
line: It was the last conquered bastion of the previous government before the empire entirely took the valley. →

name: MARISHA
line: That's right. Zadash is on the edge of the empire too, right? →

name: MATT
line: It was, but now it's more central. It expanded past and took over Trostenwald, Alfield, it expanded all the way into the valley. →

name: LIAM
line: Will you share your map with me for just one minute? →

name: LAURA
line: Of course. →

name: SAM
line: This is a good trick he does. He can look at it once and it will stay with him forever. →

name: LAURA
line: Really? →

name: SAM
line: Yes, it's amazing, you can quiz him on it later. →

name: SAM
line: While he's memorizing it, Yasha, is that your name again? →

name: ASHLEY
line: Yasha. →

name: ASHLEY
line: SAM; It's like Ash, with an -ay. →

name: ASHLEY
line: Not really, but close enough. →

name: SAM
line: I got you these flowers. →

name: ASHLEY
line: Oh. →

name: SAM
line: Thought that they might gussy you up a bit. →

name: SAM
line: It's a lot of drab colors. Also, maybe you won't kill me now. →

name: ASHLEY
line: I'm not going to kill you. →

name: SAM
line: I know, I gave you the flowers. →

name: ASHLEY
line: All right, well. →

name: SAM
line: Girls like flowers. →

name: LAURA
line: I love flowers, did you get me any? →

name: SAM
line: I didn't, because you're less of a threat. →

name: LAURA
line: You don't know that. →

name: ASHLEY
line: That was very nice of you, thank you. →

name: SAM
line: Sure! →

name: MARISHA
line: Didn't peg you for a flowers type of girl. →

name: SAM
line: All girls like flowers. →

name: ASHLEY
line: I take out a book that I have and in between some of the pages is a four-leaf clover. →

name: ASHLEY
line: I'll take the flowers and I'll put them in between the other pages, and I'll put it away. →

name: SAM
line: You see? (laughter) →

name: SAM
line: It doesn't hurt to be nice sometimes. →

name: MARISHA
line: I mean, it can, though. →

name: SAM
line: Well it hurts you. →

name: LIAM
line: It looks like somebody was very nice to you the night before, over and over again. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh, she was. →

name: LAURA
line: You guys, we are going to Zadash. Is that what we're saying, we're going to go to Zadash? →

name: LIAM
line: Sure, let's do that. What's our goal in Zadash? →

name: LAURA
line: I don't know, I just need to know where we're going, okay? →

name: MARISHA
line: That's on the way to the "Solstryce" Academy? →

name: MATT
line: The Soltryce. Solstice, I can see you mixing it up. The Soltryce is technically in Rexxentrum, which is the capital of the empire. →

name: LAURA
line: Which is a lot farther. →

name: MATT
line: Which is a lot farther. Zadash does have the only other subsidiary of the academy there, but the main Soltryce academy is in Rexxentrum, the capital. But Zadash has some connection to it. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I'll take it. →

name: LIAM
line: Unless you're a foreigner, everyone knows about Rexxentrum. →

name: MATT
line: Yes, it's huge. For player comparison, it's twice the size of Emon. It's a massive city. →

name: LAURA
line: Zadash? →

name: MATT
line: No, not Zadash, Rexxentrum. →

name: LIAM
line: Zadash is medium, or smaller. →

name: LAURA
line: Okay. Yeah. →

name: LIAM
line: How far did that map say, when I looked at it? 200 miles you said to Zadash? →

name: MATT
line: To Zadash, roughly 200 miles or so, if you're taking the road, quicker if you take a straight line, but you're not as safe. →

name: LIAM
line: Well, I think it's good. →

name: SAM
line: Are we going to walk there? Should we get horses? →

name: TALIESIN
line: We have a horse. →

name: LIAM
line: How many horses? →

name: TALIESIN
line: We have a horse. →

name: MARISHA
line: A horse and a carriage. I'm assuming it can't fit all of us. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah, like a wagon. →

name: TALIESIN
line: We have a wagon. →

name: MATT
line: It'll be about the same pace as on foot. At a fast pace on foot, you guys can traverse about 30 miles a day. That also means you're moving at a fast pace, so you're not being completely aware of your surroundings, you have a penalty to passively seeing things around you. But you get there quicker. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I like it. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Why be fast? What are we in a rush for? →

name: LAURA
line: We can sightsee. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I find careful is always best. →

name: LIAM
line: A couple of weeks on the road to a city bigger than this one. →

name: MARISHA
line: Are we all going to get along for a couple of weeks? →

name: SAM
line: We'll find out, I suppose. →

name: LAURA
line: I get along with everyone, Beau. →

name: MARISHA
line: That's true, that's true. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I don't get along with anybody. →

name: MARISHA
line: That's also true. →

name: LIAM
line: Two weeks is not a bad test run for companions. If we don't like it, we part ways in Zadash. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah, free to go at any time. As long as it serves everyone, we'll stay this way. →

name: ASHLEY
line: I think I need to stay here just a little bit longer. But I will meet you guys there at some point? →

name: SAM
line: Why?! What're you doing? →

name: LIAM
line: You have something else to do? →

name: ASHLEY
line: I just don't think I can leave here until I'm told I can. →

name: SAM
line: By the authorities? →

name: ASHLEY
line: No, I just-- →

name: SAM
line: You're so mysterious →

name: ASHLEY
line: I have things that I need to do-- →

name: SAM
line: Name one. →

name: TALIESIN
line: You know where we're headed. →

name: MATT
line: Blindspot. →

name: MARISHA
line: Poor Ashley, we make her come up with excuses every time. →

name: ASHLEY
line: I have reasons, I can stay, I just need to converse with somebody to see where my next step leads. →

name: MARISHA
line: You know you're not beholden to Gustav anymore, right? →

name: ASHLEY
line: No, yes, no. It's not him. →

name: MARISHA
line: Is it Bo? The other Bo? Is it Desmond? →

name: ASHLEY
line: No. →

name: MARISHA
line: Is it Ornna? →

name: SAM
line: Please, Beau, let the detectives figure this out. Is it Desmond? →

name: LAURA
line: Is it Ornna? →

name: SAM
line: It's Ornna, isn't it? It's Ornna, I knew it. →

name: LAURA
line: Will you hold this? →

name: SAM
line: Yes, of course. See? Another case cracked. It was Ornna. →

name: LAURA
line: Before we leave, is there anywhere in town that there would be a courier service where I could send a message? →

name: MATT
line: There are messenger services, yeah. →

name: LAURA
line: Can I go find one? →

name: MATT
line: Yeah, okay. For the purposes of brevity, we'll say that you find a courier service that runs fast horseback all along the roads from the Empire, and then with approval, outside of it, to the south and west. →

name: LAURA
line: I'm going to write a letter to my mother that says, "Dear Mom, all of the money's gone. I don't know what happened, but I am very broke and I need more. Please help me. I am going to Zadash. →

name: LAURA
line: That's where you can send it. Just send it to the inn that is the biggest one and I'll find it there. Just address it to me. Your loving daughter, Jester. Please, thank you, I need help, thank you." →

name: MATT
line: All right. For delivery to Nicodranas, the cost of the courier service will run you about five gold. →

name: LAURA
line: This is really fucking-- She better send money, because this is eating into it. →

name: MATT
line: That's hundreds and hundreds of miles on horseback. →

name: LAURA
line: Okay, I'll give the five gold for that. →

name: TALIESIN
line: It is such a different world. →

name: MATT
line: Yeah. Welcome to level... three, after tonight. →

name: SAM
line: Oh! If we live. →

name: MARISHA
line: While we're stopping by the post office, can I talk to the courier person? →

name: MATT
line: Sure. It's a young girl with short-ish brushed hair, she's boyish and freckled, and a bit dirty in the edges of her chin, she's in the process of loading up the packs on the horse, and she's wearing simple leather armor, and looks back at you. "Can I help you?" →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, I was just wondering if you had any incoming mail for the Baumbauchs? I said that I would pick it up on the way home, heading over there. →

name: MATT
line: Make a deception check. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Wow. →

name: SAM
line: Mail fraud on the way out of town. →

name: MARISHA
line: That's good! 20. No. Deception? 19 total. →

name: MATT
line: "Let me check. Yeah, actually, we've got three small parcels on the way to the Baumbauchs there." →

name: MARISHA
line: Thank you so much. He's going to be so happy to not have to run this errand. Thank you, bye. Oh, sorry, here you go. I give her a gold. →

name: MATT
line: "That's very kind, thank you." →

name: MARISHA
line: Have a good day. →

name: MATT
line: Hops onto the horse and takes off southward. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Mail fraud. →

name: MARISHA
line: Let's go. →

name: TALIESIN
line: That is actually the worst crime we've committed today. →

name: MARISHA
line: You said how many? Three parcels? →

name: MATT
line: Three parcels. →

name: ASHLEY
line: When you get to Zadash, maybe send me a note, or maybe I'll be there. I just have to do a couple things. →

name: LAURA
line: We'll send you a note on the way to Zadash. →

name: LAURA
line: Then maybe you can meet us there. →

name: ASHLEY
line: Okay. That sounds like a plan. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Do we have our fucking wagon ready? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Wagon's ready. I've even attempted to hide some of the contraband and otherwise. I packed well. →

name: LIAM
line: While everyone is getting ready, I wait for a moment when Fjord is on his own and everyone is busy, walk over. This group seems rough around the edges, but you seem clever. Hopefully we can make this work. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I think we should be able to, yeah. I mean, a little guidance goes a long way. You seem to be good at looking out for Nott. →

name: LIAM
line: I mean, full disclosure, I'm a little rough around the edges, but you catch my drift. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I do. You can trust us. You're safe here. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I'm concerned with what happens with Jester and Beau. I think, amongst all of us, we should be fine. →

name: LIAM
line: Let's make it work. →

name: TRAVIS
line: We'll make it work. →

name: SAM
line: Fjord, something in me says that, for some reason, you should be the one who tells the horses and wagon to go. →

name: SAM
line: (laughter) →

name: SAM
line: It just seems-- you're the biggest, maybe? →

name: TRAVIS
line: That is mighty considerate of you, Nott. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Are you sure you don't want to take a crack at it? →

name: SAM
line: I could take a crack at it. The wagons be hitched, hee-haw. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Use your diaphragm. Really get a yee-haw, get in there. →

name: SAM
line: Saddle up your doggies, hee-haw. →

name: TRAVIS
line: One more time, on the count of three. One, two, three. On three, I push his chest in. →

name: SAM
line: Yee-haw! →

name: MATT
line: All right. With that, her vocal expulsion is majestic and sudden. Make an animal handling check with advantage, please. →

name: SAM
line: With advantage? Six. I'm still a scary goblin. →

name: MATT
line: The sound that comes out is less of a "Yee-haw," and more of a screech sound. The horse immediately rises up and goes into a very heavy gallop, and the cart takes off ahead of you, and you all struggle to catch up for a bit. With that, you guys quickly try and saunter up, heading northward along the road towards the direction of Alfield, and eventually Zadash, as you head further into the Dwendalian Empire, and whatever fate has in store for you the next leg of your journey.
