We'll stop tonight's session there. →

name: SAM
line: Ashley Johnson, ladies and gentlemen. →

name: LIAM
line: Yee-haw. →

name: ALL
line: Yee-haw. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Well, we committed felonies and mail fraud. That's good. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Quite a few. Got into a bar fight. →

name: LAURA
line: We skipped town without paying our inn fees. →

name: SAM
line: We bought drugs. →

name: TRAVIS
line: We bought a little bit of mold. →

name: MATT
line: You paid your inn fee. →

name: LAURA
line: We did pay on the way in. I did pay for a few days when we got in. I guess that is probably enough. →

name: LIAM
line: Oh my gosh, and Sneaky McSneakerson over here. Oh boy. →

name: SAM
line: Oh, yeah. Who knows what Marisha did while we were out there? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah, we got to go back and not watch that later. →

name: MARISHA
line: Like the three rules of Fight Club. →

name: MATT
line: You guys are all level three when you come back next week. →

name: MATT
line: (cheering) →

name: TRAVIS
line: Oh god, we got to shop. We got to book shop. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh man, this is fun. →

name: MATT
line: Yeah, thank you guys for sticking around for a less intense, more character-driven episode, these early days of figuring each other out and forming a fellowship. This is fun, I love it. →

name: LIAM
line: Bunch of assholes. →

name: MATT
line: I know. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Bunch of assholes! →

name: LIAM
line: That's the name. →

name: MATT
line: Thank you guys for watching. Thank you again, Deven, for being an incredible artist, and an incredible mapmaker for working with me on that. Her Twitter-- I should've had this prepared in advance! You can follow Deven on Twitter @devenrue, Mistress of Maps. Her work is incredible. She has a Patreon, which I'm a patron for, you should be too. It's her birthday, so say happy birthday to her. →

name: ALL
line: Happy Birthday! →

name: MATT
line: All right, guys, have a wonderful week. →

name: MATT
line: Ashley, come back. →

name: ASHLEY
line: Hopefully soon, I never know. I'll try. →

name: LAURA
line: So glad you were here. →

name: MATT
line: If anybody from Blindspot is watching right now, kill off her character. I mean, don't do that, but we want her back. →

name: ASHLEY
line: I don't think any of them are watching. →

name: MATT
line: It's fine. We just miss her a lot. We'll see you guys back next week. Much love to you, much love to you, and is it Thursday yet? →

name: MATT
line: Hello everyone, and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons & Dragons. Some of us are mentally lagging a little, but that's okay. It's been a long day. Welcome, guys. Before we jump into tonight's session, we're going to do some quick announcements. First and foremost, thank you to our returning sponsor and partner at the start of this campaign, and for the foreseeable, amorphous future of which they wish to come along with us on this journey, D&D Beyond. They've been awesome and I actually just learned today of a really helpful functionality that I probably should have known about, where you can create your own campaign in there and then send out a link to all your players and their characters get added to your campaign. →

name: MATT
line: Now I have access to all of your character sheets at all times, which alleviates me having to text you all, "What's your maximum hit points now?" and all that shit. →

name: LAURA
line: Did you just have them? Or do we need to send you our characters? →

name: MATT
line: Well no, I sent out the link earlier today and you're one of the only ones who hasn't responded yet, but you will, later, that's okay. →

name: LAURA
line: I didn't see it, I was recording. →

name: MATT
line: That's okay, so were we. →

name: MATT
line: (laughter) →

name: LAURA
line: I didn't look at my phone. →

name: TRAVIS
line: What a dick. →

name: TRAVIS
line: (laughter) →

name: MATT
line: It's all good. →

name: LAURA
line: That means all of you guys were texting in your sessions. →

name: TALIESIN
line: This is true. →

name: LIAM
line: We're that good. →

name: LIAM
line: (laughter) →

name: MATT
line: Sam, do you have any words you wanted to say about our sponsor? →

name: SAM
line: I do. Here, give this to Matt, he'll need it. →

name: MATT
line: Oh no. →

name: SAM
line: Our partner this week is once again D&D Beyond, that's dndbeyond.com. The big news is that D&D's newest book, Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes, is available for pre-order now on the site. If you preorder, you'll get exclusive character portrait frames, sheet backdrops, and themed colors that you can use with upcoming character sheet updates! I don't know what that means but it sounds awesome. →

name: SAM
line: The $10 off code "beginnings" can be applied to your preorder. To celebrate, I'm going to personally be giving away one copy of this book to either Travis, Liam, or Marisha, but they have to compete for it. Here's the rules: I'm going to give you a race, class, and character description, just like you can do on D&D Beyond, and all you guys have to do is come up with the name of that character. Laura, Taliesin, and Matt will be the judges. Best out of three wins, all right? You just have to come up with a name for this character, ready? A male stout halfling swamp druid who only wears a diaper made out of kelp and loves to Wild Shape into manatees. Liam, what is the name of that character? →

name: LIAM
line: Twill Pillikins. →

name: SAM
line: Marisha, what is the name of that character? →

name: MARISHA
line: Squall Squatlock. →

name: SAM
line: And Travis? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Merkin Dullbringer. →

name: SAM
line: Judges, who wins? Oh, Travis, easy win for Travis. →

name: MATT
line: Adding Merkin to a swamp druid was too easy. →

name: LAURA
line: It was you, Liam, until he brought up the Merkin. →

name: SAM
line: Remember, these characters can all be made on D&D Beyond. The next one is a male tabaxi bard with an electric guitar who constantly plays K-pop songs and has a runny nose. What is his name? Liam O'Brien. →

name: LIAM
line: Bathtub Stealthcat. →

name: SAM
line: Marisha Ray. Oh yeah, sorry, three names. →

name: MARISHA
line: Mollysquawk the J-pop Hadockhop. →

name: SAM
line: Yep, okay. Travis? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Pubert Pimplepop. →

name: SAM
line: Ooh! Judges. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I got bribed. →

name: SAM
line: Travis again. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm purchasable, putting that out there. →

name: SAM
line: One more, this one is worth two points. A female kenku paladin with no arms or legs. →

name: LAURA
line: What's a kenku? →

name: LIAM
line: Kenku's a bird. →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah, I know. Shut up! →

name: SAM
line: Who worships the lobster-headed god Blibdoolpoolp, and it is a real god, and is dragged around by a pack of reindeer. Liam, what is the name of that character? →

name: LIAM
line: Dagon Henry Kissinger. →

name: MARISHA
line: Madame Mannequin Ba-Deece. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Filma Kraken. →

name: SAM
line: Judges, Liam, Liam, Marisha, Liam gets two points! Travis gets two points! Marisha wins! →

name: MARISHA
line: Yay, golf rules! →

name: SAM
line: I will personally buy you one of those books, Marisha, hold me to it. D&D Beyond, everyone, make your character today. →

name: MATT
line: Thank you Sam, thank you very much. →

name: LAURA
line: That was good. →

name: TALIESIN
line: That got weird. →

name: MATT
line: Isn't it always, though? →

name: LAURA
line: That was close, I'm not going to count it. →

name: LAURA
line: This is the one Sam gave me, so we'll see. →

name: MATT
line: Finishing up from that, we have Talks Machina next Tuesday at 7:00pm Pacific here on Twitch and Project Alpha to discuss tonight's episode of Critical Role hosted by our fantastic Brian W. →

name: MATT
line: Foster, so check that out on Tuesday next week. We have a new show called Weave coming up, Marisha, do you want to explain this a little bit? →

name: TALIESIN
line: We're one episode in. →

name: MATT
line: One episode in? That's right, that launched this week. →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, it happened... last night? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Wednesday night. →

name: MARISHA
line: Wednesday night, it happens after Wednesday Club. It's being GMed by Amy Dallen and it's an interactive storytelling RPG game. It's got all the ladies of Geek & Sundry, so check it out. →

name: MATT
line: That's awesome. →

name: TRAVIS
line: That's a dope jacket, by the way. →

name: MARISHA
line: Thanks, man. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah, jealous. →

name: MATT
line: We'll get you one, same size. Last week's episode of Critical Role is available in podcast form wherever you can find the greatest podcasts to download. So if you have friends who are listening to the audio, they can do so now and be caught up with you up until after tonight. Also, comic book issue four of Critical Role: Vox Machina Origins is available for digital download anywhere where you can find digital comics for the most part: ComiXology, the Dark Horse app, and other great places. →

name: TRAVIS
line: It's so good, Minxie's in there killing things. →

name: MATT
line: We've got a new one creeping up on the horizon. →

name: LIAM
line: I've read the whole thing, I've seen the pictures. →

name: MATT
line: I was supposed to see the art today! I can't wait! Anyway, enough of that. Of course, our fantastic 826LA and the 826 group that does fantastic after-school programs for kids to get into creative writing. Check it out if you haven't already, and if you can't give to help out with this charity, you can donate your time as well to help teach some of these kids and help expand their imaginations, so check it out. They're awesome people and we continue to support and push them forward. Any new appearances you want to announce? Or just rinse and repeat the ones-- if you want to know what conventions we're going to be at in the near future, watch last week's episode. Otherwise it gets monotonous for us. →

name: MATT
line: Anyway, any other announcements that I've missed? →

name: SAM
line: Apparently my breath stinks, so if anyone has any gum, I'll take it. →

name: MATT
line: Send your gum to Geek & Sundry. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Don't send your gum. →

name: LAURA
line: I have something. The Shadow of War expansion pack, The Blade of Galadriel, came out and you can play and be me, so get it and play. →

name: SAM
line: Just you, Laura Bailey? →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah, basically just me, running around Mordor. →

name: LIAM
line: Donut hole! Donut hole! Donut hole! →

name: TRAVIS
line: You've got a ring of power and shit. →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah, so check it out. →

name: LIAM
line: She has a ring of power? →

name: LAURA
line: Shut up! What? No. What? →

name: MATT
line: On that note, let's go ahead and dive in to tonight's episode of Critical Role. →

name: MATT
line: (cast singing) [click, TV static] [groovy Critical Role theme] →

name: MATT
line: And welcome back. →

name: LAURA
line: He just tunes it out now. →

name: MATT
line: I have to. →

name: LIAM
line: Except when he doesn't. →

name: MATT
line: Except when I don't, which makes it a challenge for you guys, which does not help me. →

name: MATT
line: Anyway, last we left off, the group of adventurers whose fates are slowly entwining found themselves meeting in the city of Trostenwald on the southern reaches of the Dwendalian Empire on the continent of Wildemount. Through a mishap in a circus passing through town, you began to give chase to the investigation that has caught you up in this legal issue and you found yourselves locked under house arrest and being considered possible murderers. →

name: MATT
line: You sought the answer to this endeavor, you found the devil toad, or the nergaliid, as you discovered, was responsible. You hunted it down, slew it, brought its head back, and after arguing with a very tired and wanting to get it over with lawmaster in Trostenwald, managed to convince her enough to let you off the hook and leave most of the standing legal issues with Gustav, thus disbanding the circus and setting you and Yasha free. Yasha went on her own path while the rest of you, the six of you, decided strength in numbers, and at the time being, you all seem to enjoy each other's company. Purchasing a fresh map, looking at your future prospects and your dwindling funds, you decided to head northward, towards the city of Zadash by way of the Golden Road, past the city of Alfield. And that is where we left off, as you had smacked the rear end of the single horse and cart, and sent it spooked into the northern field. →

name: LAURA
line: We chased after it, right? →

name: MATT
line: You do. You chase after it to keep up. →

name: LAURA
line: We don't just lose it. →

name: MATT
line: Being relatively before noon at this point in time, you're heading northward along the Amber Road. The well-packed dirt of the ten-foot roadway gives you a clear path towards your next destination. The gentle creak of the cart mingles with the clomping of the horse hooves as you push forward. The midday air is warmer than you expected. The sky's common gray presence is broken into smaller cloud patches, the victorious blue peeking through. You guys continue for a few hours, talking amongst yourselves a bit. If there are any questions you wish to ask each other, now is the time. →

name: SAM
line: Any questions? →

name: MATT
line: Meaning if there is anything coming out of the city you wanted to talk about, otherwise I'm going to continue to push forward with your journey. So stop me at any point. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Is Beau-- is her face all jibbity-jacked, or is it pretty normal-looking at this point? →

name: MATT
line: Make a perception check. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Not that I watched anything from last week, because I didn't! 16. →

name: MATT
line: You can see there is some faint bruising starting to show on the left side of the face. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I bet she doesn't want to talk about that. →

name: TRAVIS
line: That's a good shiner. →

name: MARISHA
line: Thanks. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Did you give as good as you got? →

name: MARISHA
line: I wouldn't say I won, because I lost. →

name: MARISHA
line: But I did pretty good. What color is it right now? Is it in that orange-ish purple-- →

name: TRAVIS
line: It's got the green-yellow sunset happening, things are starting to spread. Tomorrow will be-- →

name: MARISHA
line: Right. Got that little orangey. Mm-hmm. →

name: LAURA
line: It's really pretty. →

name: MARISHA
line: Thanks. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Significant improvement. →

name: TRAVIS
line: That trouble going to follow you as we go on our way, or do you think you're free and clear? →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh no, that was just a little bar fight. →

name: MARISHA
line: Nothing. Just a little friendly sparring. Nothing crazy. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Nice. →

name: LAURA
line: Does anyone want a donut from my bag? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Yes, I'll have a donut, thank you, please. →

name: LIAM
line: I would also like a donut, please. →

name: LAURA
line: Okay, here you go. I don't have them in real life, just this one in real life. But in the game, you guys are having delicious donuts. →

name: TRAVIS
line: How old are those donuts? →

name: LIAM
line: Do you actually have donuts? I don't understand. →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah, here you go. →

name: LIAM
line: Oh, there it is. →

name: MATT
line: Imagination! →

name: LAURA
line: You're doing it, Peter, you're doing it! →

name: TALIESIN
line: I was just going there, damn it! Bangarang! →

name: LAURA
line: These donuts are not that old. →

name: TALIESIN
line: What does "not that old" mean, does it mean they're young? →

name: LIAM
line: Are they pretty new? →

name: LAURA
line: They're pretty new, yes. →

name: LIAM
line: Three days new? Or-- Forget it, I don't actually want to know the answer. →

name: LAURA
line: Just eat it, it's good. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Is it good and do we gain or lose hit points? →

name: MATT
line: No hit point transition, no constitution saves. They're a bit stale, but still tasty enough. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Any lint from the bag that they were being held in? →

name: MATT
line: You can chose to remove it if you'd like, but it may be part of the texture. It adds color. →

name: LAURA
line: That's right. It's like sprinkles. →

name: LIAM
line: Mollymauk, is this weird for you to not be traveling with your performing family? →

name: TALIESIN
line: It's change, but travel is travel, so. →

name: LAURA
line: Did you travel in a wagon when you were with your family? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Oh yes, we traveled forever. It was constantly on the road. Once we left home, we stayed moving. →

name: MATT
line: Ironically, traveled in the exact wagon that you're in right now. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh, nice. →

name: LIAM
line: Some things don't change. We didn't have much of a chance to see you perform. I saw you do a card reading for Jester, but things got waylaid at the circus. What do you normally do? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Oh, things. I'm not really much of a performer, I'm more of-- Help set up. Help run the shows, help make illusions, that sort of thing. →

name: SAM
line: Like a techie? →

name: TALIESIN
line: I guess you could say a techie. I show off a little bit of the sword juggling. →

name: SAM
line: Oh! →

name: TALIESIN
line: I've got some things I was working on. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Like this. →

name: TRAVIS
line: You juggling those big motherfucking swords? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Yeah. →

name: MATT
line: You watch as he balances one on the edge of the hand and then tosses it up and catches it as it falls, and takes the other one and glides it across, spins it up, catches it on his chin. On his nose; he makes it hop around. It's pretty decent. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Little roll. →

name: LAURA
line: Can you swallow it? →

name: MATT
line: Make an acrobatics check if you want to try. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Well, it's a curved sword. So not the curved ones. But I could probably do a straight sword. I'm not going to swallow a curved sword! That would be very complicated to pull off. →

name: LIAM
line: If anybody can do it, it's you. →

name: SAM
line: That tiefling anatomy is very strange, you know. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm flexible, but not that flexible. I'm pretty flexible. Yeah, I never nailed anything down for a really good act. →

name: MATT
line: A few hours into travel along the road, you catch ahead the sight of another caravan heading southward in your direction. They begin to crest over one of the hills. As you look forward, too, the central portion of the Marrow Valley isn't just a smooth, constant grade. It's a series of rolling hills and high grasses and wheats and grains, and a lot of wild weeds that have taken over the areas between bastions of civilization. →

name: LIAM
line: How far away are they? →

name: MATT
line: You can see up there about maybe a half mile or so, as they crest over one of the hills in the distance. →

name: LIAM
line: Yeah, I send Frumpkin ahead and see it, and go blind and deaf here, so I can get a closer look at them. →

name: SAM
line: Which is Frumpkin now? →

name: LIAM
line: Frumpkin's a sparrow at the moment. I don't have the components to put him back to the shape he prefers, which is a cat. →

name: LAURA
line: What are the components? →

name: LIAM
line: Charcoal and some incense, a kind of incense you have to use. I'm all out. I used it all. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Not my incense. →

name: LIAM
line: No. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Is there money involved? →

name: LIAM
line: Money? Well, you have to pay money to get the things to do it. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Right, I'm sorry. →

name: LIAM
line: He's been a couple of things before. He can last. Anyway. Off you go. →

name: LAURA
line: Have you ever made him a turtle? →

name: MATT
line: He can't hear you right now, unfortunately. →

name: LAURA
line: Have you ever made him a snake? Have you ever made him a roach? →

name: SAM
line: He's gone to the other place. He won't be able to respond. →

name: LAURA
line: Have you ever made him a unicorn? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Oh my god. →

name: SAM
line: A unicorn would be really cool. →

name: MARISHA
line: That would be really cool. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'd like to see that. →

name: LAURA
line: They exist, you know. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I didn't know that. →

name: LAURA
line: They do. →

name: MATT
line: As your vision crests up with the flight of Frumpkin, make a perception check for Frumpkin. →

name: LIAM
line: Don't fuck me, Scanlan. Oh, that's not Scanlan, that's Percy, but you did fuck me, Percy. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I try. →

name: LIAM
line: That is very low. We'll just say it fails, because it's a two. →

name: MATT
line: It's a two? →

name: LIAM
line: Yeah, I rolled a two. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. I mean, at a safe enough distance to look down, there are shapes. The most that Frumpkin makes out is that it looks to be six heavy wagons. →

name: MARISHA
line: Six? →

name: MATT
line: Six heavy wagons, each being pulled by a trio of horses. →

name: SAM
line: We can rob them. →

name: LIAM
line: 18 horses. →

name: TRAVIS
line: We should what? →

name: SAM
line: Well, we could rob them, or we could go off the road and hide and wait for them to pass. →

name: LAURA
line: Is Frumpkin back? Do we know all these things yet? →

name: SAM
line: Oh, we don't. →

name: MATT
line: We'll say for the purposes of this-- →

name: SAM
line: Pleasant day! →

name: LIAM
line: I started muttering as soon as I could see that. What they were, what I saw. →

name: LAURA
line: Do they look like they're in armor? Do they look like they're soldiers? →

name: SAM
line: He can't hear you. →

name: LAURA
line: Do they look like they're mean? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Do they look like they're unicorns? →

name: MARISHA
line: Do they look like they're traders? Like traders, not traitors. →

name: SAM
line: He can't hear you. →

name: LAURA
line: Do you see, are they carrying money? Are they carrying people? →

name: SAM
line: He won't be able to talk to you for a while. →

name: SAM
line: You see, he's not really there. →

name: MATT
line: Coming closer down the road now, the gap between your traveling troupe and this caravan grows smaller and smaller. All the rest of you, I'd like to make a perception check, please. I think at this point, Frumpkin has-- →

name: LIAM
line: I would've released it, yeah. He's not back, but I released the sight. →

name: LIAM
line: Perception check? →

name: SAM
line: Nine! →

name: LAURA
line: Five! →

name: LIAM
line: Zwölf. →

name: MATT
line: Amongst all of you guys keeping an eye out, you look ahead and you can see the wagons are covered, some of them are bundled; some of them are taller; some of them are smaller. What you do notice is at the front of each of the wagons, there's a figure with the reins that is in the process of sitting there and occasionally making sure the pace is kept relatively steady forward. →

name: MATT
line: You do see by the long robes and ornate silk mantles of the highwaymen that are holding these reins, you get the impression that they probably are from the Menagerie Coast. You two in particular recognize, it's not well-off mercantile clothing, but it looks like it's not rags for a person that makes this trek up and down the Amber Road. Looks like they're heading southward, probably returning after completing some sort of a trade run up to either Zadash or Rexxentrum and spaces nearby. As the gap begins to close, there's a brief moment of chicken to see who's going to avert the path as it's only about ten foot wide. →

name: MATT
line: It would be a pretty tight fit to get both your troupe and their wagons past. Do you guys yield or do you continue to push forward? →

name: TRAVIS
line: I would just like to suggest we might give way. There are six of them. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm fine with that. →

name: MARISHA
line: Yes, agreed. →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah. →

name: MATT
line: You guys skirt your single horse-- poor thing is pulling this cart on its own. →

name: TRAVIS
line: We're going to kill it. →

name: MATT
line: It's not going any faster, really, than you guys walking, necessarily. →

name: MATT
line: (laughter) →

name: LAURA
line: But we get to be lazy. →

name: TRAVIS
line: But we're not walking. →

name: TRAVIS
line: (laughter) →

name: MATT
line: Because it is not a riding horse, it is a beast of burden, so it's about the same pace that you're going. As you guys pull slightly off into the grass, the cart bumps as it hits some rocks and patches of dirt and thick grass. They continue to pass, and as they do, you see the individuals. →

name: MATT
line: The one in the front has what looks to be a thick scarf tossed over the shoulder obscuring part of the face, and she gives a hand salute up to you as it passes and a bit of a head nod. As you wave your hand frantically, a bit of eye contact is made and continues past. →

name: LAURA
line: Are you going to Nicodranas? →

name: MATT
line: No response. The first cart continues past. →

name: LAURA
line: Hi. Hi, are you going to Nicodranas? →

name: MATT
line: The next one looks over to you for a second, the head cocked a little bit. "No, we are on our way to Port Zoon." →

name: LAURA
line: Oh. →

name: MATT
line: "By way of Nicodranas." →

name: LAURA
line: Oh! Did you come from Zadash? →

name: MATT
line: "We briefly did, yes, but we are returning. →

name: MATT
line: We have finished our wares and we have things to bring back to sell." →

name: LAURA
line: How far is it to Zadash? →

name: MATT
line: "Uh..." At this point he's passed by you and his voice gets a bit louder over his shoulder and he's like, "From this point, it's probably around 150 miles." →

name: LAURA
line: Thank you! →

name: MATT
line: The next one continues, one after another. →

name: MATT
line: You get a better look, too. The ones at the front that were pretty heavily covered, as opposed to the ones in the back which are a little taller, and as you look into the back, there's little flaps and openings on the inside, you can see there's families traveling. →

name: MARISHA
line: Does it look like they have any wares that they're traveling to trade? →

name: MATT
line: Make a perception check. →

name: MARISHA
line: That's a 16, I think. Yeah. 19. →

name: MATT
line: Glancing through, you can see the three wagons towards the back seem to be more for transport of people. It seems like either these merchants are bringing their family with them for long treks, so they're not apart from them for so long, or their family is just a family of traders or transport. Looking past them, you can see there are a lot of supplies behind them, but you're not sure if they're wares or just their personal goods. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Molly, feel like making some coin, doing a little bit of a show? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Hmm. →

name: MATT
line: The fifth cart's now passed. You're moving on to the sixth cart. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Do these people look like they're in the mood to stop? →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, do they look sad? →

name: MATT
line: Make an insight check. →

name: SAM
line: Do they look sad. →

name: TALIESIN
line: What's insight? →

name: LAURA
line: Plus five. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Oh, where do you see that? Oh! There it is. Thank you. 19. →

name: MATT
line: They don't look sad necessarily. They're on the road, just kind of looking out and keeping eyes on the vicinity and probably lost in thought. →

name: MATT
line: You do see a pair of children, hard to gauge their age at this distance, but they're under the age of ten at least, and they seem to look relatively bored. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'll balance one of the swords on my head and flash the cards and see if anybody bites. →

name: LAURA
line: As you drop them all over the ground. →

name: LIAM
line: Wakka wakka. →

name: MATT
line: You watch as the young boy, he has tangled black hair that poofs out a bit on the sides, he has a deeper brown skin, and he looks up at you with his bright blue eyes. As soon as you begin balancing the sword, he smiles a little bit and jabs his elbow into his sister who's a little bit older than him, who glances over and points. They both point towards you. You don't hear anything. →

name: MATT
line: They just point and smile as their cart pulls away, the sixth cart making distance from you. →

name: LAURA
line: He can tell your fortune! →

name: TALIESIN
line: They didn't poke the parents. →

name: LAURA
line: They're stupid. →

name: MATT
line: The caravan continues without you. →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah! →

name: TALIESIN
line: Ah, it's very good. →

name: LAURA
line: Is it? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Yes. →

name: LAURA
line: What does it mean? →

name: TALIESIN
line: It means that you're on a cart. →

name: LAURA
line: It was the chariot. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Would you normally, you know, hijack a caravan like that? →

name: SAM
line: I mean, we have in the past. If we are confident we can get away with it, we would. We could-- →

name: TALIESIN
line: Can you get away with something like that? →

name: SAM
line: There's a lot of people in that caravan though, it seems like a risky maneuver. →

name: LIAM
line: That's a pretty big matzo ball there. →

name: TALIESIN
line: And stealing is wrong. But if you did it, could you get away with it? →

name: SAM
line: We could probably get away with it. Why? You want to follow them and rob their shit? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Just going off what you said earlier. I don't want to change your behavior just because you're with us all of a sudden. →

name: SAM
line: I mean, sure. Let's go do it. →

name: LAURA
line: He's just trying to get you in trouble. →

name: SAM
line: Oh, okay. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I am not. Merely asking a question. →

name: MARISHA
line: Would you join in in the stand off? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Wait, what does that-- →

name: MARISHA
line: Would you join the stagecoach robbery? →

name: TRAVIS
line: If we're pointing them down, reach for the sky! →

name: TALIESIN
line: Careful, those fingers are loaded. →

name: LIAM
line: Yeah, but I would ask. Are you asking because that is something that you have no experience with or are you wondering maybe is that something that we could join you in? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Only because I have no experience in it, I was just curious what it was that you might have done, you know, previously. →

name: LAURA
line: Did you hijack a cart? →

name: SAM
line: No, we were more small-time thieves. We wouldn't typically hijack moving caravans. Usually we'd wait until they parked somewhere and then just go sneak on and steal something out of the back. →

name: LIAM
line: Mostly whatever we can walk away with. →

name: MARISHA
line: The things with moving carts of that big a family is they tend to prep. You don't know what kind of people or weapons they have with them. →

name: LIAM
line: Always go for a sure thing. →

name: MARISHA
line: You know how we're pretty sure that everyone on this road's going to kill us? Yeah, everyone else thinks that, too. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Fair enough. →

name: SAM
line: But if you need me to teach you how to steal, you can tag along sometime. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I might take you up on that, yeah. →

name: SAM
line: All right. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Interesting. →

name: MATT
line: Continuing on your path, I want to ask which two of you are taking point in keeping an eye on the road and the landscape around you as you progress? →

name: TRAVIS
line: (fake cough) Beau. →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, I'll take watch. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Oh, sorry. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. Beau and who else? →

name: TRAVIS
line: So generous of you. →

name: LAURA
line: You want to do it? →

name: TALIESIN
line: I was going to say, yeah. I'll take a round. I'm used to keeping an eye out on the road. →

name: MATT
line: So the two of you are taking point up until you guys decide to change it when it comes to travel along the road. →

name: MARISHA
line: It's just general perception? →

name: MATT
line: Yes. I would like you both, currently about an hour's journey past that intersection with the other caravan, to make a perception check. →

name: LAURA
line: Ooh! I bet someone's going to try to hijack our shit on the road just like we were talking about then. →

name: MARISHA
line: Not too bad. 18. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah! Smash. →

name: MATT
line: 18 and eight. Actually, both of you don't really notice anything. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh. Take that back. Take it back. →

name: MATT
line: Both of you keeping an eye out, the hills continue to roll. You see patches of trees and small wooded areas. Grass field is tall but it's beautiful and the light breeze that blows through, you can see the waves of wind as they come across. →

name: MATT
line: You can hear the faint sound of it moving the fields across. →

name: MARISHA
line: Is there a tree that looks climbable that I could get a vantage point? →

name: MATT
line: There is. It's maybe about 600 feet off the road, but you can try and head over there if you want to. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Plus we've been traveling for what? About hour and a half, two hours now? →

name: MATT
line: I'd say total right now, you've been probably on the road for about four hours. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh. →

name: TRAVIS
line: We should probably rest the horse for just a bit. →

name: TRAVIS
line: (laughter) →

name: MARISHA
line: Sure. Anyone want to take a quick pee break? →

name: LAURA
line: Yes. →

name: SAM
line: Yes, please. →

name: MARISHA
line: All right. Let's go over to the bushes. →

name: MATT
line: All right. So you guys leave the cart on the road or do you take it off to the side? →

name: SAM
line: Should leave a guard with the-- →

name: LAURA
line: We should lead it off the road. →

name: MARISHA
line: Can we take it with us fairly easily? →

name: MATT
line: I mean, you can. The progress will slow a bit because you're now taking it through the hills and the field and having to push the cart through the grass. →

name: LIAM
line: No, we should take it off the road. →

name: LAURA
line: Just off the road a little bit. →

name: MARISHA
line: Just off the road but we don't have to go all the way to the tree, I can-- →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'll sit with the cart for the first roll. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I'll stay with you. →

name: LIAM
line: Where are you going to do? →

name: MARISHA
line: I'm just going to go check out this tree over here. See if I can get a little better vantage. →

name: LIAM
line: Okay. I have a bird that can go probably higher than the tree, if you want. →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, kind of forgot about that. →

name: LIAM
line: Would you like me to do that? →

name: LAURA
line: Maybe she likes climbing trees. →

name: LIAM
line: Or you could. I don't want to rob you of the joy of climbing a good tree. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Or falling out of it, which we would really enjoy. →

name: TALIESIN
line: That would be actually extremely-- →

name: MARISHA
line: Both are very pleasant, but I do not necessarily need that to feel fulfilled. →

name: LIAM
line: Okay. Well, I will sit in the field then and give him a little chuck under the chin and-- oh, wait. Before I go away, am I looking for anything specific? →

name: MARISHA
line: Just people coming. →

name: LIAM
line: People coming. →

name: MATT
line: As the rest of you take a moment to step off to the side of the road, pull out some of your travel supplies to feed the horse, give it a rest. →

name: LAURA
line: Pick some flowers. →

name: MATT
line: Pick some flowers, which you can find. →

name: MATT
line: They're wildflowers. They're bright white, scattered and simple, but they're beautiful in their own right. You all take a bit to relieve yourselves a little ways off the road. You make your way towards the nearest tree and it's a cluster of about five or six that are nearby, this pocket where it seems like some seeds long ago got dropped by a bird, probably, over the sky, and then proceeded to grow and sprout. The lowest branch is about ten feet up, so you're going to have to take a quick leap and try and climb some of it. →

name: MARISHA
line: I wanted to wait for Caleb. →

name: MATT
line: Oh, that's right, you're waiting there. →

name: MATT
line: Never mind. You see that tree and you go, "I'll get to that later." →

name: MARISHA
line: It's a damn good tree. I do miss climbing trees. →

name: LAURA
line: Do you need me to lift you up to the branch? →

name: MATT
line: Your eyes cloud over. →

name: LIAM
line: They do. As the bird is flying, just for a second, I say: You know, ordinarily-- I can't hear you, but he's a cat almost all the time, so this is a rarity. You'll be able to climb many trees, many other times, but we should take advantage of him. Well, okay. →

name: LAURA
line: None of us were nearby when he was saying all of that. →

name: MATT
line: No, you guys were quite a ways off. No one was in earshot. →

name: TRAVIS
line: We were shitting in the bushes. →

name: MATT
line: A ladybug lands on his nose and goes in his nostril, but he can't feel it. →

name: LIAM
line: Feel it?! I can feel stuff! →

name: MATT
line: Maybe not this. You're too focused. →

name: LIAM
line: We worked out that he could-- okay, great. →

name: LIAM
line: There's bugs in my nose. →

name: MATT
line: It tickles a little bit. →

name: LIAM
line: Shove it all in, everybody! →

name: MATT
line: To be fair, your face itches in general from the sheer amount of filth that's on it. It's hard to really differentiate. →

name: LIAM
line: In the middle of the field you hear: Ooh, look at that! What do I see? →

name: MATT
line: Make a perception check for your birdie. →

name: LIAM
line: That's a nine. →

name: MATT
line: Glancing over and doing a wide pass around as everyone begins to gather their things and head towards the cart, the road's pretty open. At this point, the previous caravan is invisible from that height, the hills close that distance. You don't see anything coming your way. It seems pretty open and safe. →

name: LIAM
line: Okay. I keep flying for a little bit longer. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. →

name: LAURA
line: I lift Beau up to the branch just because. →

name: MARISHA
line: Okay. Feels like childhood. Do you want up here? →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah, I'll jump! →

name: MARISHA
line: All right, I lift her up. →

name: LAURA
line: We sit up in the branches. →

name: MATT
line: Okay, cool. It's a nice view. →

name: MATT
line: (laughter) →

name: TRAVIS
line: It's impossible to believe him. →

name: MARISHA
line: Is there anything carved in the branches, in the tree trunk? →

name: MATT
line: Make an investigation check. →

name: LIAM
line: The treant eats you. →

name: MATT
line: Shh, don't spoil it! →

name: MATT
line: No carvings of names or letters, but you do see a few knots in the tree that have currently been carved out and made a home to a number of woodland creatures. →

name: LAURA
line: I've never climbed a tree before. →

name: MARISHA
line: Really? →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah. This is really pretty. →

name: MARISHA
line: What do you think lives in that hole? →

name: LAURA
line: Probably very small unicorns. →

name: MARISHA
line: Have you ever seen an unicorn? →

name: LAURA
line: Yes, I've seen many. The little ones can be as small as hamsters. →

name: MARISHA
line: Pocket unicorns? →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah. →

name: MARISHA
line: Where do you find such things? →

name: LAURA
line: All over. You just have to know where to look. →

name: SAM
line: And believe. →

name: TALIESIN
line: She's starting to believe. →

name: MARISHA
line: What is it like being in your head? →

name: LAURA
line: It's pretty great! →

name: MATT
line: Eventually, you all gather yourselves again back at the wagon, cart it back onto the road, and head northward. Another few hours pass before the sun begins to set. As the sky grows darker, the clouds from the north-northeast begin to filter in with a colder wind. You get the sense that the warm day that you had is coming to a close and who knows how long the current cold weather will keep. →

name: MATT
line: The light begins to fade, darker and darker, until you get the sense that you have about 30 minutes before this field goes pitch black. →

name: LIAM
line: How cold is it out? →

name: MATT
line: You can see your breath. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh, that's pretty cold. →

name: MATT
line: Not super thick, but when you exhale you see a bit of the breath before you. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Should we pull off on the side of the road and get a campfire going? →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'd say let's get a bit off the road, if possible. →

name: MARISHA
line: Does it look like there's any trees or any base of mountains or any place that would be a good sheltered campsite? →

name: MATT
line: There are no mountains anywhere in the vicinity. You're in the center of the rolling hills. There is a cluster of trees you could go to that's about 300 feet or so off the road. It's three trees, so it's not a lot of cover, but unfortunately you're in the middle of a valley. →

name: TALIESIN
line: It'll do. →

name: LAURA
line: Can we get the horse over to them? →

name: MATT
line: It takes you a little bit. You spend about 45 minutes in pitch dark keeping an eye in that direction before you come upon the tree. You can faintly see the outline of the tree against the faint bit of light making it through the cloud cover. →

name: MATT
line: You guys stop there, get the horse a little bit of water and feed, and the site's yours. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Set a tent. Start a fire. →

name: LAURA
line: This is why we should've taken one of the circus tents. →

name: TALIESIN
line: They take an awful lot of time to put up. You do know this. There's a process. →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah, but think about how cool it would be to camp in one. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Oh, it would be amazing. I've done it. →

name: TALIESIN
line: It's great, but this is nice, too. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Shall we collect some wood and start a fire? →

name: SAM
line: Sounds good. →

name: MATT
line: Who's starting the fire? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Anybody want to come with me to find some kindling? →

name: MARISHA
line: I have an adventurer's kit. Does that have a tinder in it? →

name: MATT
line: You can do that. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Shall we? →

name: MARISHA
line: Sure. →

name: TRAVIS
line: All right. Go look for some dead-ish branches. →

name: MARISHA
line: I'm a little-- you be my eyes. It's super dark. →

name: SAM
line: Maybe you shouldn't go. →

name: MARISHA
line: You know what, I'll start digging a little pit. →

name: LIAM
line: Now, hold on. I pull a rag out, and I (poof) one of the Dancing Lights, and make that hooded lantern again so that you can see. →

name: MATT
line: With that light, it's easy enough to find some small kindling. There's not a whole lot in the vicinity, mainly being that it's an open field. But you find a few pieces of fallen tree and general dead plant life in the vicinity that can get something going. →

name: TALIESIN
line: We can chop it up. →

name: MATT
line: Eventually you get a fire going. It's a little beacon of light here in the darkness, orange-ish flickering against the interior of the three trees as you guys are situated there. →

name: MATT
line: You figure you've made it a little under halfway to Alfield, which is the small city on the way to Zadash. It'll take you a little over a day's travel, or if you push it ahead you could probably make it in a day, but you can run the risk of getting tired. But for resting this evening, who wants to take watch? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Nobody. We're all going to sleep. →

name: LIAM
line: While they decide that, I'm going to pull out my silver thread and I'm going to start winding a 20-foot circle around the fire. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh, nice. →

name: LAURA
line: I get my little bouquet of wildflowers and I give it to Nott. →

name: SAM
line: Oh, that's very nice of you. →

name: LAURA
line: Well, you said all girls like flowers. →

name: SAM
line: We do. That's very nice of you, thank you. →

name: SAM
line: What did I do to deserve this? →

name: LAURA
line: I don't know, you are my friend. →

name: TALIESIN
line: A single tear pours down a porcelain cheek. →

name: LAURA
line: I'll take first watch. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. →

name: LIAM
line: Everybody hears a little (ting) as I hit a little bell that I have that's part of it. →

name: LIAM
line: And that's it. →

name: SAM
line: I'll sit up with you, Jester, and take first watch, 1B. →

name: LAURA
line: I like it. →

name: MATT
line: All right. We'll say for the purposes of expediency on this, I'll take three perception rolls from three different people that are keeping watch throughout the evening. So with the setup of your spell, you go to rest. Jester, you first. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh, god damn it! →

name: SAM
line: No, it's pretty good. →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah, one. So pretty good. →

name: MATT
line: All right, natural one. About ten minutes-- →

name: LAURA
line: Sorry, guys. →

name: MATT
line: About ten minutes into your watch, the inspiration hits for you to start drawing interesting faces and weird trees. You start sketching-- →

name: LAURA
line: Little tiny hamster unicorns! →

name: MATT
line: There you go. As you begin to sketch, you are not paying attention at all to the area around you. →

name: LAURA
line: It's really cute! All wrapped up in a little swaddling blanket! →

name: MARISHA
line: Little hamster tails! Oh man! →

name: MATT
line: Giant miniatures space unicorns. However, even though you rolled really poorly, your watch goes through unabated. Second watch, who's taking that? →

name: LAURA
line: I'm so tired! (snores) →

name: LIAM
line: I will stay up for a little bit, yeah. →

name: MATT
line: All right. Go ahead and roll a perception check, please. →

name: LAURA
line: (chanting) Caleb! →

name: LIAM
line: Oh, that's pretty good. That's a 19. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. Keeping an eye out, you see a little ways off-- it's hard to make out any shapes because of your human eyes and, with the firelight that's near you, your eyes can't adjust to the darkness as well, but there are bits and pieces where the clouds do break, the moonlight comes down and you can see a distant shape that's moving through the field maybe about 400 feet off. You can see it pushing through the height of the grass, moving slowly. →

name: LIAM
line: Am I the only one awake at this moment? →

name: MATT
line: Yep. →

name: LIAM
line: I slowly jiggle Nott awake. (whispers) Get up. →

name: SAM
line: It was violin class! What? →

name: LIAM
line: I put a hand over her mouth. →

name: SAM
line: What's going on? →

name: LIAM
line: There is a thing out around our fire a ways off. →

name: SAM
line: Why did we leave you on watch? You can't see in the dark! →

name: LIAM
line: No, I saw the shape. It's not dark, there's a fire here. →

name: SAM
line: Okay, let me sneak around and look. Right? We don't want to wake everyone because-- →

name: LIAM
line: Because we want them to die? I think we should probably wake everyone. →

name: SAM
line: What if it's nothing? Then they'll be upset with us. There's nothing more dangerous than-- →

name: LIAM
line: I shake Beau awake. →

name: SAM
line: No, she's the most irritable! →

name: MARISHA
line: I'm what? →

name: SAM
line: Sorry. →

name: MARISHA
line: Did you say I'm fucking irritable? →

name: LIAM
line: She said "most beautiful." There's a thing out there in the field. Something is moving. →

name: LAURA
line: She can't see! She's human, too! (laughter) →

name: SAM
line: I'm going to go look! I can see in the dark. →

name: LIAM
line: No, wait here! →

name: SAM
line: I'm going to dart off in a flanking maneuver. →

name: MATT
line: Make a stealth check. →

name: SAM
line: 18 plus stuff. →

name: LIAM
line: As soon as I see her do that, I start swatting Fjord on the back to wake him up. →

name: MARISHA
line: What do I see? →

name: MATT
line: You vaguely see the shape moving, but it's hard to see, and only because of the moonlight. →

name: MATT
line: Nott, as you stealth up and quickly move through the grass, eventually you hear this (soft grunting). →

name: MATT
line: You glance up and see there is not one, but three large buffalo-type creatures that are lumbering through the fields. →

name: SAM
line: Buffalo-type creatures, or buffalo? →

name: MATT
line: You're not sure. You're not close enough to see. You see they're bipedal, they're thick and muscular, and they have these large horns that curl off to the side and out. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Bipedal? →

name: MATT
line: Sorry, quadruped, not bipedal. →

name: SAM
line: How far am I from the camp? →

name: MATT
line: You're about, maybe, 80 to 100 feet from it. →

name: SAM
line: Cool. I'm going to pull out a piece of copper wire and, remembering the motions that Caleb taught me, I'm going to twirl it around in my hand and hold it up to my mouth and whisper a Message just to Caleb. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Oh shit, what?! →

name: SAM
line: I'm going to say: it's three buffalo, or buffalo-type objects. Creatures. What do you want me to do? (fwoosh) →

name: LIAM
line: I'm so proud! I don't know that spell, so I cannot talk back. →

name: SAM
line: Yes, you can! →

name: LIAM
line: What? Who said that? If you can can hear me-- I don't think you can-- come back with the group. →

name: SAM
line: All right. →

name: LAURA
line: Can you hear him? →

name: LIAM
line: Is that how Message works? →

name: SAM
line: Yes, I can hear you. →

name: LAURA
line: That is awesome! →

name: MATT
line: The whispers continue back and forth. →

name: SAM
line: It's just one back and forth. I can talk to him, he can reply once. That's it. →

name: MATT
line: For one round. →

name: LIAM
line: For one round, so six seconds. →

name: LAURA
line: Sick. →

name: MATT
line: It's a cantrip. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh my gosh, I love it. →

name: LIAM
line: Oh, if it's a cantrip, you can do it over and over again. →

name: LAURA
line: It's a cantrip? →

name: SAM
line: Is it? Oh, it is! Ooh, this is exciting! I've never had magic before. →

name: LIAM
line: It's two soup cans with a string. →

name: MATT
line: Essentially. →

name: LAURA
line: How far does it go? →

name: SAM
line: You don't know! →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah, there you go. →

name: SAM
line: You're drawing hamsters. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh, the cutest unicorn hamsters. →

name: MATT
line: So Nott, what are you doing? →

name: SAM
line: He said to come back, so I'm coming back. On the way back, I'm going to see if they're eating or sleeping. What are they doing? →

name: MATT
line: They're just moving. As you head back to the camp, you can see they pass and continue heading in the southwestern direction in the field, not taking notice of your fire or the encampment. →

name: SAM
line: They could be good for meat. We could go kill them and eat them for meat. →

name: LIAM
line: Is she back? →

name: MATT
line: Yes. →

name: LIAM
line: I scoop her up. Look at you! You cast a spell, you spoke to me! →

name: SAM
line: You said to do the hand movements and the whispery thing. And I did it and it worked! →

name: LIAM
line: It's as simple as that, isn't it? →

name: SAM
line: Yes! →

name: LIAM
line: Oh, I'm so proud of you! We need to calm down and go back to bed. →

name: SAM
line: Oh, but we could've eaten those buffalo-type creatures. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Hey, what the fuck did you wake us up for, anyway? →

name: LIAM
line: (laughs nervously) Got you. →

name: TRAVIS
line: That's a joke? →

name: LIAM
line: No. I thought we were all going to die, but it was just-- what was it? →

name: SAM
line: Three large beasts of burden. Wait, we could use them to pull the cart! →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah! Where are they? →

name: SAM
line: They went that way! In the dark! →

name: MARISHA
line: You sure they were just cows? Or donkeys? Or buffalo-type things? →

name: SAM
line: I don't know! I don't know what they were, but they looked big and able to pull the cart. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Let's go look at one. →

name: SAM
line: You want to go cow-tipping, don't you? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Fuck yeah! Take me cow-tipping, son! Woo! →

name: LIAM
line: Echoes in the field. (echoing sounds) →

name: SAM
line: What happened? →

name: TRAVIS
line: I don't know. Back in college. →

name: SAM
line: Are we going to go after them or are we going to go back to sleep? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah, let's go look at one. →

name: LIAM
line: Well, shit. I guess we're going to look at a buffalo. →

name: SAM
line: Let's go! →

name: LAURA
line: I'm still sleeping. →

name: MATT
line: While Molly and Jester continue to enjoy their continued long rest, you all interrupt it to get up, and head in the direction of these creatures. I would like you all to make a stealth check, please. →

name: MATT
line: All right. The four of you, shoulder to shoulder, keeping low, making your way through the field, stepping ever so carefully. And there's this (croaking) as one of you accidentally goes completely foot down on to some sort of field frog that had been there. As the croak hits, you watch as one of the creatures (startled grunting), and they all start running away, spooked by the sound. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Shit. →

name: MARISHA
line: Can we tell what they are? Now that we're closer? →

name: MATT
line: Make a perception check, if you want to. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I'd like to, with my darkvision. →

name: MATT
line: At disadvantage on you, unfortunately, at this distance. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Welcome to human. →

name: MARISHA
line: Six. →

name: MATT
line: They look like buffalo-like creatures. →

name: MATT
line: They look like buffalo. →

name: SAM
line: You'll never know what they were. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Well, that was worth a look. →

name: MATT
line: You aren't too familiar with a lot of the indigenous animals that live or have been brought to this region if they haven't been near the port towns that you grew up in. You haven't seen these types of creatures before, but you vaguely know they're in the ballpark of what a buffalo, you imagine, looks like. →

name: TRAVIS
line: It's vaguely what I imagine a buffalo would look like. →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah. →

name: SAM
line: Sorry. →

name: MARISHA
line: That was fun, let's go. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Back to sleep. →

name: LIAM
line: Silently ruffle Nott's hair on the way back to camp. →

name: SAM
line: Stop it. →

name: LAURA
line: (singing) Who's got the third watch? →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'll take it. →

name: LIAM
line: Turd watch. →

name: MATT
line: All right. Molly has the third watch. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Turd watch. →

name: MATT
line: Perception check, please. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh no! →

name: TALIESIN
line: Six. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. As you keep an eye out, everyone else sleeps throughout the evening. Eventually, you nod off, and fall asleep with the rest of them. I would like to ask all of you to leave the table for a moment, except for Fjord. →

name: TRAVIS
line: For me?! →

name: MATT
line: Yeah. →

name: MARISHA
line: It's your turn now! →

name: TRAVIS
line: Why? (shouting) Why didn't you roll a higher perception? →

name: TALIESIN
line: I literally don't know. That's actually the problem. →

name: MARISHA
line: Just don't get a lich phylactery installed in you again. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Travis, it's been nice playing with you. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Oh god. Oh no! →

name: TALIESIN
line: I thoroughly enjoyed your accent. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Oh shit! →

name: MATT
line: Fjord, as darkness takes your mind, dreamless like most, you await the emptiness of sleep to carry you to the day. Your sense of body fades, but your mind and the dark linger. Minutes, hours, days. Time loses real sense and meaning, but you're conscious for it and that is almost maddening, in that split second or endless stretch of experience that you're currently unable to express. As the time passes, the air grows colder around you. The faint shimmer of shifting midnight blue, muted and distant, now showing endless depth before you, rippling. You begin to flail about, your senses returning with the dropping temperature, but there is resistance to your limbs as you push in the space around you. You're sluggish. There's force. It's not air, it's water. →

name: MATT
line: You suddenly feel the burning pain in your lungs as your breath fights to escape you, but you hold tight. You seize and swim in desperation, choosing any direction, but the shimmering blue is directionless. There is no up, there is no down. →

name: MATT
line: It's just depth. Movement. The universal shadows dance as one, right to left. With a speed that pulls you along with the current, you feel yourself being jostled. As it shifts again to the left to right, around behind you, you find yourself toppling, head over end, eventually coming to rest again. You spiral over and over again, the darkness swallowing you, tightening around you as this dance, this shape, this endless coil, this spiral around you. As the current tugs at you, battering you, you cannot fight any more as the increased power of the current pulls on your form. You cough, and the freezing waters rush into your body, the briny taste of salt water stinging your insides. Your wincing eyes open with the pain that clutches the interior of your chest, only to see a gargantuan mass moving through the water around you, like a massive noose closing in. →

name: MATT
line: The pain in your chest vanishes. As your breathing normalizes-- thicker than air, but breathable all the same-- it feels strange yet weirdly familiar. →

name: MATT
line: In that moment, yellow light bursts before you in the shape of an enormous yellow eye. An impossibly low tone rumbles through the waters around you, shaking you to your core, like an organic war horn the size of a canyon. The eye narrows as the tone grows stronger. A thought enters your mind, a jumble of emotions that your brain attempts to make sense of until a word congeals into the center of your consciousness: "Watching." The eye just looks at you, waiting expectantly. →

name: TRAVIS
line: (English accent) What are you? →

name: MATT
line: "Watching." →

name: TRAVIS
line: Watching me? →

name: MATT
line: The eye opens a bit and leans closer towards you. "Potential." →

name: TRAVIS
line: My potential? What are you asking of me? →

name: MATT
line: "Learn." →

name: TRAVIS
line: Learn. What would you have me learn? →

name: MATT
line: "Learn. Grow. Provoke. Consume." →

name: TRAVIS
line: Learn, grow, provoke, consume. I don't understand. →

name: MATT
line: "Reward." →

name: TRAVIS
line: A reward for this? I'm listening. →

name: MATT
line: "Patience." The eye closes, and the light is gone. You feel the darkness and the cold completely suffuse your entire world as the panic and solitude, the true quiet of your unconsciousness, begins to take hold. At that moment, you gasp for breath, and your eyes open, coughing and sputtering in the morning air. If we could have everybody else come back to the table, please! Call them back in. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Fuck. Fuck you! What were those words?! →

name: MATT
line: Watching, potential, learn, grow, provoke, consume. We'll go over the rest later. Come on in! →

name: SAM
line: Are we supposed to come back? →

name: MATT
line: Yes, you're supposed to come back in. →

name: LAURA
line: We're supposed to come in! →

name: MATT
line: You are. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Sorry, I found a patch of strawberries. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Everybody back? →

name: MATT
line: Everybody back. →

name: LIAM
line: Are you okay? We're fine? Everything's good? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah! We're fine. We're great. Just doing dandy. Yep. →

name: LIAM
line: You would tell us if something was wrong? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Of course. →

name: SAM
line: That was fast. You really fought five guys in an alleyway that fast? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Sometimes it doesn't take that long, you know what I mean? →

name: LAURA
line: What does he look like? What are we doing? →

name: MATT
line: As the rest of you have already come to consciousness in the morning air, begun to situate your belongings and put out the embers of the fire that lasted-- pardon-- throughout the night. Your morning belches getting out. Fjord has slept in, and has been ever so still in his sleep. Suddenly, without warning, he suddenly shoots up from his sleep, his eyes wide, and as he opens his mouth, begins coughing and spitting water up. →

name: TRAVIS
line: (coughing) →

name: SAM
line: Oh no, he's injured! →

name: LAURA
line: Fjord! Have I ever seen this happen to him before? →

name: MATT
line: No. →

name: LIAM
line: Can you speak? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah. No, I'm fine. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Yeah, you look it. →

name: LIAM
line: You just spit a lot of water out and you were sleeping. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Was it a lot of water? →

name: MATT
line: It was a sizeable glass filled with water. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm going to do something very weird. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm going to walk over and dampen my hand on the water on his chest really quickly and (sniffing). →

name: MATT
line: It's briny and salty. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Huh. →

name: SAM
line: Why are you drinking salt water? →

name: TALIESIN
line: You don't know that. →

name: SAM
line: Oh. (in Sam's voice) Why are you drinking salt water? (laughter) →

name: LAURA
line: Jeez, Fjord. That's a lot of drool. →

name: MARISHA
line: Does it taste like stomach acid? Because that's gross, man. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Only one way to find out! →

name: TRAVIS
line: Like a momma bird. Everybody have some of what I puked up. It's all good. →

name: LIAM
line: I don't, I want to make an insight check. →

name: LIAM
line: He's talking about acid reflux but he just spit a bunch of water out. →

name: MATT
line: Yeah, make an insight check. →

name: LIAM
line: Yeah, okay. That's 22. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah, I don't think it was acid reflux. →

name: MARISHA
line: You taste like a seaman. →

name: MARISHA
line: (laughter) →

name: TRAVIS
line: I don't know. I want to shake your hand, but at the same time, I want to smash it. →

name: MATT
line: I've never been more proud of my wife. →

name: TALIESIN
line: That's not normal. →

name: LAURA
line: What happened, Fjord? →

name: LIAM
line: Does he seem full of shit to me? →

name: MATT
line: Seems like he's covering some confusion or at least trying to deflect. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I had a dream, I'm sorry. A vivid one. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Just shook me to my core a little. I'll be fine, really. It's not a common thing. →

name: LAURA
line: Why the water, though? →

name: TRAVIS
line: I don't know. →

name: MARISHA
line: You never told me where you got that sword. I mean, because I saw it get a little soggy, a little drippy, when we were fighting the frog thing, so, you know. →

name: MATT
line: As you glance down at your sheath on the ground, it is empty. There is no falchion. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah. That sword is a pickle. →

name: MARISHA
line: It's a pickled sword? Are there benefits to pickling your weapons? →

name: TRAVIS
line: It's a mystery. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh, right. →

name: TALIESIN
line: He's not wrong, though. It actually is a pickle. You can taste it. →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah. It is very salty. →

name: LAURA
line: I do like pickles. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Yeah, it's not bad. →

name: LIAM
line: Is our group going to be all about puns and that stuff? →

name: SAM
line: It's the lowest form of humor. →

name: LAURA
line: Is it really the lowest? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Level three. →

name: MARISHA
line: Okay, there are some pun competitions that get serious. →

name: SAM
line: Are you all right, Fjord? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah. I feel funny. Caleb, you remember me asking you about your arcane prowess? →

name: LIAM
line: Yeah. →

name: TRAVIS
line: My small experience with the arcane came to me around the same time that sword did. →

name: LIAM
line: How long ago was that? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Not too long ago. Very recent. Right before I met up with Jester. →

name: SAM
line: Were you in the ocean? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah, I was. Did a lot of merchant sailing, previously. Had one trip that didn't go so well. Suffice it to say, after it was done, I found that sword. →

name: MARISHA
line: What happened on the trip? Rough waters? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah. →

name: SAM
line: Did anyone die? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah, I'm not real comfortable talking about it. →

name: LIAM
line: What about the sword? You said you found it on the ocean, you found on the boat you were on? You were on an island? What do you mean? →

name: TRAVIS
line: I found it on the shore. When I got back to land, it was just there. I'm not super familiar with a ton of weaponry-- the sword I know, I had some training in it, but this seemed like a unique sword. I felt like it almost called to me. I know how that sounds, but when I picked it up, seemed like everything changed. Ever since, I've been able to do more things. Been able to reach out with some of the stuff I've seen you do. That's why I'm trying to make it up to the Academy. I'm trying to figure out what it is that I have. →

name: LIAM
line: DM, when I cast Detect Magic in the first game, in the tavern, did that sword light up? →

name: MATT
line: No. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I don't mean to alarm any of you, really. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I'm trying to be as forthright as I can. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Where is the sword right now? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Can I make it appear? →

name: MATT
line: You look down, and it's not in the sheath. →

name: MATT
line: You glance around, it's nowhere near you. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I focus. Reach down. →

name: MATT
line: He looks down at his open palm, and there is a flash of greenish-blue, teal energy out of his grip. There, clutched within his grasp, you see the falchion, coated in the remnants of sea floor life. You see the barnacles encrusted around the edge and up the back of the blade, as it begins to drip water. The same kind that was coughed up by Fjord this morning. →

name: TRAVIS
line: You can see why I'm a little curious about this item. →

name: TALIESIN
line: That's a great trick. →

name: LIAM
line: I don't even need to touch it, but would you trust me to study it for a moment? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Do you have any experience with items like this? →

name: LIAM
line: I'm good at figuring things out. I'm clever. →

name: MARISHA
line: I might be able help you with that. I was obsessed with underwater life and mermaids, so I've read a few books. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Could we revisit that idea, perhaps? I'm sorry, the night has left me a bit shaken, and I feel like I need a moment to get my bearings, if that's all right. →

name: LIAM
line: Ja, you can understand that we would be curious, but I don't want to push anybody. I mean, we've just met. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Of course not, and I don't want to make anyone feel uneasy. Again, trying to be as transparent as I can. I don't quite understand, and I appreciate your patience in advance. And I make it vanish. →

name: MATT
line: You watch as it just disappears out of your grip. →

name: LIAM
line: When he says he doesn't quite understand, is he telling the truth? Is that the same insight check? →

name: MATT
line: You have to make a new one. →

name: TALIESIN
line: This whole story, I've been watching. →

name: MATT
line: As far as you can tell, as forthright and honest as you've heard him be. →

name: TALIESIN
line: That's so disappointing. All right. →

name: LAURA
line: Fjord, do you think you're slowly turning into water? →

name: TRAVIS
line: (sighs) No. I hadn't considered that terrifying thought, but thanks. I'll just add that to the fucking list. →

name: LAURA
line: If you feel like it's happening, let us know and we'll try to catch you in a jar. →

name: TRAVIS
line: In a jar? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Unless he runs away. →

name: SAM
line: We're not going to let you run into the dirt. →

name: LAURA
line: Maybe something can happen. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Tell you what, I start sweating real hard, I'll let you know, okay? →

name: TALIESIN
line: He's fine. →

name: MARISHA
line: Has that happened to you before, by the way? The whole, "waking up coughing salt water" thing? →

name: TRAVIS
line: I don't really remember. →

name: LIAM
line: You wouldn't have to remember that far back. →

name: LIAM
line: You said that this all started just a few weeks ago, when you met this one. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I don't really remember my dreams all that well. They leave me quickly. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I remember all of mine, I don't know. →

name: LAURA
line: I've never seen him wake up with water all over him. →

name: MARISHA
line: Well, excited to see what unfolds. Shall we? →

name: TALIESIN
line: If you're going to vomit something, salt water's pretty decent. It could have been way worse. →

name: LAURA
line: Of all things, it's way better than vomit. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Oh, it's far superior. Already, you're proving to be an asset. →

name: LAURA
line: If we get really thirsty, we'll just come to you in the morning. →

name: TALIESIN
line: You can't drink-- the salt water makes you thirstier. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh, really? →

name: TALIESIN
line: It feels like you should be able to, but you can't. →

name: SAM
line: Should we get back on the road, then? →

name: TRAVIS
line: If you wouldn't mind. →

name: SAM
line: How is Horse doing today? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Horse? →

name: SAM
line: How's Horse? →

name: LAURA
line: What is his name? →

name: LIAM
line: I was wondering the very same thing, actually, all night. I was wondering what we would call-- →

name: LAURA
line: This horse? Maybe he has a name. Molly? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Does the horse have a name? If it did, I'll make one up. →

name: MATT
line: It probably had a few names, in travel, and you've gone through a few horses. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Try not to name them. We're just going to end up eating them. →

name: MATT
line: So whatever you come up with. →

name: TALIESIN
line: His name was Winter's Crest. If he lived that long, that was when we were going to butcher him and eat him. You can rename him, it's fine. →

name: LAURA
line: I like it, it's like a celebration. →

name: TALIESIN
line: That was the plan. →

name: SAM
line: Maybe for short we'll call him W.C. →

name: LIAM
line: You were going to butcher, at Winter's Crest, and that's a special treat? →

name: TALIESIN
line: It means you're going to eat meat, and then you're going to make some jerky, and then you're going to buy another horse with the money you make. →

name: MATT
line: Interesting point, too: For most of you, Winter's Crest would have little meaning. It's largely celebrated in continents to the west, as it is specific to a historic event that did not happen in Wildemount. But you're a carnival, so you guys have more of a vast and strange knowledge. →

name: TALIESIN
line: We celebrate everything. →

name: MATT
line: When he says Winter's Crest, maybe Beau. →

name: LIAM
line: Have I ever read about it? →

name: LAURA
line: I feel like my mom saw lots of visitors from other places. →

name: MATT
line: It's possible, but just for a bit of information. →

name: MARISHA
line: I feel like the snooty town that I came from would have a Winter's Crest festival, like how we have Oktoberfests out here. Even though we have no real business having them, yeah. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Just glögg. Lots and lots of glögg. →

name: MATT
line: As you guys look off, at this conversation with the horse, the horse is currently about 30 feet off in the field, eating grass out of the field. →

name: TALIESIN
line: If you're on the road long enough, you eat a lot of animals. You eat a lot of beasts of burden. →

name: LAURA
line: I wander over to the wagon and I go and sit down and start drawing, because I need to. I need to spend a little time. →

name: LIAM
line: I pull Nott over. Do you know what W.C. →

name: LIAM
line: means in Zemnian? →

name: SAM
line: What does it mean? →

name: LIAM
line: Toilet. →

name: SAM
line: It's a pun. →

name: SAM
line: (laughter) →

name: LIAM
line: I give her a little fistbump. →

name: MATT
line: As you guys gather up, in the fresh morning air, back into the cart. →

name: MARISHA
line: Do some pull-ups on the tree branches. →

name: MATT
line: As Beau gets nice and swole for the morning. →

name: LIAM
line: Vasquez. →

name: MARISHA
line: Just a little bit. →

name: TRAVIS
line: You're just too bad, Vasquez. →

name: MATT
line: (laughter) Vasquez is a pretty good print. →

name: MATT
line: I think we were talking, Vasquez and Starbuck from the new Battlestar are both good character prints for Beau. Yeah, love that. As you guys bring the cart back up onto the Amber Road, northward, you begin your second-day trek. You guys push on for a few hours. Is it still Beau and Mollymauk keeping point? →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'll keep. →

name: MARISHA
line: I don't mind. →

name: MATT
line: I'll have both of you roll a perception check, please. →

name: MARISHA
line: Do we have the highest perception? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Ugh. I did until it bounced. →

name: MARISHA
line: Fuck. I almost got-- samesies. 11. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Five. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. →

name: LAURA
line: I have decent perception, what's yours? →

name: MATT
line: Calm fields. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I might be distracted looking for things that I can pluck out of the fields. All right. →

name: MATT
line: You push on for a few more hours, the afternoon staring to get late. You can choose soon, when it gets dark, to set up camp again and stay another evening out in the fields, or you get a sense looking at the map that you had procured that if you push an extra hour or so past, you could probably make it to Alfield before the night's done. →

name: SAM
line: Let's do that. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Most of us can see in the dark, it's not a big deal. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah. →

name: LAURA
line: Okay. You guys just hunker down in the wagon, okay? You be safe. →

name: MARISHA
line: Deal. →

name: LIAM
line: Must be nice. →

name: TRAVIS
line: (singing) Must be nice. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Can't say that, ah! →

name: MATT
line: All righty. You guys push forward, kind of pick up the pace a bit, but the horse and those of you who are on the sides of the cart, if you wish to, you can jog along the side to alleviate some of the burden. →

name: MARISHA
line: I'm going to scan still while I'm-- →

name: MATT
line: Keeping an eye out. →

name: MARISHA
line: With my shitty vision. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. The sun does eventually close towards the Cyrios Mountains to the west and night begins to fall. At this point, you do see just over the distance in the hill as darkness comes, you can see the faint glow, a cluster of light, of a village in the distant hills. You get the sense that this is probably Alfield at the perimeter of your vision. As you continue to push forward, you've now gone past eight hours of continuous travel into the ninth hour. I would like you all to roll a constitution saving throw, please. →

name: MARISHA
line: Natural 20. →

name: LAURA
line: Whoa. That's because you guys are-- oh, no, you're riding in the cart. →

name: MARISHA
line: I'm riding. →

name: MARISHA
line: I'm just like: What's wrong? →

name: LIAM
line: Nine. →

name: MATT
line: Nine as well? Wow. It's like Rammstein on that side of the table. →

name: MATT
line: (laughter) →

name: TRAVIS
line: Nein! Cookie monster. →

name: MATT
line: All right. So the three of you take one level of exhaustion. →

name: LAURA
line: Aw. How do we do that in here? →

name: LIAM
line: How does that affect us, again? →

name: MATT
line: This is a good thing to look up. →

name: MATT
line: Essentially, per point of exhaustion-- →

name: TALIESIN
line: So you go to your HP. →

name: MATT
line: There you go. So you have disadvantage on ability checks until you take a long rest to get rid of it. →

name: LAURA
line: Disadvantage on abilities? →

name: MATT
line: Yes. On ability checks, so skills and things like that. →

name: LAURA
line: Okay, okay, okay. →

name: MATT
line: All right. You guys are-- you're a few-- you're probably about a half mile away from Alfield and it looks, even at this distance, a bit smaller than Trostenwald, where you were. You can see the faint clusters of trees on the north, eastern and northeastern sides of the city, otherwise it's just in this pocket behind a few hills. It's a bit podunk in size, you can gather from this distance, but it's welcoming. There's a flash of orange light on the outskirts of town. →

name: LIAM
line: Did that look arcane to me? →

name: MATT
line: No, it just looked like a flash. I mean, it could have been arcane. It's hard to tell at this distance, it's quite a ways away. →

name: TALIESIN
line: That's weird. →

name: MATT
line: There's a second one. (flash) You faintly see what looks like the distant curl of flames beginning to spread across what appears to be a roof. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Oh shit. →

name: LAURA
line: Oh no. →

name: MARISHA
line: Think we just watched someone commit arson, you guys! →

name: TRAVIS
line: That's not really a-- →

name: MARISHA
line: Let's go kick their ass. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah, let's do that. →

name: LAURA
line: Does it look like the fire is spreading at all? →

name: MATT
line: I mean, as you sit here and watch-- →

name: LAURA
line: We're walking. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Let's head that direction and start yelling at people. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Full sprint. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Fire! →

name: MATT
line: You guys begin to go into a faster jog in that direction. As you do, you can see the fire is now beginning to consume a handful of buildings and the flames are beginning to flicker higher. →

name: MATT
line: You begin to hear in the distance a very faint high-pitched yelp or some sort of a screech. It's hard to make it out at this distance, it's an open field area and it's mingling with what sounds like now dozens of voices screaming and entwining. As you can see the uncontrolled flames still progressing on the eastern side of the village, you can just see, as you get within a few hundred feet of the western side of Alfield, people just running. Villagers, probably a few hundred of them, are now just running out of the town as you guys begin to approach. Towards you and out into the field. So as you're approaching, they're coming your direction. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm going to stop one and ask what happened. →

name: MATT
line: As you glance over, you see a family of five halflings rushing right past you. The mother is dragging two of the younger ones by the hand while the father is running alongside the eldest daughter, probably in her teens. The father wears a leather cap and has a handlebar mustache and simple farm clothing. As you shout out, he makes your eye contact. →

name: TALIESIN
line: What has happened? →

name: MATT
line: "Oh, I don't know what happened. They started to burn the buildings and these things started rushing. The city is under attack." →

name: LAURA
line: What things? →

name: MATT
line: (panicked) "Big things. Dog-faced. I can't-- Come on." They just keep running. →

name: LAURA
line: Dogs are attacking the village! →

name: MATT
