You catch it with your hand, but it's still a few inches into your actual midsection. Then there's the one over here that turned around and sees you now engaging with the current pack leader. →

name: TRAVIS
line: But I'm a gnoll! Ah! →

name: MATT
line: That's a 15. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I'm just confused, that hits. →

name: MATT
line: That's going to be six points of piercing damage. This one now slams into the side of your knee, and hits the meaty part, so thankfully it's not locked in the bone or any of the joint, but it hits you in the side and you buckle to that side from the pain. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Understood. →

name: MATT
line: This guy over here is going to leap down and begin helping push the cart. →

name: ALL
line: No! →

name: MATT
line: With that, the cart pushes another full 40 feet and is currently off of the board. Let me mark it over here. →

name: MARISHA
line: How do we feel about the cart? →

name: LAURA
line: We got to get the cart! →

name: SAM
line: I can take a shot at the cart, but what is one arrow going to do? →

name: TALIESIN
line: We can take out people pushing it. →

name: MATT
line: That finishes the gnolls' turn there. Oh, there's the one that's attacking Molly. It's going to take its spear and attempt to two-hand strike at you. That is cocked. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Does he have a spear? I thought he had a bow. Oh, he's got both. →

name: MATT
line: 13 to hit, which I don't think hits. →

name: TALIESIN
line: No, it does not hit. →

name: MATT
line: You, on the wall, dance off the way, leap as it goes up. All right, and I believe that's all the gnolls immediately in the vicinity that are in combat. That ends the gnolls' turn. Fjord, you're up. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah, great, awesome, sweet. Can I use Eldritch Blast against the big fucking guy, because he didn't get any closer for a melee attack, right? →

name: MATT
line: You're still within his attack range, because he has the glaive. You do have disadvantage on Eldritch Blast. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Oh. Imma fucking move out of his attack range. Does that give him attack of opportunity? →

name: ALL
line: Yes. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah, I'm doing that anyway. I'm going to move back towards the corner where I was going. →

name: MATT
line: Right there? →

name: TRAVIS
line: No, all the way back. Back towards my original hiding place. →

name: MATT
line: You pull back to the corner there. As you pull back, he takes a step forward and reaches out with the glaive to try and strike you. →

name: SAM
line: Does he have any disadvantage or anything? →

name: MATT
line: Nope. That is a 23 to hit. →

name: TRAVIS
line: That hits. →

name: MATT
line: That is going to be ten points of slashing damage. As you back away, arcs downward. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I will now, out of his melee range, Eldritch Blast. Ugh, God, that's not great. 13. →

name: MATT
line: 13 does not hit. Now that it's seen the Blast, after it strikes and grins you hear this (hyena chuckle) under its breath. You turn around and go to strike out with the Eldritch Blast, and it pulls one of the other gnolls nearby and yanks it in front of him, just as the shield takes it off, then sets him back in place. Deflects it with its own guy. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Nice. As I'm pulling around the corner, can I use my bonus action to drop the stupid, runty gnoll look? →

name: MATT
line: You don't have to spend a bonus action, you just drop it. Pulling back from the fire, yeah, you can get just around that corner. The guard lets you by. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I need cover. →

name: MATT
line: That ends your turn. The leader at this point makes this loud gibbering sound that echoes throughout the alley, turns, and runs off to pursue the cart. →

name: SAM
line: He left! →

name: TRAVIS
line: We're at level three, that's got to be an acceptable option right now. →

name: SAM
line: No! →

name: LAURA
line: That means we almost killed him, that's what that means! We almost had him. →

name: MARISHA
line: Do we chase after him? →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah. →

name: MATT
line: That ends his turn. The guards now, who have notched their crossbows again, are going to take shots at both of those guys right there. Fucking two. That does hit. The other one gets hit. →

name: LAURA
line: Have we killed any of the gnolls-gnolls? →

name: TRAVIS
line: Yeah, it's simple numbers. Them leaving is a good-- →

name: MATT
line: Molly, you're up. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm taking a slice at this guy again. I don't have advantage anymore. →

name: MATT
line: You do not. He is not prone anymore, unfortunately. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Slice number one. Oh, for fuck's sake. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Ten. →

name: MATT
line: Ten does not hit, unfortunately. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Slice number two. That hits, thank you! 23. →

name: MATT
line: 23 will hit. Go ahead and roll damage. →

name: TALIESIN
line: That's five points of damage and two points of extra damage. →

name: MATT
line: Radiant? All right. The first one, you swing and it ducks out of the way, and attempts to strike upward with its spear. As you do, you knock it to the side, with the scimitar that missed, and with your other hand, strike down right across its face. You arc through and you actually carve one of the eyes in twain. You see a large red mark where you've split part of its face, and it's hurt really bad, but it's still standing. There's gore dripping out of the socket where its ruined eye sits. (snarls) →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm going to try and circle around it to get out of the way of the archers. I'm going to hop back off and get behind him. →

name: MATT
line: You can do that without a problem. You leapfrog off of him, grab his shoulders, and land behind him, scimitars at the ready. Okay, ending Molly's turn. Jester, you're up. →

name: LAURA
line: What about the guards? →

name: MATT
line: The guards already went. Oh, she didn't fire. Sorry, thank you for reminding me about that. The other guards did go, she did not-- They did not. →

name: LAURA
line: Aren't they going to attack this skeleton one that's right here next to both of us? →

name: MATT
line: They throw their crossbow to the ground and pull out a morningstar, and does a sideswipe towards this-- That is a 19. We'll say that straight up hits. That does five plus eight points of damage to that one. I don't think you've damaged that one yet, right? →

name: LAURA
line: Yes I had. I did the Hellish Rebuke to it. →

name: MATT
line: That's right, you did! That was the wrong one. All right, with that, they swing backwards with the mace and hit the side of the skeletal head, which shatters immediately upon impact, ruining its form, and is no longer part of the battle. →

name: LAURA
line: I am so surprised I fall off the wall! →

name: MATT
line: You are. You tumble that way. →

name: LIAM
line: Get out of the city! →

name: MATT
line: All righty. Jester, your turn. →

name: LAURA
line: Okay. Are either of those two gnolls over there damaged? →

name: MATT
line: From what you can tell, nope. →

name: LAURA
line: Okay, well, I'm going to use my giant lollipop, and it's going to swing and hit a couple times and try to hit one like a bat. →

name: MATT
line: Go for it. →

name: LAURA
line: Okay, this is the one you licked. →

name: SAM
line: Okay. →

name: LAURA
line: Eight. →

name: SAM
line: (sad trombone) →

name: LAURA
line: Sam's spit: not a good luck charm. →

name: MATT
line: As it swings in the air and spins, they both take one step back and it hits the dirt, and they both look at each other, and (chuckles). →

name: LAURA
line: Shit. I'm going to cast Cure Wounds on myself, and then I'm going to leap off the wall with great flourish and land next to Caleb. Okay, that's a good idea. I'm going to land next to the guard. Then I'm going to skip away to the building. →

name: MATT
line: There you go. All righty. That ends Jester's turn. Caleb, Nott, you're up. →

name: LIAM

name: MATT
line: Yes, over here. →

name: LIAM

name: MATT
line: That one's probably the easiest to see right now. →

name: LIAM
line: Then that's the one I'm going to go for. →

name: LIAM
line: Come on. Oh, that's good. That's a 17. →

name: MATT

name: LIAM
line: Thanks, Keyleth. →

name: MARISHA

name: LIAM
line: That is 3d8, so where is my eight-sided die? There it is. This is fire, and it is 11 points of damage. →

name: MATT
line: As it bursts into it, you see the fur burn and singe and (whimpers) pats it out and the flames subside, you see it's charred and burnt, and you see the flesh is cracked and blackened. →

name: MATT

name: LIAM

name: MATT
line: That ends your turn. Nott? →

name: SAM

name: MATT
line: You can see those down there. The one just got blasted with the familiar fiery explosion of Caleb's Chromatic Orb. The other is untouched. →

name: SAM
line: The other one, I will point at and I will remove a tiny rotten tart from my pocket and crumple it onto the floor and take a feather and move it around over the crumbs, and say: Hey, what happens to a frog's wagon when it breaks down? It gets toad away! And I will cast Hideous Laughter on the gnoll. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Hideous indeed. →

name: MARISHA
line: No bad Halle Berry lines. →

name: MARISHA
line: What happens to a toad when it's struck by lightning? The same thing that happens to everything else. →

name: MATT
line: Wisdom saving throw? That is a natural 11. →

name: MATT

name: MATT
line: 13. All right. →

name: TALIESIN

name: LIAM

name: MATT

name: SAM

name: MATT
line: You watch as the one that was currently untouched that was drawing another arrow glances up and hears, and goes, (uncontrollable laughter) and falls to the ground. (manic laughter) Laughing this horrible hyena chuckle, and it's billowing out into the street, clutching its stomach and dropping its weapons to the side and just rolling on the ground. Its friend next to it is like, huh? Looks up and sees you. →

name: SAM
line: Okay. All right, I'll use my bonus action to hide. →

name: MATT
line: Go for it. →

name: SAM
line: Oh, I have to stealth. Oh, God damn. Okay, that's 13. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. That ends your turn. There are no more of the undead types, so they're off the thing. →

name: MATT

name: MARISHA

name: LIAM

name: MATT
line: That's five feet of movement. →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, and looking at this one, I go: Hey, your friends have an inside joke without you. →

name: MARISHA
line: Pointing at the guy on the ground. As soon as he turns, I go whack like a baseball bat, right across his head. →

name: MATT
line: As soon as he glances over to the side, he looks back just as you're already in his face. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh, that's good. →

name: LIAM
line: Swing it high, Beau. →

name: MARISHA
line: 25! No, sorry, 24! →

name: MATT
line: 24, that'll definitely hit. Roll damage. →

name: LIAM
line: Swing away. →

name: MARISHA
line: I'm going to take that, that's a 13, sorry, ten, nope, 11! Math. →

name: MATT
line: 11 points of damage. Whack! You watch as about five or six gnoll teeth go flying from the impact, the jaw quivers as spittle and blood goes careening off the side of the impact. It falls and stumbles, if you want to follow it up. →

name: MARISHA
line: I'm going to, using that momentum, do a helicopter flourish above and go crack down over top. →

name: MATT
line: Go for it. →

name: MARISHA

name: MATT

name: MARISHA

name: MATT

name: MARISHA
line: Ooh, that's a four, so eight points of damage. →

name: MATT
line: Eight points of damage. Wham! As you bring it down over the top of the head, it falls and gets up, it's dazed and beaten within an inch of its life, it's ready to go. It's barely standing at this point, one eye is lolling around and trying to find, and the other one is swollen shut now and can't actually see anything. It's in a bad place. →

name: MARISHA
line: Fuck. I'll hold. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. That ends your turn, Beau. The guy on the ground is just laughing his ass off. At the end of its turn, it's going to try and make a saving throw. No, that is a two. It is still laughing on the ground. This one, seeing the rest of its allies run, turns around and is just going to run. →

name: SAM
line: That's the one you just hit? →

name: SAM

name: MARISHA
line: Fuck. Oh, but that's still good. 18. →

name: MATT

name: LAURA

name: MATT
line: Yes. →

name: MARISHA

name: MATT
line: You knock and crush him to the floor. As he tries to run, you whack and hit him, and you watch him take a few steps and skid and fall onto the ground, and he's not moving. The one over here, who is not currently in the process of knowing that everyone else is fleeing, because he's been stuck over here, is going to try to take a spear attack at you, Molly. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm going to snap at him. I'm going to use Blood Maledict. →

name: SAM

name: MATT

line: Yeah, no he ain't. →

name: MATT

name: TALIESIN
line: That is my armor class. →

name: MATT

name: LAURA

name: TALIESIN
line: Nope! →

name: LIAM
line: All his friends are running away, and he's going, "Me and my friends are going to kill you." →

name: MATT
line: Eight points of piercing damage. Its eyes go dark and it pulls back, and still it seems its sense of smell can still find your placement in the vicinity, and as you pull out of the way, it still manages to find you. The spear pierces right around where the hip is, and you pull back, gritting your teeth. That's going to end its go. →

name: TRAVIS
line: My turn. →

name: MATT
line: Yep. →

name: SAM

name: TRAVIS
line: I'll go ahead and use my 30 speed to close in on the proned-out. Great, and I'll use Eldritch Blast against that. →

name: MATT
line: All right, it has disadvantage against it because it's prone. →

name: MATT
line: 11. As it's rolling around on the ground, it's difficult to find a proper shot, and you fire, and it hits the dirt next to it, sending a bit of dust over it. It stops laughing for a second as the dust-- He laughs even harder at the actual dust. →

name: TRAVIS
line: That's it. That's my turn. →

name: MATT
line: That ends your turn. All right. The guards go. The leader continues to run, and is now disappearing into the smoke and ash. You don't have a visual on the cart at the moment, it's now pressed into where a lot of the fire is, and it's obscuring their escape. These guards are going to move forward as they load their crossbows, and they're both-- actually, because he's on the ground laughing, you're coming out on the roof, they're going to turn and fire at the one that's in front of Molly. It does have three-quarters cover because of the wall. They're trying to help you out. →

name: TRAVIS
line: We need the assistance of guards, guys. →

name: MATT
line: Hits the wall and deflects. →

name: TRAVIS
line: It's hard. →

name: MATT
line: That does hit! That is a 21, actually, so that does, even with the bonus to armor class from the three-quarters cover, it still hits. →

line: Those guards are killing more than we are. →

name: MATT
line: With that, as it's there in front of you with its spear, after stabbing you, it pulls back and one crossbow bolt out of its forehead. →

name: MATT
line: Its jaw goes slack and falls to the ground, dead. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Oh, come on. →

name: SAM
line: Don't you want to ask that nameless guard how he wants to do this? →

name: MATT
line: Well, there's still one left on the ground, which we'll say for the purposes of narrative here, who wants to do this? →

name: TRAVIS
line: What, you really want to do something? →

name: SAM

name: LIAM
line: Yeah. →

name: MATT
line: Well, when we come back around, it would be Molly's turn, Jester, then Caleb and Nott. So whatever you guys want to do in this moment before it comes back, let me know. →

name: MARISHA

name: MATT
line: Make an acrobatics check. →

name: SAM
line: Oh, disadvantage. Jesus. 11. →

name: MATT
line: You jump off the side and you land, you do suffer four points of bludgeoning damage as you hit the ground and your feet buckle, and you actually slam and your face hits the dirt, but you use your momentum to scurry back up, and beginning to move forward, you get-- and if you're using the rest of your-- →

name: SAM
line: Dash, everything. →

name: MATT

name: SAM
line: Oh. →

name: MATT

name: SAM

name: MATT
line: Yeah, so you maintain control over the Hideous Laughter. Okay. You rush into the cloud of ash after them, and you begin to see some of the shapes ahead of you of the gnolls there, pushing the cart. You're still behind them by about 30 or so feet, and right as you rush forward, darting in, the heat from the embers entering your lungs burn, and you put your mask over to block and help filter a bit, with the cloth and bandages, and right as you rush forward, you see the back of the heavy armored leader, that's bringing up the rear of where the cart is, and he turns and sees you. →

name: SAM
line: Oh god. →

name: MATT
line: As soon as you finish your movement, it spins and looks in your vicinity, to see that you're alone. →

name: SAM
line: Oh god. →

name: MATT

name: SAM
line: Oh god! →

name: MATT

name: SAM
line: Oh god! →

name: LAURA
line: What did you do? →

name: TALIESIN
line: Wait, is it his turn already? →

name: MATT
line: At this point? The narrative timing on this. →

name: TALIESIN

name: LAURA
line: Yeah. →

name: MARISHA
line: Yeah, who was allowed to run? →

name: MATT

name: LAURA

name: SAM
line: Yeah. →

name: MATT
line: All right, cool. All right, well let's roll it back a little bit here and see how this helps you. All right, cool. So. No, it's fine. So Jester, Molly, what are you guys doing? →

name: TALIESIN
line: I was going to run to see where the cart was going. Full dash. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. As you sprint off, with a full dash, you don't quite get as close as Nott does. →

name: TALIESIN
line: No, I wouldn't. →

name: MATT
line: Because Nott is much faster. →

name: MATT
line: No. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Okay. →

name: TRAVIS

name: MATT
line: It's not really a spider sense. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I know, but you know. →

name: SAM
line: But it's a spider sense. →

name: LAURA
line: Basically. →

name: MATT
line: You're about that far back, I would say. →

name: LAURA
line: I was going to have my duplicate go over and touch the guy laughing on the ground, and cast Inflict Wounds. →

name: MATT
line: Go for it. →

name: MARISHA
line: Dope. →

name: MATT
line: It's a melee spell attack, correct? You have advantage on it because he's currently incapacitated. →

name: LIAM

name: LAURA
line: Natural 20. →

name: LIAM
line: Yeah! →

name: TRAVIS
line: That'll be all the damage. →

name: MATT
line: Oh my god. So roll the dice. →

name: MARISHA

name: LAURA

name: MATT
line: As he's laughing, your image walks up with a skip, bends down and touches him, and he suddenly withers into this completely dried-out husk of what the gnoll once was, the life force drawn and cast out of his body. He stops laughing, and the body falls like a mummy to the ground. →

name: SAM
line: Your duplicate can cast spells? →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah. That's why it's more fun if I can move her. →

name: TALIESIN
line: That's why it's like a bear. →

name: MATT
line: All right, finishing those turns, back to the top of the round. →

name: LIAM
line: No, I would have leaned out, if I had seen it was dead, and no enemies, I would use my movement, my action to move further up to the corner, not much besides that, but join where Fjord and the duplicate are. That's it. →

name: MATT
line: That ends your turn. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Your friend took off running. →

name: LIAM
line: Nott? →

name: LAURA

name: LIAM
line: This is simultaneous. →

name: MATT
line: Beau, your turn. →

name: MARISHA
line: Hearing you say that, I'm going to be like, I guess we're-- race you! I'm going to take off running after Nott. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. →

name: MARISHA
line: 40 feet speed. →

name: MATT
line: You manage to catch up right around basically where Molly is there. Do you have a ki point left? →

name: MARISHA
line: I do. →

name: MATT
line: If you wanted to use your-- →

name: MARISHA
line: That would just get me-- I'll save it for right now. But I can see Nott, and I can see the guy, and I can see the cart. →

name: MATT
line: There's cloud and ash, embers pushing into the atmosphere now, the nearby building are actually in flames and engulfed on the side here. →

name: MARISHA
line: That was a double move? →

name: MATT
line: That was a double movement to get to there. →

name: MARISHA
line: All right. →

name: MATT
line: As you and Molly are 15, 20 feet from each other, and ahead you can see the shape of Nott, and you can see the leader of them. You can now see from nearby buildings that about ten other gnolls are all gathering around the cart and they're all leaving. They're all carrying giant sacks on their back, dragging bodies and corpses behind them. →

name: MARISHA
line: Ten? →

name: MATT
line: Yeah. This wasn't the only gnolls that attacked the city. →

name: TALIESIN
line: This was just our little patch. Our gnoll patch. →

name: MATT
line: Finishing Beau's turn, it comes back to Fjord. The rest of the gnolls continue pushing the cart. A few join them, giving it momentum. →

name: MATT
line: About six more of them begin stepping up, flanking the leader, who's now staring at the three of you. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Now's not the time! →

name: TRAVIS
line: I'll run forward using my 30 feet but I will call out: Nott, get back here! →

name: SAM
line: What? Don't blow my cover. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Let them go! →

name: SAM
line: Okay. What? →

name: MATT
line: That ends Fjord's turn. The leader sees the three of you there, puts the glaive away with one hand, turns around as he draws his longbow and fires an arrow right at you. That is a 17 to hit? →

name: SAM
line: Hits. →

name: MATT
line: That is eight points of piercing damage. →

name: MARISHA
line: Are you down? →

name: TALIESIN
line: He is so down. →

name: MATT
line: The arrow strikes Nott in the chest, who falls unconscious onto the ground, the ash and embers starting to spill over her unconscious body. With that-- because I believe-- yeah, it can make two attacks with its longbow. He's going to make a second strike now. This one's going to be at-- I'm going to make it-- He can't decide at the moment. This'll be a four, Molly. That is a natural 20. →

name: MATT
line: (groaning) →

name: MATT
line: That is 18 plus three. 21 points of piercing damage. →

name: TALIESIN
line: You got to be fucking kidding me, really? →

name: MATT
line: He rolled a nine on a d10. And it's a crit. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Oh, I'm down. →

name: MATT
line: Molly goes down. →

name: SAM
line: Oh, shit. →

name: MATT
line: With his movement, he puts the bow back away and keeps walking with the rest of the gnolls. →

name: MARISHA
line: I grab Fjord and I say, just wait. Wait. →

name: MARISHA
line: Let them go. →

name: MATT
line: You watch as all of them turn around and they all begin to gather. You hear this cacophony of different gibbering cries in the distance as they're all starting to call themselves back to leave the city. They all step into the clouds of smoke and ash in the distance before eventually all the shapes disappear. →

name: MARISHA
line: I want to watch them as far as I can to try and pinpoint a direction that they're heading in. →

name: MATT
line: Okay, make a survival check in this moment. →

name: LIAM
line: It's dark, too. →

name: MATT
line: It is dark. →

name: MARISHA
line: Not great, 11. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. It's hard to tell with all the smoke, you can't see the moon, you can't see the placement of the sky, but you make a note of which direction they're traveling based on the street. →

name: MATT
line: Those who are both on the ground as Beau continues doing this, you guys begin to rush up and you see both Molly and Nott on the ground. →

name: LAURA
line: I run up and I'll cast Cure Wounds on Molly. Then I'm going to run over and do the same thing at level two to Nott. That's six points of healing for you, I'm sorry. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Thank you. →

name: LAURA
line: I'll run up and cast it on Nott. Oh no, Nott! I pull her up into my lap. Oh, that's good. 13-- oh, 13 plus five! No, plus three. →

name: MATT
line: That immediate first breath is filled with pain, both from the wounds you've sustained and the immediate influx of burning ash that sweeps into your lungs. Both of you come to consciousness. →

name: SAM
line: (gasping) Oh my gods! →

name: TALIESIN
line: What were you thinking? →

name: SAM
line: I was just going to follow them from afar. I forgot they had bows and arrows. →

name: TALIESIN
line: That's literally the only thing that's been happening. →

name: SAM
line: I thought they wouldn't see me because of the smoke. Oh boy. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm going to put out these fires. Oh, I'm not getting up. →

name: MARISHA
line: Ah shit, the town, you guys! And I'm going to go back and start trying to put out the fires. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm going to crawl back towards the-- →

name: MATT
line: As you guys begin to regather your troops, more of the crownsguard that you see have been battling and have been partially wounded by a lot of the other gnolls are beginning to gather their dead, beginning to try and put out what fires they can and acknowledge which buildings can't be saved. As you begin to take what remains of your energy to do so, we're going to go ahead and take a break. →

name: MATT
line: We're going to take a break here, and we'll have a little denouement to this episode tonight. But before I leave, we have another contest tonight. →

name: MATT
line: Our friends at Wyrmwood actually have a pretty cool giveaway tonight. As part of their new Kickstarter, they have this all-inclusive package here, which is both a dice box, with a leather base, and on the inside here an all-inclusive package for your dice. →

name: SAM
line: We don't have those. →

name: MATT
line: No, they just started producing them. These are walnut Adventurer's Arsenal kits, and we're giving away two of them. The keyword tonight is map, M-A-P, based off last week's episode, thank you Deven. During the break in Twitch chat only, come in there and when you're prompted go ahead and enter the keyword, map, into the chat only once. More than once and you will be disqualified. →

name: MATT
line: Two of you will be chosen during the break, and we'll come back to see who wins that. See you guys here in a few minutes. →

name: MATT
line: [break] →

name: MATT
line: Welcome back, everybody. That was on the air, well done. The winner of the Adventure Arsenals are, we have two of them, TheBravestKoala and GrandmasterBlaq. Congratulations to both of you guys for the win, go ahead and Danoba will reach out to you and get your contact info and we'll get those to you. For those of you who are curious to look at it, this particular Kickstarter you can find on wyrmwoodgaming.com to look and see the cool thing this new release is going to entail, so thank you very much, Wyrmwood. →

name: MATT
line: All right, with some of the flames dying down, 30 minutes or so of the chaos descending, the Crownsguard begin to come back, those that are still living, many of them wounded and tending to their wounds, or helping the survivors that are still within the town. You see some families are starting to unblock their entranceways and the people who had escaped the city are slowly beginning to filter in. You can hear the sobbing in the distance of families that are coming back to homes that have been destroyed. The smoke still chokes the air, and at this hour now it's probably pushing close to 11:00 or later. But as the guards come through and begin to take in the essence of what's happening, the armored individual that helped you when you first arrived and gave you the command to aid in this approaches. You see their half-elven face, solemn and tense, approach and extend a hand. "There aren't many who would immediately jump into the fray as you did. I would say that we would have lost many more, and perhaps all of my men had you not been there, so thank you." →

name: LAURA
line: Of course, I say as I cut off the ears of some of the gnolls. →

name: LIAM
line: You beat me to it. You said 30 minutes went by, I wanted us to be doing that already. →

name: MARISHA
line: We're like: Oh no, put out this fire! →

name: LAURA
line: These people have lost everything! →

name: LIAM
line: I was just waiting for you to pause. →

name: MATT
line: Yeah, no worries. Unfortunately, for the three skeletal ones you only manage to get one full ear. →

name: LIAM
line: That's fine. →

name: LAURA
line: That's okay because we got two ears off of all the other ones. →

name: MATT
line: You did. We'll say for that, for those who would've been destroyed or damaged, let me go ahead and roll and see how many ears you're able to pull off of those bodies. →

name: LAURA
line: I'm also going pull off a chunk of tail and see if it will pass. →

name: LIAM
line: I'd like to think that we leaned down to the same gnoll, cutting, and went, same hat? Same hat. →

name: MATT
line: You manage to pull up about 12 ears intact between all the fallen bodies. Some you killed, some maybe you didn't. You came across the body elsewhere in the square and just took the ear. →

name: MARISHA
line: I totally remember kicking this guy's ass. →

name: MATT
line: Other guards are collecting them as they go and there are a couple moments where someone was going for an orc-- or a gnoll that you had killed and you went to the guard and went, nuh-uh, and they backed off. But anyway, the soldier head that was speaking with you extends a hand and they say, "I am Watchmaster Bryce Feelid, assigned here to Alfield, now in my fourth year. Thank you." →

name: MARISHA
line: Watchmaster? →

name: MATT
line: "Watchmaster Bryce Feelid." →

name: TRAVIS
line: What were those creatures? Have you encountered them before? →

name: MATT
line: "We've encountered them before, yes, in smaller hunting packs, maybe a half-dozen at a time, usually on the outskirts. They don't come to civilization like this. It's generally too dangerous for them, in the smaller numbers they travel. What the fuck are they after?" →

name: TRAVIS
line: Such a grizzly scene, they seemed to be carrying away bodies on that cart they had. →

name: TALIESIN
line: That was weird. →

name: LAURA
line: Did you notice they had some undead gnolls with them? →

name: TRAVIS
line: I did. →

name: TALIESIN
line: There were. →

name: LAURA
line: Have you ever seen anything like that? →

name: MATT
line: "I've maybe crossed one or two as part of the roving packs, it's not terribly uncommon." →

name: TALIESIN
line: What turns them like that? Is there something in the water? →

name: MATT
line: "I have no idea. I don't know the ins and outs of their creepy bestial lifestyle. I mean, what--" And you watch as they sit down for a second, leaning against the wall, thinking and scratching at their chin, "Word came of a small hunting party of these beasts spotted to the south, so we sent a small troupe to slay them naught but two hours before they struck here. We had sent more than half of our men's strength to go and deal with them, so we were unprepared and, at the time, unguarded for the most part. We were caught at half strength. It can't be a coincidence. They must be desperate to assault head-on like this. There's plenty of small game in the surrounding wood and they're known to be provoked to violence, but I've only heard of gnolls picking off the outlying folk, those that wander too far from the fields." →

name: LAURA
line: Do they eat the bodies? →

name: MATT
line: "They eat what flesh they can get a hold of, but we went through a number of the buildings and they've ransacked two of the inns. They completely took the entire butcher's stock. They've carved the city of whatever meats, fresh or dried, we had." →

name: TALIESIN
line: Word came? Word came that they were in the south? Where did word come from? →

name: MATT
line: "Word came from some of our crownsguard who were running a patrol." →

name: LIAM
line: We have seen these things as far south as Trostenwald. Further even. →

name: MARISHA
line: Has there been something else going on, that you can think of, that might have cut off their food supply? →

name: MATT
line: "Not that I can think of. For the most part, this far south, other than a few run-ins here and there, they aren't-- conflicts of this size don't make it past Bladegarden." →

name: MARISHA
line: Bladegarden? →

name: MATT
line: "It's where most of them-- It's where most of the Empire's military and guard are trained and then sent out throughout the rest of the valley. →

name: MATT
line: That's a lot of meat that they've acquired from us, and they've lost many, I thought, of their kin in this battle as well." →

name: LAURA
line: Too much meat. What are they feeding? →

name: MATT
line: "Or what's making them so hungry?" →

name: LAURA
line: Oh. Or that. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Indeed. My concern is that they'll return. →

name: TRAVIS
line: We've fended them off for now, but they'll come back. →

name: MARISHA
line: Especially if they're as desperate as you say they are. →

name: MATT
line: "I've sent three of our scouts to try and find out where they went, track wherever they're taking their spoils. Reports come in that most of the bodies they took were dead, perhaps not all. →

name: MATT
line: We have to do our best to at least recover any survivors, wipe out what remains, and prevent this from ever happening again." →

name: MARISHA
line: Have you heard local farmers complaining about them stealing livestock? Missing livestock? →

name: MATT
line: "I'm going to look into that, actually. I'm sorry, I'm still gathering my thoughts." →

name: LAURA
line: (gasps) W.C! I get up and I run and see if our horse is still there. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh, W.C. →

name: MATT
line: Okay, so you charge out to the far city and you do find W.C., still affixed to the cart, currently chewing on a small bag of oats where one of the families of villagers who fled have come back and begun to feed him. →

name: LAURA
line: Thanks, man! Thumbs up to the family, I'll run back to the group. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Are you going to run back to the group, or bring W.C. with? →

name: LAURA
line: No, I'm going to leave it out there. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Oh, cool, okay. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Petting zoo. →

name: LAURA
line: Yeah, they're petting him. →

name: MATT
line: To the rest of you, Bryce says, "Well, as rash as it was said-- and our coffers are not as strong as they could be, I will request more of a monetary influx up north-- for the ears you have taken you will be paid. Any more that you find, those will be paid as well." →

name: TALIESIN
line: Well, and we're going to need some lodging anyway, so perhaps some trade could be worked out. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Indeed, we could provide some extra muscle, perhaps for some lodging while we stay and maybe we could aid your men and their efforts to exterminate this foe. →

name: MATT
line: "Well, I would normally put you up in the Candleglow Inn but--" They gesture over towards the large building that you had walked through that's now currently-- →

name: TALIESIN
line: It's literally glowing like a candle right now. →

name: MATT
line: "That is ironic now that you point it out." →

name: TALIESIN
line: I feel really bad for saying that out loud. →

name: MATT
line: "Let's just not let Thadeus know that his life is--" →

name: LIAM
line: I have a question. After listening to this for a while, I start looking around the town, would you say that with all these burnt buildings everywhere, that if I start picking through the rubble I would find enough charcoal to reduce the costs I would need for Find Familiar, eventually? Because I still need the incense and the herbs, but if I get a lot of charcoal from these burnt homes-- →

name: MATT
line: I will say if you take 30 minutes to find good pieces of charcoal, and roll an investigation check. →

name: LIAM
line: Yeah. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Nein. →

name: LIAM
line: Yeah, done and done. That's good, and I have a good investigation too. That is a 23. →

name: MATT
line: All right, you manage to reduce the cost of you next Find Familiar spell by three gold pieces. →

name: LIAM
line: Yeah, good, that's good. →

name: MATT
line: From the hopes and dreams of Alfield. So Bryce looks at you. "I can have you put up at the Feed and Mead tavern." →

name: SAM
line: Feed and Mead? →

name: MATT
line: "Feed and Mead tavern. It's not the most comfortable place, but it'll do." →

name: MARISHA
line: It's a good name. →

name: MATT
line: "I did not name it, but pass it on to Crute, the owner." →

name: TRAVIS
line: Crute? →

name: MATT
line: "Tell him that Bryce sent you and you are being put up by the Crown for as long as you are hunting these creatures." →

name: TRAVIS
line: We appreciate that. Hopefully, there won't be another call to action while they're here, but you can count on us if there is. →

name: MATT
line: "Of course. Well." They reach into a pouch and begin to count out the gold for the number of ears you've collected. With twelve ears-- →

name: LAURA
line: 360 gold. →

name: MATT
line: Mm-hmm. →

name: MARISHA
line: Dope. →

name: MATT
line: After bringing the ears forward, they glance over. "Actually, I'll be right back. I may need to acquire a bit more change." And after a brief wait, Bryce returns and you are paid the full amount. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Damn. →

name: MATT
line: So 360 gold at your disposal. →

name: SAM
line: Should we divvy it up equally? →

name: LAURA
line: If we do, that's 60 gold apiece. That's Laura talking. →

name: LAURA
line: (laughter) →

name: MARISHA
line: I'm fine with that. →

name: MATT
line: Bryce says, "We hope to hear back in the morning of our scouts' findings. If you wish to, if you can hunt whatever remains of these creatures and bring back proof that they've been wiped out, I'll see what I can have sent southward of Zadash to make it worth your while." →

name: MARISHA
line: In the meantime, you wouldn't have anything that might help us and our little expedition, would you? Healing potion might be nice if you got one hiding away somewhere in a closet, forgotten. →

name: MATT
line: "I don't mean to be brusque, but at the moment I think we have a number of our guard who are in more desperate need." →

name: MARISHA
line: Fair. →

name: LAURA
line: I can help them... in the morning. →

name: LAURA
line: (laughter) →

name: MATT
line: "I'm sure that would be appreciated. For the moment, you all look about as battered as I feel. Rest up, come--" Let's see, they would be at-- "Meet me outside of the Broad Barn." →

name: SAM
line: The "Rod Bawn"? →

name: MATT
line: "The Broad Barn." →

name: LAURA
line: The broad? →

name: MATT
line: Barn. Broad Barn. →

name: MATT
line: They point it out to you, it's on the western side of the town. "There, we'll make sure you get the basic supplies necessary. Hopefully, we'll have information on where to go, and if you so choose, we could conscribe you to be under our intent to destroy these creatures. Think on it, rest, we'll speak in the morning." Bryce turns around and limps off with a few of the other crownsguard. As you guys eventually find your way to the Feed and Mead, you are immediately met by Crute, who is this ornery, salty-looking dwarf of tousled white-gray hair, this single tuft of a beard that dangles down towards the belly button before it hits a ring of gold, goes, "Oh, so I've been told you're the ones who were coming to sleep. Got one of our two rooms for you." →

name: SAM
line: One? →

name: MATT
line: He never quite makes eye contact with you. →

name: MATT
line: He's looking at your shoulder, or right above your face. →

name: SAM
line: I think he's got two glass eyes. →

name: MATT
line: "Come, I'll show you." Turns around and leads you to your space. There are four beds jammed in here. It's like a youth hostel-type living situation here, but it's functional. →

name: LAURA
line: Are they doubles? Fulls? Queens? Twins? →

name: MATT
line: They are pretty much as twin bed as you can get. →

name: MARISHA
line: I'm fine with the floor. →

name: TRAVIS
line: I'm great with a bed. →

name: LIAM
line: I've already got the silver thread out and I am looping it over any open window and by the door. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Was there beer downstairs? Was there ale? →

name: MATT
line: You can go ask. →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'm going to drop my things and run downstairs. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. You come downstairs and there's nobody inside, this is not a tavern night for a lot of people. "Right, can I help you?" →

name: TALIESIN
line: Is there drink? Is there smoke? →

name: MATT
line: "Smoke we don't have. But drink, that I can give you." →

name: TALIESIN
line: I'll take something interesting. →

name: MATT
line: "Interesting, you say. Heh." Takes out a bottle, looks like a deep green glass, and uncorks it. Takes a small shot glass that has a bulbous bottom, pours it to the very top with this liquid that looks a deep sea-teal green, and slides it forward. →

name: TALIESIN
line: Fast or slow? →

name: MATT
line: "Well, depends on how much you like to dream." →

name: TALIESIN
line: How much? →

name: MATT
line: "For that, and for what I heard you did, it's on the house." →

name: TALIESIN
line: Nonsense. →

name: MATT
line: "For the night. You want more, you're paying top-shelf price." →

name: TALIESIN
line: What's top-shelf price? →

name: MATT
line: "For that drink there, that would run you about three silver." →

name: TALIESIN
line: I put a gold on the table. →

name: MATT
line: "Not going to complain." →

name: TALIESIN
line: Consider it an advance, it's been a rough night for everybody." →

name: MATT
line: "Right, right, of course." →

name: TALIESIN
line: And I'm going to sip this mother. →

name: MATT
line: It has a very smoky, oak-barrel flavor to it at first as it hits your tongue and then it burns into this very medicinal, herbal, almost anise mixed with burnt charcoal. →

name: TALIESIN
line: That sounds nice. I'm going to sit, and sip this, and grin, and very silently have a mild nervous breakdown about what just went down. →

name: MATT
line: Okay. As you all slowly come to rest, exhausted, sore, beaten, trying to fall asleep to the distant muffled sound of shouts and wailing in the streets-- →

name: LAURA
line: And Jester jumping on the bed. →

name: TRAVIS
line: Jester! →

name: MATT
line: You find yourself to rest, preparing for what the morning may hold, and that's where we're going to pick up for next week's session. →

name: LAURA
line: Worst roommate ever. →

name: LIAM
line: You're not the only one. Caleb is going: one gold, two gold, three gold, 60 gold. →

name: LAURA
line: 60 gold, Caleb! →

name: LIAM
line: This was a good idea. →

name: TALIESIN
line: This is working out weirdly, I'm excited. →

name: MARISHA
line: We all have an extra 60 gold, yeah? →

name: LAURA
line: For all the work that Beau did. →

name: LAURA
line: (laughter) →

name: MATT
line: That was some Jackie Chan shit. You were in the doorway, dodging everything. →

name: TALIESIN
line: We now need to have a Stephen Chow night, that was some crazy shit. →

name: LIAM
line: We are hitching out stars to your wagon. →

name: LIAM
line: (laughter) →

name: LIAM
line: She just shot some Sun Chip out of her mouth. You're welcome, internet! →

name: MATT
line: Gif that. →

name: MARISHA
line: Oh, there it is, I found it. →

name: SAM
line: (groan) →

name: MATT
line: Waste not, want not. That's my wife, ladies and gentlemen. Thank you guys so much. Thank you guys for watching. Thank you, D&D Beyond, I'm learning more and more about the app and I'm enjoying it, thank you for supporting the show. →

name: MATT
line: Thank you all for joining us tonight, we'll see you next week, and is it Thursday yet? →

name: LIAM
line: Nein! →

name: MATT
line: Good night, everybody. →
